11/3/2019. Cask at the Victorian Craft Beer Cafe, Halifax. Pours pale amber with a creamy off-white head. Aroma of hops, malt, flowers, vanilla, caramel, butterscotch and fruit. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Moderate body, creamy texture, very soft carbonation. As 3 point something bitters go, this was a good one.

Aroma has orange peel and floral hops. Pours golden with white lace top. Taste is medium sweet to bitter. Palate is medium bodied oily texture average carbonation and a bitter finish. Good session bitter and they need our support.

8-3-7-4-15 Cask @ Craft Beer Co., Covent Garden. Pours golden, with an off white head. Aroma is herbal hops with citrusy notes of orange peel, stone fruits and grassy notes, as well as Light to medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is herbal hops with lemon and citrusy notes, as well as pale malts with cereals and toffee. Nice herbal, bitter finish.
Cask (Saxon Bear, Christchurch) - Amber in colour. Biscuity and orangey aroma. Orange, peach, dried apricot and biscuity malt in the taste.
I know it's a bitter but this is quite a bitter bitter. Soft frothy head. Glorious golden appearance. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gravity dispense at Holmer Green Sports Association 2017 BF, 28/05/17. Golden amber with a decent off white cap. Nose is orange peel, straw, bread dough, floral notes. Taste comprises bubblegum, light caramel, grass, grains, melon, straw. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi drying close spiked with mellow hop bitterness. Decent session gear.

(Cask at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London 23 April 2017) Golden amber colour with foamy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with apricots, orange and some caramel. Malty, fruity taste with notes of apricots, toast, citrus and a balanced earthy bitterness. Light body, with a slight sweetness. Tasty and well balanced. Quite nice.
Cask at the hanging bat. Pours clear golden, nose is floral, toffee, grassy, taste is sweet, floral, toffee.

Das Baby-Weizen sieht im Glas sehr schön aus: Blond, etwas schlierig und im oberen Bereich etwas ins orangene gehend, hefetrüb mit toller, stabiler Schaumkrone. Der Geruch fruchtig. Der Antrunk zunächst recht süsslich, dann kurzzeitige zitronige Noten, und danach prickelnd fruchtig. Im weiteren Verlauf werden feine Malzzüge wahrgenommen. Der Hefegeschmack wird nach und nach im Hintergrund aufgebaut. Insgesamt recht mild und fruchtig. Könnte im Mittelteil prägnanter sein. Das Etikett ist schön designt.
Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, malty, modest yeasty. A bit moldy-grasy. Light fruity hints. Finish could be more balanced. Still okay.

(Bottle) Typical German wheat aromas. Some doughy yeast and clove, little banana. Crystal clear but yeast settled in bottle, so cloudy when completely poured. Mid pale yellow appearance. Huge head and v. high carbonation. Some lace. Acidic mid palate. Bitter yeasty aftertaste. An unpretentious true to style German Weizen. Bargain

330ml bottle into weizen glass. From Aldi, Hurstville. Wow! Fills the entire half litre glass with foam. Impressive but less then useful. Eventually some cloudy amber beer appears at the bottom of the glass. Smells more maltier and less spicier than other hefes. The towering white head takes a long long time to reach manageable height. Eventually a sediment laden amber beer appears with a fluffy white crown. Good body, taste is light on, a bit sickly sweet. Finish has bitter notes not normally found in this style of beer. Tiny touch of fruity banana at the end, not much spice. It's OK.

Bottle. Giant white completely fills the glass. More success pouring after a while - cloudy orange with a huge white head. Aroma is more crackers and vanilla than bread and banana. Fairly strong cloves. Taste is a little softer. Not a lot of finesse but a nice dry spicy finish with some bitterness. I washed my 1/3l hefe glass and it would have easily filled a 1/2l one - but no other complaints.
Bottle from Kaufland, Goslar. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, yeasty and light citrus. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. Fizzy and high carbonation. 090417

Pours hazy, straw-colored from the bottle. The aroma is banana and puke. Don’t think I’ve ever written that about a beer before. Taste is lightly sweet, buttery, bready, with light acidity on a highly carbonated palate. The head after the pour was truly monumental. Thins and turns one-dimensional going into the finish. The sweetness fades and the vinegary, fermenting notes pick up slightly, leaving behind a somewhat sour aftertaste. Overall a disappointing effort, and not worth repeating.

0,33 l swing top bottle. Murky golden with a nearly two finger foamy off white head.Very yeasty nose, fruity elements in the second row. Taste starts a lot of sweet fruitieness, increasing caramell and some dry hints in the middle part.Typical mid banana-chewing gum-clove-wheat mixture. Thins out to the end. Okay, but nothing special.
0,5l Flasche. Tiefgelbes naturtrübes Bier mit schnell schwindender Schaumkrone. Hefiger Geruch nach Banane, schmeckt fruchtig, im Nachgeschmack bitter etwas metallisch.
Hazy, yellow to light orange color, creamy white head. Aroma of wheat, notes of yeast, cloves, light fruity.
Flasche. Rotbrauner Körper, klar, etwas Schaum. Aroma Röstmalz, Karamell, Getreide. Geschmack: Malz, Karamell, metallisch, wässrig

Bottle. Copper/brown with shades of red and a nice beige head. Mild aroma of malts and caramel. Taste is malts, caramel, a little bit of nuts and only the slightest hint of milk chocolate. Medium carbonation. Watery and a little bit metallic. I had better Dunkels and see no point in revisiting this one soon.

330 ml bottle. Pours with a clear, dark copper color and a nice off-white head. Nose is Malty, caramel and slightly mineral. Taste isnt sweet as expected, malty and herbal aromatic. Nice hops, slightly sweet and malty finish. I little to thin, but high carbonated.
0,33 l Bügelflasche. Rotbraunes Bier, cremeweißer, stabiler Schaum, akzeptable Gardine. Riecht nach Röstmalz, Karamell, malzig. Schmeckt nach Röstaroma, malzig, Karamell, weich, leicht wässrig.
Bottle from Kaufland, Goslar. Clear brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and bready. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light bitter finish. 090417

(Flasche) Es hat eine kupferbraune Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer gelblichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist karamellig, leicht metallisch, und etwas wie Trockenfrüchte. Der Geschmack ist schlank, karamellig, oxidiert und im Abgang metallisch. Alles in allem langweilig

0.33 l bottle, best before March 2017. Clear, dark reddish brown with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty aroma of caramel, nuts and a touch of bread. Rather sweet, malty and minimally roasty taste of caramel, nuts, bread and hints of chocolate, followed by a short, slightly bitter, a bit roasty, rather bready finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Okay!

Bottle: Chestnut brown color, small off-white head, quickly and completly diminishing. Aroma is malty, caramelic, light roasty. Flavor is also malty, light bready, cake, caramel, roastiness. Quite tasty.

0,33 l swing top bottle. Real old school label art design. Clear dark copper in the glass, small light beige head. Low malty on the nose. Taste starts with toasted malty increasing in the middle part. Little bit metallic, maybe due to hop influences. Low bitterness.
Keine objektive Bewertung möglich. Bier meiner Jugend. Das erste Bier meines lebens. Werde ich immmmmmer wieder kaufen....
Amber coloured. Hoppy aroma. Full body, decent amount of hops and almost a bit of spicyness there. Interesting as far as bitters go.

Cask, handpump at The Royal Standard, Wooburn Common, Bucks, 30.07.10 Pours amber with a white lacy head, fruity, malty and served in great nick. There is some bitterness to this and overall its rather tasty (better than I was expecting) A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov13 3.4
Cask @ Three Judges, Glasgow. Clear amber color, short head. Aroma of bit vegetable, slight hop and malt. Boring bitter.
On cask @ Three Judges, Glasgow. Amber colored brew. Faint aroma. Sweet, fruity, alcoholic.
On cask @ Three Judges, Glasgow. The aroma is flowery.. Clear, amber-copper coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is very flowery and has a light caramel background. Okay.
Cask @ 3 Judges. Amber colour, off-white head. Brew has toasted malts, and some toffee.. Slightly dry finish.
Copper with a small white head. Aroma is grassy with sulphur and a hint of roasted malt. Fruity and roasted malt flavour

Cask @ The Speaker, Westminster SW1. Rating #3600. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with some hints of caramel. Fruity malty hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy caramel finish.

Cask (handpump) @ Market Porter, Borough, London SE1, England. Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, nutty, coffee notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration. Bitternes is malt bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft. (030808)
Clear light copper ... light tofee malt nose ... soft sweet toffee malts with quite a big hop background.
Sampled cask conditioned at The Marble Arch, Manchester. Pale golden and cloudy. Acidic, citrusy nose. Malty and sweet with lemony finish.
Cask lager; hazy straw appearance; citric bite like orange juice; biscuits, acidic overtones; almost wheaty. Quite different.
Draught in messrs quite some time back, obviously. Pours black with light brown head. Roast/toasty flavour with some limited sweetness and almost smokey. Mildly carbonated and pretty pleasant.
Draught @ Messrs. This is their best brew. A nice simple stout that is not exceptional but very sessionable.

Draught at the Messrs Maguire pub in Dublin. Dry, well roasted stout with lots of coffee and a touch of cocoa. Very dry and flavorful. Typical but well-made dry stout. Although I tried 5 times (usually in the afternoon) and it gets me very very sleepy. Strange...
Keg at the pub. Dark brown-black, smooth body, chocolate on the nose, medium carbonation, dry, roast barley and some coffee.

This was the best of the beers tasted. The pub is well worth visiting on the Liffy near the O’Connell Bridge. The stout poured pitch black with tan head that laced down the glass. You detect the aroma of coffee and smoke at the beginning. The stout was a medium body beverage with soft carbonation. The stout had a dry finish with rich coffee aftertaste.

Draught at the brewpub. Pitch black oloured with a medium sized beige head. Light roasted aroma of caramel and peat wiyh fruity notes. Light roasted flavour of caramel, peat and hops with n otes of fridge. Hoppy finish.

Draught at the brewpub in Dublin, under the name ’Stout’. I assume it’s this one. Black body, thick brown head. Sweet aroma, raisins and malt. Taste a bit weak and has quite a boring finish. Nothing wrong here, but nothing special.
Smoky and roasted aroma. Continues in the flavor along with a very subtle peat quality and a nice chocolate finish. Good mellow hop bitterness and medium body all the way through.

Draft @ Messrs, Dublin. Brune, col ivoire; Arôme malt grillé, biscuité avec fine touche houblonnée. Palais est léger, présentant aussi ce profile malté et grillé alliant une légère présence de malt fumé. Sec en bouche, une fine amertume de torréfaction est détectée avec une bière qui reste bien axée sur le malt grillé.

Draught at the pub. Black with a thin off white head. Aroma is sweet with chocolate notes. Flavour is slightly sweet with roast and chocolate, plently of malt in the background. Not as creamy as some Irish stouts

Yeah, all I know is that this is for the bitter served there now. Quickly descending head and a pale gold body. Smells of black bread. Pretty bitter taste Some hops were present in there as well. A little yeast in the aftertaste. Overall it is a pretty good bitter.
(draught at brewpub) Not sure if what I had was the DDA, but it was on draught and labeled as a bitter. Amber with small head. Mild malt aroma. Flavor was biscuit malt and a nice hops bitterness.
Fiery amber; good fruity taste & toasy malts............................
Pale brown. Sweet mellow body, a hint of acidity. Rather malty with low to medium bitterness.
Keg at the clockwork beer Co. Pours clear golden, nose is toffee, floral, taste is dry toffee, sweet, malty.

Clear golden beer with a decent frothy head. Light sweet aroma. Flavour is light, sweet and hoppy. It’s a touch watery and feels more lightweight than it actually is but it’d be perfect if you needed a beer for the long haul.
Cask at Clockwork beer Co. Pours golden amber with a thin white head. Aromas are faint, light malt. Taste is thin too, light sweet. Not a right lot going on.

Cask as origin Amber at Clockwork. It pours hazy orange with a small white head. The nose is earthy, grainy, barnyard, egg and soft farty sulphur. The taste is bitterearth, toasted grain, citrus peel, barnyard and peppery grapefruit with a rather dry finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Sulphur on the nose is rather off-putting. Not great...
Pint at The Clockwork pub in the South side of Glasgow. Quite hazy dark brown. A little sharp.

Half, from the cask menu of their own ales at the brewpub. Clear amber, fragile lacing from a tiny, white layer. Soft hoppy smell, notes of grapefruits. Fresh fruity hops in flavour offset by caramel malts. Dry hopped ending. Thin in the mouth, but quite alright (Glasgow, 12.04.2012).

Cask-conditioned at Clockwork, Glasgow 15/06/10. Pale amber in colour with next to no head. Sweetish malt aroma with some citrus hops. Easy drinking, with orange fruit, a touch of green herbs and more hops, before a dryish finish. Good.
Golden colour. Orange citrus flavour and aroma, should be my sort of beer but it wasn’t. Disappointing.
Cask @ Brewpub. Dark golden colour, white head. Nose is slightly hoppy, with caramel malts. Flavour is hoppy, fairly bitter, body is a bit thin.

Draught @ Clockwork Beer Co. Brewpub, 153-1155 Cathcart Road, Mount Florida, Glasgow G42 9BH, Scotland. [ As Clockwork Amber Ale ]. Alc. 3.8%. Clear medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, mesk, moderate hoppy, pine, citrus, orange. Flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy shell bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20090410]
Bottle co op. Golden beer. Fruity malty bitter standard stuff. Nice enough.

500ml bottle: BBE Dec 2015. Shared with no one on 31st July 2015. Poured into an Abbot Ale glass tankard, it looked fine. Pale amber body, clean and clear, the head a white affair. Fruity hop aroma, no citrus notes (pleased about that), slight maltiness also. The taste followed the nose in flavour, fruity and malty with a semi-bitter finish. Most enjoyable.

8th October 2013 Lightly hazy gold beer, little white head. Palate is minerally crisp. Light clean pale malt, whisper of cream. Hops are light, a little citrus and a light floral touch. Neutral finish. Quite well balanced. Standard stuff, done well.
Drunk from 0.5 bottle. Hoppy, fruity bitter. Lots of aroma and flavour. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask @ The Staff of Life Inn, Todmorden. A flavoursome golden ale with a smooth head. Has mild orange fruit notes in aroma and taste. You can really smell the hops as if they are dry before the brewing process.

Bottle 500ml. [ Trade by madmitch76 ]. Clear medium yellow colour with a small to average, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity, sweet malt, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity, sharp, hoppy, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130112]
Bottle @ FOneFan, 4.3%. Slightly hazy yellow with tiny white head. Aroma is malt, hop, fruit and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, little harsh, hop, little grass, little citrus and a little bitter.

Bottle @ fonefan berliner weisse, cream ale multistate tasting. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, grass, malt and hops. More like a golden ale than a bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 120113
Bottle @ Berliner Weisse Takeover Ulfborg, 2013. Day 2. Pours clear golden with bubbles on top. Lots of rough grain and caramel. A bit of citrus. Some DMS. Rough and raw.
Aroma is coffee and toasted malts. Taste is dark chocolate, espresso beans and vanilla. Some clove on finish. Pretty flat body on finish. Appearance is black with a thin beige head that retains ok.
Pours a half finger of head on a black body. Aroma is roasted malt. Taste is nicely roasty, mild coffee. Texture is crisp.

Tap... Poured opaque, deep brown with amber highlights and a beige head. Aroma of candy, chocolate and malt. Lots of smoked flavors with refreshing malt qualities and a minimum bitterness. A little coffee in the finish. Very drinkable.
Tap @ Rock Bottom Portland. Dark color, short head. Aroma of coffee. Still bit thin porter, wasnt too impressed.
Deep brown, almost black, with a thin creamy head. Very hoppy, with flavors of smoky peat and hops dominating. A little thin as well.
Best Rock Bottom so far. Aroma is malty, choc and coffee. Flavor is balanced and very tasty, smooth and clean as most of their brews are.

Draught. Poured black with thin white head no lacing. Malty aroma with a bit of chocolate. Spicy and peppery flavour, not unplesent, but unlike most porters. Peppery finish. It’s hard to rate this, it’s so unlike most other porters.

On tap at Portland location. Dark brown with ruby edges and a white head. Nice aroma of roasted malt and mocha. Flavor has notes of caramel, toffee, roasted malt and chocolate. Finish is expectedly roasty as well. Thin bodied with moderate carbonation. Solid
Mahogany tinted black beer with a thin tan head. Subtle chocoalte aroma, caramel sweetness up front with chocolate and coffee flavour. Lightly bitter finish.
on tap at rock bottom in portland. purple-brown, light prune and brown sugar aroma, some instant coffee and toasted flavours. passable

(Tap) Es hat eine Bernstein Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist süß, etwas fruchtig, mit zitrusnote und etwas Passionsfrucht. Der Geschmack ist schlank, bitter, fruchtig im Rachen und der Nachgeschmack ist angenehm prickelnd.

Can. As Pale Ale Draught-Style. Amber with a large white head. Soft aroma of caramelised bread crust, weeds, grapefruit, berries. Softer and sweeter taste than the normal version with the hops mainly belonging to the finish. They ooze through and grip in time. Interesting, highly drinkable.

Color dorado transparente con espuma media blanca de buena retención y residuo abundante. Aroma a melocotón, hierba y cereal blanco. Sabor a cereal blanco, melocotón, mango maduro y notas a caramelo y hierba. Dulzor y amargor ligeros con regusto herbal medio. Textura acuosa, cuerpo medio-ligero y carbonatación baja. Una Pale Ale de sabor relativamente intenso, amargor bajo y buen acabado.

Tap at Sancho's Broken Arrow. Clear, deep golden appearance with a solid white head. Aroma of zesty hops, floral notes, mild pine and light cereal/grains. Similar flavor, adding mild hop bitterness and balanced by a light malty sweetness. Light to medium body with ample carbonation and a crisp finish. Good.

Can't believe this is rated so much lower than the bottled/can offerings. Nothing better than a cheap pint at the bars in Chico. At 5% its a little easier to smash down, but still has all the hallmarks of its parent
On tap at Glenn Sportsbar andra lång, Göteborg. Clear golden with white head. Fruity, floral, piney hops with some biscuits and caramel. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Draft (at some radom place in vienna, didn't realize it is different tick at the time..). Pours hazy golden with white head. The head stays. Aroma is fruity, hoppy, caramel. Flavor is sweet and bitter, floral, resinous, caramel. Finish sweet and bitter. Overall: good, but not really that different from the bottle version.

Draft. Pours copper color with off-white head and some lacing. Light bread malt with some pine and grapefruit notes. Bready Malt with some caramel and pine and grapefruit hop notes. Medium-light body.
Keg at All Bar One, Brum. Pours dark orange with a medium head. Aroma is caramel and orange squash. Taste has caramel, orange and toast.

On tap @ CraftbierKiosk Wuppertal. Nice floral round body. Pine and resin over a nice not too grainy bitter body. Crisp and clear in the aftertaste, lots of piney floral hops and a moderate grainy bitterness.
Cerveja de trigo honesta. Boa formação de espuma e pouca retenção. Aromas frutados e de especiarias.
Decent beer, not what I would expect from a beer named "Ruthless", a tad light and lacking flavor ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark orange color with a light top. Light hoppy aroma. Nice palate with nutty end. Over all good IPA with a light bitterness note. ---Rated via Beerology
cloudy dark yellow with a bubbly head. light lemon apple nose very clean flavor with a bit of banana way back in the finish. extremely easy to drink , a bit bready but overall non-descript. 4 5 4 4 9

On tap at Lanesplitter in Berkely poured a cloudy orange with a small diminishing amber head. Aromas of wheat, yeast and a hint of spice. Palate was light to medium bodied and crisp. Flavors of wheat, clove and yeast with a crisp lingering spiced finish.

On tap at Showbox in Seattle - how the hell did they get this? Hazy dark golden. Moderate spicy malt with some sweetness. Refreshing. One hell of a surprise when at a concert at a very non-beer joint. Far from mind-blowing, but solid.
on tap @ Blind Tiger Sierra Nevada tasting. Very nice american made hefe. Pours a cloudy light yellow. Clovy, banana light citrus aroma. Taste follows the aroma up correctly. Nice beer

Draught at 99 Bottles in Santa Cruz. Lightly cloudy yellow with a moderate white head. Aroma is light banana, somewhat sweet, with a bit of clove. Flavor is the same, with a small bit of hops in the finish, and a good bit of yeastiness. Slightly sweet, though none of the bubble-gum sweetness of some hefeweizens. Not exceptional, but solid.

I had this beer at the Sierra Nevada tasting at the Brickskeller in DC. Pours a yellowy-golden unfilitered (or lightly filtered as Steve Grossman said) look with a good amount of head. The head retention is fantastic. The aroma is of orange peel, clove, and maybe some banana. The beer imparts a lovely bouquet of spicy wheat, clove, and non-descript fruit in a smooth medium-sized mouthfeel.
Hazy golden yellow. Aroma of wheat cereal, bubble gum, clove, and banana. The flavor is very similar. Medium carbonated, smooth, and rather light.
Tasty plain blonde at brewery. Pale Malt character, mild bite. Easy drinking.

"another "not bad for a blonde" brews. delicate hop profile in the aroma and taste...would make a decent summer beer, but in january, not quite what i was looking for. grainy, crisp and sweet (like stout said). good into to micros."
On tap at Final Gravity. Pours blonde with a nicewhite head and a light floral aroma. There is a light-bodied pale malt flavor with a dry slightly bitter finish.

On tap at Capital Ale House - Downtown on 04/22/2011. Clear golden body with a small creamy white head. Sweet pale malt and light grainy aroma. Grainy flavor with a pale malt background. Medium body with moderately high carbonation.
Draft. Light yellow. Large white head. Very clear. Corny aroma. Light malt. Taste is the same. Not very characterful. Not bad.
Sampled at San Carlos art and wine faire. A refreshing brew. Not a great brew but nice for a Holden ale. Well crafted.

On draft at Tap 25. It pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma is really nice with spicy noble hops and fresh grains. The flavor is the same. Good dry, crisp maltiness with some earthy, herbal and floral hops near the finish. Very clean and sessionable. One of my favorite blondes and a beer I would love to have regularly.

Tap @ Tap and Handle Fort Collins. Pours a clear light yellow appearance with a white head. Fairly plain, a bit grassy, lemony aroma. Fairly dry, grassy, a bit grainy flavor. Easy drinking but boring.
Didnt like this beer. Not any real positive qualities. Just tasted cardboard, water and soggy socks. It was clean but a gross malt profile. Not good at all.

Served on draft at Capital Alehouse Downtown. Pours a clear golden color with a frothy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of sweet bready malts, slight graininess and faint grassy hops. The taste is bitter grassy hops, grainy malts and faint fruity notes. Medium bodied.
Draft at the (NC) source. Clear dark gold with a finger of white head. Bready malt nose. Flavors also light bread, biscuity malt with balancing hop notes for a drying, mildly bitter finish (notes).

Gravity pour @ GBBF 2014. Amber pour with a delicate bubbly white head. Nose has some pine and PNW hop character. Moderate caramel and honeycomb. Flavor is balanced. Earthy pine cone and mellow peppery hoppiness. Caramel and cake batter. Medium body, a touch dull on the palate. Still, a decent, assertive bitter.

Warm golden colour, white head. Malty aroma, vegetable, root vegetable, carrot, caramel. Malty flavour, straw, butter and malts. Finish butter, malts, straw and light toast. (from draught -cask- @ GBBF ’14, London)

From tap of brewery at NC. Pours a clear copper color with no head. Aroma was earthy and malty. Taste was bitter and a little sweet with the malts. Not heavy but not complex. Just a bitter ale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the Mills River, NC brewery. Orange, slightly cloudy, with a very small head. Smells bready, toasty, with some earthy and peppery notes. Taste is dark toast, Some weedy, peppery flavors, and a dry, woody finish.

On tap at bier thirty. Pours out a clear crisp copper topped with white head. Nose is citrus hops wood earth tones and some herbal notes. Taste is more of the wood earthy tones and a little bitterness on the end.

"eh. not bad, but definitely not a standout at Sierra Nevada or for a bitter (gimme Goose Island, Alesmith, Deschutes, or Boonville there). bitter, yes. but the malts were boring and the body thin. maybe a little harsh, but it was at the back end of their beers."
Sample at Great British Beer Festival 2014. Clear golden beer with a small white head. Hoppy floral aroma, grass, earthy notes. Hoppy earthy flavor, hay, grass, florl, citrus, some grapes.

On tap @ Tap and Handle Foco during another massive Sierra Nevada tap takeover. Pours a clear, golden appearance with a white head. Cracker and lightly toasted grain in the aroma. Some herbal / grassy notes as well. Nice mouth feel. A bit floral. Pretty dry with an herbal hoppy flavor. Clean and simple. Good.

12th August 2014 GBBF Day 1. Cask. Hazy gold beer, good bubbly pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry and crisp. Fine carbonation. Good condition. Light floralness and light but spicy citrus. Underneath are light malts with a touch of toffee. Light dry crisp finish. Interesting! This is kina how I imagined a US Cask bitter would taste like. Good stuff.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Six pack from Save-Mart. Medium, clear golden , small foamy head, streaky lacing. Bready, biscuity aroma. Taste too is pure wheat ale, white bread. Simple, clean.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Draught at Toronado. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, toast, pine, a bit of fruits and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, pine, a bit of fruits, toast and grass. Solid hoppy Pilsener.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Nothing offensive, but less flavor than a mass market pilsener. Definitely not "a great choice for those new to craft brew and longtime beer aficionados alike".

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Clear golden coloured body with a light white head, about three centimetres at first that fades down quite nicely. Aroma of fresh hops, citrus, grasses, hay and some hop pellets. Light-bodied; Grassy flavours at first with a dose of fresh malt and hops, a hint of artificial sugars and a dose of grain noticeable right behind. Aftertaste shows more of a funky malt with cardboard than anything else, but some fake sugars are also around. Overall, a decent beer that shows some very light flavours, but nothing too exciting and definitely not in the same class as other kristalweizens are. I feel like this beer is more like the beers of the East here, instead of a beer from California from one of the bigger breweries. I sampled this stubby twelve ounce bottle purchased from City’Super in One IFC in Central, Hong Kong on 29-July-2017 for a marked down price of HK$22,00 sampled in my hotel room here in Admiralty, Hong Kong on 01-August-2017, marking this the first time I’ve ever seen this beer, which is halfway on the other side of the world from home and the U.S.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: From bottles at Total Wine in Elk Grove, it is a clean wheat beer with a nice but somewhat weak aroma and muted malty flavors. No defects but somewhat flavorless and boring, even for ABV 4.8%.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: 12oz bottle picked up at Total Wine in Reno Pours clear light golden with a medium sized white head, good lacing. Aroma of wheat, hay and grains. Flavor of grains, bisquity, grassy and citrus zest Ok

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: A refined and clean wheat brew. Light sweet corn and some hay. Crisp, clean, light, and finishes refreshingly dry.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Bottle, from old notes. Bright clear golden with a great lacy white head. Grassy, grainy, and earthy aroma. Flavor same, balanced, light but pleasant, quite clean. Lighter bodied with good carbonation. Not interesting but good for what it is.

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Definitely a top 3 from Sierra Nevada. Perfect for a nice sunny day. Delightful. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

column1: Sierra Nevada Old Chico Crystal Wheat
column5: Bottle from Sierra Nevada brewery. Clear, pale golden color, white head. Slightly sweet aroma with malts, wheat bread and grassy hops. Spicy hop flavor with fruity notes and white toast. Lemony finish. Medium-light body, medium carbonation. Maybe not worth carrying halfway across the world, but a decent beer.

0,5 l bottle from Zisch, Wildeshausen, beside the Nordmann Headquarter. Murky pale orange in the glass, small and for a Weißbier fast fading head. Orange fruity smell with some chewing gum. Orange banana sweet taste, some wheat and yeast with a moderate bitterness. Higher carbonated, flat dry aftertaste. Okay. But nothin´ more.

Fand ich bei der ersten Verkostung einfach nur schrecklich, inzwischen hab ich es etwas besser zu schätzen gelernt. Trotzdem, irgendetwas stört den puren Genuss. Es besteht eine deutliche Disharmonie zwischen der (für ein helles Weizen) ungewöhnlich malzigen Grundnote und den säuerlichen, süßen, bitteren und fruchtigen Tönen. Beim dunklen Weizen aus gleichem Haus gibt es hingegen absolut nix zu kritisieren. Arco ist nicht gleich Arco. Es gibt 2 vollständig eigenständige Brauereien die "Arco" Im Namen tragen. Hier handelt es sich um Arcobräu in Moos. Nicht zu verwechseln mit Graf Arco in Eichendorf / Adldorf.
Hazy yellow, white foam. Sweet malty, banana, citrussy, very bready, unbalanced, some tartness. Not nice.
Trübes gelb, recht klassischer Geruch banane würzig, ebenso im Geschmack dazu säuerlich hefig herb, passt
Trüb gelb, fester Schaum. Hefe Duft.Banane und Nelkengeschmack. Recht süss. Schön wie lange sich der Schaum hält.

Nun, bei diesem Bier bin ich doch sehr gespannt, wie es schmeckt. Bin ich doch bis jetzt nur guten Bieren in dieser Region begegnet und Arcobräu ist auf dem Gäubodenfest mit einem sehr gutem Festbier vetreten. Der Anblick zeigt orangene Farbgebung mit fruchtig, leicht nelkigem Geruch. Der Antrunk ist etwas säuerlich, etwas nelkig und fruchtig. Im Mittelteil versucht das Bier vollmundig zu werden, schafft es aber nicht. Es ist kurzzeitig malzig, würzig und weiterhin fruchtig, säuerlich und nelkig. Die Hefe bemerkt man als Unterton. Fazit: Das Bier ist mild, süffig, fruchtig und ein Tick zu säuerlich.
Lekker en makkelijk te drinken bier. Geen uitgesproken smaak van weisbierr of andere smaken. -backlog de BierApp-
(> frais (banane-abricot-blé), μ-girofle, onctuoso-ample fraîche, belle texture (at 5,3), black blé-pêche, μ-acide)

Murky golden color with a big foamy head. Aroma very yeasty and bready, some clove, but not much in terms of banana. Taste doughy, bready, and yeasty. Basically what you'd expect from a witbier. Similar palate.
Tap in Seoul. Hazy yellow colour, small white head. Banana, grainy aroma. Light-bodied to medium-bodied. Banana, grain, sourness (from tap). Not in top condition but generic weizen.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Draught. Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy off-white head, medium retention. Moderate rich toasted bread malt, light caramel character, a clean lager character and a medium dry finish. Medium-full body and moderate carbonation.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Draft/Fest. A- Malty. A- Mahogany color, clear liquid, off white head. T- Watery, creamy, malty. P- Light body, watery texture, flat carbonation, bland finish. O- Very tasteless. Somehow managed to be creamy and watery at the same time. Not pleasant.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Taps barely translucent chocolate, scarcely any head. Aroma features roast malt, earthy, subtle chocolate and nutty tones. Flavor delivers roast malt, earthy, nutty and slight chocolate notes for a distinctive bock. Texture yields fair body and OK fizz. Drink to Brother Bennie!

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Sampled on draft this beer poured a nut brown color with a medium sized creamy white head that left no lacing. The aroma was thin caramel, wood and a hint of nut. The flavor was toffee, wood, yeast and a touch of smoke. Medium length finish. Medium body.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Pours mahogany with a thin, light beige head. Aroma is caramel, nuts and some fruit. Taste is raisin and caramel, warming to nuts and a light roast. Finish is smooth malt. A good, straight-ahead bock.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: 5.2%ABV. Altbier. Tapped out clear dark crimson-brown. Mouthfeel is beery and light. Palate is light sour, hint fruity, carbonated and wheat toast. Hint of nutty flavor. Hops are noble. Finish is light and beery.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: A dull and lifeless bock...perhaps because the flavor was lost when they poured it in that frozen glass. Why? The best thing Granite City serves, but that isn’t saying much.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Draft, as the Bennie. Heller Bock?? Pours deep reddish hickory, minimal head or lacing. Aroma is light, malty, caramel, not much going on really. Flavor is nondescript, watery. Light body, no carbonation. Ugh

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Draft at source. Nose of light toffee and bread crust but both very faint. Deep red pour, crystal clear. Off white head laces well. Breast malt presence with some honey. Moderate hop peppery flavors mid palate through the finish. Solid but doesn’t have a lot of complexity.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: On tap at brewery. Pours brown amber color. Ariana is smoky roasted malt. Flavor is roasted malt, biscuit notes and slight fruit, roasty finish. Most enjoyable beer of the night.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Taps clear straw yellow with a good eggshell head. Crisp aroma provides raw malt and a hint of pear. Flavor features crisp malt and subtle pear, typical but serviceable. Texture presents average fizz and body. Could be a gateway beer to turn macrobrew devotees on to craft beer.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Sampled on draft this beer poured a vibrant golden color with a large foamy white head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was sweet and tangy with a hint of fruit. The flavor was tangy, sweet, a touch yeasty and was pretty watery. Medium length finish. Medium body.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Taster flight at Granite City, National Harbor. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of malt, citrus, wheat. Tastes of malt, citrus, wheat. Light body with a dry finish.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Blind tasted with 5 other pale lagers. Beers were: 1. Dog Tag Legacy Lager, 2. Amber Harde, 3. Granite City The Northern, 4. Rammer Jammer Beer, 5. Amber Johannes, 6. Ale Asylum 12 oz. Curl. All raters rated them 61 345 TIED 2. 355ml bottle, brewed at minhas. Clear pale gold pour. Aroma is spicy and buttery. Flavor is sweet and papery, bit of plastic, not great. Post tasting thoughts: I know granite city is a poorer brewpub chain so going to minhas for a contract was a bad decision.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Tap. Pours crystal clear pale golden, small white head, decent lacing. Aroma is grain, hints of corn, grass. Flavors is light sweet, light bitter. Light body. Pretty clean example of a much maligned style

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Draft at source. Light malt nose, very clean with no off aromas. A light corn aroma. Crystal clear straw color. Small white head of tiny bubbles. Taste is crisp malt with a light body. Refreshing as a lager can be. Somewhere between a bud light and a bud heavy.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: On tap at the Schaumburg location. Clear yellow appearance with a fully dissipating white head and light lacing. Bland, thin and watery with a bit of corny malt sweetness. Tastes like domestic sludge, maybe slightly better.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Meh. Its the requisite craft beer for the non-craft beer enthusiast. Lightly grainy with a some grass and lemony notes. A bit on the dry side. Clear golden with a half finger spotty white head.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: On tap: The aroma is pretty minimal with just a hint of straw. It’s a transparent dull yellow with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. There is a thin sheet of lacing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with a very light grain/cereal sweetness. The finish has mild grass/straw. It’s light bodied with light-moderate carbonation. Overall, it’s a really light with nothing offensive going on. I’m sure that was the goal, but hedonistically, it’s a little bland for my tastes.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: I’m surprised by this beer since I really don’t like light lagers. This beer had more body and less astringency. It was fairly balanced too. Otherwise, it mimics others in color and aroma.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Had at their St Cloud Mn location. Appearance Light golden color with good lacing on a thick white head. Has a bit of a wet towel aroma. Solid lager flavor - goes good with the ranch cheeseburger I had.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, malts and grass. Taste is grass and malts. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Rated on 7-11-2010 at Granite City Food & Brewery in Fort Wayne, IN. This draft beer pours a small smooth head with a long retention. The hue of the body is yellow gold, no visible carbonation, and a good amount of lacing. The aroma is malt and lightly fruity. The taste is sweet, lightly bitter, malt, fruity, and light citrus. The palate is smooth and this beer is light bodied. Overall, I did not care for the flavor of this beer as it is rather bland tasting.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: This draft brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of frothy white colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a uncarbonated transparent straw yellow colored body and an excellent lacing. The mild aroma was malt hop. The acidic mouth feel was tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of acidic and mild hops. A horrible one that I would rather not drink again. The acidity of this brew ruined it for me. After a few sips, it gave me gas.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: on tap-pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is lemon/spice, some grain. Taste is sweet lemon/spice hops, grain/light malt. Soft/minimal carbonation. Easy.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Tap from KC,Mo location. Poured a hazy yellow almost orange color with a smaller white head that was gone rather quick. Aroma was grass, citrus, lemon and some mild hops. Flavor was grass, earthy tones and spruce. Kind of a dry finish. Weird but not in a good way. Something missing with this beer. Kind of watery and thin. Not all that great.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Mug club pour. Looks nice in the 25oz glass. Filtered orange-yellow. Steady, creamy white head. Pretty respectable Pils, lots of Boho characteristics. Pepper noble hops, some grainy brewhouse malt. Old school beer-beer, where there is a fine line between World Class and macro swill. Standard, in a good way. Not bad by any means.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: It poured a clear amber color with a white head. The aroma was moderately hoppy. The flavor was bittersweet with a bittersweet finish of moderate duration.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Tap at St. Louis Park brewpub. Crystal clear light yellow pour with a small wispy white head. Very mild aroma of Saaz hops, grain, and a touch of sweetness. Lighter palate. Taste is mildly bready malts and a tinge of a metallic finish.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Draught at Cedar Rapids. Pours crystalline yellow with tight white head. The aroma is light cookiedough and a subtle floral note. The flavor is grainy with assertive hop bitterness. Mellow doughiness and dry herbal notes in the finish. Crisp, decent.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: A nice pils from this brewpub, pours a medium gold with white head. Flavors are pretty traditionally pils, with an emphasis on a moderate and enjoyable hoppiness. A good beer that I’d have again.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Taps coffee sable with a thick tan head. Aroma yields roast malt, coffee, molasses and chocolate tones. Flavor presents roast malt, earthy, molasses, subtle roast coffee and semi-sweet chocolate. Texture offers good body, if thin for a stout, and peppy fizz. Chop chop!

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Sampled on draft this beer poured a black color with a large creamy beige head that left decent lacing. The aroma was sour, malty and off. The flavor was sour, acidic and off with cheap burnt coffee. Unfortunately long finish. Medium body .

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: On tap at Granite City Troy. Black with big beige head. Aroma is diacetyl, medium body, medium carbonation, and thick small-bubble lacing. Taste is diacetyl garage.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: pours dark black with lots of foam, light aroma of oatmeal and malts, medium mouthfeel, light coating on your teeth, light taste of roasted malts, tap at brewery.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: On draft at GC. Poured black with fluffy head. Creamy, was it on nitro? Sweet malt, cocoa. Smooth and pretty decent.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: 5.5%ABV. Oatmeal stout. Tapped out black. 40°SRM. Nose has dark fruit, ume, charcoal. Coffee. Good "stout" aromas. Mouthfeel is watery and light beery. Palate has light charcoal, roasted malt. No bitterness. Indistict finish.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Black draft pour at Granite City in Rockford. Tons of creamy head. Toasty roasty coffee milky aroma. Taste is about the same. Not bad at all

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Tap. Pours dark black, medium creamy beige head, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, a bit of rubber. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, lactose. Medium body, creamy.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Pours a coffee black with a brown cream head. Light aroma of oatmeal. Berry taste with a chocolate follow. Creamy mouthfeel and a light coffee aftertaste.

column2: St. Louis Park, Minnesota, United States
column5: Tap at granite city by Washington DC. Great thick dark pour and nose is oat and cocoa sweetness. Super smooth but not Much oat or other Notes except cocoa and a bit of roasted coffee. Would do again but will try something else next.
Botella de 33 cl de el c. Ingles. lote 14 hasta julio de 2005. recuerdos suaves y cereales. Cuerpo ligero con 4.8 vol fácil de beber, no es gran cosa.

Somewhat hazy golden straw, white head. Dusty, malty, slightly sweet nose. Taste is malty with honeyish notes, grass. Some hayish-hoppy bitterness in the finish. Thin body, oily palate, discreet carbonation. Not bad.
Bottled. A hazy light golden beer with a thin beige head. The aroma is sweet malty. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and malt, leading to a dry bitter finish. The body is thin.
0,33 liter bottle from a health food shop in Croatia. Hazy, very pale, fine carbonation, crisp bitterness. There is not much of a body here, and the finish is short and a bit metallic.
0,33lt Bottle @ "Prasino" Bio shop. Muddy yellow color with white head. Malty aroma and taste with some nice flowery notes. Wasn’t bad but not over the top. REfreshing nevertheless.
(Bottle 33 cl) Slightly hazy, pale golden with a white head. Malty aroma. Medium body with lightly sweet malts and a whiff of flowers. The finish is dry with a subdued bitterness. 260208

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange/yellow with a white head. Dry malty, light caramel malt. Flavour is light cardboardish, dry. Ends with a light sweet lingering malt note. Light bitterness in the far finish.

0.33 l bottle from Bio-Bio shop here in Split (great thanks Doggythedog for the tip!). Poured murky yellow body with big head. First I thought it is rotten, but soon realized it is just unfiltered! Aroma of some herbal hops, but nothing too much. Flavor very bitter, some metallicity also felt at the first few sips, but it dissapeard soon. Also it is really watery. Palate is very complex, it is medium carbonated beer, with oily texture, and finish first bitter and unpleasant but after a half of the bottle begins to turn out to some honey and other flavors. Very interesting. Actually this one was not similar to Export too much. When you see all it’s not bad, only is a bit too bitter, but Export is somewhat better beer for me.

Sold as Rapunzel Bio Pils in a supermarket in Kastelruth, Italy. Bottle gushes slightly. Pineapple and flour in the aroma. Vanilla, just a touch of hops and boiled milk in the flavor. Light hoppy, hay-like aftertaste. By no means a "normal" pilsener, but tasty.

Bottle. Clear yellow / golden color with a average frothy good lacing white head. Aroma is moderate malty and yeasty., lemon. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and bitter with a short to average duration. Body is light, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. Very "fresh" tasting but thin ... :o|
Bottle from organic shop in Montpellier. Old notes. Golden color, white head. Pretty common lager, refreshing but not special

Botella de 50 cl de el c. Ingles, tomada en mayo de 2005. lote 416 hasta agosto de 2005. un poco mas fuerte que su compañera pils, aun así se queda bastante floja, con 5.1 vol bastante fácil de beber. No es gran cosa.

500 ml bottle (Von Krahl Bar, Tallinn) 5+ Simple malted barley, just like the freshly malting stuff we tasted in Aizpute, pleasantly sweet, but not caramelly at all. Perhaps a bit more medicinal later. 2+ Clear gold, and a small but nicely persistent head. 5+ Clean and simple malty taste, a touch chalky, some pineyness, a touch of eco to the grains. 3 Simple palate, crisp carbination. Immediate finish very menthol-like, but its just keeps getting more and more perfumey, over time to a quite absurd level. 11 Fairly clean, but more than a little quirky. Not that that’s a bad thing at all. I can imagine some lager drinkers raving about this, it’s just not quite my style

50 cL bottle. Pours golden clear yellow with a crispy white head. Dusty grain aroma with a distinct bitterness. Carbonated mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet malty with a nice blend of the bitterhops into the finish. Ends mellow dry with a persisting light malt note.

0.5 l bottle found at Bio-Bio shop here in Split (great thanks Doggythedog for the tip!). It poured pale yellow body with almost no head. Aroma is very different than other lagers, corn, some malts and just a bit of citrus hops. Flavor is bitterish, sweetish a bit. Medium bodied, but goes down smoothly. Average carbonation. Finish is a bit sweet. Quite good beer, although nothing too special.
chiara poca schiuma non fine per niente persistente mediamente luppolata un po scialba in bocca

Bottled 0,50L. Voluminous and compact head, good duration. Limpid yellow color, medium fizz. Stinging and bitterish scent; notes of cereals, fresh grass and dampen malt. Prickly taste, nearly sour (I do not find the definition), with pleasant sourness and final alcohol. Not much persistent.

0.5l bottle from a bioshop in Zagreb (thanks again to ozujsko for the tip!) Right, I forgot to say this in the Pils review, but both of these are brewed by some brewery called Aktienbrauerei Simmerberg for the Rapunzel Naturkost. I’ll do some research, and send corrections if necessary. Now, onto the beer. It poured a big thick white head that went away fast (smaller but thicker than the Pils head), leaving a lot of nice lacing on the edges of the glass. Slightly hazy golden colour. Looked promising until I smelled it.... Remarkably n/a-ish malt nose. I agree with muzzlehatch on the corny part... something just felt odd. The taste was interesting, but in my opinion not as good as in the Pils. One rather assertive, and interesting kind of malt dominates the taste going from honey to strong caramel to nuts. Sounds impressive, but in practice, it isn’t, some fruitiness in the background, provided perhaps by the same kind of malt as in the Pils. No noticable hops, exept maybe some extremely faint hints in the aftertaste. Interesting beer, but not great.
Un poco mejor que la Pils pero no comparable con una buena cerveza. Posiblemente la mejor cerveza organica.
Bottled(500ml). -pale golden coloured, sparkling white head, little bit too watery, slightly bready and fresh aroma, easy drinkable beer

Bottle: Deep golden to orangey coloured, mid-sized rocky yellowish head,cloudy, lively carbonation; moderate spicy, hoppy nose, sweet malt and fruit detectable; moderate bitter, slightly sweetish flavour, light bodied; drier, fruity, spicy finish. Well crafted, a bit thin..............
Bottle. Deep golden, clear, big white lacing head. Very hoppy nose-fruity and grassy. Flavours are bitter throughout, just a hint of toffe towards the finish. Dry mouthfeel,medium body. Well-crafted.

(Bottle 50 cl) Hazy golden, almost without any head and very low in carbonation. Huge, solid yeast sediment. Light aroma of caramel. Lightly malty with weak notes of caramel and nuts. Light hoppy finish without being more than moderately bitter. Very drinkable. 111005
Bottle conditioned, rather smooth at first, but it opens to more complex flavours. Nice hops, fruity malt taste. I would love to have a few of those in the fridge.
Cloudy golden color. Quite nice earthy hop aroma. The flavor is quite simple, but with a strong bitterness, pretty aromatic.
From A Bottle.Amber brown in colour,no head,light hoppy aroma, flat and clean tasting with a hint of hops.
A hazy dark orange beer with a small white disappearing head. The aroma is of celery leaves, malt, caramel, and hints of spices. The flavor is very hoppy and malty with a fine dry bitter end.
Hazy amber color, light hoppy aroma, bitter hoppy taste, medium body, light bitter finish.
cloudy amber in colour with not much head. hoppy maltrich aroma. taste is malty, and rather bitter. with a long bitter aftertaste

Pours a thin airy off-white head on a unclear orangebrown body. Hops and nut in the aroma with some grassy tones. Also hops in the flavor, quite bitter but rather thin. Malty and nutty tones. No carbonation.
Tap at the Fürstenfeldbrück Volksfest. Golden, white head .Grassy hops on chewy malt, light citric aromatics. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel. Grassy aftertaste.
clear golden colour, fine head, floral aroma, robust maltiness, sweet, full and oily, strange unpleasant, oily finish
Bottle from Landbierparadies, Golden light yellow weizenhaze - aroma of lemon banana - nice taste medium thick - very nice Weiss that you can drink a lot without getting “full”

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, pale, golden, amber, orange, clear, cloudy, sparkling, rocky head, frothy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sourness, light body, medium body, full body, fizzy, lively, average carbonation, soft carbonation,
Top appearance: gold, yellow color, a huge, nice foam and a yeasty and banana aroma. Taste is clove, honey, very sweet. Medium body, sticky texture. Very pleasant. Above average.

Bottle. Hazy light yellow with a huge white head that leaves thick sheets of lace. Wheaty and yeasty, light banana and lemon, hints of spice but not very asserive in this direction. A touch thin/watery. Not bad.
500ml Bottle - Hazy golden/light amber in colour. Lemon and banana in the aroma. Slightly tangy taste with cloves, banana and lemon standing out.
Bottle from Landbierparadies. Hazy orange, white foam. Sweet nose of malts and banana, light citrussy sourness. Easy drinkable. Good Hefeweizen.

Cask at GBBF ’17, 11/08/17. Usual hefe banana and cloves aroma. Pale gold and opaque. Creamy white head. Sweet penny sweets banana, a hint of sourness. Citrus. Medium bodied. Soft. Light fizzy carbonation. Abrupt finish. I like a hefe and I like this.
Keg at The Great British Beer Festival 2017, Kensington Olympia. First beer of the Fest! Typically good hef. Lots of yeasty esters, soft fruit and grain.
Geschmacklich merke Ich Banane, die aber kurzlebig ist, weil es gleich säuerlich schmeckt. Wegen der vielen Kohlensäure muss man ständig sauer aufstossen!

Many thanks for this beer to kevnic2008. Piwo ma swietny wyglad, ogromna piana juz podczas pierwszego przechylenia butelki dynamicznie powstawala, dodatkowo jest bardzo trwala i sporo wystaje poza brzegi szklanicy Erdingera. Metnosc takze doskonala jakby lopatami upychano w tej butelce. Zapach delikatny lekko bananowy. W smaku tez delikatne, sadzilem ze bedzie bardzo drozdzowe ale sie mylilem, bardzo pijalne lekkie banany i troche na wpol dojrzalych gruszek z sadu. Dobre, choc liczylem na wiecej

Bouteille de 500 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur d’agrumes et de coriandre. Apparence: La couleur est blonde opaque avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence d’un énorme col mousseux et d’une large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de citron et de coriandre. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de coriandre en arrière goût. (Rating #4694)

Brown bottle, 50 cl, best before April 2012, via Importations Privées Bièropholie, savoured on March 12 2013; eye: impressive psshtt on opening, golden with a whitish hue, good effervescence, voluminous white head made up of rather large bubbles, nice lacing; nose: wheat, acidity, light malt, coriander; mouth: wheat, acidity, light malt, coriander, dry finale with presence of coriander, medium-light body, rather carbonated, slick texture; overall: fine FRANÇAIS Bouteille brune, 50 cl, meilleure avant avril 2012, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 12 mars 2013; œil : psshtt sonore impressionnant, dorée avec une touche blanchâtre, légèrement voilée, bonne effervescence, mousse blanche abondante formée de bulles plutôt grosses, bonne dentelle; nez : blé, acidité, léger malt, coriandre; bouche : blé, acidité, léger malt, coriandre, finale sèche en blé avec présence de coriandre, corps moyen-léger, plutôt carbonatée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

Une autre Panil qui explose chez Yan. M’enfin, ils nous restent deux petits verres et cela est malgré tout suffisant pour rassembler quelques idées. Donc, une mousse increvable qui scelle pour un moment les parfums de cette blanche qui présentent, rapidement, des similitudes (le pouvoir de la suggestion) avec la Weizen Bam de JP. Des notes de bretts, une aigreur citronnée et des arômes épicés caractérisent le nez de cette fontaine. Sur les papilles, des saveurs sèches, acides et aigres qui fonctionnent et qui sont, sans grande surprise, plaisantes. Une bouche, par contre, qui n’a pas l’étoffe des bières de Dexter. Le corps et la texture sont minces et souffrent-ils de l’attaque des microbes? En finale, ce sont des notes aigrelettes et surettes qui s’exposent avec une attention délicate sur une période de temps relativement courte. Bref, une blanche transformée qui reste relativement intéressante à boire.

Un couple attablée dans un grand restaurant de Milan, un homme en complet 3 pièces, une dame avec une belle robe noire, autour du cou un collier de perle. Le risotto était bon, la bouteille de Bolgheri superbe. Le garçon s’approche. –Monsieur désire, oui nous aimerions avant le café une bouteille de Panil Blanche, ma femme adore la Blanche de Bruges. – Bien monsieur j’apporte ça tout de suite. Le serveur revient avec la bouteille la présente et la décapsule avec soins. POP !!! Imaginez la suite. Jean Alesi remportant son premier grand prix. Une douche de bière. Le serveur maladroit tente d’éponger le décolleté de la dame. Inspecteur Cluseau brise le collier perle. La bagarre éclate avec le dandy. Tout ça pour une bière. Lire slovaksniper pour une description technique. 7/10

[ASPETTO] oro paglierino-aranciato chiaro, velata [SCHIUMA] bianca, fine e abbondante, persistenza elevata [OLFATTO] buona intensità, dominato da profumi di cereali, lieviti e note fruttate con un tocco agrumato. Sul fondo si nota qualche profumi insolito, forse la speziatura al coriandolo? [GUSTO] buona intensità, con un approccio dove si riconoscono chiaramente i lievi e sapori di cereali tipici dello stile. Immediatamente compaiono note acide, aspre, con sentori agrumati che accompagnano fino alla fine dominando anche un retrogusto piuttosto lungo che lascia una evidente astringenza quasi salina sulle mucose della bocca. sul finire si converte in una secchezza legnosa al palato e subentra una certa componente amaricante. [TEXTURE] corpo medio, media morbidezza nonostante una carbonatazione piuttosto elevata che pizzica la lingua. Percezione alcolica minima [COMMENTO FINALE] una blanche più acida del previsto ( anche se sembra sempre più essere un carattere distintivo dei prodotti panil) accentuata inzialmente da una carbonazione pungente. le note classiche del stile ci sono tutte dando un prodotto pulito e complesso . mi risulta difficile isolare la speziatura del coriandolo , percependone forse il residuo vegetale nel finale che infonde una certa amarezza e sensazione vegetale. sensazione dry, simile ad uno spumante secco fruttato. gioca contro la mia personale scarsa "simpatia" per le birre acide, tuttavia per onestà intellettuale, non posso parlarne male.

Purchased at Enotecca Bonatti in Florence, March 2009. bright orange, thick looking beer, almost like egg yolk. Yeast aroma, with brett. Surprisingly complex flavor, with wheat, coriander, more yeast, lemon. It is tart, sourness is getting close to a lambic.
Nice sour and bready yeast nose with some barnyard. Pretty, hazy yellow. Sharp but satisfying & clean sour - would make a stellar summer deck beer.

[bottle] shared by jk. Pours hazy gold with a dissipating white head. Aroma has evident Brett, but it works, light coriander and lemon. Wow, the flavor is quite sour, lactic, some brett, a touch of sulfur, lemon, this is much better than the ratings suggest.

A beautiful hazy gold body with faint white head. Plenty of lees floating around the bottom. A nice citrus and sour aroma with faint egg. A very light and almost fruity body an evervescent finish. Thanks to JK for sharing.

Bottled 500ml (BB 05/2007) Hazy yellow-orange color, steady creamy white head. Orange, sourish apricot in the nose. Medium-bodied, but watery palate. Light apricot, lychee fruity flavor. Slightly leathery and sourish. Interesting blanche.
Nice roasty smooth flavors and aroma. Toasty grain with a honey sweetness. Very nice body. This truly is a porter perfect mouthfeel and flavors vs. a stout. Thin fading head to a ring.

From bottle into glass at Corner in the Square in Beauly, Scotland. Light tasting porter. More faint chocolate than coffee. Light creamy head. Very little aroma. Smooth taste. Appreciate effort of making an organic beer.
330ml bottle at Innis & Gunn Glasgow. A black with a thin off white head. Light coffee aroma, flavour is roasted malt and not much else. Ok

06Jul2019 Intense dark chocolate, cacao, toasted malts, burnt bread. Hazy, very dark brown, medium, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More cocoa, dark chocolate, dark roast malts, burnt toast, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Nice. Draft at Black Isle Bar and Rooms, Inverness.
Pours a deep brown-amber with soft off white head. Chocolate aroma and taste. Thin bodied. Notes: on cask at Hootanany, Inverness Jun ‘19

BB 21 11 19. ABV = 4.6%. From a bottle poured an opaque black with a slight mahogany edge tint with a light tan collar that laced very poorly. Carbonation average. Aroma slightly of roasted coffee, smoke and malt. Taste moderately strongly of sweet coffee, vanilla wirh hints of chocolate and dried fruits. Light to medium body. Very smooth with coffee notrs on a short finish.
A bit too chilled for me so I'd like to have it again but it's a decent malty porter with a bit of fruit and chocolate but the chill really takes the edge off the flavour.

Draught at Taphouse. Dark brown coloured with a medium sized off-white head. Light roasted aroma of caramel and licorice. Light roasted flavour of caramel with notes of licorice. Light roasted finish.
Nice coffee, caramel and liquorice roastiness. Fair body for the abv. Enjoyable porter.
Tap at Stadsbrouwhuis, Leiden: Almost black colored brew with an sweet bitter taste with hints of chocolate, , coffee, caramel and roasted malts.

Tasted this in the Hogshead, Paisley in October 2000. Clear dark mahogany in colour with russet highlights and a creamy buff head. Strong vinous fruit note in the lingering aroma. Smooth creamy mouthfeel and good lacing throughout. Mixed complex malts give a robust maltloaf flavour with ripe figs and molasses evident. Slight prickle of earthy hops present in the short aftertaste but sweet malt returns with aplomb. Finish is sweet and malty with juicy raisin fruit off setting the dry vanilla oak cask and hazelnut notes coming through in the moreish finish. Reminded me of Harviestoun Old Manor. A cracking session Old Ale and highly recommended.
Cask Stillage at the Howcroft Inn, Bolton 12/10/2001 Dark coloured and rch on the palate. Fruity and somewhat like a porter. Strong alcohol in a wine like finish.
A bit thin for a beer of this strength, it was nevertheless easy to drink.Dark and sweet with a hint of toffee.
Cask Conditioned at The Anchor, Birmingham. Dark brown red colour with soft head. Sweet malty sl. smoky flavours, plummy nose. Smooth drinking with well roasted malts, little bitterness.
Dark brown; slight molasses & toast aroma; balanced toastiness, choc. chip cookie notes. Mild, but decent.
Very dark auburn color. Slightly smokey, good choclatey malt aroma. Sweet malty body, some smoke and light touches of iron.
Nice ale, bitter aroma but with sweet malty accents, chocolaty. Dark brown with creamy white head. Taste: bitter, smoky a bit over...

Bottled. Deep red, almost black colour with moderate head and condition. Chocolate and sweet licorice aromas tempered by a good hop note (challenger?). Sweet and chocolaty in the mouth with more hops and a sweet finish with a roast bitterness edge.
Dark redbrown beer thin white head. Chocolate toffee in the nose. Peppery flavor with cellar tones.
Dark brown. Roasty and citrusy. Medium bodied, dry, hints of coffee. Roasty finish.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Bottle conditioned, 500ml, aged 3 yrs, from Thirst for Beer, Pwlheli, Wales. Volcanic rush on opening, Black with excessive brown head. Rich fruity stout, quite tart with a blackberry, plum note. The body has dark roasty notes, husky rather than coffee, smooth with the sweetness aged out. Interesting stuff.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Bottle: In fact black coloured with a small firm tanned head; complex nose: ripe black berries, a touch of molasses, a tinge of almonds, roasted malt and coffee; not very dry = sweetish-bitter flavour, medium to full bodied, velvet MF; lingering finish: sourish-fruity with a restrained coffeeish bitterness. Warming a bit. A very pleasant, well rounded Stout.......

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Probably the winner of the festival. BUt it is apparently from another brewery. The colour is just nice, the flavour and the aroma are nice combination.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Cask Stillage at Edgeley Park, Stockport 04/06/2004 Black stout which is slightly rich on the palate. Some fruit and dryness in a bitter roast finish.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Bottle@spiesys. Pretty nice, dry and dusty. Light choclate and roasted malt flavours, lightly acidic, and nicely dry, a nice little beverage, easy, drinkng, with a good flavour.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Beer #27 at Spiesy’s. A pretty decent stout from Wales. The name is welsh for The Old Black Bull. Poured with a big frothy head and an almost black, opaque colour. Coffee and hints of chocolate in the aroma. Dry roasted malt and restrained coffee flavours, with some dark berry fruit. Long, quite bitter, finish. Nicely balanced. A very good effort. 500ml bottle (bottle conditioned) from orchard-hive-and-vine.co.uk. BBE 30 July 2005.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Bottle @ Spiesy’s gaff. Extra stout. Dry, roasty and very tasty. Long roasty burn. Nice. It’s penalty shoot out time. Sweden v Holland. And we have no TV!

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Bottle conditioned. So brown its black, good thin but lasting creamy beige head and moderate condition. Good chocolate and roasted barley nose. Moderate chocolate sweetness is the mouth with a background low tangy fruit note. Big long roasted bitterness in the finish with a faint hint of spiciness that could almost be mistaken for mild chilli. Alcohol seems well hidden.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Dark brown with beige head. Malty aroma with coffee tones. Falvor with lots of coffee and bitterness.

column1: Ceredigion Yr Hen Darw Du (Old Black Bull)
column5: Dark brown; bitter chocolate and coffee notes dominate. The bitterness is quite substantial, more so than any British stout I''ve ever tasted. Coffee notes are lighter towards the end. For all its bitterness and roast, it somes off quite evenly balanced, due to the high gravity.
Sampled draught at The Clockwork Beer Co., Glasgow Dark amber. Raisin and fig aroma. Medium body. Sweetish and fruity with rather low bitterness. Dominated by the fig flavour.
Cask Handpump at the Clockwork Beer Co, Glasgow 26/01/2002 Golden coloured and cloudy in apearance. Wheat aroma. Sweet on the palate with a hoppy finish.
Sampled draught at The Clockwork Beer Co., Glasgow Pale yellow, hazy. Yeasty, sulphuric aroma. Light bodied and sweet. Bitterish sulphuric finish. Like chewing on the back end of a pencil.
Keg at the clockwork beer Co. Pours clear pale golden, nose is floral, toffee, taste is similar, dry, cold.

Half pint, which I didn’t empty, at the Clockwork brewpub. Near-clear amber-gold, headless. Smell of fruity butter. Strange taste of sour hops and butter-like malts. Oily palate. Far from persuading, to be polite (Glasgow, 12.04.2012).
Cask @ The Clockwork Beer Co. Hazy reddish amber colour, not much head. Smells & tastes of rubber. Horrible.

Cask-conditioned at Clockwork, Glasgow 15/06/10. Pale gold with a slight white head. Sweetish malt aroma with a touch of fruit. Flavour was also sweet to start, with a touch of citrus and slightly sour finish. Not wonderful.

Cask @ Brewpub. Hazy golden-greenish colour, no head. Aroma is sour malty. Flavour is slightly hoppy and malty. Sour finish. Rerate cask @ Clockwork Brewpub. Nose is rubber. Flavour is rubber, sour vegetables, very bad. Should not be allowed to be served in this condition. -.9

Draught @ Clockwork Beer Co. Brewpub, 153-1155 Cathcart Road, Mount Florida, Glasgow G42 9BH, Scotland. Clear medium orange color with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, overriped fruit, moderate hoppy, acidic citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet, light light acidic and light to moderate bitter with a average duration. Body is light medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20090410]

From tap at the brewpub. Pours almost clear and pale yellow with a small white head. Light hoppy aroma. Somewhat apple citric flavoured with a mild cornish note and medium dry bitter hops finish. Quite simple and boring.
on tap at clockwork. sparkling white wine appearance, mineral water aroma, no bitterness, actually tasted a bit like watered-down sparkling white wine

Hazy pale golden lager topped by a light white head. Not particularly clean in the nose. First of all, I smell of old melon bubble gum, accompanied by floral and dubious fruit nuances. Just quite yeasty really. In mouth, a very husky feel detracts from the attempts to appreciate. Grainy lasting film over the gums. Too cerealic and fruity to be enjoyable.
Cask ... Light yellow colour ... odd lemon notes to nose ... sparkling lemon tartness and sweet lemon with little lageryness.

Cask at the Brewpub. Mahogany and translucent with a big cream-coloured head. Malt loaf and stone fruit dominate the aroma with a touch of smoky liquorice. Tastes sweet and fruity but there is a dry herby bitter hoppiness in the finish. Body’s a bit on the thin side and there is the slightest astringency to it. OK but I think I wanted a tiny bit more.

330ml bottle at home on 27 Nov 2016, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow (bb 1 Aug 2017), earthy, toffee aroma, deep chestnut brown with a thin short-lived head, herbal, toffee flavours, oily, very bitter herbal finish on warming.
Keg at the clockwork beer Co. Pours murky deep amber, nose is light fruit, caramel, taste is sweet toffee, caramel, blackcurrant.
Cask at Clockwork beer Co. Pours dark amber with a thin white head. Aromas of toffee, biscuit, little butter. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, more biscuit. Bitter finish. Ok.
Cask @ Clockwork Beer Co. Hazy reddish brown colour, reasonable head. Toffee aroma. Dry citrus biscuit malt flavour, grapefruit aftertaste. One of Clockwork’s better beers.

Tasted this at the University of West of Scotland 1st beer festival, Paisley in March 2008. Cask, handpump dispense. Cloudy copper red in colour with a poor open white head. Strong sulphurous aroma with hints of canned fruit salad. Good smooth mouthfeel and poor lacing. Pale malts deliver a very juicy malt base with syrupy fruit salad flavours. Sweet cherries, honeydew melon, peaches and pears are present. Aromatic hop resins give a floral dusty aftertaste which compliments the malt well. Finish has a sweet edge with dry redcurrant fruit and sweet sherry notes. Reminded me of Caledonian Strong Ale in places. Worth seeking out at the brewery.

Cask @ Clockwork Brewpub. Amber colour, thin off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, bit of vegetables. Flavour is slight sour and malty, vegetables, fairly bitter, with a hint of sour fruits. Medium bodied.
Red in colour with again a flavour that i cant place that just didnt work for me.

Aroma gives rich fruity spicey malts with some ginger saying something over peppery grassy hops. Taste has a huge mouthfeel almost sticky at times it seems to rich, but the peppery hops stop it from cloying, alround defo one of the best beers iv had from a scottish brewer and may ake me think differently about this place also.

Draught at the Clockwork. Reddish dark brown. No head. Aroma of malt, fruit, vinous notes, grapefruity hop. Great mouthfeel. Almost like a barley wine despite the abv - reminiscent of Fullers Vintage Ale. Classy stuff.

Sampled draught at The Clockwork Beer Co., Glasgow Viscous and cloudy orange brown with beige creamy head. Sweet strawberry jam aroma. Initial attack of fruit flavour, then just water and citric acid. Sweet finish.
Cask Handpump at the Clockwork Beer Co, Glasgow 26/01/2002 Red coloured and cloudy appearance. Fruit and wheat aromas and tangy on the palate. Sharp finish.

Sampled draught at The Clockwork Beer Co., Glasgow Clear red, slightly hazy. The nose is full of sulphur and acidic raspberry aroma. The raspberry flavour is dry, fresh and well balanced and does wonders to the sulphuric wheat beer used as base. The finish is disappointingly sweet and one dimensional.

A re-rate, sampled at Carlisle Rugby Club, Dec. 2011. Deep mahogany coloured beer, smooth and full-flavoured. Has a subtle smokiness to it, lovely balance, warming in the chest and a good finish. Tangy, fresh and very good.
Sampled cask conditioned at Black Bull, Haltwhistle, Northumberland. Dark ruby. Roasty and grassy. Dry and malty. Chewy, full bodied. Balanced salty finish.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: cask dorata cereale lieve fruttata nota terrosa un filo terrosa nota maltata amaro piuttosto contenuto

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Celebrating Finn's latest milestone of 10000 ratings with this one at The Forum (JDW) in Hexham. Rich lacing from a creamy white head, misty golden body. Doughy fruits on the nose. Moderate taste of ripe lemon and biscuit. Mid-dry finish. Okay. (08.02.2019).

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Delt med Rune. Varm gylden. Rabarbraaroma. Smaken Svisker & overmodne rips. Ikke ueffen. Tørr avslutning.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: 9/5/2018. Cask at The Bodega, Newcastle. Pours dark gold with a creamy white head. Aroma of malt, floral hops, citrus, caramel and a slight grassy herbal edge. Moderate sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Grower.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask at Tanners Hall JDW Darlington. Golden colour, white foam head leaving lacing and citrusy aroma. Taste is malty, caramel, floral fruity, citrus, some biscuit and tangy bitterness. Light bodied, soft carbonation, dry bitter finish. Quite OK.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask (4.8%), 1/3 pint by gravity from the Main Bar, Ayrshire Real Ale Festival 2017, Concert Hall, Troon on 7 Oct 2017: malty, grain aroma, pale golden with a very thin short-lived white head and no lacing, lemon, grapefruit flavour, oily, good carbonation.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask pint on 15th April 2017 in The Cross Keys, Llanymynech (Shropshire side). Very surprised to find this on the Welsh border, and pleased too. Golden pour, white crown. Decent blend throughout, light malty front with a slight hop, bitter finish. Nothing too strong, but far from subtle. Easy drinking beer.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Draught at Milecastle Inn 160626. Clear light golden amber with a creamy thick white head. Malty and bready nose. Distinct bitterness with resins but no floral notes. Nice dry ale. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Thanks to Mark!! Pours a pale golden color with an off-white head. The smell is light toasted malt, light fruit, mild dull sweetness. The taste is earthy light toasted malt, some grass, mild dull sweetness ending with a bit of dry fruitiness. Light+ in body with elegant carbonation.

column2: Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne & Wear, England
column5: Cask @ Bridge Bier Huis, Burnley. Clear golden-blonde with a small creamy head. Has a dirty-malty nose with a crisp, slightly hoppy flavour. There’s a very small dryness in its texture too.
Bottle from Booths, Media City. Clear copper with a thin head. Has a light but tasty grainy-malt aroma and flavour. Has a small sweetness.
Bottle Asda Carlisle. Pretty average brew, lacks any distinguishing features. Pleasant enough malt and hop aromas and flavours, but......just average!
Cask by handpump at 3 Judges, Glasgow (26 May 12) - clear amber ale, bubbly white head, biscuit malt aroma, good temperature, earthy, biscuit flavour, bitter aftertaste
Nice amber colour with a thin head, malt aroma and a toffee malt taste, I like this one.

Pours orange amber with some cloudiness. Not sure supposed to be but looks good. Nice foamy white head. Nice biscuity malt nose and goldings hops. Taste is light and simple with nice balance of malt and hops.
Cask (gravity dispense) at Ealing Beer Festival, July 2009. Standard amber colour. Slightly clammy aroma. Sweetish. Straightforward bitter. Entirely serviceable but rather forgettable.

Bottle 50cl. @ Chriso’s pre GBBF Shindig ’09. Clear light to medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white grey head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel, oxidide, raisin and plum notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average duration, and a dry finish. Body is light medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20090801]

Bottled. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hops, nectar, some notes of honey as well. Flavour is nectary, honeyish, sweet wooden and gets some grassyness in the finish. Quite pleasantly balanced.
