It’s still quite fruity, again with the not-uncommon trio of fig, date, and raisin, plus some red apple, and the sweeter elements such as brown sugar, holiday spices, and caramel are also present, but apple skins and the slightly roasty, woody, dusty, and vinous aspects are strong throughout, but especially dominate the finish, creating a rather bleak and dreary final impression. There’s also a noticeable suggestion of hard alcohol that doesn’t help either. It’s full bodied on the palate and delivers moderate carbonation, but despite the suggestion of sweetness from various flavors, the mouthfeel is actually quite dry. The beer pours a hazy, amber-brown body capped by half an inch of tan-colored head that recedes to a thin ring. Overall, it’s an interesting beer, but the nose is the absolute high point. Too bad the beer doesn’t taste as good as it smells.

From a bottle which gushed the beer pours a crimson color with a medium tight head. The aroma is musty and nutty with some fig and rotting leaf notes. The flavor is malty and for lack of a better term "rustic". Lots of fig character is displayed here without being overly sweet, in fact it finishes dry and has light peppery and roasty notes throughout. On all accounts a very enjoyable beer.
25th May 2007 Warning! Early amateur rating! Dark and sumptuos beer. Rich and slightly treacly. Dark malt chocolate finish. No bitterness. Smooth. Nice.

750ml Bottle: Aroma of malt, dark ripe fruit, slight toasting, slight toffee, slight brown sugar, and a hint of yeast. Poured very deep amber/brown in color with a medium-sized, dense, beige head that diminished but lasted throughout. Cloudy. Sparkling. Full of small, medium, large, and huge-sized particles throughout. Flavor is medium to heavily sweet. Tastes of malt, slight chocolate, light roasting, slight wood, dark ripe fruit, and slight cocoa. Medium body. Thin, slightly tingly, then dry texture. Average carbonation. 8.5%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Pours deep brown with a rocky tan head. The aroma has lots of dates, raisins, plums, brown sugar, sourdough, Belgian yeast, light molasses, anise and cream. Medium / thin body that’s slick and has very light carbonation for the style. The flavor starts as an ultra-watery version of the aroma with some sourness. The finish adds some spice and caramel. Fair at best.
Tasted at Extreme Beerfest. Clear brown with apricot lights. Tasty with a thick sweet malty nose.

Sampled at the 2010 Crescent Moon Extreme Beer Festival. Hazy brown with a medium beige head. Oxidized caramel aroma. Thin in body. Mild caramel flavor. I’m not so sure what is so special about this beer.

Date: November 11, 2009 Mode: Bottle Source: Green’s, Atlanta Appearance: gusher, hazy brown, fine beige head, sticky lace Aroma: sweet malt aroma, dark fruity esters, light spicyness Body: thin body Flavor: sweet malt flavor, fruity esters, touch of chocolate, caramel sweetness, light earthyness Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 4/10; Overall: 13/20 Rating: 3.2/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **+ /4
Fles @ ‘t Brugs Beertje, Brugge VIII 2019. Fris en fruitig licht peperig pittig met koriander en aan de droge zoete kant. Wazig gouden kleur met witte schuimkraag. Origineel glas
Heldere licht gele Tripel met ruime witte schuimkraag. Fruitig met een licht bittere, maar mooi gebalanceerde afdronk

Robe blonde, fine mousse. Nez typé sur des notes fruitées et épicées sur un fond malté et une pointe hydrocarburée. Bouche à l'attaque ample et puissante, fruitée et ronde avec une belle bulle délicate et un finale équilibrée. Une triple classique et équilibrée.
Dies hier ist ein sehr guter Vertreter seiner Gattung. Zu den üblichen Gewürznoten kommt ein bisschen Schwarzbrot und Feige dazu. Für Freunde von Tripel-Bieren auf jeden Fall sehr interessant.
Bottle, Beers of Europe. Nice light golden colour with high carbonation and a billowing white foam. Fairly classic spicy yeasty tripel, medium bitterness, finishes medium dry, pretty solid.

Trübe, goldene Farbe mit weißer Schaumkrone. Malziger, würziger, hopfig grasiger Geruch. Geschmacklich malzig, würzig mit Koriander, grasig hopfig, leicht hefig. Mittlere Süße mit mittlerer Bitterkeit, mittlerer Körper mit spürbarer Kohlensäure.
33cl bottle from the belgian years. A malty boozy spicy ale. Medium body, high carbonation, slick texture. Citrusy and spicy notes, both in nose and palate, some dry hoppy finish.
Tap @Luppolo12 (Rome). Hazy golden bright, persistent white foam. Nose: spicy, peppermint a bit, bubblegum. Mouth: lovely sweet/spicy, dry, more bubblegum.
Flaska från Saveur Bieré. Smak och doft av humle, malt, jäst, honung, persika, äpple och söta päron med kryddiga och örtiga toner. Fin sötma, fruktig, rund och len, bra balans, fin beska.

F: huge, white, good retention. C: shiny gold, hazy. A: malty, fruity esters, green apple, lemon, grassy, coriander, yeast, spicy. T: malty, hint of honey, light peach, mellow fruity, peppery, coriander, full body, soapy mouthfeel, medium carbonation, good one, enjoyed, 33cl bottle from Prik & Tik ABC Drinks in Leuven.
Donkerbruine dubbel met ruime crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Kruidige aanhef, blijft lang hangen
From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.
33cl bottle from the belgian years. A malty sweet ale. Dark copper, caramel and licorice in nose, spicy, yeasty. Malt forward, overall sweet, fruity, caramel, some roasty.

Aroma sweet, chocolate, something off ( alcohol? DMS? ). Taste sweet chocolate, some caramel, fruity. Sweetness becoming a bit overpowering after a while, downright sugary even. Maybe best not to warm this one too much. Body both rather thin and a bit sticky. Feeling suddenly in the mood for stew.
Botella 33 cl en el Lúpulo Oviedo diciembre 2010. Fcpref 06..2011 Lote C. Sabores maltosos dulces algo tostados con buena sensación alcohólica 6.5vol. Normal.

Color marrón oscuro con capa de espuma marrón de un dedo de grosor. Sin carbonatación. Aroma a malta tostada, alcohol, humedad. Sabor a malta tostada, caramelo; dulce, mínimamente alcohólica. Sin más.
5/31/2011 1:13:05 PM Bottle from Bierparadijs. Dark brown body with puffy head. Nose of malts, sugar, spices. Taste of caramel, malts, sweet. Pretty good dubbel.
Brown with small yellow head. Malty aroma. Taste with roasted caramel bitter with remarkable sourness of fruity and metallic taste, bit too watery.
14/05/2015 @home. 33cl bottle from Prik&Tik Edelare. Brown with nice tanned head. Roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits, acceptable sweetness. Very nice for this style and ABV.
Beautiful.Fruity. Belgique. Nice yeast. Sweet aroma. Taste is sweet, containing cola, caramel, and toast bread.

330ml bottle in 2012. Clear pale golden with a vanishing white head. Aroma of yeasty esters, peppercorn, coriander and bready malt. Herbal and leafy flavours with a banana and soft fruit sweetness and slight bitterness on the linger.
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, slightly hazy, white foam. Strong aroma of coriander, other spices, malt, yeast. Taste: coriander, light malt, lollipops, light bitterness, so so.

Bottle. Clear golden liquid with a fine rockt white head. Aroma: spicy, peppery. Additional sweet corn and banana. Medium body. Taste: sweetish malts and a fair amount of coriander. Too much of it. Out of balance.

Pas réellement une réussite cette De Graal Blonde. Côté arômes nous sommes sur du relativement classique, coriandre, céréales/pain, miel et agrumes. Mais c’est sur l’équilibre qu’elle pêche et une ligne plutôt brouillonne. En verre blond légèrement voilé (EBC aux alentours de 20) avec un mousse blanche de 3 mm, donc rien d’exceptionnel. Le nez est classique et appréciable sur la coriandre, le pan, le miel et les agrumes. A la dégustation, nous sommes moins heureux : acidité présente laissant révéler des arômes de citron et coriandre et petit côté plastique pas agréable. La deuxième bouche est légèrement plus équilibrée laissant s’exprimer davantage le fruit (agrumes/pomme/pêche) mais avec une arrière bouche brouillon, encore portée sur l’acidité. Le final allie acidité et amertume avec des épices dominant l’ensemble. De Graal sait faire mieux.

F: huge, white, adhesive, good retention. C: pale gold, hazy. A: fruity, yeasty, apple, spicy, coriander, honey. T: malty, dusty, grassy, yeasty, touch of fruity, floral, coriander, light soapy, medium body, medium carbonation, good, easy drinking and tasty, enjoyed, 33cl bottle from Prik & Tik ABC Drinks in Leuven.
Drunk in the restaurant Bier Central Antwerp. Clear blond beer with a short white head, typical Belgian Ale, yeast is dominated, not special,

Bottled 330ml (Beergium) Slightly hazy yellow color, small white head. Belgi yeasty, pear aroma with some grassy notes. Medium-bodied. Fruity Belgi yeasty, pear, grass, light metal. Short pear fruity finish. Very standard.
33cl fles. Helder goudgeel kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. Aroma van honing en gist. Smaak is honing zoet, mout, fruitig en gist. Medium Lichaam, veel koolzuur. Bier is mooi in balans.
Bottle. Mostly clear golden color with a medium thin foamy white head. Aroma of honey, yeast and wheat. Sour and medium bitter taste. Medium body. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Flaska från Saveur-bier. Gyllenfärgad, lätt disig, lågt skum. Söt och ganska kryddig doft med lite söt frukt i bakgrunden. I grunden en söt blond med lätt kropp, lite som en lättare variant av Duvel med söta fruktiga inslag, söta päron, äpplen, apelsinskal och druvor. På det en rejäl kryddighet med pors, malört, koriander som kanske är lite väl tilltagen. Men annars ett trevlig belgare.

Uitzicht: Gouden bier met een zeer licht wazig met witte schuimkraag. Aroma: moutig, kruidig, fruitig, bloemig, beetje gember, kaneel. Smaak: moutig, kaneel, gember, kruidig, fruitig, bloemig, Mondgevoel: middelmatig met gemiddeld koolzuur. Totaal: Aanvankelijk typische Belgische Ale, maar met een onderliggende kruidigheid veroorzaakt door de gember. Na een tijdje is er een milde maar onderscheidende smaak van gember, zeker niet te veel. Nogal een interessant en goed gemaakt brouwsel.

Golden with a very light haze, white head. The first impression is that of a typical Belgian Ale, but with an underlying spicyness caused by the ginger. Just after a while there is a mild but distinctive taste of ginger, yet not too much. Quite an interesting and well crafted brew.

Trotz des ordentlichen Alkoholgehaltes kommt dieses Bier (im Vergleich zu anderen belgischen Starkbieren) eher mild herüber. Eine friedliche Bittere passt sich gut mit den fruchtigen Aromen an. Ein gemütliches Bier, das sich leicht und angenehm trinken lässt ohne langweilig zu sein.
Fles 33cl thuis. Gember aanwezig niet te overheersend, zacht, geel fruit, nadronk gember. (4-2017).
Tasty, but rather blant version of a ginger beer, the ginger really only kicks in after the 3rd sip and doesn't last very long. Shame, because otherwise quite dull taste.

Déception avec cette De Graal Gember qui manque d'équilibre et de structuration. Robe blond doré voilé (EBC aux alentours de 17) surmontée d'une mousse blanche de 8 mm d'épaisseur. Nez pas exceptionnel avec orange, gingembre, citronnelle, céréales, un brin acidulé et avec un petit côté plastique. L'attaque est également acidulée et toujours avec ce petit goût de plastique avec, en complément du miel, du gingembre et des agrumes. Pas réellement équilibré. La deuxième bouche voit l'amertume et l'acidité monter en intensité avec un gingembre qui devient plus présent. L'arrière, linéaire reste peu équilibrée. La troisième bouche est la plus appréciable, sur un bon équilibre aromatique et un gingembre très bien intégré. Le final, peu intéressant, ne continue malheureusement pas sur la lancée. Trop court, retrouvant l'acidité avec des arômes de citron et gingembre. L'alcool, pourtant à 8% Abv, ne structure pas assez la bière et le sucre quant à lui est légèrement surdosé. Dans le genre, on fait mieux.
Decent triple, not too alcoholic or sweetish, malty, light bitterness with noticable but not overpowering ginger aroma and taste adding depth. Soft, lingering bitterness. Well made I think.

F: huge, white, long lasting. C: gold, hazy. A: malty, spicy, fruity, floral, bit of ginger, cinnamon. T: malty, cinnamon, ginger, spicy, fruity, floral, medium to full body, medium carbonation, soapy mouthfeel, ginger beer, good balanced, enjoyed, 33cl bottle from Prik & Tik ABC Drinks in Leuven.
Sample, Golden beer, medium head. Aroma is malt, yeast, ginger. Taste is the same, bitter some sweetness. not bad.
Bottle at home. Cloudy golden, white foamy head. Yeasty, dry, grainy malty triple, ginger blends nicely along. Good body, medium-high carbonation.

500ml Bottle - Golden with a white head. The aroma is moderately smoky with notes of ash and citrus. The taste leans more onto the citrussy side with the noticeable yet fairly subtle smoky notes taking a backseat.

Yellow, a little dark light hazy beer with a white head. Nose: Garass, pine, caramel malt, wood, tobacco, smoke and bread. Taste: Caramel, tobacco, oak, resin, smoked grain and pilsner malt. Mouth: Medium body. High but smooth carbonation. Smooth beer! A smoaky taste but not to much! A dry bitter ending.

resin, floral, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, caramel, bread, hay, cereal, chocolate, light sweetness, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium bitterness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium sourness, heavily sour, salty, umami,
Bernsteinfarben. Milder weicher Trunk mit einer feinen Würze. Süffig und feingehopft!
Probier 2016. Hazy golden, offwhite foam. Buttery malt start, tropical nuts, a bit peat, a hint buttery finish. Fullbodied.
Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is grass, hops, butter, onion. Taste is lots of butter. Sugary sweet, less hop bitterness. Very smooth and heavy. Nice.

Tap. Orange-copper color with big eggshell head. Aroma is grainy, malty, sweetish fruits, diac. Taste is sweetish, malty, slightly fruity, buttery again. Medium carbonation. Not bad, but not impressive either.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty - faintly grainy and lightly sweetish aroma, light bread and faint smokiness, light hoppyness. Body is medium, malty - faintly grainy and lightly sweetish flavor, light caramel/bread, faint smokiness, faint hoppyness. Finish is average, malty - faintly grainy and lightly sweetish with light bread and hoppyness. Nothing wrong - nothing special. I did not get any whisky here. Could be drier with more smokiness/(whiskymalz).
Bottle, 500 ml, courtesy of Miro. Shared with him and Kova. Pours orange, white head. Malty, bit smoked, some caramel. Dry finish. Medium bodied.

50 cl bottle. Deep gold/orange color.Hazy. Small off-white head. Short lasting retention.Interesting aroma :malty with smoke hints. Smoked salmon and some fruits flavor . Medium to light body. Medium carbonation.
Tap. Pours cloudy amber with a White head. Aroma of bready, minerals, spicy, slight grassy. Creamy, slight minerals, slight toasted - touch of toffee. Sweet
500ml Bottle - Amber in colour. Sultanas, bread and dried fruit in the aroma. Bready, malty and refreshing taste with rye, nuts, caramel and dried apricot. Easy to drink and refreshing.
olla suffki della kellaris ondra festa astra greifus con forziheimi, klassti birras

Thanks to the boys again for this one. Aroma is caramel, nuts, a whiff of dried dates, overripe banana, some grains, a little syrup. Taste is caramel forward malt sweetness with some lesser grassy hop tartness. Full body, kinda chewy, almost oily, still quaffable and light. A perfect example of a beer that is quaffable yet full bodied. Long sweet caramel finish. Good.

Oktoberfest et nous sommes précisément en septembre, le mois où elles sont le plus consommées .. pour cause de Münchenfest !! Niveau abv de 5,5 % pour 13,5° plato, en format 50 cl, de ce brewpub de Forchheim, au nord de Nürnberg .. Mon exemplaire était à 2 mois avant sa date. Couleur ambré aux reflets bronze superbes, et grande clarté cristalline. Bulles extrêmement fines, en fontaine centrale, très vives. Mousse beige, soyeuse, stable à 2 mm. Arômes de malt cara, toffee, et une fantastique bière luxembourgeoise maltée dont j'avais fait mon dada pendant une période de ma vie. 1ère bouche souple, précise, sur toffee et butterscotch. Arrière-bouche fine, nette, à l'amertume stylée. 2ème bouche équilibrée, au style festif indiscutable. Arrière-bouche souple, bien dosée pour le style. 3ème qui permet de savourer ce malt grillé superbe. Longueur qui pourrait durer toute la nuit (tiens ça me rappelle une pub pour quelque chose de beaucoup moins bon …). Jambes fines, longues. Levure adaptée au style. Alcool très bien pour l'objectif visé. Finale très agréable, impeccable. CONCLUSION : enfin une oktober qui mérite pleinement son nom de festbier, et qui mérite en plus sa médaille d'or aux WBA de 2017 … Ceci est à noter, parce que c'est loin d'être toujours le cas !! Je pourrai donc faire une oktoberfest un jour, mais pas à Munich pour moi, à Forchheim … Toute la nuit avec Anna dans le Greif's keller !!

Bottle. Clear amber-copper color with beige head that is rather large-bubbled. Aroma is caramel and earthy hops, bready, classic Festbier aroma. Taste is caramel malts, bready, a bit rustic, medium sweet, but not too sweet. Silky to foamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. A standard Franconian Festbier, doesn't do anything wrong.

Keg at GBBF 2018. Low key yeasty aroma. Slightly cloudy gold. Fluffy white head. Some bitterness with a sweet core. Medium bodied. Slick. Average carbonation. Long finish. More interesting than a bog standard lager but that's not saying much.
deep golden amber color. Apricot and bready character. A touch sweet and rich but overall just middle of the road Marzen

500ml bottle. Clear, orangey, pale amber colour with average, frothy, moderately lasting, minimalyl lacing, white head. Mellow, minimally husky, malty aroma, a touch of honey and cereals. Taste is sweet-ish malty, mildly bitter, grassy hoppy counterweight, a touch of honey and cereals. Very clean, well balanced - nice.
Pours a pale golden color with a nice white head. Sweet malty aroma. light body, Flavor is malty with hints of hops

Gekocht op 16-08-2018 bij Dranken Geers in Oostakker. En thuis geproefd op 24-11-2018. La Hervoise wordt verdeelt door SA Corman-Collins in Battice en is een wazig donker-bruin biertje dat maar weinig beige schuim maakt bij het uitschenken. Het heeft een romig tot moussige structuur en het blijft wel op een normale manier aan het glas kleven. Pareling kan je zeer moeilijk zien wegens de donkere kleur van het bier. Het schuim zakt vlug in elkaar en na een tijdje blijft er slechts een zeer dun fijn laagje over. Het aroma is karamel-zoet met wat citrus, vanille en een hout-toets. De smaak is karamel zoet en karamel-moutig. In de mond toont La Hervoise een volle body met een ietwat olieachtige textuur en toch ook prikkelend koolzuurgas. Een eerder complex biertje. De nasmaak is wat plakkerig en vloeit lang uit, is wat hop-bitterig en zoetig met hier toch wel wat peer en ook koffie-mout en een heel licht droogje. Een leuk biertje gebrouwen met siroop op basis van appelen en peren maar dit heb ik met enige moeite slechts in de nasmaak waargenomen. Foto's en wat info vind je op: http://www.beersfrombelgium.eu/nl/La_Hervoise-b-528.html

Bouteille offerte par Jean-Paul de ... Herve. Apparence : grenat, petite mousse. Nez : épices, fruits rouges, poire. Bouche légèrement acidulée, un peu de candi (de sirop ?), du caramel, des fruits (cerise, prune, poire). Corps moyen, petite amertume. Pas mal car le sucre est maitrisé et l'alcool est bien caché.

Bière au sirop de Herve (c'est un sirop de poires et de pommes confectionné au pays de Herve). Robe rousse brune, belle mousse aux reflets orangées, haute et crémeuse qui tient longtemps. Nez fruité, on retrouve le sirop de poire, groseilles et fraises. Bouche également fruitée sur des saveurs de poires et de fraises, amertume agréable avec de houblons herbeux et épicés. Longueur moyenne mais amertume durable, les notes de fruits restent quand même bien en bouche, corps dense limite liquoreux, bonne carbo, alcool qui chauffe les oreilles. Belle surprise, méfiant habituellement quant à l'ajout de sirop dans la bière, on a ici un bel équilibre entre l'amertume de la bière, le sucre et le côté fruité du sirop de Herve !
33cl Flasche. Hellbraunes Bier, dünner Schaum. Fruchtig-malziges Aroma. Antrunk alkoholische Früchte. Malz.

(bottle) murky brown colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of roasted wheat and bubble gum, with lots of bum bum schnaps, liquorice and earth. flavour is more bubble gum and cherry juice, slightly tannic, with a hint of yeast and a light toasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Brown. Aroma is indeed pear, caramel, earthy, soy sauce. Taste is quite dry with sour pear and some tannins. Also quite some amount of dead yeast. Murky alcoholic. A bit watery still. Misses some body. Ok.
Bottle. Dry chocolate covered pear/berry, some spices. Murky brown, offwhite lace. Permumed, metallic roast, light salt, chalky light mouthfeel. Dry muddled finish.

Bottle. Brown color with white head. Aroma is pear syrup indeed, chocolate, dark malts, a touch roasted. Taste is fruit syrup, chocolate, earthy, herbal. Silky mouthfeel with high carbonation. Drinkable, but not too convincing.

F: medium size, tan, quick diminishing. C: dark brown, hazy, opaque. A: malty, pear, cocoa, mellow fruity, bit spicy, candy. T: red/dark fruits, bit herbal, spicy, caramel, pear, not very sweet, bit honey, interesting but in a good way, medium body and carbonation, not great but good, enjoyed, 33cl bottle from Carrefour market, Route de Marche, Bastogne.
Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass ; from the fridge. Great aromatic beer, with a nice colour. Go for it

Pint on cask. Pours clear copper golden with a white top. Aroma: pale malts, floral, lemon, grassy hop. Taste: light sweet, light better, citrus pith, lemon, caramel, toffee, lightly astringent. Light body, average carb, dry finish

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Appearance - bright amber, like an ember. Nose - struck match. Malt bag. Taste - light orange, dried biscuit. Then maybe orange pith on the finish. Palate - light to medium bodied with a tangy texture and a reasonably good finish. Overall - ok.
Bottle shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours clear amber with a thick white head. Aromas of toffee and struck match. Some caramel. Taste is slightly better. Light astringent and pithy. Dry finish.
Bottle. Amber in colour. Malty (grainy malts, some caramel). Fruity (slight citrus). Hoppy (grassy hops). Bitter citrus hoppy throughout. Dry citrus hoppy finish. Not bad. (2008)
cask golden dry medium bitterness earthy bit citric oro buonaschiuma secca amaro piuttosto terrosi filo citrico
Cask at the Tockwith Festival. Amber with an off white head. Very mild malt aroma. Citrus and toasty malt. Average.

50cl bottle from Tesco’s, Wokingham. Bottle-conditioned, so a slightly hazy chestnut pour with a billowing, creamy head; rich, complex malty aroma, with some floral notes; buttery, caramel malt taste, with some berry fruit; and an elegant spritzy finish. A well-made, farmhouse-style bitter.

Cask at White Cross Beer festival 2014. Copper ale with a massssssive white head. Nose is floral, lemony hops. Light and breezy in the mouth imparting some lemon, tasty light biscuits, touch of toffee. Sweet, bitter, balanced.

Bottled: This unassuming golden orange beer kicked every-other beerz ass this X-Mas: Smell this beer , because it has the nicest grassy hop aroma ive smelt in fucken ages !!! , woody , musty and rich like an isolated log-wood cabin from a horror-movie . .I wasn’t expecting much from this because as everyone tells me , Im judgemental and narrow !This is twisting my palate .. ;floral chewy hops , caramel . notes of cricket wicket like grass resemblance .resin. I like the mustiness. . Maybe I got a bombastic bottle ? I don’t care , A damn nice ale !

Bitter and dry but very malty flavour. Not so much a floral aroma, in fact tastes like most if not all of its complexity must originate from the choice of grains and fermentables, not a variety of hops. Takes a while to unfold in its full complexity. Due to the high bitterness it takes some effort to get through all if the layers.
# 439; 9/2016. Plný, sladový polotmavý ležák. Vyvážená chuť, sladové, topinkové, kořenité, mírně karamelové.
A good beer, great body, tasteful. Amber colour. I will recommend this beer.
Aroma Czech hop. Taste Malt with hop bitterness at the end. Pleasant body beer.
I drank this at the brewery, it is for some reason cloudy, which I don’t understand. And has a weird hazy-like astringency. I don’t understand why it is so good.
Tap @ Butchers Tears. Amber color. Grassy aroma with a hint of caramel. Malty bready grassy flavor. Sweetish.

Draft at brewpub. Pours with a large dense off white head over a clear amber body. Negligible aroma but nice taste of brown bread crust with a touch of caramel and a herbal hop finish. Medium bodied moderate carbonation. Great lacing.

Klášterní pivovar Strahov Praga Wygląd: Barwa ciemno złota wpadającą w bursztyn z minimalną opalizacją. Piana złamanej bieli, wysoka zbudowana z drobnych oczek, opada do sporej ostatniej warstwy pozostawiając ślady na szkle. Aromat: Średnio lotny, głównie słodowy, biszkoptowy, lekko chlebowy, ciasteczkowy, bardzo subtelny karmel, na pograniczu ziołowość chmielowa i nuta estrów jabłkowych, a po zamieszeniu szkłem także cytrusowych. Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie, ciut więcej ziołowości. W ustach pełne, półsłodkie. Treściwość średnia, wysycenie w stronę niskiego. Goryczka niska, ziołowa, krótka. Finisz słodowy, biszkoptowy, odrobinę karmelowy oraz nuta ziołowej goryczki.
Draught at the brewpub. Cloudy golden colored with a small white head. Malty aroma of hay and hops. Malty flavor of hay and hops with notes of grass. Hoppy finish.

On tap at Klášterní Pivovar Strahov, pours a hazy amber with a small beige head. Aroma brings out bready malt and a touch of caramel. Flavour brings out bready malt and light caramel. Clean and finishing lightly bitter. Good stuff.

Bottle from the brewery - big thanks to Di! It pours lightly hazy copper with a medium off-white head. The aroma is toasty grain, cereal, hearty bread, earthy, wood and light spice. The taste is dry, bitter, toasty grain, cereal, brown bread, bit of spice, bio of alcohol and leather with some tannin with a drying finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Not bad. Earlier Rating: 3/11/2017 Total Score: 3.5 Bottle, big thanks to Ian. It pours clear deep golden - amber with a medium white head. The aroma is rich, malt - driven, brown bread, rivita, toasty grain, cereal and touch of orange sherbet. The taste is smooth, bitter, rich malty action, bitter - sweet, wood, leather, cereal, toasty grain, spice and toasted grain with a drying, woody finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Good example of style.

7/19/2007: Elevator XTRA Kölsch is a pretty mild Vienna-style Lager. It’s color is light amber and there is a bit of toasted malt in the aroma and flavor. The hoppiness is quite subtle and just barely enough to give the beer a slightly spicy hop flavor and mild bitterness. Drinkable, but not great. Draught at the The Smiling Skull Saloon during the Ohio Brew Week in Athens, Ohio. Rating #1 for this beer...

Presented as Elevator Hubris Clear yet deep, ruby-tinted-amber with an off-white head that re-emerges upon swirling. Sweet roasty grains (probably the most aromatic of today’s brews) with defined lagering yeasts behind. Light dirtiness to the flavor (earthen) of sweet malts against rye bitterness. Roasts linger. Steady body carries flavor a long while. Well done. On draught at Elevator Brewing Co., Columbus, OH 43215
Sampled at Ohio Brew week in Athens. Listed as Hubris - Vienna Style lager. Malty aroma, that seems sweet and smoky. Tastes like smoked peat. A bit thin and sour.

Comp from the Bartender. Nose of chocolate & dried fruit, toast, and smoke. The brew is a ruby copper. The tall beige head is mostly lasting and leaves light lace. The huge toasty flavor is slightly sweet & roasted. The finish is long and subtly smokey. The medium soft body is creamy. Very interesting.
Amber color with a small beige head. Toasted malt aroma. Malty flavor with a slight amount of bitterness.
Nice amber color with a thin head. Not a spectacular aroma. nicely and slightly bitter. medium thin body. crisp aftertaste. Reminiscent of Murphy's Irish Amber.
A very good amber color to it. Not a bad beer...............................
A little on the syrupy side for me. Strong sweet flavor. I couldn't drink a whole glass in a reasonable amount of time.

Me: Do you have any seasonal beers? Waiter: Yes, we have a Vienna-Style Amber Lager. Me: That sounds good, I'll have that. Waiter: Here you go. Me: By the way, what do you call this beer? Waiter: Vienna-Style Amber Lager. Me: No, I mean what is the name of it. Waiter: Vienna-Style Amber Lager. Me: Oh... I didn't like this one as much as Great Lakes' Eliot Ness but it was still a good seasonal from the Elevator. Lack of creativity in naming it aside, it was not a bad beer at all. Dark amber color with medium bone white head and rather sticky lacing. Sweet malty aroma. Flavor was sweet and a little syrupy. I'll get this one again next year.

column1: Streets of New York Skyline Stout
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Opaque black color. Head was tan, lasted a while, and left some lace on the glass. Aroma was of milk chocolate, vanilla, and subdued coffee. Smooth on the tongue with vanilla, roasted malt, and a touch of smoke.

column1: Streets of New York Skyline Stout
column5: This beer has a wispy full tan to light brown colored head that sits atop a deep-dark amber-brown to black beer that is somewhat hazy. It shows amber highlights when held up to the light. The aroma has strong notes of coffee, lightly roasted malt and chocolate. The taste is sweet with a solid chocolate note, and finishes off with a smooth, roasty, light bitterness. This is quite quaffable and pretty tasty, I would be happy to drink a couple pints of this. There is some fruitiness here (I get notes of raisin and fig) as well as a hint of vegetal character in the finish.

column1: Streets of New York Skyline Stout
column5: Didn’t get much of anything from this sample so had full glass. Good thing I did. Best beer of the day. Black body with tan creamy head and real good lacing. Good chocolate aroma with some light coffee. Rich chocolate roasted flavor to it.

column1: Streets of New York Skyline Stout
column5: Black with a nice thick head with a roasty malt, chocolate and coffee aroma. Flavor is rich and creamy with a heavy roasty finish.

column1: Streets of New York Skyline Stout
column5: Great bar, but this is one bad beer. Easily the worst Stout I've ever tried. It has a creamy, buttery aroma, which certainly is not what one would expect from a stout. Light tan head, dark body; at least it looked the part. The beer was sour and undrinkable. The other two beers I had there, IPA and Central Park Pale Ale, were both excellent. So, either they don't know how to make Stouts, or somebody screwed up badly on this one.

column1: Streets of New York Central Park Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Slightly hazy orange color with a lasting white head that laced the glass. Attractive buttery caramel and flowery hop aroma. Flavor was dominated by flowery hop and was accompanied by mild hop bitterness.

column1: Streets of New York Central Park Pale Ale
column5: 12 oz glass at the brewery. Citric, fruity aroma with some cereal and grainy notes present. No hops really detected. Not much going on. Perhaps the ugliest beer I have EVER seen. Opaque, murky, orange-yellow color with no head at all. This seriously looks REALLY wrong. Sweet, sugary, fruity start with some graininess and faint hops to finish. There is absolutley no carbonation present. I think they fucked up and served me some wort.

column1: Streets of New York Central Park Pale Ale
column5: This beer is quite clear with a pretty copper color and a wispy pale tan colored head. The aroma is lightly citrusy with a hint of diacetyl that slowly becomes more evident with time. The taste is a mix of flavors dominated by the diacetyl and a weird phenolic, sharp flavor that is sort of like burnt plastic. Oh yeah, there are some beer-like notes too; I get a hint of malty caramel, a wisp of spicy, citrusy hops and a very light bitterness in the finish. The off flavors do not make this undrinkable, but this is certainly not worth having more of.

column1: Streets of New York Central Park Pale Ale
column5: A darker shade of gold. White head and some lacing. Not much to the aroma. Flavor was heavy on the palate and kind of bland. Didn’t have that hop bite.

column1: Streets of New York Central Park Pale Ale
column5: On tap at Streets of new york. Mesa Poured copper amber with small head an heavy sticky lacing. Light aroma of malt and hops. Body was a bit watery with the flavor of malt and hops. Refreshing summer beer.

column1: Streets of New York Central Park Pale Ale
column5: No aroma to speak of. Thinnish head, deep amber. Good lace. Nothing special about the appearance. Strong malt hides behind the even stronger hops. Very good IPA; strong and satisfying.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Clear orange color with an off white head that laced the glass. Smelled of malty caramel and light flowery hops. Mild hop bitterness, but not much hop flavor. Minimal malty caramel flavor with a woody hickory note.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: Medium amber color with no foam. Light sweet grassy, grainy nose. Light sweet caramel start with a light citrus hop bitterness in the finish. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Pretty tame for an IPA.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: Small 2 ounce sample at the brewpub--see my place rating for you to realize why. More of an earthy/floral bitter aroma with a little sweet maltiness with some pine aroma as well. Mildly hazy honey-orangeish color with frothy off-yellowish head and nice lacing. Citrus hoppiness to start with grapefruit notes. Malts are very light. Just a grapefruit monster with lingering hopped dryness. Needs more malt backbone.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: This beer is lightly hazy and is a full copper color with amber hints to it. The head is wispy and wan with a pale tan color to it. The aroma is strangely lacking, perhaps a bit of herbal hops, plus a subtle note of grapefruit. The taste has quite a bit more bitterness than I was expecting from the bland nose. The bitterness and the carbonation combine to give this beer a spritzy quality. There is a bit of caramel like maltiness here, as well as a hint of spicy, citrus hop flavor and some fruitiness, but mostly the bitterness is noticeable. This is quaffable and clean, and I like this as a session brew.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: Copper amber with a big thick head and lacing that hangs on the pint glass. Aroma is all hops and citrus with a good hops and citrus flavor that stayed long on the palate. A good medium strength, easy drinking IPA

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: 2005 Great Arizona Beer Festival sample 8oz. Nice amber color to the body. Hoppy aroma. Had detected a citrus flavor in this beer. Good easy finish.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: I had this at the Great Arizona Beer Festival in Phoenix. A very nicely hopped IPA.

column1: Streets of New York India Pale Ale
column5: Floral and malty aroma. Thin head, dark amber body, good lace. Somehow it was lacking that "drink me" look, however. Very hoppy. Rich and full-bodied. A very solid pale ale. I would drink it all night, but based upon the sketchy service at the Scottsdale (Shea) location, it might have taken me all night just to catch a buzz!

Clear amber with a thin light tan head. Light carbonation. Clean, crisp smooth and malty sweet. Some citrus elements as well. Medium light body. Sharp and tingly. Well lagered. Toasted caramel coated popcorn flavors emerge as it warms. Good session brew.

Please note that on my older reviews I used a 100 point scale. To make up for any scoring discrepancies, all palate and apearance scored are assigned a neutralized 3/5. Undated review: This was a golden beer with a white head (actual name was slightly different). The beer smelled like dust and sweet. It tasted very hoppy in a good way.

Hazy amber with a sticky light tan head. Slow carbonation. Huge hop nose. Hoppy, citric and lush with bushy hop notes. Mellow body. Medium natured. Alcohol tasted in wisps. Dangerous with loads of Cascade hops and wheat malts for supreme drinkability. Surprised me with the amount of hops in this one.
GABF 2003. Poured very dark red with nice tan head. Aromas of coffee and chocolate. Sweet and warm mouthfeel. Very nice.

Nice dark brown color. Way too much chocolate in the aroma and flavor for me, but a nice beer in general. The feel was too watery, thin. I think the strong aroma had me expecting the body of a stout instead of a porter.
A clearish orange-yellow, white cover. Aroma is lemony, borderline citrus, and crackery malt with a crystal twang. Taste is similar, solid malt backing and a good hop taste, light bittering finish.
Pours amber with white head. Nice caramel nose. Same for flavor with a mild bitter and some grassy notes.
Draft. Pours golden orange with a white head. Sweet malty aroma with floral hops. Similar flavor, sweet malts, floral hops, and a very light buttery notes. Not awful, but not great either.

This one pour a clear amber color with an off white head. Aroma was some stale malt, and fresh triple C hops. Flavor was nice fresh hops but extremely watered down. Tasted like water with hops crushed in it. If this had some body too it, it would be pretty decent.
Medium gold, thin white chainmail head. Faint classic aroma. Lemony, not bitter, a bit briny. Not outstanding or distinctive, but a servicable session beer.

On tap at the Pittsburgh Rock Bottom. Has some hoppy aroma and a slight hint of vinegar smell. It is a bit floral and fruity too. Has the ubiquitous appearance of american pale yellow lager. This tries to come on like an IPA but it never quite gets there. More well behaved and mannered. Easier to drink and appreciate compared to an IPA. This stuff is OK considering I don’t like hopped brews and it is not offensive. If you like hops, this may be less than you would expect for the style. Taste is as mild as the lumpy dog, pretty fruity and flowery. They also offer a cask edition that is dry hopped. and you can tell it is.

A blah pale ale. My first ever visit to this place, I was expecting a lot more. Aroma was weak hops. Pour was a clear orange with no head. Taste was malty and syrupy with hops in the background. Not much of an aftertaste.
On tap in Pittsburgh. Yellow amber with white head. Aroma is faint citrus and floral. Flavor is apricot, hops, floral, and wheat. On the mild side.

Not that great. I’ve had a lot of the rock bottom beers, most of which I dont see listed here. but this was certainly one of the better ones. this place really just doesnt seem to make beer that well for a restaurant who’s entire marketing scheme is targeted toward their beer making ability. The first time I went to this restuarant I could tell i was getting ripped off. I still go there cause they have great food, a lot of which is made with their beer. I just suggest saving your money and getting a water instead of an overpriced and unfulfilling homebrewed beer. The pesto pizza and sausage soaked beer pizza is highly recommended.
A good balance of malt and hops. A bit on the citrus/grapefruit side, which is where an APA should be. Appeals to the Rock Bottom crowd.
This is a *huge* beer in every way - flavor, appearance, ABV. Might be the best Titletown offering yet.
RAM Restaurant. Clear yellow, white lacing foam head. Barley aroma, bitter taste with citrus tones. Taste is staying quite long. (Chicago 201510)

Aroma is very light with hoppy/lemon tones. Color is a hazy copper with an average but "busy" head. Flavor features a fruity/hop character with very light malt support--light citrus accent in the medium-dry finish...Body is moderately light, as is the carbonation, which makes for a nice overall smoothness...In sum, this is a tasty brew but lacking some balance and body due to the light malt influence.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Better Kölsch than in Cologne. On tap at Bryce Canyon Lodge; refreshing with some bitterness as added bonus.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: 12 oz. can, poured into a frosted mug at the Bryce Canyon Pines Restaurant. Pale yellow color, with a big, frothy, white head. The nose is hay, lemon peel, white bread, light pine, and dust. Sweet and malty, with a bit of bitterness. Light body, with a watery, thin, lightly acidic mouthfeel. This is a weak and thin kölsch. Refreshing, but not that tasty.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Another great and refreshing beer from Uinta Brewing Co. Pours a clear golden and has a slightly bitter taste. Overall, very good.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Draft at the brewery. Pours clear pale gold with a creamy white head and lots of lacing. Tastes like sweet corn, grassy hops, straw, creamy wheat, and some lemon. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like citrus creamy wheat, corn, lemon, get grassy hops, and straw.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Bottle. Yellow pour, with a white head. Watery, light, biscuity/bready, mild grassiness, and a bit sweet. Boring, but drinkable.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Not much aroma. Light and refreshing. Great Caramel notes. Just something I can’t describe that I really like. First kolsch. Beautiful glass a beer. Upgrading my sample to a pint

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Cloudy and murky golden with a medium rocky white head. Bready and toasty German blonde grains on the nose with a wee kiss of grassy dry bitterness. Smooth and lasting delightful flavor that’s German blonde and grainy, a were touch grassy, crisp and dry yet lingering with just the right amount of lightly toasted bread.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: This brew was highly carbonated and of a peach tea hue, with small islands of head. Sweet, toasty cereal grain nose that creates and enticing presence. The body is likewise toasty and of sweet cereal grains and caramel/crystal malting. Not a hop cone to be sensed anywhere. The flavor is much like fresh wort--as it seems rather underattenuated. It’s almost like drinking Kellogs Corn Flakes.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: On tap @ Uinta. Dark golden pour with a nice white head. There’s a nice biscuity and almost doughy/cake batter thing to it. Perhaps a bit sweeter than I’d normally like in a Kolsch, but not bad. Some light grassy hop character, a touch of apple esters, and lemon peel. Light bitterness on the back end. Decent enough.

column2: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
column5: Golden pour with 1-finger white head and lacing. Bready/cereal, bit of a lemon note. Not very good, pretty bland. Disappointing.
Cask Handpump at the Bankers Draft, Sheffield (JDW) 23/08/2003 Golden amber coloured with a cloudy appearance. Slightly acidic tasting. Hop finish.

Cask handpull at County Hotel, JDW, Ashford. Reddish brown colour with thick lasting cream head. Rich biscuity caramel throughout. Hop finish kind of balances the sweetness of the caramel and there is some green apple as well. There is nothing to hold the whole thing together it lacks cohesiveness.

Beer Engine: Dark brown orange with minimal head. . . deep malty aroma - reminds me of Kalamazoo Bells malt. . . soft sweet, chewy caramel. Creamy palate with some cotton candy flavours along with caramelized bananas and soft pears.
Cask, Golden Lion, Rochester. Sweetish malt with citric balance. Pale amber colour. Apple on the nose - ripe and juicy. A pleasant modern bitter.

Plain bitter. Pretty standard amber-red appearance with a bit of an irregular head. Mild aroma, slightly buttery with a suggestion of popcorn. Watery palate, relieved by only a faint hint of life later in the finish. Lacking support, some maltiness but weak. (on tap, Willow Walk [Weatherspoons], London)
Cask Conditioned. Sweet malty bitter with little overall character. Some dry bitterness but mostly average
Aroma di malti e erbaceo leggero, in bocca corpo esile máltato con finale amaro secco
12oz bottle @Ole Bridge Bar Reno-pours a white head and gold color. Aroma is grassy, light/medium malt. Taste is grassy/spice hops, light/medium malt with some sweet.
I’m not really a fan of lighter beers, and this certainly falls into that category. The aroma was practically non-existent as well, which was disappointing.

Bottle. Very light citrus aroma. Thin to medium body with mild carbonation. Flavor is light malt and mild citrus and grassy hop. The finish is actually grassy in a dry way. It’s mild, but flavorful. The grassiness gets a bit over the edge, but it is flavorful. I doubt that Mammoth can make an unpleasant product. The grassiness makes this a substantial, compared to most Kolsches, ale. Very drinkable.

Date: 12/03/2007 Mode: Bottle Source: Roadtrip hazy light gold, wispy white head, lightly sweet grain aroma with light floral and earthy hops, sweet malt flavor, lots of cereal character, a touch of sweet corn, well balanced with floral hops, light lasting bitter finish, Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 7/20 Rating: 1.9/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: *+/4
White head on top of a clear yellow. Not a whole lot of aroma. Some malt sweetness and mild hoppiness. Carbonated on the palate. Pleasant after a day of boarding but nothing special.

Aroma is slightly sweet bready malt, similar to a pilsner more or less. Pours yellow gold with a small velvetty head. Flavor is sweet bready and mildly fruity malt. There is some citrus hop presence, but it is mild. A malty sugary mouthfeel lingers, as well as some gentle spiciness. Definitley smooth and drinkable, but like the last rater said, it does seem a little heavy for the style. Definitley the heaviest beer I have had tonight.
Light aroma, a little funk. Has a spice taste to it but I can’t quite place it. A bit heavy for the style, but mostly pretty decent.
Bottle: Grassy hop and toasty malt nose; sweet and vegetal flavor, ax.......
Probably their weakest and worst offering, unless you’re a fan of the style - I’d save your money. But hey, its better than Bud, Coors, or Miller . . def not awful by an means

Flasche 0,5l: Bernstein, leicht grünstichig, kräftige Trübung, sehr stabiler kräftiger feinporiger Schaum; frische Nase, leichte fruchtige Süße, dezente Zitrusnoten, leichte Hopfennoten, kräftige Hefearomen, reife Bananen, Malz, Getreide, kräftig Karamell; frischer + leicht fruchtiger Körper, malzig-fruchtige Süße, leichte Hopfennoten, kräftige Hefearomen, Bananen, Malz, Karamell, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgang

L: -pours a cloudy deep golden-orange with a medium to big,fluffy,white head -medium to high carbonation visible S: -clove,banana,oranges,wheaty,spicy T: -Follows the nose + light acidity -Finishes dry F: -medium carbonation -medium body O: About right in the middle between the sweeter Hefeweizen Beers and the more acidic,wheaty ones. It's also really full-bodied compared to most other wheat beers.

Bottle. Banana, ester, yeast and cloves. Cloudy yellow color with medium to big sized white head. Nice banana in taste, bit spicy, medium to heavy sweetness. Medium to full body, average carbonation, sweet finish.
Sweet banana notes. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Estery sweet banana and clove.

On tap at The Globe, pours a cloudy orangey blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of banana, esters, and a little clove. Flavour is well-made, with banana, clove, and some cotton candy. Estery but in a proper way. This style is lost on me. Meh.
on tap oro velata bella schiuma pepata lieve acidita nota citrica discreta seccheza banana media
Cloudy yellow, good stable head. Aroma: wheat, ripe light fruits, some bananas, low to none cloves. Light sweetness, light tartness. Full body. Good.

Honigfarben, trüb mit mittelgroßer weißer Krone. Typischer Weißbiergeruch mit dezentem Bananen/Nelken Mix und viel süßem, staubigem Weizenmalz. Sehr weicher Antrunk mit moderater Kohlensäure. Verhalten fruchtig. Sattes Weizenmalz. Getreide. Vordergründig süß, dahinter minimal säuerlich und herb. Extrem süffig!
Classic Weizen. Hazy yellow-beige with a decent white head. Taste incorporates banana flavours, but also some sour elements. Quite refreshing and drinkable.
Una weizen ben riuscita, colore in stile giallo velata schiuma ampia e fine, persistente. Aroma sommesso, si avverte banana e frutta, meglio al palato. Carbonazione eccessiva.

On tap @Pork'n'roll Fest 2019 (Rome). Dorata limpida, schiuma leggerissima. Al naso molto morbido, sentori citrici, di stalla, fieno, erba tagliata e note balsamiche. In bocca conferma le sensazioni olfattive, molto morbido e bilanciato, appena dolce con acidità media. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Delicato ma non senza carattere, buonissimo.
Mikołaj Rutkowski is drinking an Oude Gueuze Cuvée René (2018) by Brouwerij Lindemans
Bottle at .... The Grote Dorst 2019-06-30 AR: sour tart wee sweetness AP: clear coppery, no head F: sour berries white grapes wee grainy

ami Rami is drinking an Oude Lambik by Brouwerij Lindemans at Kufle i Kapsle No nie tylko w browarze jak widac. Fajna dziczyzna, fajna owocowa kwasnosc, rzeski. Jedna rzecz mi mocno psuje - cos pomiedzy goryczka (i to nie nieska) a cierpkoscia zostaje w uscie. Niezbyt zlozony ale i tak smaczny mocno. 3.6 Earlier Rating: 8/9/2016 Total Score: 3.7 Rami Rami is drinking a Lambic (2015) by Brouwerij Lindemans at BrewDog Warszawazaskakujaco malo kwasny i taninowy a conwiecej owocowy dosc, dzikosc malo sympatyczna, smrodliwa g... Morelowy, cytrynowy, slodkawy. Cacy Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB). Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Gueuze Cuvée René (2017) by Brouwerij Lindemans at Powisle Bardzo owocowo (cytryna?) rzeskie, dzikusy slomiane, bardzo pijalne, kwasnosc srednia... nawet swieze jest pycha i do chlania :) usrednienie 3.5 i 3.9
Okoliczności nie pozwalały na zrobienie porządnych notatek, zapisałem tylko noty.

Sampling tray at de Grote Dorst, from a bladder box?, 09/12/18. Very light haze on a golden pour with an off white cap. Nose is mellow funk, straw, lemon, damp hay, grains. Taste comprises lemon tinged straw, apple core, on the turn peach, balsa wood, sweat, earthy, wood must. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Ok easy drinking Lambic.

Pour at dorst. A mostly clear golden orange coloured pour with no head. Aroma is shurbet lemon, bright citrus funk, little straw. Flavour is composed of tart and light, straw, lemon rind, sharp, earthy citrus.. Palate is crisp, easy going,, light grains, moderate carbonation.
On tap at Grote Dorst. Pours golden yellow colour. Thin white head. Fruits, apples in the aroma. Tastes like ice tea with fruity kick. Light bodied, very well drinkable lambic.
Tap at Grote Dorst. Clear golden colour, small white head stays. Aroma is fruity, berries, apples. Taste is sour, apples, juicy, creamy. Medium body, very low soft carbonation. Drinkable.
Tap at grote dorst. Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is sour, vegetables, carrots. Flavor is sour, bitter, fruity, apples. Overall: good.
33cl Bottle @ Saveur-Biere, Lille, France. Dark amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, slightly fruity. Taste follows the aroma. Medium body, average carbonation.
Profumo di caramello, malto tostato e frutti di bosco. Secca e luppolata con note tostate al palato. Una buona Scotch ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Booths, Media City. Dark amber-red with a thin head. Sweetened ale in both aroma and taste with some dark berry fruitiness. Crisp and strong tasting.

Clear dark brown, very minimal head. Aroma is slightly sour and malty. Taste is medium sweet, notes of caramel, coffee, malts but well balanced by the hops. Easy drinking and quite tasty winter beer. Not bad at all.

Bouteille achetée Au Grain d’Orge - De couleur rubis avec une fine mousse beige crémeuse - Au nez des arômes de café, de mélasse, de noisette, de fruits confit, cacao un nez complexe et magnifique comme souvent avec les scotch ale - En bouche on retrouve bien ce qu’on a au nez, des notes de café, de mélasse plus de fruits confits, une bonne présence de houblon terreux et floraux, une pointe de torréfaction - Corp moyen, amertume moyenne, carbonation pétillante, légèrement huileuse, final amère et mélasse - une bière complexe mais facile d’accès, une bonne scotch ale comment souvent avec ce type de bière

330ml bottle. A nice Scotch ale, but there are better examples like Traquair. Aroma has a very slight lemon-like freshness to it which may be from late addition hops. Colour is a reddish chestnut brown. Taste has a reasonable amount of malt for the ABV, but I would prefer it to be more viscous as some are. Sweetness is about right and the hoppiness too. Maybe this bottle could benefit from a little ageing. Overall quite enjoyable.

So gut wie keine Krone, aber schön weiß! Riecht nach Malzbier, schmeckt nach Malzbier, mit extrem viel Weizen. Sehr süß und vollmundig, im Mund ölig und Sirup nicht unähnlich. Extrem gut trinkbar, zwischen 7 und 14 Grad verändert es seinen Geschmack und die Süße. Im Abgang Honig und Karamell, vielleicht ein wenig unraffinierter brauner Zucker. Perfekt als Begleiter zu Rauchwaren oder als Digestif. Tolles Bier! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330 ml, pours ruby with beige head and remains quite long. Aroma is very fruity with black fruits, grapes and some vanilla and cocoa. Medium to high sweetness with light bitterness in the finish.

330 ml bottle from the Pillars of Hercules organic farm store. At the BB date Full smooth body and full flavor with a hint of dark fruit cake Dark roasted grains leave a pleasant aftertaste suggestive of black bread and a hint of coffee.
Bottle at home. Pours ruby, nose is caramel, smoky, taste is rich, fruity, sweet caramel.
Une ambrée légèrement trouble, avec un petit dépôt et une très fine mousse. Je lui sens une attaque de bouche avec des notes de levures et une fin de bouche d'amande amère.

Bière belge qui a un certain historique, puisque d'abord brassée par le 1er propriétaire de la ferme au chêne, elle est maintenant brassée par le repreneur de la brasserie et taverne .. Elle est ainsi une bière à deux brasseurs, comme pas mal de belges … Niveau abv de 6,5 %, définie comme une ambrée naturelle avec épices. Mon exemplaire était à 17 mois avant sa date. Couleur ambré cuivré, avec un léger voile. Bulles fines, en fontaine centrale, virevoltantes. Mousse beige, soyeuse, stable à 3 mm. Arômes de malt cara, feuilles d'automne, muscade, sureau. 1ère bouche souple, à la belle entame malt cara/muscade. Arrière-bouche à l'amertume parsemée d'herbes de Provence. 2ème avec tabac blond, écorce de chêne. Arrière-bouche agréable. 3ème avec quelques notes de gentiane. Arrière-bouche aux jolies notes. Longueur à la texture très légère, et quelques beaux moments. Jambes lisses, longues. Levure un peu boisée, ligne correcte. Alcool un peu juste, mais il ne perd pas pied .. Finale agréable. CONCLUSION : une bière ambrée que l'on peut situer entre une spéciale belge et une spice/herb .. Avec l'esprit ouvert, on y trouve des choses intéressantes. (6/3/6/3/13)

Thank the parents of my girlfriend to share 0,75 l bottle a sparkling amber coloured body with a off white head and a spicy yeast malt hops aroma a spicy yeast herby malt hops bitter taste with a bitter finish
Opaque golden yellow, white lasting, lacing foam head. Nice barley aroma and taste, warm alcohol feeling, just enough. (Durbuy 201608)
Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge. Good "barn-beer" : a wonderfull dark orange beer, with aroma of cereal and tastes of nuts. The palate is more cereal too. Go fo it

Very murky, nice head. Bubbly but Belgian style at all, especially considering its origin. Amber malts, biscuit, bit of an English style yeast feel. Different than I expected for sure. But a nice change of pace. (On tap at the brewpub)

Kolor herbaciany, u podstawy kieliszka pomara?czowy. Barwa jest zm?tniona. Piany brak, w czasie nalewania piwa tworzy?a si? jedynie cienka warstwa drobnych p?cherzyków, by nast?pnie bardzo szybko stopnie?.Aromat: jest bardzo ciekawie, brzoskwinie w zalewie, karmelizowana skórka pomara?czowa, troch? karmelu mieszaj?ce go si? z cytryn?.Smak: tutaj równie? bardzo bogato, obok brzoskwini, pomara?czy i cytryny, pojawia si? delikatna zio?owo??. Marckloff jest lekko wytrawny i bardzo g?adki.Goryczka wyst?puje tylko na finiszu i ma charakter zio?owo alkoholowy, cho? alkohol jest idealnie schowany. Wysycenie wysokie, szczypi?ce w j?zyk, nie przeszkadza.

Donkerbruin bier met schuim. Gedronken in de Brasserie La Ferme Au Chene, Durbuy. Smaak is licht zoet en licht bitter, met wat caramel. Valt echter wat tegen omdat er weinig nuances overheersen, zeker na de eerste visuele indruk. Bier is wat mat van smaak en had mijns inziens wat krachtiger kunnen zijn. Al met al een goed biertje.

(Bottle, 0.75 l, at One Pint Pub, 20150516) The beer poured deep amber and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, caramel and Belgian style yeast. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, sweetness, spiciness, clove, Belgian style yeast and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and bitter. A clean, sweet and spicy brew. Nothing impressive though.

Bottled@HBF2015. Slightly hazy ambery red colour with a mediumsized off-white head. Aroma is wood, some caramel, spices, mild yeast, citrus and some spruce and pine like notes. Flavour is more traditional sweet malts meeting some fruity and floral notes along with quite a big spiced and yeasty edge to it.

column1: Rock Bottom La Jolla 33 Strong Ale
column5: Dark amber color. Frothy off white head. Sweet malt up front with a slightly tangy finish. A quaffer. (Rock Bottom La Jolla, CA)

***REVIEW FROM JAN 20, 2007*** This is a bit run on, but I thought this to be humorous enough to share. From the website: "Alfa Brouwerij is the only Dutch brewery to extract its brewing water from a spring certified by the Dutch Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport" .....there’s more..... "Aunt Wies, who has been living at the brewery since 1913, is still tasting the filled beer every morning. No bottle leaves our brewery without her approval!" bahahhha killer! My beer has been approved by someone who can only taste food if it is covered in salt.....here’s my review: Expect nothing but your average Euro brew. Beer is weak pee gold with so much crap floating in in you’d swear that you got a pint poured out of terribly mouldy lines. Instantly created a monster rocky white cap that managed to dissipate to near to nothing. Every swish does produce lots of spotty lacing. Aroma is quite refreshing actually. Lemon hits first and then is followed by dry grass and yeast. The lemon is pretty good actually! Taste is off a bit, but nothing bad - just something a bit different. You’ll still find the usual yeast and dryness with grass and an odd strong bitterness that does not quite fit in but does distinguish this beer as not totally run of the mill...maybe I should check the bottom of the bottle for Aunt Wies’s dentures...... I’m not sure if I should give this a 7 or a 5 for taste. Mouthfeel is ok with lots of carbonation. Light bodied obviously. Touch sour (very tiny ammount). Varying levels of bitterness. Oxydized. I’m not sure if this is a clone of Alfa Brummen or if it’s just an export only version but it will do. If I have to look at all the garbage floating around in my glass anymore I might puke. Looks like it’s half frozen. Beer is good though.

Bottle 35cl. Pours a clear golden colour with a normal size head and good carbonation. Just like the Eindhoven Reserva, this was only brewn for export and is not brewn anymore as far as I know. Smell is very hoppy and grassy. Taste is also about the same but has a nice bit of bitterness.

355ml bottle. Grassy and hoppy aroma. Pours with a light golden colour and good frothy head. Biscuity, grassy and hoppy flavour with a lot of sweetness in the flavour. Not great, but better than a lot.

Aroma of corn and perhaps some hop. Perhaps not. Light golden color with a non-lacing white head that didn’t stay long. Starts corny sweet. Nearly medium mouthfeel. The good news is that there is a reasonable amount of hop in the finish. Arguably this deserves the label pilsener, and definitely deserves a much higher rating than mass-Bud.
Bright yellow, initially tall white head that fades quickly. Corny-grainy aroma, not a lot in the hops department. A disappointing and bland pale lager, not worthy of pilsener status.
Amber/golden color, thin head, like a pils/pale-lager, nice grainy but less hops,...good to drink

Green bottle. Pale yellow. Cornfield aptly described the odor as mineral water. Depsite the snow outside, this is a lawnmower beer. Fair sweetness. No real hops. Almost no taste. Wouldn’t suprise me if it also had no alcohol.

Bought a 12 pack of this junk the other day. Not sure if mine had seen the light or what but it’s horrible. Rotten tasting - a drainpour. This is why I should try beers before buying large quantities.

Bottle: Pours a pale yellow with a huge head that last about a minute then dissapates to 1/8" with some lacing. Extremely clear beer with very few small bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma is faint, but slightly grassy. Flavor is mostly hops and slightly malty, a bit grassy, with a slightly bitter, metallic aftertaste. Tastes more carbonated than it looks or acts, which is good. Metallic aftertaste hangs on for a while. Still, not a bad beer at all. I find it more palatable than Heineken, but not as smooth as Grolsch.
Despite the obvious fact that Dutch Royalty has selected this lager...I must most respectfully, politely and humbly decline their selection, as it is sucky.

Bottle 30cl. Pours a clear golden colour with a normal size head and good carbonation. Smell is very hoppy and grassy, nice fresh smell. Taste is alot like many other mass-produce pilseners, but this was only brewed for export to the USA and is not brewn anymore at the moment.

Beware of beer sales. Got a 6-pack for $3.99 "club card price" - figured, at 4 bucks, its cheaper than budweiser and anything’s better than Bud. I was wrong. This smells and tastes very musky, dusty, copwebby arm pit-like. Fizzy urine yellow with an astringent finish.
Bottle. Poured light yellow with small head. Grassy nose and average palate. Clean to the end. Overall an average brew. Drank one cool, and the other ice cold. The colder it is better it tastes.

A very refreshing, well-balanced summertime beer from the Netherlands. Not overpowering, not dry, a clean taste with little bite. Not the best from the region by any means, but better than most crap they market from that area (see Heineken & Oranjeboom).

Green bottled Dutch beer. Pours light yellow in color. Smell kind of skunky. Has a sort of grassy aroma as well. Flavor is kind of malty. Decent taste. Has a hint of skunkiness. Not enough to really bother me though. Nice full mouthfeel for a beer of this type. Better than some other Dutch beers I won’t mention.

This junk smells like it was made with skunk cabbage. I forced my way through the 6 pack, as I refuse to waste beer no matter how bad. This was that bad. Typical yellow color, and feel of a lighter lager. Tastes grassy, hay-like, anyway you put it, this stuff tastes more like somebody threw a houseplant in a Juice Tiger and Wallah. Jack LeLane would be spitting this mess out.
Pours a medium amber color with a big and quickly dissipating head. Aroma is earth and metallic. Flavor is yeasty and bready. It finishes dry and quick. An average pils.
A good solid lager with bready and cookie flavors. Not too much hop flavor to get in the way either. A palate point for not being too fizzy on the palate.

Lots of grassy scent assaults your nose as soon as you pour it. Even before I could focus my attention on this beer for a review, I noticed it's scent spewing forth from the glass. Nice white head fades into a soapy layer. Slight bitterness up front. There was some sort of sweetness in the beer, very light and candy like. It may have been from a soda I had drunk immediately before trying this beer, and I didn't cleanse my palate right. Anyhow, this sweetness, there or not) fades to tart dryness. Really didn’t think this beer was that good. I usually drink it straight out of the bottle as my drinking buddy likes this beer but never has glasses for us when we partake of it.
0,5 bottle under 1€. Goldy look. White foam but not compact. Strong taste at first. Watery aftertaste. Godd bbq partner.
Fresca. Classica birra commerciale. Bevuta negli anni tra Slovenia e Croazia.

La birra si presenta di colore giallo paglierino, con un cappello di schiuma mediamente persistente, a grana media-fine. Aroma di malto, biscotto, cracker, un pizzico di spezie: è una lager gradevole all'aroma. Gusto purtroppo non in linea con l'aroma: molto leggero, equilibrata tra dolce ed amaro, ma poco gusto; retrogusto praticamente assente. Si tratta di una birra leggera, dalla carbonazione quasi assente. It looks of a pale yellow colour, with a head of foam persistent on average, with medium-thin grain. Aroma of malt, biscuit, cracker, traces of spices: it is a pleasant lager as regards aroma. Taste is not in line with the aroma: it is so light, balanced between sweet and bitter, but little taste; aftertaste is almost missing. It is a beer with light body, with almost no carbonation.
Bottle 0,5l,solid beer when cold,it's more bitter than sweet,solid choice if you want to chill and watch basketball :D
[Butelka / Puszka b.d.] Barwa jasnozłota, klarowne. Piana średnia, średnio pęcherzykowa. Smak i aromat słodowe, niewielki posmak żywiczny. Goryczka niska, nasycenie średnie.
Zlatnozuta boja, bijela pjena srednje debljine, umjereno trajna. Skoro bez arome, veoma blago kukuruz i karton. Srednje gorcine, duzeg gorkog finisa. Vodene teksture, umjerene karbonizacije.
Klasyczny koncernowy euro-lager w zielonej butelce. Wodnisty, z niewielką ilością nut słodowych, chmielu. Goryczka obecna, niska.
Goldy. White foam. Good strong hopy taste. Watery taste on the end but that's refreshing.
25-08-19 // bottle shared. Thanks! Clear golden. sweetish lager grainyness. boring.
Stosunkowo czysty profil, może tylko jakieś estry. Jakaś minimalna goryczka jest. Ogólnie nie jest fatalne, ale i brak chmielu i stanowczo zbyt słodowe.
Just when you thought that you had drank enough over Xmas...This is a purple-black beer with vimto fruitiness and a generous helping of alcohol. A good post-xmas booze up.

July 9th, 2015. Cask @ The Railway Tavern, Chelmsford. Amber pour with a creamy white head. Fairly twiggy nose. Some complementing red apple and toasted brown bread. Moderately leafy bitter falvor. Caramel trail mix sweetness. Light body, soft carbonation.

Cask @ Wenlock Arms, Hoxton N1. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with weak hints of citrus. Fruity malty hoppy citrus flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty hoppy floral finish.

August 23, 2013 - hand-pull cask at Wenlock Arms. Hazy orange, minimal head. Taste and aroma juicy light malt and fairly pungent floral/herbal bitterness. Light body and carb, quick finishing. Refreshing.
Cask@Southampton Arms, London. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruits, wood, mild herbs and some slight maltyness. Flavour is fruits, wood and mild notes of crystal crispyness.
Cask. Pours gold with a white head. Bready/biscuity aroma with a light sweetness. The flavor has sweet malts, a hoppy hint, and a little bit of a fruity sweetness. Not bad.

Cask conditioned handpump Victoria Inn Northampton. A bright gold coloured beer with a whitish head and lacing. A fusty aroma with a bit of stale citrus hop. The hops are better in the mouth with nice orange notes. Served a little warm.

Cask at the Southampton Arms, London on 11th February 2010. Crystal clear gold with small, thickly lacing off-white head. Slight yeasty aroma, soon hoppy with grassy bitterness. A lingering, tickling bitterness on the roof of the mouth with a bitter, but rather short-lived finish.

Cask conditioned at Far from the Madding Crowd, Oxford. Pale amber with white head. Gentle little session bitter, nicely balanced with a sweetish biscuity malt, a touch of peach in the background then a gentle fragrant, bittersweet hop. An enjoyable start to the days festivities.
Aug 07 Cask conditioned @ Yorkshire Terrier, York. Biscuity malt and slight caramel sweetness. Peppery hops to start but they are quite restrained in the finish. Light and refreshing

Cask (handpump) at Chelmsford Winter Beer Festival 2005. Pale amber colour. Distinct diacetyl notes on the aroma, which I found off-putting. Otherwise, it’s a reasonably well balanced, moderately hoppy, but unremarkable session bitter. Too delicate to cope with the intrusive butterscotch. Sadly, not in peak condition methinks. [4/3/6/3/12 = 2.8] RE-RATE. Cask (handpump) at the Cask Pub & Kitchen on 17 January 2011 - meet the brewer night, with 10 Mighty Oak beers on tap. Looks good - bright darkish amber with sparkling condition and a thin white head. Much fresher and cleaner than when I tasted it before. However, tasted next to a lot of ebullient golden ales it came over as a rather staid traditional English session bitter. Solid but not too exciting. Score updated [6/4/6/3/12 = 3.1]
A tasty Hoegaarden-style wheat beer, served with an orange slice............

Tap @Brewdog Shepherd's Bush. 10%. Cloudy amber, small creamy light beige head. Aroma has malt, caramel, wood, light vanilla. Boozy, malty and caramely flavour, fruity notes. Rough, not very refined but still quite decent.
An acceptable libation, but it did not knock my socks off in the way I expect a barley wine to do. Lacks a certain je ne sais quoi.

The other reviews on this site are quite a bit less recent than my own, and while I thought this beer was OK, I htink it was decidely less hoppy than the previous two reviews from 2004. This beer looked like a very serious IPA...a hazy dark straw color with a minimal soapy head that appeared as if it could be skimmed off and used to blow bubles in the yard. IMO, this appearance often foretells a pretty serious blast of hops, and I was a bit disappointed by the actual flavor of this beer. This pale ale is noticeably hoppy but not decidely so, and has some malt balance to it. Mouthfeel was a bit thin, flat, and watery. I would say this beer is just OK...not sure how it stacks up to Minocqua’s other offerings, but I was neither impressed nor offended by this beer.

Redish-orange body, fizzy/soapy off-white head. Dry and peppery bubblegum dominates aroma the aroma. In fact, I normally like a bit of bubblegum, but this was too much. But, it was a pleasant surprise nonetheless. Sweet grapefruit, caramel, and spruce in the flavor. It had a slight resiny feel to it and a nice bitter grapefruit peel finish. Not too bad overall.

Clear amber body, off-white ring of bubbles around the top. The aroma has purple grape, taffy and a touch of spicy, piney hops. Buckwheat pancake malt, caramel, more pepper-spruce hops, and grilled grapefruit comprise the flavor. I enjoyed this pale because it did a good job of differentiating itself from other run-of-the-mill pales.

Serving: from tap at Pit Stop Taproom & Pub. Aroma: lightly sweet. Appearance: average-sized, creamy, light-brown, initial head with very good lace and mostly-lasting longevity. Cola-brown body. Taste: lightly bitter, roasty initial flavor and finish with long duration. Palate: full body with syrupy texture and no carbonation. Overall: very good. Low alcohol.
On ta p at Blackfinn. Creamy, milky body with cereal like malts and oats. Chocolate like finish.
Draft at Beercade. Nitro. Poured black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, cocoa. Taste was mild bittersweet, roasted coffee, cocoa, oat, creamy, grainy dry finish.

On tap at Willy’s. Pours black with thick, creamy, tan head. Aroma of cocoa and vanilla. Taste is nutty, malty, some chocolate. Medium body. Finish is a bit watery with some mild bitter chocolate finish. Not Founder’s best offering, but still decent.

Nitro draft at Craft Brewed. Pours a pitch black with a beige head that lasts throughout. Gorgeous pour. Light cacao nib aromas with faint milky latte aromas. Smooth and creamy w/ some macchiato cofffe/milk notes. Medium bitterness that lingers with more cacao.
Surpisingly delicious, would order it again any day. Would go great with a chocolate cake
Draught at Clinton Hall FIDI. Pours brown black with a tan creamy head. Aroma of chocolate, oats and vanilla. Smooth with roasted malts, chocolate and coffee grounds.
On tap. Pours black with full nitro head. Aromas of coffee and roasted malts muted by nitro. Flavors of black coffee, acidic roasted malts, a bit of dark chocolate and cream.

I'm not sure I've met a beer on nitro that I haven't liked. I'm not a huge fan of oatmeal stouts, but this one from Founders on nitro at the Railroad was outstanding! The beer poured a black color with a beautiful, cascading body that settled softly, but firmly at the top of the glass. The nose was semi-sweet, with notes of chocolate, malts, a touch of cream and oats. The body was silky-smooth and so enjoyable. I could have sat there all night and enjoyed pint after pint of this delicious stout. The flavors were well-balanced and tasty, with notes of milk chocolate, cream, oats, light hops and a hint of sugar. This was one outstanding stout!
Black with a creamy nitro tan head. Roasted malt, cocoa, earth, light caramel. Medium smooth body. Finish has light bitter but mostly sweet roasted malt. Nice.
copper color, frothy head. aroma of fruit. sweet malty taste with a tart fruity overtone. several spicy nuances , coriander and orange flavors come through strongly. interesting brew.
Bottle, during a holiday in Australia. Backlog rating from my bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. Tasting notes not kept, just rating.
Bottle. Had this beer many years ago, just adding it to my records. All I remember was that I didn't enjoy it. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle. I didn’t klnow they still made this, found it on the shelf atr First Choice on the Sunshine Coast. I remeber drinking this stuff back in the day before decent craft beer was available. Bit of colour for a low alcohol beer and carries a whiff of white foam. Cereal in the aroma is no surprise.
This is horrible stuff, tastes soapy, and not like beer at all. Stay away....you have been warned!

2.5% and tastes it. In fact it hides this 2.5% very well in that you can’t tell it’s alcoholic at all. Clear orange gold with a head that disappeared virtually instantaneously. Cold metal aroma, with a bit of sweet sugary adjunct. Slightest hint of bitter and sweet on tasting, but only slight. As much as these low abv beers keep professing to be "full flavour", it really is just a crock of shit. As to be expected there is no depth at all. Tastes like beer cordial really.
well it is a light beer, so gone is any depth and it is carlton so gone are any hops or character. I’d rather have 1 nice heavy than 20 light beers, but i guess this isn’t aimed at me!
At the risk of sounding like a tool, I actually enjoyed a longneck of this. Really easy to drink, although nothing spectacular. Shame about the low alcohol.
Pale golden, clear, medium head. I wouldn’t go so far as calling this "foul", but it is pretty boring (even allowing for it being a light beer). A whiff of hops, but nothing on the palate. Watery.
POints for $$$ cheapness. however when fresh, it really tasts like a crown larger only much less alcoholic kick.... sign the things i do for money
Draught at Irish Murphy, Ballarat. Pale yellow. A hint of Pride of Ringwood hops. After that sweetness, fizz and emptiness. Hello? Anybody in there?
This really funny because I was given this beer at the brewing company and they tried to pass it off as if it were an Oberon. Really not funny but gave me another beer to rate. It wasn't very good.

Slightly hazy light golden appearance. Nose is fruity with a touch of citrusy hops and sweet malt. Body is smooth, big hop presence, little roast. The thing about this beer is that it has no wheat beer qualities, no hints of wheat at all. Too hopped for the style. The description says hefeweizen, hefeweizen''s are unfiltered, this beer was transparent. Not a good example.

Draft at brewpub. Pours clear dark copper color with an average frothy off-white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate toasted malt and leather aroma. Medium body with with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium balanced flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of an average duration. My expectation where met.
copper with a small beige head. Sweet malt aroma. taste is of some slight caramel malt sweetness, incredibly thin. boring.
This beer wasn't too bad, I enjoyed it with my jambalaya. This beer had a great taste, but isn't that great with spicy food!

Bright copper appearance, lttle head. Nose is butterscotch - Lifesaver-esque, sweet, light hops. Body is of slightly roasty hops. Mouthfeel is oily. Finishes thin, dry and short. All and all a one-sided brew, nose is quite unpleasant, like an artificial butterscotchiness.

Caramel toasted flavors ... hmmm ... well, it has some sweet edges that might seem caramelly, if you have a lot of imagination, but any toast here is obscured by some cheap, banal marmalade. Pretty basic amber.

On tap at the BOB. Light golden body, thin/medium off-white head. Rather nondescript aroma and flavor of bitter, lightly citric hops, with a light toasty, biscuity malt body. Thin-bodied. Not a terrible beer, but certainly a hackneyed attempt. Still, it’s neat to have a microbrewery designed to serve a variety of restaurants and clientele in one building with local beers.
golden color with a medium sized white head. slight aroma of citrus hops. slight citrus hop taste, but overall bland and boring.

Slightly cloudy light golden appearance. Sweet malty nose with citrusy hops present. Body is fairly hoppy and it seems as if the hops change to piney hops here. Hmm. Light malt presence as well. not enough malt to be interesting.

If you alternatively suck on soggy sweetened cardboard and some old homebrewing hop pellets you had forgotten about, you'd approximate the taste of this stuff. OK, maybe it's not that bad, but it definitely is mediocre enough to arouse a little ire from this APA lover.

Sample at the B.O.B. as Fahrenheit Porter. Dark brown pour with a medium tan head. Roasted malt nose with a bit of coffee. Roasty and creamy flavor, but it’s kinda thin.
