Doesn’t know whether it’s a brown porter or a robust. My guess is that it’s an attempt at the latter, but could use some more body.

Draft sample at B.O.B.. Poured clear dark brown color with an average frothy off-white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate toasted chocolate malt aroma. Medium body and smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium roasted sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. This beer met my expectations.

Dark brown color. Weak roast in the nose, light hints of chocolate. Body is lightly roasty, soft mouthfeel, finishing bitter and drying at the end. A fairly boring porter, needs a lot of work to stand up to the vast amount of porters out there nowadays.
On tap at Michigan Summer Beer Fest. At one of the food stands. Went well with my pulled pork sandwich. Quenching and clean.
Golden color. Fresh malt and hops (Cascades) on the nose. Body is sweetish malt with an organic hop bitterness. Finished bitter and oily.
Tastes mostly of honey, in the tradition of breakfast cereals marketed to kids. Sweet, pale, and limp.

On tap as B.O.B. Happy Pils. This was a light, bready pilsener with more malt depth than I expected, pairing grassy, snappy hops with sweet, bready malt and a hint of light fruit. It’s interesting that the previous reviewer mentions not picking up Saaz hops, as I didn’t pick up a significant contribution of this classic Pilsener standard, either. That’s not to say the hops weren’t used, but this was a bit unusual.

Light golden color. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Body is smooth, big, long hops and drying in the finish. A bit one sided and could stand for a bit more malt. I seriously doubt that this is saaz hops in here, tastes more like cascades to me and has similar tasting hops to their other brews. i don''t know, maybe they use saaz in most of their beers. All in all, one of this breweries better beers.
Pretty much the only BOB brew with guts. That is, they dared to go beyond sweet, thin mass market brewpub fare and put some real Saaz tang and decent body together.
Golden. Nose is piney hops, slight roast and a touch of malt. Body is very hoppy with a little bit of sweet malt but not nearly enough to round off the unpleasant, long one-sided hoppiness.

The hops are definitely there but the thing is so dang sweet that the result is a confrontation in the trenches which neither side really wins, much like the Great War. Still, it does have big flavor, and the only real sustained head in the brewery, so it fares better than most BOB brews.

Sample at the B.O.B. as Eve Isle Scotch Ale, but I’m assuming this is the same beer. Pours a light brown with a thin tan head. Nose of sweet malt, caramel and peat. Smoky and peaty flavor up front with some caramelly sweetness on the back end. Pretty solid, and definitely the best beer of theirs I had.

Draft sample at The B.O.B. Poured clear brown color with an average frothy light brown head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Good toasted caramel malt and nutty aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium toasted sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Good beer.

Very dark red appearance. Sweet malty, light choclatey and somewhat organic nose. Body is sweet, organic, very lightly smoked. Finishes hoppy. Not enough smoke to merit the label "smoky". Sweet, unbalanced and uninteresting.

The B.O.B. is a great old building in Grand Rapids, Michigan, converted into a series of upscale dining rooms. The basement boasts the Monkey Bar, featuring great tapas and the house brew, not so great. This one, at least, is interesting, with a pleasant smoky aroma. It's typically thin, sweet brewpub fare, though and the smoke seems a touch artificial, like the liquid smoke stuff on the wrong end of a marketing assault on true barbeque.
Fles 30cl thuis. Redelijk krachtig. Wat citrus, wat tarwe, wat zoet. (4-2013).
Backlog rating from 2007. Pale wheat color, low head. Milkacid tartness. Grainy base, light tart. Dusty. Light body. Metallic salty aftertaste.
Geruch nach Nelke, Weizen und Hefe. Geschmack ist ziemlich weich und leicht bananig. Insgesamt aber nicht sehr intensiv.

big airy head on a somewhat hazy pilslike liquid... some spices at first, some banana, moderate malty... sweet... gets boring and even a bit annoying pretty quick, too thickish and yet also too bland..

Bottle: Thanks Douberd: Served in a shaker: Small white foamy head on top of a hazy darker yellow to orange colored beer. Aromas of dust, wheat, yoghurt/lacto, leather, banana, grains, light cardboard and some hints of meat. Bit smelly... Flavours of wheat, yeast, light yoghurt/lacto, malts, some herbs, pencil sharpener, some bitters and a light nutty tone... Aftertaste is malty, wheat, grains, light bitter and some yeast... Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied and a light creamy texture. Quite unbalanced and a (very) strange witbier...

Bottle, 300 ml. Into a weizen glass. ABV 5.2% Dark honey orange colour on the body,hazy, lots of activity in it, with two fingers of white head on top. Good retention, light lacing on the glass. Aroma of wheat and starch, sweet, ripe pears, ripe bananas. Taste is sweet and fruity, again lots of wheat malts, little yeast, ripe bananas, light floral notes. Medium thin body, good carbonation, nice dryness on the palate. Overall this one from Huttenkloas is also more than decent, following the style’s guidelines.
Ziemlich hohe Karbonisierung. Aroma leicht nach Pfirsich. Geschmack alkoholig.

Gouden met matig witte kraag Aroma zeer beperkt en niet bijzonder Smaken: allereerst valt de zachtheid van het water op, daarnaast de bananen, verder.wat lichte mouten maar ik mis de typische witbier karakteristieken. Matige body, laag co2, matig zoet, licht bitter. Aardig ja maar géén topper

Slightly hazy pale yellow colour, white head. Aroma of malts, sweets, bubblegum and banana candy. Malty flavour, yeast, bread. Quite thin, slightly watery even, finish wheat, light toast, green banana. (From 30cL bottle @ home)
Bottle looks simple but strange. Beer in the glass terrible, ugly head. Starts mild but awful, sourish, unbalanced, malty-moldy. Almost undrinkable.
A very fine dunkel. So this region in the Netherlands can make a good dunkel.
Caramel aroma with a hint of chocolat. Brown color, beige head, nice lace. Sweet, caramel, chocolat but not roasted, barnyard, medium body.
Dutch Ratebeer meeting. Caramel aroma and flavor. Chichory, licorice and milk chocolate. Somewhat thin.
Dutch ratebeer meeting. Clear brown cola coloured, thin lacing. Caramel aroma. Sweet taste, caramel malty. Sticky palate. Bit like the altbeers and the dunkels in Germany.
Dutch ratebeer meeting. Clear brown cola coloured, thin lacing. Weird aroma, malts, caramel, some coffee perhaps. Malty aroma, some chocolate.
(Dutch ratebeer meeting) Aroma is skunky and has caramel in it. Clear. dark red/brown coloured with a white thin head. Bitter, caramelly taste. Sharp and metallic palate.
Fles 30cl thuis. Nieuw recept. 5,9%. Malttonen, caramel goed bitter, hop, droog, wat klef, geel fruit, pine, wat honing. (24-3-2018)
Backlog rating. Hazy pale golden, low head. Straw nose, light sugar. Straw, light yeast. Light body. Straw aftertaste.

Donkergeel, volle, net geen witte foamy schuimkraag , iets wazig en voldoende koolzuur zichtbaar. Aroma: Licht fruitig en zoetig, perzik, licht gehopt, karamel mouten. Smaak: Beetje metalig, licht fruitig, zoetig, graanmouten en wat karamel tonen. Prikkelige hopbitter die langer aanblijft al het fruitige. Onder medium body,  prikkelig en netelig mondgevoel, voldoende koolzuur, afdronk is floraal en bitter.

Bottle 300 ml. Appearance: A deep golden orange,with a 2 fingers of white head on top, which leaves moderate lacing on the glass. Aroma: Faint, Yeast, sugars but also peaches, apricots, Taste: Fruity, apricot, grains and yeast,good and bitterness. Slightly below average body, with low carbonation. Decent.

Bottle in hotel room bodegraven... Glowing amber... Thin white lacing... Soft sweet toffee.. Light tobacco... Fruity nose... Sweet fruits... Soft fruits... Juicy floral fruits... Really enjoying my opening beer
ok, it looks a bit golden? for the rest nothing special... like a generic pilsener, maybe a bit more saaz-like hops?

Bottle: Thanks Douberd: Served in a Shaker: Foamy snake gusher: Medium sized fluffy white foamy head on top of an almost clear golden yellow colored beer. Aromas of malts, carbo gass, some clay and card board, light creamy and some honey with a herby edge. Flavours of creamy malts, some herbs, some bitters, light nutty tone, some dull peach, light yeasty, some hay and a light marzipan. Aftertaste is herbal, creamy, malty, some marzipand and some yeast. Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, low to medium bodied and a creamy texture. Maybe a bit boring, but it’s an easy drinker and it does not taste bad!

Bottle 300 ml at home, poured into a tulip glass. ABV 5.2% Deep golden orange colour on the body, quite clear, with two fingers of white head on top. Thin, at first collapses fast, when it falls to half its size becomes more stable and leaves medium lacing on the glass. Aroma is not so strong but pleasant nevertheless. Yeast, sugars but also quite fruity, like a tripel, with peaches, apricots, bubblegum. Taste is also fruity although not so intense as the aroma. There is apricot, there are some grains too and yeast, with a nice and strong bitterness on the aftertaste, with long duration. A little bit on the body, with low carbonation, but without being watery. Overall more than decent one, quite good actually.
30 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Coop. Hazy old yellow with a big white longlasting head. Yeasty smell with some caramel. Nice bitter taste with considerable depth. Hoppy taste. Nice beer.

Bottle looks simple but good und funny. Beer in the glass deep golden, small head. Starts mild, fine malty with spicy notes, mild dry background. Finish well balanced, modest sourish. Quite drinkable. Nice!
At the brewery. Red copper pour. Wheat and earthy. Thicker. No head. Average.
On tap at morgan street in st louis... clear dark red pour... aroma of faint red wine.. taste is flat malts...dont like it

It poured a clear amber color with a small tan head. The aroma was mild and clean with faint apple notes. The taste was sweet with some spicy, floral hops. It was medium-bodied, lightly carbonated and smooth. A decent Altbier.
On tap at the brewpub, pours a light brown with no head, the aroma is of slight caramel and a little malt, the flavor is pretty bland with a metallic finish, ugh, still have samples left.
Clear medium amber color/ fleeting head. Mild spicy caramel, honey biscuit malty aromas. smooth medium mouthfeel. Decent bready pale malt, spicy caramel flavors, nicely bitter finish.
This was just bad. It looked fine, had a decent aroma, but the flavor said the beer was either off or they need to clean their lines. Didn’t like it. Didn’t really care to finish it.

I am not really sure what they were going for here, but this does not really seem very true to style. Just a little hoppier than I would expect for the style and I know that typically these are generally the hoppiest beers in Germany, but this was not what I was expecting. Lightly roasted malt, butterscotch and caramel, with hints of dried fruit. This is not of the better beers I have tried today.

Draught at Morgan St. Pours clear amber with a small, frothy, white head, somewhat lasting with good lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (bread, cookie, cereal), light hops (grass), average yeast (sweat) with notes of butter. Light bodied, sticky texture, average carbonation, and a metallic finish. Average duration, light sweetness, acidity, and bitterness.

On draught at the brewpub. This beer is a clear reddish-amber color with a thin off-white head that diminishes quickly. Spotty lacing. Lightly toasted malt and hops in the nose. Light-bodied and moderately bitter (moreso than I am used to for an Alt) with hops and some roasted malt. The finish is hoppy with a bit of malt and fruit in the aftertaste. Barely average overall.
From the brewery on 12/4/07. I liked this one, but not as much as the Vienna. Poured coppery color with a lacy head. Finally, HOPS from this brewery!
very little in the way of hops. cloudy brown with lots of foam. quite sweet and gets stuck in the moustaches of the locals

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Una Belgian Ale. Color café túrbido de espuma y carbonatacion baja. Aromas herbales y de toffee. Sabor a suave y elegante a chocolate amargo con notas de toffee con un suave amargor herbal. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: A belgian, brown "Bruin"with light head. Aroma is malt, caramel, light coffee, raisins? Taste is bitter sweet.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: caramel, medium sweetness, lightly sour, not much bitter ... not my cup of tee

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Tap@ de achelse kluis. Ziet er goed uit , bruin van kleur met een mooie kraag. Aroma is zwak mout en zoete snoepjes . Smaak idem maar helaas ook behoorlijk waterig. Niet heel goed.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Glass at the brewery, brown, small head. Aroma is roasted coffee, malts. Taste is the same, long aftertaste. nice one.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Dimmigt mörk mahognybrun med fast mörkbeigt skum. Doftar karamell och sötmalt, lite honung. Smaken överraskande tunn, ganska syrlig, men toffé, romrussin och irish coffe dominerar. Eftersmaken lång, lite bränd karamell och sötma, men även här ganska tunn. Tyvärr var den något övermogen (utgångsdatum 2/2/16).

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Dark brown colour with off-white head. Aroma malty and a bit metallic. Taste is bready and caramel.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Pours a dark brown amber with medium to low head, but quite persistend. Aroma is caramel, sweet, and slightly fruity. Taste is sweet with more caramel, hints of darker fruit and some maltyness. A very balanced and enjoyable brown.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Mooie caramelkkeur met een volle crémekleur kraag. Ruikt fruitig, Zoetig, honing, caramel. Smaakt zoetig, stroop, kruiden. Tikkeltje overrijp fruit.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Hints of caramel in the aroma looks Ruby tot Brown clouded taste little body not a lot of bitterness some caramel but faint not as good as its blond sister

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Flasche in einem Restaurant In Antwerpen Rot-brauner Körper. Aroma: Malz, Hefe, Hopfen Wenig bitter und Hopfig. Malzsüße, Honig, aber auch Zitrus.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Nawet jak na piwa belgijskie Achel Blond jest bardzo mocno wysycony. Wyraźnie słodowy, wręcz słodki, z drożdżowym posmakiem. Troszkę owocowe i wyraźnie przyprawowe, kolejna klasyka belgijskiego piwowarstwa.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Bière blonde cuivrée, avec une bonne mousse blanche, un nez assez amer, un goût un peu amer, de vieux fruits, assez semblable au palais...

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: From a bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a rich gold with head and lace. Aroma of amber malt, slight candy sugar, fresh bread. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of amber malts, grains, slight honey, slight field herbs, powder sugar, oak. Overall, rich and tasty, fresh or aged.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: 33cl bottle.Appearance: A hazy yellow body with a medium sized white head, that leaves fair lacing. Aroma:malts, yeast,cereals, banana, lemon. Taste: lightly herbal, lightly bitter. some lemon and banana with some cereals. Average to medium body and carbonation. (backlog rating)

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Tap@ de Achelse Kluis. Helder blond bier met een mooie plakkraag. Ruikt fris hoppig, gist. Hoppig, gist en vaagzurig in smaak. Bitterwaterige afdronk. Goed te drinken op een warme dag.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Molto buona ed equilibrata fin.dal primo assaggio. Gusto pieno, molto aromatico e persistente.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: This beer is nice, red brown colored and it has a nice slightly sweet taste.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Sample at the brewery, blond beer, small head. aroma is yeast, hops some malts. Taste is the same. ok beer.

column4: Brouwerij der Trappistenabdij De Achelse Kluis
column5: Yellow, clear white foam. Mild sweet aroma. Sweet, fruit, peach, nice fruity aftertaste
(Tap) Pours yellow with little head. Slightly hoppy from start to finish. Not bad for a light beer, but not too impressive.
Tap: golden pale color with no head. Nice lacing. Very faint saaz hop aroma and flavor. Little bite in the finish.

Lager aroma with some diacetyl notes. Like some of City Brewing (La Crosse) beers in that regard. Hint of hops in the nose. Light gold in color with no carbonation. Thin white head with not much lace. Bland flavor, but not that bad for a light. More flavor than some. No glairing flaws.

Clear pale gold with a short ice sheet of white for the head. Aroma is croissants, lemons and laundry detergent. A little watery with a hop profile of an APA. Clean, bready finish and a sour lemon aftertaste.

Golden with a thin white head. Carbonation present with bubbles here and there. Nose is thin with some hops but barely. The taste is mostly grains with just a bit of hops. For a light beer this is very drinkable and actually kind of pleasant.
Very light gold color with a fizzy head. No real aroma with just a slight taste of grains. Nothing off about it, so it’s better than most light beers.

Light Gold With Small White Head. Lemon, Sweet and Malty Aroma. Lemon Dies Out on the Tongue...Malt Underlining the Brew and Hop Ending.. Grainy Taste to it Overall and Makes This one Hard to be Very Drinkable.
Sample at the brewpub. Very very light, bit hazy. Only the faintest of aromas, clean, thin, bit of malt evident towards the end. Average for a light I suppose.
Light yellow beer, with no real scent. Your average, generally tasteless, light beer.
Slightly hazy straw color wih a small white head. Light malt aroma. Bittersweet finish distracts. Fizzy - Please check the CO2.
Pale amber in color. Mild floral hops. Decent hop character with a mild malt background. Again, on the light side.
Slighty hazy amber with a light beige head. Light orange citrus aroma. Light malt and acidic citric bitterness. Fizzy, I think the serving pressure is to high, all the beers seem fizzy.
A nice APA. Good balance of bitterness and roasted malts...................

Hops are definitely there, but not in a form I can enjoy. Simply bitter, without any of the herbal, citrus, or pine notes that come from using quality ingredients. Very dry, lacking in sweet maltiness. They would do better to copy a popular APA than to keep brewing this stuff. If this is number 5, I'd hate to have been around for 1,2,3, and 4!

Unfortunately this beer does not live up to the glory of the Schmitz name to which I am proud to carry myself. If I brewed it I wouldn''t have put my name on it. Not a strong pale ale, not hoppy enough, plain, unentertaining, just not as exciting as I hoped a beer bearing my name would be.

I was also excited for this brewery after a long day of playing in the sun and water at Noah's Ark. I was pretty disappointed though. First of all the restaurant itself is covered with dead animals. Not my style when I'm trying to eat... Then there was the beer. They weren't all bad but there was not much going for this ale. Do they even know what hops are? I sure didn't taste any.

After a hard day spent with the family "enjoying" the Dells, we headed over to the Moosejaw for some eats...and yeehaw, we find out this place has its own brewery!! I was very pleased with the Pale Ale. Looked nice in a glass, head stuck around until the bitter end (pun intended). The flavor of this beer was long on hops, just the way I like it. Yum.
On tap. Clear golden color with white head. Great malty and hoppy aroma. Taste is sweet with nice hop character. Overall it’s very good beer with nice hop character.

Pours a clear yellow golden color, topped with a decent white frothy head. Mild aroma, grassy hops and grainy malt. Taste has some initial sweetness, some gentle grassy hops and mild bitterness. Refreshing sourish feel to it. Nicely drinkable, quite enjoyable, although pretty light. Ok.
Clear yellow with a white head. Spicy hop aroma. Bready malt with a spicy hop finish.

500ml bottle. Pours big but quickly diminishing head. Floral hop aroma. Taste is slightly malty with a very strong hop presence, mild hops not spicy in the slightest. Some caramel in there too. Soft carbonation. Long bitter finish from the hops. This is a good, hoppy pils from Murauer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.5 l bottle Doggythedog brought from Graz, thanks for sharing! It poured pale golden body with medium sized head. Malty aroma, some hay and grass hops. Fine, slightly herbal bitterish flavor, malty in fruity apple or similar way. Medium bodied with shorter, bittersweet finish. Yes, it needs a bit more hops for its name, but it’s an interesting and nice austrian macro beer anyway.

Poured a pale yellow-golden body with a medium sized white head. Oily nose, light vegetables, some malt. The taste is oily again, some apples, some alcohol?! Dry, sweet, not far away from the typical Austrian macro lager, even if I haven’t mentioned meny pleasant tastes here. I expected more hops. Way more hops.
Pours golden with medium white head. Raisins and caramell in nose with herbal hops and fruity peach with maltiness in flavor. Rather intense bitter finish, (a bit unbalanced towards the bitter side).
Clear golden beer with a small white head. Malt and some hop in the nose with a bit of sourish yeast. Medium body with malt and some caramel, characteristic hop flavor. Dry hop finish.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pilsener golden with a small, white head. Hoppy nose. A bit unusual malt character - I sense some slightly smoked notes - odd indeed. Lightly hoppy finish. Not your typical pilsener. 170805
Bottled(500ml). -I've expected much more than ordinary pilsener, hoppy aroma, too much carbonation, bitter finish

Aroma is malty with a subtle hoppy note. It smells like grain, bread, slightly caramel and grass. Clear golden color with a medium sized, frothy, white head. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. It tastes like white bread, grain, biscuit with some nutty notes. Body is medium, mouthfeel is thin to creamy. Finish is first sweet then light bitter. It's more like a traditional Austrian Märzen to me. 0,33l bottle from Amersin Vienna.

On tap at Brauhof in Villach-Austria. Intense golden clear pour, crazy white foam with retention and nice drafts. Nose: a nice mix of honey, hay, grassy hops. Mouth: medium-high carbo, rich malty mouth, the finish is sharp and bitter. Yes. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. L’intensità olfattiva è flebile e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il gusto al naso rimanda al malto. Il cappello di schiuma da bollicine medie resiste poco. La carbonazione è abbondante. Il liquido ha frizzantezza da bollicine fini a carbonazione ben fornita, vivace e persistente. La consistenza è limpida. Il colore è giallo dorato. Il corpo è medio. Il dolce medio quasi sovrasta l’amaro moderato. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono di facile beva. I sentori in bocca sono di pane, frumento, fieno.
Draught. Clear golden colored with a medium sized white head. Malty aroma of hay and bread with notes of hops. Malty flavor of hay, hops and grass. Dry hoppy finish.
@Alba Adriatica - pale golden beer with a little white foam left; oily grassy nose; medium-bodied, sweet and with a low bitterness; paperey and oily grassy finish
Clear yellow golden appearance, medium head. Hoppy, grassy, light bitterness and sweetness. Refreshing Pilsener.
A pilsner to forget. No aroma dull appearance and a simple industrial taste...
1 pint on tap @ Tokyo House. Pours pale golden with a high head. Aroma is slightly sweet malts. Flavor is slightly sweet and grassy malts. Decent.
Imported from old beer-rating-app. My notes say not much, only that it was acceptable but nothing more. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Eine schöne Farbe und appetitlicher Geruch. Dieses Bier hat einen herben Einstieg und sobald man schluckt kommt der typische österreichische Biergeschmack zu Tage. Danach ein runder aber auch herber wohl komponierter Abgang. Kein schlechtes Bier!

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Very nice bottle cap <3 cold after hot day. Smell- weak nonalco feel, some hops maybe. Foam- To the small side, maybe medium white, quite thin, but not yet watery. Appearance- clear orange, yellow amber, some carbonation. Taste- weak nonalco notes, weak hops, some bitterness in back. And bit more of some biting bitterness but weak. Average lager.
500ml bottle (random shop, Latvia). Straight from the bottle. Papery, grain, malty, acetone, sour in aroma and in taste. Nope!
Bottle sample at a tasting at Max' place. Thanks Tom L. Clear-to-hazy gold. Cardboard and some candy aroma, sweet, oxidized and wet cardboard taste, light body, long, mildly bitter finish.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Max's place. Thanks Tom L. Golden. Corn, cardboard, sweetish, paper, bitterish note in the finish, light-bodied.
At Max Place, pours yellow with a small head, aroma of fruits, caramel, flavor of paper, corn, rice, light bodied

500ml bottle, best before 19/06/16. Has the same barcode as Arsenalnoe Premium. ABV is 4.7%. Pours dark gold with a small white head. Aroma is caramel malts, grass. Taste is more caramel, lots of water, low bitterness. Quite underwhelming, but probably better when fresh (this one was almost a year old). Glad that it wasn’t anything more than half a litre.
Bottle 0.5 Абсолютнго нейтральный лагер. Никакогозаетного послевкусия. Нет пены. Но на вкус не мерзкий, сойдет.

I tried this at a resturant the other day, 500 ml bottle for $5. Pours a standard yellow body with a wispy cap that left some ok lace. Aromas and flavor of hay, and overly sweet malts. Its about what you would expect.

Golden beer with an average white head that doesn’t last. Aroma is malty with bread and straw notes. Flavor is sweet and bitter leading to a dry bitter long end. Body is medium and carbonation is low.

Während das Villacher bei den Leuten in Kärnten recht beliebt ist, so wird auch unglaublich gerne über das Schleppe geschimpft -vor allem über das Schleppe Märzen (besonders wenn man es in der verruchten Schleppe-Alm trinkt). Was man bekommt ist zwar nicht so schlimm wie es viele Kärnter beschreiben, aber auch keine Welt. Ein klassisches Helles mit wenig Hopfen und einem unangenehmen pickig-süßlichen Abgang. Bei großen Durst ok, aber kein Genuss.
Tap in piazza. Golden color white head, malts and grass, simple, mild sugary clean finish, average.
Goudgeel, iets wazig, redelijk wat koolzuur, witte schuimkraag. Mout, graan, licht citrus. Smaak is licht bitter en iets spicy... licht grassig en een rustige bitter. Makkelijk drinkbaar bier.
Tap at Felsenkeller. Looks good in the glass, deep golden, small head. Starts mild, malty, dry hoppy. Light metallical. Hoppy notes a bit dry. Okay.
On tap at some gasthaus Clear gold with white head Tastes sweet, grainy, malty. Light bitter finish. Okay marzen

Flavor is malty and grainy with subtle hoppy notes. Golden colour with a medium sized white head. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. It tastes like malt, grain, bread and honey. Mouthfeel is thin, body is medium. An ordinary Märzen, but the honey flavor is interesting in a way. 0,5l bottle from Amersin.

0,5 flaske delt med Petru, hjemme hos ham: klar gylden med fint skum som varer. Mild citrus, litt urter, honnning og karamell. Lettdrikkelig og forfriskende, og etter Eggenberg Bio og Schützen Bräu var dette en opptur. Sier også noe om de to foregående.
Helder geel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is licht bitter hoppig en licht friszuur met sporen van citrus en ananas. Niet onaardig.

Clear golden with little white head. Aroma is white wine, alcohol, juicy basement malt, chalk. Taste is slight bitter hops of lots of uicy malt, not sweet though. Drinkable and quite smooth, not alcoholic or murky. Overall nice and not ugly.

Pours a clear pale golden color, topped with a medium and nonlasting white head. Mild malty nose with some fruity notes (pear) present. Sweet start, not too rough, with some bitterness in teh finish. Sparkly feel and light body. Not too bad, but nothing special.
Light brown color with about ok foam. None interesting aromas with some malt and hobs. Medium- fill, ok lenght. Slightly strange mouth flavours of malt and hobs... ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Has a fruity malty weak butterscotch aroma. Sweetish malty grainy caramel and weak butterscotch flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.

From tap at Plutzer. Pours clear and golden orange with a slowly collapsing off-white head. Aroma is dark malty, breadish and slight roasted. Roasted malt and breadish. Slight bitter and caramelish. Lingering dark malty. Roasted finish.
Sampled draught on Klagenfurt airport, Klagenfurt, Austria. -I`ve drink this beer on Klagenfurt airport and it was very watery, but it is nice pilsener
Malty aroma. Dark golden colour, good lace. Malty, light sweet, ok hops. Very full for a lager.

Medium brown color. A medium bodied Belgian style Pale Ale. Malty and slightly bitter. Good flavor. Very smooth taste. Not to hoppy. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Finish is malty.

Tasted 7/28/02 at the Oregon Brewers Festival. A very minimal nose, poured out brown with a small thin head with almost no lacing. It was smooth front to back, but lacked the complexity of a good Belgian. Not bad, just not what it could have been.

On tap at tugboat Portland. Pours out black topped with a small head. Nose is roast malts some odd chemical notes maybe some sort of nuclear waste. Taste is roast malts chocolate and as bad as the nose.
On tap at Tugboat. Black with a small head. Aroma and taste of licorice, chocolate and some warming alcohol. Drinkable but a bit chemical.
@ Tugboat 16-3-8: en lite klen doft och smak med lite kemiska undertoner. Lite bitter choklad i eftersmaken.

Draught at the Tugboat Brewing Co, Portland, OR. Black colour with a tiny tan head. Marmalade, sweetness, cocoa, chocolate, roasted malt and some hops in the aroma. The flavour is roasted malt, dry ashy notes, dark chocolate, cocoa and some sweetish hoppy notes. Decent one. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft pour at tugboat in Portland. Like gravy. Thick milky cocoa and choclate taste. Monster beer. Good beer to have before going to Mary's next door

Bottle at Deans impromptu Monday night tasting. Poured a clear dark brown with a bubbly light tan head. The aroma is light yeast, alcohol. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a big alcohol liqourice palate. Medium bodied with flat carbonation. Like many high ABV beers the alcohol tends to dominate. Nice but not "that" nice.
Poured deep dark reddish brown with a small tan ring. Aroma is vinous and slightly malty. Full body, flavour is bitter dark chocolate, bitter raspberries.
50cl bottle via a trade. (tap pour bottled) No carbonation or head (to be expected). Clear black pour. Nice enough. lots of chocolate.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is nail polish, candy like fruits, artificial something. Flavour is roast, malt, liquorice, molasses, dust, yeast. Meh. Sure this 13%?

On tap at Tugboat Black with a big dark tan head and good lacing. Aroma and flavors of roasted malts, chemicals and metallic goodness Wow, we were leaving and the bartender saw we left 2 full pints of terrible beer on the bar so he says "try this, it’s my favorite" and puts a sample of this on the bar. What’s a ticker to do!
On tap at the brewery pours out a copper color topped with a white head. Nose is not much better than hop gold pine yeast some grain. Taste is more of the funky bitter hops and a grain end.
Cloidy orange with foamy white head. Nose is wierd...sour. palate is full- bodied and hoppy. Flavor is not good. Very bitter grapefruit and that sour smell again. This beer tastes off.

On tap at Tugboat. Pours a cloudy copper color with a small white head. A sweet hoppy nose, very light. The flavor is very odd; initial fruity and biscuit, then a huge finish of bitter grapefruit. It burns the palate, I can’t say much else. Very odd, medicinal. Perhaps no late kettle additions? Something is amiss. I tried in vain to question the server who said people come from all around for this beer. I hope that is not correct.
From a really old tasting note on our pacific nw trip from a few years back - pine hop, grainy yeast, citrus, lemon and grass.

On tap at the tugboat location. Pours a beautiful hazy orange with a nice frothy head. the taste, however, is of plastic and stale hops. not a beer that i am a fan of. goes down nicely though, but the plastic....

Grapefruit, orange and caramel aromas. Deep yellow,slightly cloudy. minimal head. busy in the mouth. sharp citrus taste, right to the edge (couple years ago had one of these i just couldnt drink, mega-grapefruit peel.) barest hint of caramel

Date: 10/15/1996 Source: Brewpub slightly sweet malt aroma, mild hop flavor Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Tap at their brewpub... came out an unfiltered honey hue with a thin white head that dissipate to nothing on the surface. I enjoy the hazy look in an IPA sometimes. Aroma was too yeasty with some hoppy notes, I couldn’t get too good of a sniff though because of the smoking there. Really dry palate which accentuated the hops with other flavors of pine/grass and grainy yeast. A dry hop finish with a touch of malt.
Nice orange, but a bit cloudy. Taste is pretty typical....not as hoppy as other IPA in the area, but good....more grassy than citrus. Average.

This was the first brewpub I visited on my trip to Portland last October, but I forgot to submit the rating. The smell is very distincly citrus, almost lemon drop. The appearance was cloudy orange, almost like a wheat beer, but was a little hard to tell since it’s so damn dark in this place. Decent head and lacing. I didn’t think this was too bitter. However, I don’t think I could drink this for hours, even though I could hang out here for hours.

Not like any other Alt I have ever had, this was very strongly hopped, and had a strong hop aroma as well. Poured a murky brown, with a off-white head that diminished after a bit. Then the hoppy/fruity flavors take over, and were very pleasant. Not quite true to the traditional style perhaps, but still a great beer.

Half pint on July 1, 2015. At the brewpub in Portland. Hazy brown color, tan head. Acidic, malty taste. Acidic, bitter aftertaste. Medium thin mouthfeel, very low bitterness. Acidic, fruity scent. Feels like an infection going on here, or just very bad cleaning of the lines at the bar. All in all not a pleasant beer the way I had it served.
Draught at brewpub. Tugboat was the real letdown of the trip. Very little of their own beer on tap. This ESB had an odd but strong fruit flavor I liked. Maybe too much grape, but not bad.

Draft. An unclear amber beer with no head. The aroma is sweet malty with primary notes of caramel as well as lighter notes of citrus. The flavor is sweet matly with notes of citrus, grass, and hops. Way above their pay- grade?
Nice, pleasant beer. Cloudy amber colour with ruby. Nice white head. A bit watery but very nice.

Date: 10/15/1996 Source: Brewpub centenial hops, very smooth and bitter througout Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Foggy copper color (at least that is how it appeared in the darkness of Tugboat’s tap house). Strong floral hops in the nose. Body a little washed in the finish. Hoped for more bitterness. A little homebrewy and under carbonated. Overall a decent drinkable beer, but nothing to write about (oh wait I am). Try it at least once. Maybe mine was slightly off.
By far the best of the tugboat beers I had today. Strong hop taste with an almost equally full malt body. Smells of pine and caramel and taste is similar. Aftertaste coats the mouth quite well.

Cloudy amber colour, a bit of ruby tint as well. Pale malt, light caramel, spice/resiny hop aroma. Falvour shows light fruity malt, a bit of yeast. Spicy and resiny hop flavour. A touch of citrus in the finish. Comes across a bit muddled, but is drinkable.
Hazy orange-brown color. Fruity, apple like aroma. Moderate bitterness, some notes of grape skins and toast. An alright bitter, but something just seemed off about it.
Slightly murky dark red color. A weird off-flavor in here... bland and stale metallic flavors. the nose is a mild hopped citrus fruit experience, like a fruity orange juice/IPA nose.
All of Tugboats beers are brewed quite strong. Hazy red, overly hopped, goes down good. High ABV. i can only handle one or two of these in a sitting.

On tap at Tugboat, described on their chalkboard as a "hoppy ESB". Clear deep red with a quickly fading white head. Some caramel and hops in the aroma. Flavor starts of with notes of caramel, toasted malt and then comes a big burst of piney hop bitterness. Lingering bitter hop finish. Medium to full body, smooth texture and moderate carbonation. Nice beer.

Well the most accurate discription of this brew was when someone said, "this tastes like a mimosa", they were correct. This brew pours a light yellow/orange with a normal wheat haze to it. Aroma is very tropicana. Taste is very thin and watery with a very light yeast taste, light on the wheat. The only major flavor in this brew was a big dose of orange juice.

A great summer beer. The aroma is light floral, and the flavor is nicely fruity, with a very present honey sweetness, and toasted malts, the finish has just a taste of mandarin orange. Perfectly balanced, could have gone completely the opposite direction, but instead it came out just right.

This is definitely an easy-drinking summer beer. The honey is clear in the flavor, nicely complementing what is really just a hint of orange. There's just enough sweetness to be refreshing instead of cloying and the wheat in the mash makes for a nice palate on which the honey and orange to work.

A pleasant surprise for the tasting, just not for drinking more than a single pint or even a taster. Nice cloudy pale yellow body. Crisp with hints of orange zest& plenty citrucyness. Lots of honey sweetness as well.

I tried a dry hopped red ale, so I am assuming this is the same beer, with the wrong name. Anyhoo, this was very nice, lots of rich toasted malty notes, with a great almost esb like bitter hops bite. Great color and aroma, with a very well balanced finish.
Looks more like an Irish red. Very nice lace. A really malty brew, more congruent with those Wisconsin beers back home. Caramel, of course. A decent floral hoppy bite too. Great balance.

Pours a hazy dark orange with a tall white head. Aroma had a good hoppiness to it with a citrus fruit thing goin on. This brew was very smooth and crisp with a good light maltiness up front followed by a mildly bitter end to balance it out. Good citrus hops in the aftertaste.

This brewery is really good at what they do, so far I have been nothing but impressed. This is a really great IPA. Pours a deep amberish brown color which was surprising and the nose, is floral and fruity, and the flavor is rich and powerful and just slap you upside the face. Great fruit flavors with a sweetness from the hops and the malt, but again a nice dry finish. Wonderful.

Slightly darker than most IPA"s around here. A very nice, tight head. Tons of cascade and Mt. Hood hops, but followed up by a caramely, well balanced experience. I"d be interested to see is the brewers used a direct flame kettle to get that carmely malt presence. This is definitely highly complex stuff. The 90 IBU are definitely countered well.

Nice fruity-hoppy aroma...Color a copper/amber--a little bit darker than most IPAs---head on light side, but still a pretty brew...Flavor is suitably hoppy, but with distinct fruity countenance and healthy malt base...Body is in the medium range, so this is quaffable stuff as well...Finish is medium-dry, again with slight fruit overtones...very tasty...This is a "toned-down" West Coast IPA in the hop sense, but has the other ingredients to compensate...Robust and bright...A very good IPA.
nice soft mocha aroma, dark choclate brown, robust dry choclate with hints of smokiness

Ruby hued, VERY dark body with a nice chocolatey brown head. Well roasted barley malts. Lots of chocolate, milk and dark. Diddn""t linger worth a damn, but nice while it lasted. Tasty, but thin, watery mouthfeel is tought o overcome.

On tap @ Bier Steinm - Another one that I am amazed has held up so well. Found this keg in the bottom of Eugene City, formely West Brothers. Starting to get kind of weak, but still tastes great! Lots of rich chocolate, black tea, and creamy coffee. Extremely well balanced for the style.

Had this on tap at the new westbrothers off franklin blvd, i think its called the river lodge or something. Black with a nice tan head. Very thick and very smooth. Taste was kinda bitter with hints of coffee with a small amount of hops to back it up. A little to bitter of a stout for my taste but great non the less.
Black as midnight. Good roasted nose & taste. Just a bit sweeter than the porter. Not a ton of hops, more subdued perhaps. Good stuff, just not remarkable. Does have that nice coffe finish though.

Color is a hazy glowing copper--creamy pock-marked head that leaves rings of lace---very attractive indeed...Aroma is citrus-hoppy with slight floral overtones...Flavor features a measured but snappy hop profile that comes forth immediately---a slight fruitiness accompanies the main body and lingers through to the lovely finish that fills the back of the palate with a fog of hop vapors...Body is medium-light, very appropriate for such a brightly-flavored ale. Overall, this is most stimulating to the senses...This has flavor and olfactory qualities that one only obtains fresh from the source.

(gabf 2003) Pours a rich amber color. Given the high ABV of this IPA, I was really surprised at the light taste. This is a very smooth IPA with caramel flavors. Little hops but a lemon/orange zip to the taste.

Color is a rich copper-amber with a thinnish head and wispy lace--no doubt the influence of the high ABV rating...Aroma is fairly light balance of malts and hops and also a bit estery. This has an assertive hop top-end---nice bloom---with a firm malt bottom and brandy-like fruit accents. Finish is also fruity-dry. Carbonation is moderate and substantial enough to provide a buoyancy to this powerhouse ale--this is amazingly quaffable stuff, but watch out! That Demon Alcohol sneaks up on you in a hurry!
On tap at the brewery pours out a amber color topped with a sand head. Nose is rye malts some citrus fruit notes. Taste is more of the rye malts some grain spice and citrus hops.

On tap as the Rye Pale Ale. Perhaps a new beer, but the descriptions match what I had. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head. A sweet nose of grains and light fruit. The flavor was a nice mix of spicy rye and fruity hops, light bitterness, very clean. Good.
Great sheets of lace. Very pleasant, light yeasty and sweet. Hints of lemon too. An almost minty clean finish, perhaps as result of some Mt. Hood hops??
fruity hops then serious berriness and serious rye, a one two punch.........

This was very nice...reddish amber color with an off-white head, and a pleasant if slightly less hoppy aroma than their IPA or German Alt that I tried. The flavors were more mild as well. Wish I could get specific ABV numbers on their beers, but except for their stout, I was told "between 5 and 13 percent". This was a very pleasant drinking beer.
Nagyon jó levendulás 😁👍mellékíz erős pörkölt magok dominálnak. Bananos illat csodálatossá teszi
Ochutnáno přímo v pivnici v Hotelu Pegas. Poměrně standartní české lehce vodovější pšeničné pivo, jehož nejsilnější chutí je samotné obilí. Banány, hřebíček jen v pozadí.
On tap. Golden colour, rocky head. Aroma is lots of banana, a bit of lemon, a little bit of sulphur, no clove. Light bitterness, dry. Light body. Good.
Tap at brewery. Hazy yellow colour with stable head off. Aroma of banana, wheat,spicy. Taste of banana,wheat malts, lemon.

Lane bezpośrednio w browarze. Kolor ciemnozłoty, piana drobnopęcherzykowa, osadza się, ale szybko opada. Aromat pszeniczny. W smaku pełen dobry hefeweizen, czuć dodatkowo cytrynkę (którą kelner dorzucił do piwa!). Piwo smaczne, warte polecenia.
Tap (Pegas, Brno) Pale straw, clear, and served with a lemon slice. Bland wheaty taste, as was the aroma post-lemon. Flat palate, a bit sweet and sticky. A very dull wheatbeer.

On tap at the brewpub. Hazy golden body, huge white head. Comes with a lemon wedge thrown in the beer. Aroma of bread, banana, lemon zest and some cloves. Taste of bread, wheat malt, cloves, lemon juice, peach and banana. OK weizen.

Tap (Pegas, Brno). Clear golden color. Slice of lemon is floating in my beer. Small size, off-white head, stays. Sweet, citrus and surprise lemon in aroma. Wheaty, sweet, lemon and fruity in taste. Quite bland and watery.

Ve vuni i barve fajn. Pena drzi, krémová. V chuti banán, lehce cit. plody. Po napití zvlastní pachut na patre, ne prilis výrazná. Prázdnejsi, dobre nasycené, dobre nachlazené. (Pito v pivovarské pivnici Pegas, samozrejme bez citronu)
Tap at Le Senk. Golden hazy color, thick white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, spices, wheat. Same in taste. Good carbonation, not too sweet, refreshing

05/04 On tap at the brewpub. Clear, darker golden bodied beer with rich medium white head. Flower malty and mild hoppy aroma, sourish, as unpasteurized. Quite bitter, but nice flavor, grainy, some notes of fruits, interesting and for the style full bodied. Finish is long, follows the flavor well, bitterish, pretty simple but still very nice. This beer is very well brewed and obviously fully matured. Tasty.

0.5l at the brewpub Poured a nice golden body with lively carbonation (big bubbles too)... a medium sized thick white head that went away at a medium pace.A very nice peachy and malty nose with a hint of hops. The taste was nicely balanced; the hopiness was mild but pleasant, it was grainy, malty/fruity with a dry hoppy aftertaste. Like the wheat, quality stuff.
Sampled draught at Bavarska Pivnica, Jastrebarsko, Croatia. -nice gold color, little to sweet,refreshing

05/04 On tap at the brewpub. Murky darker golden bodied with medium white head that lived really long. Strong weizen yeast aroma, meaning banana, some orange, cloves and some other spices. As it’s unpasteurized aroma is also sourish, which gave me impression of a very "natural" beer. Flavor is very nice as well, slight bitterish though, but yeast is still dominating along with wheat malt sweetness. Full bodied, not nearly watery as most beers of this style, perfectly balanced and tasty. Of course, finish is nice as well, really long sweetness which follows the flavor. Nothing complex of course, but a great Weizen indeed, probably the best I’ve ever had!

0.5l draught at the brewpub. Poured a murky dark apricot/orange colour with a medium sized thick off white head that went away at a slow pace. The nose started off quite nice and quite by the book, with notes of banana, cloves, and bubblegum, but was ruined a bit by some odd sourish aroma. I was afraid that it’d be spoiled, but it turned out not to be. A somewhat light, pleasant, refreshing taste. Lactic, banana, quite yeasty, a bit bready taste with just a touch of hop bitterness near the end. The mouthfeel was lovely, pleasantly smooth. Surprisingly nice, and the better of the two Croatian wheats. Better than almost every other Hefeweissbiers that I’ve head, but that might be because of the freshness. All in all, worth the long wait. (from what I know, this brewpub started brewing again this year again after 3 years of "pause").
Sampled draught at Bavarska Pivnica, Jastrebarsko, Croatia. - the best Jastrebarsko beer, very rich head, fruity aroma, refreshing
Sampled draught at Bavarska Pivnica, Jastrebarsko, Croatia. - not so good as other two beers, to much bitter, small head

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Pint glass at the joint- served a transparent golden/orange color, creamy head that laced upon the vessel, light carbonation, Very faint aroma consisting of malt, caramel, hops, and fresh grass. Hits the mouth with a light medium body, malt isn’t overly sweet- ’bout time, medium holds up well, finish is slightly creamy and lightly bittering. Not shabby, could have knocked back about a dozen of them and I’d be happy for the day!

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Had as just ESB, so i’m assuming this is the right spot .. . pours a maple gold .. mild head, low spotty lacing .. . medium bitterness .. . light hoppy wood .. . a nice simple straight shooter of a beer .. . . Look, we can sit here all day and play the blame game, or we can start freaking people out!

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Translucent amber with a clearance nice white head. Malty nose. Flavor is more malty like an amber, not esb. Cool and crisp. Just too malty for me. I wanted something bitter.

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: (Draught) Pours a clear amber body with a moderate white head. Aroma of caramel, apple, melon, and grass. Flavor of caramel, toffee, grass, and biscuit.

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: On tap at the brewpub under the name Excalibur ESB. I assume this is the same beer. The beer pours an orange color with a white head. The aroma is fairly faint. I get a little bit of toffee and grass, but overall the beer doesn’t have much of an aroma. The flavor is more prominent. I get a lot of toffee malt with some grassy hop notes. As the beer warms I also get some pine notes from the hops. Very easy to drink. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Orangey, thin white head. Interesting nose of sourdough bread, tea, and light florals. Flavor was earthy, bready, and floral with a good bitterness that lasts the whole way through. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, soft bitter finish. A good session ale...

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Pour is hazed golden amber with a thin off white head...smell is sweet and bready malty with some caramel...taste is nicely malty up front with some nice sourdough bread flavor and slightly subtle bitterness rounding out the finish...

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Light straw color with a white head. Very subtle hop taste to the point of almost not being there. I was not impressed with this beer.

column4: North By Northwest Restaurant and Brewery
column5: Very average appearance, little head. Pretty good bitter though...nice maltiness throughout with a pleasant hop finish. What an ESB should taste like.
Better than expected, and not as "dark taste" as expected. High sweetness, but not too sweet. Neither too dense. Goes well with pork dishes.
Ein klassisches dunkles Bier, bei dem die Malzsüße über den gesamten Geschmack bestimmt. Es ist mir einfach viel zu süß und hat kaum andere Aromen zu bieten.
0,5 l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Bier, cremefarbener, flacher Schaum, schöne Gardine. Schmeckt fast wie en Malzbier, Karamell, dezente Röstaromen.

Donkerbruin/zwart, lichtdoorlatend, donker beige schuimkraag, weinig koolzuur. Aroma: zacht Roasty, Mout, karamel, iets nootachtig. Smaak: Niet heel roasty, vrij zoet, karamel zoet,  iets spicy, zachte bitter. Lichte body, wat waterig, zoetige en licht bittere afdronk. Matig!

Aroma is malty. It smells like roasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Dark brown to black color with a medium sized, good lasting, off-white head. Flavor is heavy sweet. There's a dominant caramel note escorted by roasted malt, milkchocolate, milk and some herbal notes. Body is light to medium, mouthfeel is thin to creamy. Finish is medium sweet and short. It's very sweet. I like it. 0,5l bottle.
Bottle: 500 ml, Gift: from Austria Saldus, įdomus skonis..
Black with little brown head. Aroma is chestnut, honey, roast, caramel, syrup. Taste is intense caramel sweetness with some dusty sourness. Overfull body. Dusty sweet finish. A bit ugly.

On tap at Brauhof in Villach-Austria. Coffee bean pour, resistant ivory foam. Nose: cocoa, caramel, ground barley. Yes! Mouth: lovely caramel, mou, soft caramel aftertaste. It is good! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
tap @ restaurant (slovenia). dark brown colour, normal body, average carbonated, semi-sweet taste, roasted malty aroma, too waterish for me
Draught. Dark brown colored with a medium sized beige head Sweet and malty aroma of caramel and cane sugar. Sweet and malty flavor of caramel and bread. Sweet finish.
[on tap] Deep brown body, thin beige head. Mild caramel, burnt sugar and chocolate aroma. Nutty and roasty flavors are covered by an overwhelming caramel sweetness. Enjoyable but not too balanced.

Wow, I finally found some information about this beer. I first had this one when visiting friends in Austria. This was one of the first "good" beers I ever had, and it has stuck with me. Probably more nostalgia than anything wrapped up in it. Decent selection.
Red-black color, brown head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Tast is very sweet, some acid, light alcoholic. Dry aftertaste with som roaste malt aromas. I don't like "Dunkle"
Light chocolat aroma. Dark brown colour, off-white frothy head, good lace. Sweet, light caramel and hints of chocolat. Very light bodied.

Had this on tap at the brewery and is was much better. Still a bit watery but the body was much rounder and there were very nice hints of coffee. 10/17/02 - 2.6: The Incipient Stout is still under construction. The first impression I got from this beer was that it was way too sweet. At first sip you encounter a small hop presence, followed by what at first may seem to be a pleasant chocolate malt but then there is an overwhelming sweetness reminiscent of flat soda. This could definitely use a bit more balance, not to mention some carbonation. After the sweet [mostly] subsides there is a hint of espresso, although not enough to balance out the flat Pepsi taste (not even Pepsi...maybe shasta?; RC Cola...wait RC Cola is good - not RC Cola).
Lasting brown head. Great roasted carmel nose.Very sweet malt/espresso profile throughout. Cloyinginly sweet
Great aroma that catches you and reals you in. Strong beginning taste but fades a little too quickly.

This is a beauty. I was in love with their porter because great flavor, but it seemed to lack something. This brew takes off where it left off. The color is almost opaque and the the flavor is much stronger and the palate is much thicker than the porter. reccommended to all.
Bit of head and some lacing. Nice flavors in this, with a light body. Seemed thin for a stout, but still enjoyable. Smooth going down, my second favorite at this brewery.
Thinnish and a touch roasty. Lighter than most stouts, perhaps bordering on what us Northerners would call a thick porter.
Dry, coffee flavors, lovely attractive colors...an excellent glass of beer and my favorite at the brewery. (on tap at Austin location)
Great for a brewpub stout....had all the right things about a stout and none of the wrong. Nice head, full of body and flavor....yum
Decent for a brewpub stout, nothing too good or bad except for a slightly unappealing and lasting finish. Coffee flavors, hints of woodiness, smoke? Not bad at all for a buck a pint.

Slight aroma of bread, grains....almost non existent. Decent dark gold color. Thin white head. Off-sweet tasting malt up front....synthetic. Bitterness creeps in..mild and no complexity. Finishes with the same off-tasting sweetness. Thin mouthfeel. I’ve had better cheap beer.
used to drink this as an underage teenager. a dirt cheap lager that the price reflects but i must say ive had plenty of good memories drinking this shit.

(drain pour and ticks’ night) pours clear yellow with a very small white head, little retention, no lacing. honeyed corn, faint and sugary malts, herbal blandness for a very short finish. almost aggressive carbonation, light body - seems to have a slightly better texture than water.. drinkable (read not a horrid brew)

Bottle [12oz]. No idea how it looks because I drank it out of the bottle, I imagine it’s a pale gold though. Aroma and flavour are sweet and grainy along with a hint of artificial honey. Thin bodied. It was handed to me at a yard party so I drank it, but I would never pay for one, it’s not good. -- Rated via Beer Buddy.

I used to drink this all the time. If you closed your eyes and sipped it, you might not know there’s honey in there, just that it’s a sweet lager. I wish I could comment on the appearance, but I don’t recall ever seeing this outside of the can, so I’ll just give that an "average" score to be fair. Smells of sweet vomit. Women like it. Just kidding, if you serve it they’ll think you’re cheap.

Originally rated September 2004. First of two reviews on Ontario, Canada brewed honey lagers. This one from Lakeport poured a golden-orange colour with a decent head that had little retention. Aromas were of malt with sweet hints. Had medium carbonation. Started off slightly bitter, and then finished on a mild honey note. This brew had lots of marketing behind it, being a buck a bottle (canadian funds) which is cheap here. This resulted in being in the top 10 sellers in Ontario (The Beer Store). O.K. That doesn’t say much, but this beer is pretty good for summer.

473ml can pours a pale golden color with a small white head that leaves no lacing. Aroma is cheap grains and hops. Taste is malty sweet with a terrible bitter aftertaste. Not good and not recommended.
Pretty much as you’d expect from a discount brewer. Not much here but it is my preference of the macro honey lagers.
341ml bottle. Had this one ages ago. Old notes say "drinkable." It doesn’t really stand out amongst the other buck-a-beers.

341ml bottle. Served very cold - probably helped, and really its gota be from the bottle. Its cheap and not terrible. Its very sweet, not terribly great, not complex, off after taste. But all that being said its still better then some of the swill out there (and its brewed in my old hometown so...)

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: A decent red, better then most of their beers. Pours a very nice deep red with a tan head. Not much of any smell, a tad nutty. Taste is smooth and malty, with caramel and a nutty finish. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: On tap at Old Market, pours a deep dark red with a small white head. Aroma brings out toasted bready malt, light hop resins and toasted caramel. Flavour is robust, with bready malt, hop resins and a rather abrasive astringency on the finish. Nice ambition but it’s rather harsh. Okay.

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: Keg at the brewpub, Beaverton, 11/11/14. Murky amber with a thin beige swirl atop the glass. Nose is biscuit, caramel, spice, red berry fruit notes, dusty hops. Taste comprises rich caramel, biscuit malt, light spice and fruit notes. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Adequate offering.

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: On tap at OMP. Pours a cloudy reddish color with a medium white head. A big malty sweet nose. Very sweet, caramel, dusty nutty malts. Flavorful. Decent.

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: Tap at old market, portland, or. Malty aroma with toffee and caramel notes. Pours a dark ruby red with very little head and no lacing. Malty to start with toffee and caramel flavors. Finishes dry and slightly bitter with a hint of chocolate. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear dark red, fine beige head, heavy drippy lace Aroma: lightly sweet dark caramel aroma, light bready character Flavor: sweet malt flavor, dry dark caramel, lots of earthyness, touch of citrus, light breadyness, light bitter finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4 Date: September 23, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear dark red, fine beige head, drippy lace Aroma: lightly sweet dark caramel aroma, plenty of earthy hops Flavor: big earthy hop flavor, light balancing dark caramel sweetness, well placed bitterness, long bitter finish Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: On tap@the brewery. Slightly hazy, dark reddish brown body with a dense beige head. Nice, mild aroma of sweet malt, caramel and hops. Flavor is refreshing caramel malt, some chocolate and balanced bitter. Rich and hoppy body, a bit more like a hoppy brown ale than red.

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: Draught. Poured deep red, like a red wine with a lasting beige head. Much lacing. Hoppy aroma with some citrus. Hoppy and peppery flavour, with a fine bitterish finish.

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: On tap at the Old Market. Pours out a dark dark red almost black topped with a nice head. A little hop a pretty good drink.

column1: Old Market Mr. Toads Wild Red Ale
column5: on tap looks more like a poertr. daek eedish brown. woody light roast flavoe with litttle hip bitternes. nice feel and soft carb.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: On tap at Old Market, pours a clear straw yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out light straw and biscuity malt. Flavour is along the same lines, with sweet cereal malt and some biscuity notes. Boring stuff but it’s clean and drinkable.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: Keg at the brewpub, Beaverton, 11/11/14. Clear light golden blonde with a moderate off white swirl topping the glass. Nose is pale malt, caramel, vanilla, light orchard fruit, citric peel. Taste comprises pale malt, floral notes, straw, lemon rind, vanilla. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. APA ??? Where are the hops - hang your head in shame Orygon. Sure its some crappy mom and pop rewpube but don’t pass this ramped up golden blonde as an APA! Send the rewer to London and someone will teach him how to brew one! God I miss the Kernel sometimes ...

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: On tap at OMP. Pours a clear yellow color with a medium white head. A big fruity grainy nose. Clean, lemons, bready, pale malt. Crisp not sweet dry. Good enough.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: On tap at OMP with Jeff. Pours gold with white foam. Smells simple with a hint of hops. Tastes simple, but ends with lightly floral hops and a bittering note.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: Name: Multnomah Village Golden Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy gold, fine white head, drippy lace Aroma: pale malt aroma, light floral hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, touch of candy sweetness, light balancing bitterness Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 8/20 Rating: 2.3/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: *+ /4 Date: September 23, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy gold, fine white head, lots of lace Aroma: sweet malt aroma, hint of honey, light floral hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, nice honey sweetness, balancing floral hops, light bitter finish Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 8/20 Rating: 2.2/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: *+ /4

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: Another good golden ale. Probably more bitter, but thats good. The dry-hopped-ness is a good addition.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: Draught. Poured pale amber with thin head. Light hop aroma. Medium malty body with a rather thin finish. Commonplace.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: On tap at the Old Market Portland OR. Pours out clear gold topped with a small head. A little grain but not much else.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: on tap light grains nice light aro.a. Big body ans light carbonation. Teeriffic for the style.

column1: Old Market Multnomah Village Golden Ale
column5: [Tap - Old Market Pub] A golden yellow color with a nice head. Thi also was a easy to drink after working hard all day brew. It had some flavor but was plain in my book. Nice easy balance.
On tap at OMP. Pours a clear yellow color with a small white head. A light sweet nose. Banana, grainy, lemons, sweet sugary finish. Ok.

Keg at the brewpub, 11/11/14. Clear golden blonde with a moderate off white swirl and edgework. Nose is banana, yeast, light clove, straw, spice. Taste comprises vanilla, yeast esters, nana, clove. Medium body, fine carbonation, semi drying close. So so, lacks any depth or finesse for the ABV.
On tap at OMP wiith Jeff. Pours a light gold with white foam. Smells slightly sweet. Tastes lightly sweet with hints of wheat. Simple and drinkable, but not bad.

Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy orange, fine off white head, creamy lace Aroma: sweet banana aroma, light clove Body: creamy body Flavor: sweet banana flavor, light balancing clove Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 15/20 Rating: 3.7/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: *** /4 Date: September 23, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: hazy dark gold, wispy off white head, streaks of lace Aroma: sweet malt aroma, light banana sweetness, faint clove Flavor: sweet malt flavor, banana candy sweetness, just a hint of balancing clove, sweet finish Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.4/5.0 Drinkability: 5/10 Score: *+ /4
On tap at the Old Market Portland OR. Pours out cloudy topped with a nice white head. A very nice spice and banana aroma. Great body a nice mouth full.
on tap huge dense white creamt head. nice light germ hef aroma. Agin. very full soft plawte. Manana and vey slight spiciness delish.

[Tap - Old Market Pup] A unfilteded off golden yellow with a light white head brew. A deep wheat flavor and nose When I say deep his had some malt and it was wheat flavored it was chewy to say the least. A intresting brew. Most would say "Wheres the Hops?"
Another breakfast cereal wheat, but this was not bad, had a little bit more body and spiciness than I expected. Pretty basic

On tap at the Old Market. This was one of the worst pub beers I have ever had, just rancid and very metallicy, so much that you can’t really distinguish much taste other than dimes and nickels. Pours a clear light gold, not cloudy at all.

(RBSG04) Hazy straw with white head. Aroma is medium sweet, wheat, light lemon. Taste is medium sweet, grassy, wheat, lemon, finishes with herbal element. Light-medium body. Unexpected bitterness, but I liked.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: Keg at the brewpub, Beaverton, 11/11/14. Clear golden with moderate off white spotting. Nose is apple jus, sweet, orchard wood. Taste is pale malt, apple orchard, light vanilla, straw. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, sweet apple pulp in the close. Meh!

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: On tap at OMP. Pours a clear yellow color with a medium white head. A light fruity apple nose. Light seemingly fake green apple, sweet malts. Not good.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: Name: Ol’ Granny Smith Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear gold, fine off white head, heavy lace Aroma: sweet malt and apple aroma with a hint of crisp apple tartness Flavor: sweet malt flavor, nice soft apple character, hint of gramy smith tartness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3.1/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: ** /4

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: Unfortunately uses extract instead of actual apples, but still alright. Too candy like but an interesting combination nonetheless.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: On tap at the Old Market Portland OR. Pours out clear gold topped with a small head. A nice sour apple aroma on this one. Tast off apples not bad.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: on tap. clear yellow w a quick thin wwhite head. sour appple aroma and a bittter appple soapy extraxt flavor. eh...

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: {Tap - Old Market Pub] Off yellow with a light head. The aromja was light as a light beer would beer. The apple flavor was very light and almost like I have seen jolly rancher type. It was Ok as fruit beers go.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: This has a bit of toffee and sour apple jolly rancher flavor, with just a bit of caramel covered apple fruitiness, almost vinous and ciderish at times. Not very tasty or easy to drink.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: On tap at the Old Market. This was an interesting brew, but the thing I don’t like about Old Market’s fruit beers is the artificial/candy sweetening taste that they get. This brew had an apple taste that only really reminded me of apple jollyrancher, I wish they would use real fruit instead of whatever artificial stuff they use. Overly sweet and candy taste leaves this brew tasting like one of those sweet green apple icicle pops.

column1: Old Market Old Granny Smith Green Apple Ale
column5: This is pretty much a cider. Not sure why they call it a beer. Yellow color with immediate sweetness and a dominant sour apple taste. Too sweet. Like one of those sour apple pops.

On tap at Old Market, pours a crystal clear amber with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of resinous hops, some pine and toasted bready malt. Flavour is robust, with Belgian yeast, bready malt, some caramel and a wallop of resinous dry hopping. Long bitter finish that works pretty well. Nice stuff.

Keg at the brewpub, Beaverton, 11/11/14. Clear golden amber with a moderate off white covering. Nose is hops, bitter orange, caramel malt, sweet notes, earthy. Taste comprises caramel malt, biscuit, light hop presence, sweet, mineral notes, bitter orange. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, semi drying close. Adequate.
On tap at OMP. Pours a clear copper color with a small white head. A light fruity nose. The flavor is bready, fruity, citrus hops, lemons, light resin. Solid.

On tap: A: Opaque copper with a thin white head. N: Substantial spruce and earth. Pineapple, grapefruit, biscuit, and even a hint of rapsberry. T: Densely bitter - submerged leaves. Minor sweetness. M: Medium body, very dense with lower carb levels. O: a throwback brew, what I remember drinking a lot of when I first started my beer journey.

Draught at the Broadway Grill and Brewery in Portland. Walked into the place looking for some food, and had no idea that it was a brewpub and had never heard of Old Market. In a town with so many breweries I suppose that is to be expected. Anyway.... this beer has a good, moderate citrus aroma/ Light copper color, with a thin creamy head. Very hop-forward initial / more hops in mid, and then some balance takes hold / strong, dirty hop trails in the finish. Medium body. Some good mouthfeel/texture from hops. Perhaps too much hopping for the light O.G. Tastes much more like a hopped-up pale ale than an amber. Solid stuff.
On tap at OMP with Jeff. Pours a light amber with white foam. Smells of very floral hops. Tastes bitter and hoppy with hints of overly bitter strawberries and extra hops.

Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear amber, fine beige head, drippy lace Aroma: sweet caramel aroma, floral and citrus hops Flavor: sweet crystal and caramel malt flavor, lots of balancing hops, earthy and floral with a touch of citrus, long bitter finish Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 14/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: *** /4 Date: September 23, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: muddy and chunky burnt orange, creamy beige head, sheets of lace Aroma: sweet crystal malt and citrus hop aroma Body: creamy body Flavor: sweet citrus flavor, touch of crystal and caramel sweetness, plenty of balancing bitterness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3.2/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4
For an IPA, not quite bitter, for an amber too much. Kind of a weird brew, but good nonetheless.
On tap at the Old Market Portland OR. Pours out amber topped with a white head. A nice hop aroma. With the name Hop on one would think IPA????
on tap clear deep orange. v small head and spotty lacing. Cascade citrusy hop aroma and lots of hops in the flavor. a bit unvalanced but nice and IPAish. chalky sticky palate.

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: On tap at Old Market, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of raspberry upfront, along with lots of pith and skins. Flavour is along the same lines, with lots of raspberry skins, some pith and a dry biscuity malt base. Nice raspberry notes. Nothing complex but it’s done well.

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: This buttery blondie begins with a cold, crisp refreshment that is sweet but zippy soon turning to a full, rich and nutty thirst quencher that lingers in an even nuttier finish. It’s full-bodied without being a fruity ass and the combination of sweet to sinfully soothing is my newest love. Give this baby a try if you’re looking for a light but defined brew that is palatably pleasant. Cheers!

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: Keg at the brewpub, Beaverton, 11/11/14. Clear golden with a moderate off white swirl. Nose is sweet berries, sugary, melon, grape juice, floral notes. Taste comprises sweet green berries, raspberry syrup, straw. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, sweet licks in the close. Meh - fruit beer.

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: On tap at OMP. Pours a mostly clear yellow color with a medium white head. A big sugary nose. Hmm. Taste is artificial sweetness, odd berries. Base light malt. Not good.

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: Name: Mr. Slates Gravelberry Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: muddy burnt orange, fine white head, drippy lace Aroma: sweet raspberry aroma, light berry tartness Flavor: sweet raspberry flavor, touch of candy sweetness, light fruity tartness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 3.1/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: ** /4 Date: September 23, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: cloudy orange, fine off white head, drippy lace Aroma: big sweet berry aroma, balancing berry tartness Flavor: sweet berry flavor, light candy character, just a hint of berry tartness Overall: well balanced overall with lots of berry flavor without being over the top Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3.2/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: Draught. Poured pale gold with thin white head. Aroma of bread and raspberry. Raspberry flavour with some a bit of yeastiness. Lingering sweet finish. But not sicky sweet

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: I am pretty sure only a raspberry extract is used, lending the beer a sweet raspberry taste but in a faux way. A drinkable fruit beer but the wrong kind of sugar.

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: On tap at the Old Market Portland OR. Pours out ligth pink yellow topped with a nice head. A little berry on this one just the right amount.

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: on tap big raspberey aroma. Basic light amber beer. Bitter fruit flavor. Quaffable

column1: Old Market Mr. Slates Gravelberry Ale
column5: {Tap - Old Market Pub] Thjis was an off golden yellow with a slight red to it color with a decent head. The aroma you can smell the fruit and the flavor was awesome. This was a great fruit beer. How do they do it maae the fruit come out?

An ok pale ale. Pours a clear orange with little head. Smells slightly of nuts and berries. Taste is caramel, and a bit nutty, but an empty finish. Had on tap at the brewery. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Keg at the brewpub, Beaverton, 11/11/14. Clear golden with a moderate off white covering. Nose is pale malt, straw, vanilla, diacetyl. Taste comprises butter balls, caramel, sweet and bland. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Dull diacetyl stained tedia.
Draught. Faint floral aroma. Pale copper with thin head. Light bodied, with some malt sweetness and a hop tinge. Small finish.

Name: Pinochile Pale Date: September 22, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear copper, fine off white head, sheets of lace Aroma: sweet pale malt aroma, light floral and citrus hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, light spicyness, earthy and citrus hops, balancing bitterness, linger ing bitter finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: ** /4
On tap at Old Market Pub, Pours out a clear light gold topped with a white head. A nice light hop on this one. not bad.

[Tap Old Market Pub] This was a ornageish golden color with a nice head. The aroma was a off fruity aroma with a little nut also. This was a plain brew with not a ton of flavor this was nice and would be great on a super hot day after working in the yard.

Tasted on tap at Brewery. This Pale Ale pours a deep orange gold color. Medium sized white foamy head. Aroma is fruity and sweet, with a touch of caramel. A medium bodied pale ale.
