Just tasted after 'Cuvée de Tomme', and the parentage is obvious. Taste gives wood & tannines, dark malt, prunes again, liquourish. Sourish tinge,and then: RAISINS in the way of the Flemish 'boerejongens' (=cherries or raisins preserved in jenever). Adstringent mouthfeel, alcohol (oh surprise!). No new aftertaste, unless you count the way your throat reacts after a triple brandy. This beer presented me some problems, finding the right descriptions. But Tomme is a magician, no doubt.

4/4/2018. Bottle at the Cricketers, Dorking. Pours clear bright golden colour with a just off-white head. Aroma of hop, flowers, fruit, grass and light caramel. Medium plus sweetness, light bitterness. Moderate body, oily and watery texture, average carbonation. Nice retro style bottle, beer is ok.

Was craving a meat pie so hit up best British joint in town and figured go with a Fullers to complete experience. Fine Amber pour. Nose is nothing much light hops and caramel. Tastes of dry hops, toast, earthy, light caramel. Easy drinking pleasant enough. Medium bitterness.
Bottle. Pours a dark orange colour with a thin white head, aroma is light and hoppy with hints of fruit, taste is medium bitterness with malt coming through with a dry fruit finish.

Grain and cereal malts, biscuit, dusty straw. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Light bitter. Grain malts continue, floral hops, bitter and dry finish. OK Bitter, nothing spectacular though. Bottle from brewery, Chiswick.

Thanks to Scopey for sharing a bottle with Finn and me at Fullers Builders Arms in Croydon. Pours a crystal clear golden-brown body with a tiny head and faint lacing. Malt-fruity aroma. Fresh fruity taste of noble hops and malty sweetness beneath. Short malt-fruity ending. Decent (30.11.2015).

Bottle 350ml in Builders Arms Croydon 30 Nov 15. Thanks to Scopey. Shared with him and Rune. Gylden. 0 skum. Litt søt tyggegummiaroma. Lett syrlig fruktsmak. Avslutningen har et behagelig maltpreg. Litt tørt. Utmerket øl til så lav styrke.

Bottle at the Builder’s Arms, Croydon. BBF June 2016. It pours clear amber with a tiny white head. The nose is soft, sweet, fragrant, light caramel, orange peel, peach and toffee. The taste is soft, crisp, bitter, toffee, toasted grain, grass, straw and light pepper with a dry finish. Light body and fine carbonation. Simple and easy-going. Not too shabby for what it is!
*Old rating. Best before 24 Jul 12. Das Bier ist recht neutral, aber dennoch weich und süffig. Nettes Ale-Aroma vor hellem Malz. Moderat Bitter im Nachgeschmack, rund und trotzdem lecker!
Bottle at The Basketmakers, Brighton. bb 04/03/14. Pours an amber coir. Aroma is nothing! Nothing! Light body, thin. A hint of caramel, toast. So dull. Not great. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap. Pours a amber color with no head. Aroma was malt, bread and a small amount of hops. Taste follows. A slight paper aftertaste. Decent.
Draft. Burnt toffee malt and cherry aroma. Dark brown with small head. Sweet raisin, toffee malt, and moderately bitter herbal/alcohol flavor. Full bodied.
Flight draft in Ludington. Dark brown pour with a white ring. Still looking. No real aroma. Nice flavor though with caramel malt and a hint of earth. Nice.

5 oz. sample on 5-20-12 (Flight 2)-served a very dark brown with a ruby tint color, very sugary nose. Hits the mouth hard with a medium body, malt was strong, sugar in the middle was strong, and the finish of alcohol was strong. Whew!

On tap at the brewery. Pours murky brown with a mahogany beige thin head. Light aromas of fruit and malts. Malty fruity flavors. Dried fruits, peat, and a touch of alcohol with a pleasant earthiness. Not bad.
had this at the third annual MBG winter beer festival...the numbers are reflective of the sampling, however i added no notes. my apologies.
Part of a sampler at the restaurant. I note that I had a cold when I visited and could not get a great sample of the aroma of the beers that I sampled. Not bad beer. Good hop flavor.

Had this one on draught as part of the sampler at the brewpub in Ludington, Michigan. Best scotch ale I’ve ever had. Cloudy, dark brown pour with a foamy tan head. Almost bizzare cedar nose and taste, with an awesome smooth maltiness, no alcoholic aftertaste. Wow.

On tap at the brewery. Muddy orang-brown body, thick cream head. Earthy, toasty aroma with nice sweetness. Creamy palate, with lots of brown sugar and toast, accentuated by light peat. Long, bitter, earthy hops finish. I detected a hint of apple, too. Alcohol is warming but not overbearing. Average complexity. This beer sipped nicely after a long day in a bog and cedar swamp.

Pours a clear brown color with ruby highlights and a ring of offwhite lace. Weak aroma of toffee and earthy malts. Mild flavor of toffee and earthy malts, the flavor is stronger than the aroma but still the malt feels weak and thin. Light to medium body with a liquorous texture and gentle carbonation.

All the brews were here were served really cold, so I ordered this one and let it sit for a while to warm up. This may have caused the aroma to be a little flat as I could just get a little dark caramel, but it was good. Great mahogany brown color with just a little light showing through the edges. Diminishing, creamy, off-white head. Brown-sugar, caramel, some peat malt (smoke?). Initially good flavor, thin middle and a warming finish with lots of good flavor: brown sugar and another hint of that peat/smoke flavor. Medium body, alcohol in the finish.
Draft. Banana, clove and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy pale yellow with moderate head. Sweet orange/banana, clove and wheat malt flavor. Nice body. Very pleasant - nice maltiness.

5 oz. sample on 5-20-12 (Flight 2)-served a murky dulled orange/yellow color, light clove and banana on the nose. Hits the mouth with a light medium body, malt is slightly stronger as opposed to other’s in a similar style, clove on the tongue with banana on the finish with yeast thrown in for good measure. Pleasant.
On tap at the pub: Decent hefeweizen. Pours yellow with a decent thick head. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Pretty tasty.

Had this one on draught as part of the sampler at the brewpub in Ludington, Michigan. An outstanding hefe. Cloudy, opaque light yellow pour, served with an orange. Wispy white head with lots of banana, orange and cloves. Simply awesome.

Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin white head. Mild aroma of cloves and banana. Bland flavor of cloves and bananas. The body is light with an oily texture and lively carbonation. The yeast and ester presence is not strong enough to make this beer interesting.

Banana, clove and a hint of sulfer. The sulfer fades after the initial sniff. Cloudy yellow with a thin, white head. Nice flavor with a bit of the banana and wheat twang, but the spiciness (clove, black pepper) is most prominent. Sweet, but not candy-like. Thin body, watery palate.
Pretty much what I expected and was looking for in a Hefe. Smooth and refreshing, with just the right amount of fruit aftertaste.

Based on my ratings, it was a good visit to this pub. Another brew that was strong on style. Wheat beer with light body cloudy appearance wtih aroma and flavor that was good balance of wheat and banana. Each of the brews I tried had a very distinct pleasent finish.
A little acidic flavor components; otherwise a standard, fair-quality banana-laden hefe - looks the part. TOO cold!
On the estery side of the weisse world, though a sumberged citric tang does surface now and again to duel with the banana.

On tap at the brewery. Being so close to the cherry trees of Michigan, I was looking forward to this. But I’m pretty sure they got this syrup shipped in. Red black color with a soapy head. Strong cherry aromas that are too much machino cherry. Artificial cherry flavors that are syruppy and begin to remind me a little of cough syrup. Oh and that just gets worse, change that little into a lot. The syrup just kills it.

On tap. Pours dark brown with some ruby highlights. No head. Aroma is cherry and chocolate. Flavor is sweet cherry, almost artificial, some dark chocolate. Palate is medium bodied, mildly carbonated, finished sweet and tangy. Again nothing special.

Draft at Jamesport. Dark reddish/brown color with a small off-white head. Moderate cherry and chocolate aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture. Moderate cherry, chocolate malt flavor with a medium tart bitter finish.
Definitely a battleground beer as some remarkable bitters - hard, edgy, graveyard herbal tones - take on the decent cherry essence. Red battles black in the color, too. Interesting.

Clear golden color with scant foam. Slightly oily, creamy palate. This ale has a very slight sweetness, but is really rather boring. And it was served altogether too cold - I couldn't catch the aroma. It almost froze the glass when poured!
Only 3.5% ABW. Dry, marginally sweet and aslo somewhat lemony and astringent. Exceptionally clear and thin, watery, but thirst quenching.
Mild and crackery like too many microbrewed "blondes" and "kolsches", but with more substance and body, so more worthy of praise.
Canned in 2001. Golden colour. Dry yet fruity, some grainy malt. Some alcohol, but not that bad. Bitterish finish.
Canned. Golden colour, mediumsized creamy white head. Aroma of malts, hops and alcohol. Flavour is brutally bitterish of alcohol, grass and hay. Superdry and hoppy. Very unpleasant.
<!-- i -->Can<!-- /i --> (BB 10/2006).<!-- br --> Golden color, small white head. Alcohol, grain, fruity apples in the nose. Apple fruity, grainy flavor too. Aftertaste is harsh and alcoholic.
(Can 50 cl) Fully golden with a creamy, sticky head. Nicely full-bodied but atop the malty base comes a sharp, harsh unpleasant bitterness that stays for a long, long time. No real joy. 151101
Golden, small head. Aroma from tobacco and alcohol, rather sweet. Alcohol flavor, yeasty and with a bitter finish. No good at all...
Golden with a quite ok white head. Sweet aroma, sweet flavor with alcohol. A beer mostly for those who wants to get drunk...

Pale golden colour, thick dissipating white head. Pale malty aroma, slightly fruity and a bit of floral character. A bit yeasty, floral, light malt. Not great, but the alcohol is well hidden. Probably the best malt liquor I’ve had.
Deep golden colour, medium fast disappearing head. Sweet honeyish aroma. Fruity alcoholic palate and dry, surprisingly bitter, hoppy aftertaste. Quite good.

Canned. Golden colour, with a rich creamy, steady head. Malt and alcohol nose. First sip reveals almond, wow. A bottom-fermented Barley Wine? Not really. It’s in fact unpleasantly sweetish and brings almonds but unfortunately also lots of alcohol. It gets too much after a few sips.
Golden colour, small head. Vodka in aroma... Sweet alcohol flavour with hints of hops and chemicals. Acidic finish.
I know way past its prime. All hops nose is gone. Just big malty back bone. But I can still taste how great this beer was when it was fresh. I’m sure amazing.

Sehr süßer und würziger Geruch, der Hopfen ist zwar erkennbar, geht aber zwischen den anderen Tönen fast unter. Süßlicher Antrunk, wie im Geruch ist der Hopfen erkennbar, wirkt aber fast schon schwach, stärker im Vordergrund steht die Malzigkeit und der leicht würzige Unterton. Zum Ende hin wird das Bier kurz alkoholisch, kann sich durch den stärker werdenen Gewürzton doch noch beherrschen und gefällt hier durch die stärkere Hopfigkeit. Zum Ende prickelnd, eher mild und mit wenig Hopfen. Vielen Dank an den Doppelbock für das Teilen des Bieres! Test vom 1.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,13,11,12,11,10 - 10,95
Sampled at the Double IPA fest. Really nice big sweet hop bomb. Port Brewing always delivers when it comes to hoppy beers.

12oz bottle. Pours a bright, clear golden orange color; perimeter of white bubbles at the edges of the glass; patchy lacing. Solid presence of candy sugar, dried caramel (some oxidation at this point), and residual citrus and earthy bitterness in the aroma; despite having certainly lost a ton of hops, the malt core remaining in the nose is quite nice; like an aged, light-bodied barley wine. Loads of sweet dried caramel, candy sugar, dried oranges upfront; good levels of carbonation; decent amount of viscosity in the mouth, a touch of warmth, and solid levels of bitterness (earthy, citrus, some floral notes); soft edges, good depth in the malt character, still balanced, though certainly not the hop bomb it once was (this is my only experience with the beer); I imagine this to be remarkable fresh; it’s still very enjoyable and pleasantly composed with age behind it. Lengthy finish, with relaxed bitterness: earthiness, candy sugar, and some dry toasty malts.

First taste GABF in 2004. Second taste from an aged bottle. Mostly clear orange copper colored body with a small white/tan head. Nose has a big, stinky, dank, wet orange hop note, no doubt tempered by age, and moving more towards a nutty, old orange and cardboard/bran character, dampened hops on top of some chewy malt. Flavor is resinous, old oranges, little to no apparent oxidation noticed, not the typical wet cardboard at least, but some sort of wet, nutty, orange fruit and honey flavor. Texture is resinous, oily and properly thick, and there’s little to no bitterness left after all this time. Sweet, sugared oranges and pine needles in the finish, it’s still quite delicious. I have to compare back to 2003 when I had Frank on draft at the GABF (too far gone for a proper rating), and I remember it being unbelievably dank, vibrant and thick, with a smooth-but-rough bitterness throughout. Quite different now, but still really good.

Courtesy of kmweaver. Cloudy amber body with a small beige head. The nose is rich caramels and toffee, citrus and floral hops. The flavor is moderately sweet, moderately bitter with grapefruit, tangerine, lots of caramel and honey. Medium/full body is soft with light carbonation.

Bottle, courtesy of Dr. Bill. First 2/3 of the bottle pours pretty clear. The bottom one-third is sludgey. My sample came from that 1/3 so that’s most likely affecting my rating. Aroma is soapy. Also basil, mint tea, and forest smells. My sample is phenolic and slightly acrid in the back of the tongue. Not in its best form.

Date: 04/17/2005 Mode: Bottle Source: Trade hazy orange, whispy head, aroma of sweet grapefruit sprinkled with sugar, perfect creamy body, nice sweet malt with a citrus nugget, just enough hops to balance with a light bitter finish, estasy in a glass Aroma: 9/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 17/20 Rating: 4.1/5.0 Score: ****/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

bottle.....not sure why i saved this one for so long, my god i hope i’m not becoming another BeerCellar with cellaring off dipas!! heaven forbid....aroma: very sweet hop profile. is that an oxymoron? seriously, the pineapple citrus aspect of it all is very sweet and candied up nut still held is presence nonetheless....taste: happy to discover that the hops were still evident. nice balanced flavor between the that and the malts. would definetely like to have tried this one fresh to make a comparison.

Hazy amber red body with a huge very creamy lasting off white head; Very beautiful and elegant nose, not to much, not to little simply right, very well developed aromas the actual hop flower aroma ain’t present, instead they have developed into aromas of ripe orange juice, soft sweet flowers, aromas of sweet ripe lemons right of the lemon tree are blowing into your face; Very pleasant soft textured body, but a little to much very soft carbonation, the body is very settled and very well composed and balanced bitter, slightly salty and slightly sweet; Quite long finish, smooth and elegant, fading and changing slowly from the very soft slightly sweet to the bitter sweet and ending bitter dry, all the time with the right amount of aroma and the right aroma. What a great beer. Very very well made and elegant in all aspects. If this beer is on its way down I would have loved to taste it at its prime. Thanks Chris!

Taste like champagne. Pours with a slight head. A bit bitter, with a slight tart pie after taste. A bit to sweet, drank a 22oz and the sugar made me sick. Maybe good for after a meal, in small quantities.

I had a hard time enjoying this one, it looked good, the labeling was great I like the outer beer bottle look, but it was really weak on pear taste. On a hot day I want to have that pear taste in a strong way, crisp, cold, & blow my socks off pear taste. This just didn’t do it.
Bottle. Clear golden color poured with a thin white head. Pear aroma and taste. It is clean and lightly sweet. Very nice.

12oz bottle (courtesy of Headbanger) poured into a Flute at 47°. Color is a very light, bright gold with good carbonation and a thin soda like head. Aroma is white wine and pear. Body is very light, giving it a crisp mouth feel. Flavor is like a sparkling sweet pear wine with just a hint of bitterness in the back to give it a slightly dry finish. Overall it’s very tasty and refreshing.

12 oz bottle. So this was bottled last November. Let’s see how it holds up. Aroma is pears, minerals, light note of lotion, apple core. Pours clear golden with a dissipating white head. Taste is sweet, overripe fruit (that sounds gross, but it’s not cloying); finishes dry, lightly tart. There’s nothing bad about this, but nothing sticks out, either. It’s bland, easy drinking. I wouldn’t go for it again, though.
Not many in here seemed to like it but I found it quite good and crafty. Cloudy and sour with nice bubbling hints.
This cider is easy drinking. Nothing to special from this beer. Filler words.............//// ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle labeled " Sparkling Pear", picked up at The Grapevine Pours clear straw color with a green tint, small white head, some lacing. Aroma of pears, ripe apples, sugar and fruity. Taste is sweet, pears, sugar with a tart, dry finish Ok

Bottle. Pale gold, medium carbo. Pleasing ripe pear aroma, lightly perfumey. The palate leans more toward generic Apple juice with a high of pear character. Too sweet for me regardless, but it certainly smells better than it tastes.
Clear gold pour with minimal head. Nose is pear, fruity tartness. Tastes of pear, with some sweetness, finishing tartness, like a Bartlett pear champagney flavor. Not dense, effervescent.
Goeie degelijke Märzen. Geen hoogvlieger maar daar is niks mis mee! Mooi helder goud van kleur
This is what a basic märzen like. Golden color, with long lasting foam. Pleasant hoppy, malty aroma. Slightly bitter rather sweet taste. Great beer, better than average.

500ml bottle from Hermagor Spar. Good foam, medium co2 and body, colour. It is a good beer, but rather pilsner style for me (ex. long lasting hop). Taste is equal malt and neutral hop. But its price is a bit high for an industrial beer.
On tap. Clear pale gold with a white head. Grains, caramel notes, mild hops. Meh.

Das Murauer Märzen ist eines der besseren östereichischen Märzenbiere, welche in Deutschland aber als Helles bezeichnet wären. Es hat einen angenehm vollen malzig-würzigen Körper und lässt sich gut trinken. Auch zum Essen. Kann man empfehlen.

Tap. Herknerin, Vienna. Best seat in the house. Snap is fantastic. The owner of this place is completely awesome and utterly bonkers in equal measure. This place is great. This beer is pretty good, too.
Standard light lager, same as all the rest. Nothing bad to say, nothing good to say, except that it has no off flavours. Beer Paradise Vienna

Blond / hellgelb, ziemlich karbonisiert, weißer Schaumkopf, sehr klar. Das Aroma ist malzig, Getreide, etwas würzig vom Hopfen, etwas Zitrus. Geschmack: Nontig und Granig. Etwas Süßes, leicht anregend würzig und leicht fruchtig. Frisches Bier mit einem weichen Bitter. Leicht zu trinken und ein leichter Körper.

0,5 bottle. Ajándékba kaptam ezt a szép világos aranysárga, vastag fehér vastag habkoronájú nagyüzemi sört. Letisztult illata van, inkább malátás, némi komlós citrusossággal, de semmi oda nem illő nem volt. Az íze meglepően friss, komlós, ízes. Egy nagyon finom sör-keserű jön elő, nem vizes, semmi baj vele. Nem kiemelkedő, de ha itt ilyen nagyüzemi sörök lennének, boldogok lennénk... Ausztriában úgy tudom kedvelik, remélem még én is találkozom vele. Német alap-Marzen szintet megüti....

Blond/lichtgeel, redelijk koolzuur, witte schuimkraag, zeer helder. Aroma is moutig, graan, iets kruidig van de hop, iets Citrus. Smaak: Noutig en granig. Iets zoet, iets prikkelend spicy en licht fruitig. Fris bier met een zachte bitter. Makke lijk drinkbaar en een lichte body. Niet bijzonder verder.
(Bottle 0,33l) hoppy bitter taste, with little head, below average, absolutely not my type of beer
Clear golden coloured, short head. Pilsener-like beer, but with some additional flavours. Nothing special.
Clear golden color, short head. It's more like a pilsner, but with a hint of a springbock brew. Just a bit stronger taste.
Bottled(500ml). -golden colored, lots of bubbles, fruty aroma, little head..
Average beer a good all-rounder on all fronts...............................

Ein schönes, traditionelles Weizenbier mit tollen Fruchtaromen und einer merklichen Würzigkeit . Das alles schön harmonisch kombiniert und mit einer leichten hefigen Note. Auf jeden Fall interessanter als das Edelwieß, das ja ebenfalls von der Brau-Union kommt.
Süßlich hefiger Start mit kräutrigen Noten. Feine Karbonisierung, geringe Herbe, monoton aber nicht schlecht. Steigende Süße, spritzig, zum Ende minimal säuerlich. Einfach aber gut. 10/10/10/10/9/10
Cloudy golden color, nice white head with more than average solid foam. Fruit an spices at the nose. Fairly sweet tasing, full and long. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Hazy yellow with a tense white head. Apricot, cloves, grains, light banana. Mild sweetness and a bit tart. Medium creamy body with soft carbonation. Good.

Butelka 0,5l zakupiona na 3 Giełdzie Birofilów w Tychach 2017. Piwo barwy złotej przechodzącej w oranż, piana solidna, cieszy oko. Aromat klasyczny banany, trochę goździków, lekkie owocowe w smaku, niska goryczka.

Bottle from a local supermarket in bischhofshofen. Pours dark orange. Nose is nice banana, floral, bubblegum. Palate is slightly watery, some citrus, apricot, banana. The aroma leaves is great, the beer is average
500ml bottle at Knapp am Eck, Steyr. Aroma is banana and light yeast. Appearance is cloudy yellow with a fine white foam. Taste is light sweet, light sour. Soft carbonation. Good.
Many thanks for this beer to Erzengel. Pours cloudy golden color white frothy head. Notes of banana, spices, wheat.
*Many thanks to Sascha & Sandra for this beer. Yeast, round and fresh, hints of grain, nice clove, hints of banana. Not too deep, moderate bitter. Nice.

Draft. Cloudy orange body with large lasting white head. Aroma is nice fruity, mostly Bananas and some grains. Taste is malty with herbs ans fruits. Aftertaste is nice malty slighty balanced by some hoppy bitterness

Bottle from TWSP. Pours with almost no color, bubbles up the side, no head. Aroma is sweet apple, somewhat artificial - reminds me of a jolly rancher. Flavor is sweet apple - lots of artificial flavoring here - sugar (I can almost crunch it between my teeth). I can't drink this. This is going to the compost pile.
Very good tasting cider. A little light in color, just a slight golden color, with a few small bubbles. Nice crisp taste like fresh apples. They know how to do hard cider.

12 ounce bottle to wine glass Sight: light amber golden liquid, no foam, lots of effervescence Smell: not a lot of aroma, scent of apple Taste: lightly bitter, some sweetness Mouthfeel: lively carbonation lingers in roof of tongue, abrupt finish Overall: good, ok to repeat, not to look for
Flavor is like a McIntosh apple but drier. Distinct fresh picked apple flavor. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle (courtesy of Headbanger) poured into a Flute at 40°. Color is a light, bright gold with mellow carbonation and a thin fizzy ring for a head. Aroma is apple cider with a faint wine note in the back. It has a light body with a crisp mouth feel. Flavor is like the aroma, giving apple cider up front and a dry wine feel on the back. Overall its very tasty and refreshing.
There is a weird taste on it but it was refreshing and good to drink in the overall. Cloudy in features.

Bottle: Served in a shaker: Clear bright and light yellow. No head. Aromas of red apples, sweet apples and apples sweet. Flavour is sweet apples with a light subtle bitter tart ish tone. Light sulphite. Aftertaste is light, some apples and sweetnes with a light peel coverung it up... Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, just medium bodied.

12oz bottle, labeled as Red Apple, from The Grapevine Pours clear light pear color with a small white head. Aroma is sweet red apples. Taste sweet up front, red apples with some tartness in the finish, dry A good cider

Bottle from Roth’s. Very light golden straw in color. Nose is sweet with some candy apple. Some cardboard as well. Somewhat sweet apple flavor. A little bit of a tart wine like finish. Drinkable cider.
Bottle from Wegman’s. Pours straw with minial head. Apple nose, some tartness. Tastes medium in palate heft, with apple, mid honey, tartness.

Bottle from Vine Ripe. Medium golden/amber in color. Lightly sweet nose with a hint of grains and yeast. Rich and malty up front. Good mouthfeel. Some grassy hops in the finish. These cheap Russian lagers are a lot better than American macro swill.
0,5l Flasche. Gelbes Bier, dünner Schaum. Wenig Aroma und Geschmack. Herb metallisch.
Очень слабое на вкус пиво с запахом тухлой воды из под крана. После этого напитка стоит долгая вонь из-за рта.
(bottle 0,5l) Aroma: Grainy, light corny sweet. Appearance: Clear golden color. Quickly done, white head. Taste: Medium sweet, light grainy. Palate: Medium body. Overall: Average pale lager.

Clear golden with a foamy head. Aroma is malty with notes of grain and corn. Taste is sweetish and malty, but finishes with moderate bitterness. A drinkable bulk lager. (0,5l can from a random supermarket in Moscow)
Bottle bb28/6/17 golden clear medium head not aroma light sweet oro limpida discreta schiuma niente aromi un leggero dolciastro amaro contenuto
Bottle. Crystal clear golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of straw and white pepper. Taste pepper and light paper.
Minden medvevadász kedvenc nedűje, mely nem hiányozhat a medvebőr kulacsból vadászat közben.

Clear golden, dense tall head. Good retention. Nose of grains, hay, some yeast. Light to medium body. Thin to oily. Grainy malts on taste. Minimum caramel. Low to light bitterness. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Golden colored, medium white head. Aroma is of malt and corn. Taste medium sweet, malt, corn, butter, some grains and weak grassy hops with low bitterness. Medium- bodied, soft carbonation. Very industrial overall...

0.45l can from pyatnitsa in moscow. pours a clear pale golden with a dense head and a nice lacing. aroma of hay, cardboard, and citrus. flavour of mineral water, citrus, and some grains. slight metallic notes later on. drinkable, but extremely boring.

Pours clear straw colour with a white and lasting head. Malty aroma with some citrus. Taste is rather similar, mild maltiness and some dryish flavours at the finish. A simple but refreshing brew, not bad for a bulk lager. (0,5 l can at airport lounge at DME)
Легкое, питкое, освежающее пиво. Без особых претензий, конечно. Вкус и аромат соответственно выражены слабо.

BOTTLE 50 CL. Clear pale golden, white creamy head. Aroma of sugary malts, a touch fruity/esters, fusel. Taste: sweet sugar/malts, harshness, light harsh bitterness, no hops. Ordinary macro, not totally horrible.
Pale golden color, clear liquid and minimal head. Light malty aroma. Taste is very light... not much ingredients. refreshing beer
500ml can. Pours pale yellow with a soapy white head. Aroma is malt and citrus fruits. Taste is sweet and malty with some hops. Light bitter finish. Not bad.

50cl can 4.7%abv, 3олотaя Бочkа Свeтлoе: Light off-white deutschhh tall fluffy head. Pale pale straw golden body. Lacings may be present, fluffy. Aroma; straw, grass, dust, industry, and a leaf of an apple tree. Taste; watered bread, grains, faint grapefruit. Thin. Finishes mild bread’ish. Golden can, but not that medal to the beer. Session@Finn’sPlace. [4.7%abv(!) BB12.04.15. B@supermarket in baltics]
Boks 500ml spandert av djoeye. Delt med ham på Nerstranda 16 Aug 14. Lys gul med et svakt grønnskjær. Høyt luftig skum som varer. Svak aroma av gress. Smaken det samme. Veldig vassen.
Bottle. Clear straw color with a white head. Aroma of grains, a bit of corn, a bit of hay. Sweetish grainy flavor, slightly corny, with a mild bitterness, slightly metallic. Rather light-bodied.
Directly from can. 4.7% ABV. Quite ordinary macrobeer. Drinkable, since it is chilled, no major off elements, but no great joy either. Agreeable.
Golden, with medium white head. Aroma of candies and fruits. Palate is notably sweet, malty and fruity.
Very sugary, disgustingly sweet. Avoid......................................
So not as good as when Tom Nickle brewed it. Nutty and breasy nose with soft cocoa, wood and oxydation notes.

Toronado had this on tap for their 15th anniversary. Poured without any head but once I sipped this, bubbles exploded in my mouth. Coffee, cocoa and smoke flavors. Not sweet like most barley wines. Much more similar to a smokey porter.
This ale poured from the tap without any head. Very light appearance. Tastes like sour plums or sour grapefruits.
Very dry and slightly musty with a touch of earth and grape skin. Soft and thin on the palate. Lingering acidic finish.

Aroma: Fruity and a faintly floral Appearance: Gorgrous shining deep Amber pours with a small head which dissipated quickly Flavor: Sweet, a little like wine with a nice round malt flavor, seemed a little wanting for me. Palate: Medium bodied, slightly long in the finish with malty flavors Overall: I like this abbey style ale, but I am not too crazy about it...
subtle mustiness in the aorma..reddish amber in color..thin head..musty and grapey with wierd vinous white grape dryness and lingering cotton mouth.
Complex flavors are a mixture of sweet molasses or dark syrup on waffles. Chocolate and butterscotch along delicate fruit flavours like raisons and plums.

Very crisp amber and light copper coloured body with a nice, three to four centimetre tall off-white head that leaves a pretty lace on the side of the glass. Aroma of light nuts, metal and a relatively astringent scent with some alcohol and biscuity malt, but ending with some light caramelised sugars. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong grassy and malty flavours up front with some light nuts, caramel and earthier notes that show some herbal characteristics, a dose of biscuits, but ending with a spicey quality that shows some malts and drier flavours and a hint of caramel and toffee at the end. Aftertaste shows some grass and sweetness from pitted fruits like prunes and apricots with a caramelised sugar and toffee note at the end, but relatively balanced throughout. Overall, a nice and enjoyable beer with a good quality throughout, especially on the sweet side of things. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Hy-Vee in Omaha (Papillion), Nebraska on 07-October-2019 for US$1,99 sampled in my hotel room here in Omaha, Nebraska on 09-October-2019.

Deep, dark, clear amber topped with a tall, thick off-white head that leaves nice-looking strings and loops of lacing. The head has good retention, with a thick domed top. Bready malt aroma with sweet caramel. Very malty taste, freshly baked bread and sweet caramel. Excellent lingering taste throughout, great flavor depth, finishing just a bit on the sweet side. Malty with no bitterness. The aftertaste remains on the tongue for quite some time, as with the intitial taste, bready, thick, and slightly sweet caramel. Mouth feel is moderate to thick, like bread dough. Overall, an excellent, well-done Märzen for those that like the darker, maltier, earlier Oktoberfest style (and I do).

Millstream regularly puts out good German-style beer, and there's a lot to like about their Oktoberfest. This lager pours copper-colored. Malty sweet aromas. Nutty biscuit and caramel character. Smooth feel and a clean finish.
Has a lager type texture. Goes down smooth. Full bold strong taste. Similar to SA Okto but lighter, no Carmel. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Molasses/caramel malt and hay aroma. Dark amber with large light tan head. Moderately sweet nutty caramel malt and mildly bitter hay flavor. Good body. Okay but very sweet.
Bottle: Pours hazy amber with a small, off-white head. Caramel, light spice scent. Taste is slightly tangy caramel malt, toast, a bit of sweet spicing. OK.....grew a little too sweet towards the end.

Bottle. A- Malty, bland, weak, subtle spice, caramel. A- Copper color, clear liquid, white head. T- Crackers, black peppers, caramel, malty, P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, O- A very nice looking beer but a weak aroma and not real exciting taste. Some black pepper crackers in the taste but otherwise pretty standard.
Bottle courtesy of HuskerTan, thanks you! Clear bright amber color, scant off white edge head. Aroma of caramel and light biscuit. Taste is lightly toasted caramel. OK.
12 oz. bottle. Pours dark amber with thick off white head that lasts. Aroma was sweet and malty. Taste was roasty and nutty with a dry finish.
Pours a clear coppery color with off-white head. Caramel malts, biscuit, and bread on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with malt. Nicely done marzen.
FTA: extremely thin pale lager. Served in huge bottles. Flat, rancid and not to be considered beer.

Man kann grade noch so schmacken, das Hopfen verwendet wurde. Aber nicht viel, ähnelt der Geschmaak dem von Wasser doch sehr. Bochkarev Barreled: Bleib in Russland. Test vom 25.9.2004, Gebinde: Dose Noten: 8,6,7,4,6,7 - 6,45
This beer does have some properties of yeast and good carbonation, but the rest of taste falls flat with vegetal overtones. not really worth the time.

The aroma has some water, yeast, and cheap malt but thats about it. The appearance is milky pale gold with a two finger head. The flavor is watery with some malt and paper. The palate is very watery. Yet another Russian flop.

Bottle at Fort Wayne Tasting. White small head that mostly diminished, sparse lacing, minimal carbonation, transparent, and a pale yellow hue. Nose was malt, some corn and some breadiness. Flavor was some corn and metallic. Tingly mouthfeel. Light body. Not impressed with this brew. Nothing that will knock your socks off.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of frothy bubbles that were and left behind a semi-hazy softly carbonated yellow-white colored body and a poor lacing. The aroma was malty and mildly grassy. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The flavor contained notes of malt and mildly grassy. An OK brew just nothing special.
From a bottle shared at thedm’s. Straw colored with fizzy white head. Light bready nose. Some biscuit and citrus, but mostly just thin and like every other imported Eastern European lager.

bottle at the fort wayne tasting - Pours yellow with a thin medium sized head. It has a light malt and grain aroma. It tastes mildly sweet with corn adjuncts and has a thin, watery mouthfeel. Fizzy and weak... did we really need to import another bad pale lager?

Sweetish corn, malt and corn starch aroma. Dirty yellow with a fluffy off white head that is somewhat lasting. Honey, corn starch flavors with steeped grains and almost no hops. Not at all as bad as eating glass or getting caned in Singapore. It does have a very nice mouthfeel for a pale lager.
Bottle. Light amber beer with a big white head. Light grainy/malt aroma. Sweet grainy flavor with light fruitiness. Blah. Easy to drink. Could have been much worse.

Draught. Head is mostly lasting. Body is light amber. Aroma is lightly malty (cookie, caramel), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, husky. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Pretty dang light and bland for a dunkel. Grainy.

Draught at the brewery. Pours hazy bronze with a small off-white frothy head, lined lacing. Yeast (leather, sweat) and malt (husky, corn) aroma, not very appetizing or inviting, kind of lacking in the aroma department. Flavor is sweet corn, burnt butter and malt, sweaty yeast, tart and medium acidity, low sweetness. Light bodied and slightly fizzy with a dry finish.

Had this at the brewery. Beer was a hazy, light brown color with a small, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing head that left behind neat-looking points of lacing. I think the color was a bit timid for a Dunkel, and the aroma was pretty shy, too. All I could detect was a trace malty aroma of toasted grain and a trace ester of honey. The flavor was moderately sweet with an average-length, moderatly bitter, lightly sour finish. The body was light-to-medium, the texture was watery and the carbonation was lively. Not bad, but not really that engaging, either. Didn’t seem to fit the Dunkel description that well.

Amber. Light malty, grainy aroma. Taste is dark, grainy malts. Balanced spiciness, ginger and maybe licorice root. Evident German malts, slight bitter hopping. Well made, but too fizzy and light bodied as many Coops beers are.

Brown. Delicate, lively and lovely aroma with hints of sticky fruits, clove, coffee and toffee. Caramel and toasted maltiness with a nice coffee flavor. Dark, roasted flavor. Very fruity for a lager. Lovely for the style and probably my favorite Coop’s beer to date, besides that monstrous barley wine.
One of my favorites at Coopersmith's. Dark and roasty, great on a cold Colorado night.
Clean and very easy to drink. Had a curious, clear-copper color. Excellent roast flavors. Hints of burnt toast. Light in body, yet not compromising in flavor. A good rep of the style, IMO.

Draught. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (grapefruit). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic. Finish is moderately bitter, lightly acidic, lightly sweet. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Not much going on in the aroma department, but the flavor balance is good.

Bready, biscuit-like malt flavors. High carbonation with a VERY dry finish. Didn't seem to exhibit classical rye flavors... or, it didn't have a good hop presence to complement the rye additives. Most rye beers I've had have a curious and tasty fruity-malt flavor, which this beer didn't have. Actually, this beer didn't have a whole lot of flavor at all. It was just light, clean, and dry.
Barva: světlejší zlatá, pěna řídká, nedržící. Vůně: nevýrazná chmelová. Chuť: vodnaté pivo ve kterém se bije sladká chuť s ostrým nepříjmným chmelovým řízem.

Hazy amber with a small, off-white head that faded to scum and a good deal of carbonation. Aromas were musty caramel malt, sour grass, Bit O’Honey and Lemon Pledge (is this "Polish" or "polish"?) Flavor was honey-sweet with fusels and light bitterness to end. Metallic finish-flavor/feel with a somewhat syrupy consistency. All-in-all, barely better than average. Bridgeview Liquors, Bridgeview, IL

Awfully full of corn syrup to be much of a pilsener. Gold and headless, its aroma is a mix of caramel sweetness and lighter fluid. It’s sweet and grassy with a light herbal hop finish. And it’s not worth repeating. Bridgeview Liquors, Bridgeview, IL

Big off-white head atop lightly hazed amber body. Aroma is mild sweet, somewhat astringent, grassy/herbal, light bread, light caramel. Taste is sweet, caramel, light alcohol, light herbal. Watery medium-full body, somewhat sticky.

Dry musky malt aroma that I didn't particularly enjoy. That said, almost everything else about the beer surpassed my expectations. Whiskey-colored beer. Bocky, malty bare-knuckled lager with a whole grain character and a smidge of honey. Tangy finish. Very good, except for the smell.

Pleasantly surprised - expected a dusty, boring lager from Poland. This ranks up there with Pilsener Urquell in my subtle opinion. Nice white heavy duty head with a bit of lacing. Honey-like aroma is rather pleasant. The appearance is light orange and rather refreshing looking. Flavor has some honey sweetness to it and has a good thick mouthfeel. Overall, an excellent Pils.
Not a bad Pilsner, but doesn't have the distinctive taste I like. Very light aroma; washed-out golden color.
Sweet scented, nicely topped clear golden beer. Exceptionally smooth, lightly flavored with hint of a citrus aftertaste. Excellent choice for a hot summer day.

Clear gold in color, the head is adequate, white and nice lace to coat the glass. Nose is malt, fresh and clean. Front is malt, and sweet, the top light, the finish is quite dry, acidic, lightly hopped. A "Pilsener", what do I expect?"Does not make my current 1000 beer master list."
Citrusy and refreshing. Cloudy hefeweizen like look, a little darker than a wit. Slight herb but very light. Not a Hoe.

Caña en el Scotland Yard la Virgen del Camino León 13..11..2017. (r42). Color amarillento turbio con espuma blanca persistente. Sabores frescos con herbáceos y suaves cítricos. Cuerpo ligero fácil de beber algo denso y espumoso. Suave amargo final. Sin mucho que decir. Normal.
Overall good IPA thanks to GT2. Santa Monica. Good hoppy ipa bitter robust nice finish.
pours a pretty orange. nice bit of carbonation. easy to drink. hop presence isn’t huge but you get a nice push of bitterness. aroma is muted for an IPA.

On tap, Lucky Baldwin’s. This will be an uncharacteristically short review for me. To be honest, it is befitting of this brew. This IPA pours a standard gold orange, with a clear body and small white head. The aroma and flavor were both hoppy, though not particularly assertive or inviting to me. The malt character was subdued, and contributed little. Finish was bitter and clean. OK, but nothing exciting.
On tap. Decent IPA, about average. Pours a pale color with a hoppy scent with a thin head.

Re-rating the cask version at The York. Saved my perception of this beer. What I took was that this is maltier than most - caramel malt at that. I don’t think it gets to diacetyl, just caramel. Thick texture. The hops are peppery and remind me very much of Hallertau. Really a treat.
On tap at Lucky Baldwin’s. Hoppy up front flavor with a clean, dry finish. Not a hop bomb, but not trying to be.

Draft at Lucky Baldwins. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel, flowers, and grass. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of grass as well as citrusy notes of lime, leading to a very bitter and dry finish.

From tap at Lucky Baldwin, Pasadena. Pours clear and golden orange with a lacing white head. Camomille like hops aroma. Flavour is dry and hoppy with a distinct fruity hops presence. Ends dry and bitter, yet with a lasting fruity aroma hops note.

Draft - This IPA was more reliant on the malt than the hops. Quite hoppy, but really overwhelmed by the extreme malt flavor. This beer was good, but very heavy. I prefer the Two hearted style IPA’s a bit more.

Draft. Aroma of faint smoke. Flavors are of chewy, roasty weak coffee and cocoa. Finishes dry. The smoke is tentative, too tentative (hence the low score here), and mostly exists as that chewy mouthfeel. Abundantly drinkable.
on tap lieve note torrefatta liquirizia affumicato leggero non molto lupollata ma non dolce

Draft at The Hop Grenade. Slight tan head over a light black pour. Nose is light smoke and malt. Taste is pretty nice as well. Very light, refreshing, just enough malt and a hint of smoke. Pretty good.
Tap at Churchills S.D. Dark murky brown color. Aroma of damp mop. Taste is slightly sweet, like a charred lager with added sugar.

A nice smoked lager. Pours a nice black with a tan head. Smells creamy with a bit of vanilla. Taste is creamy upfront, with a smoky finish. Had on tap at Library Alehouse. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good smoked lager, on tap at library ale house in santa monica, dark but easy to drink, bacon!
Draft. Brown beer with a tan head. Light smoke and light caramel aroma. Light caramel and light smopke flavor with light fruitiness. Medium bodied. Light caramel and light smoke lingers.

Sampled on 8/17/11 at Beer Revolution. This smoked beer pours a dark black color from the tap. Medium to small sized white foamy head, with good retention and nice lacing. The aroma is malt, smoke, fruit and coffee. A medium bodied smoked beer. The malts are fruity, caramel, chocolate and coffee. The hops are earthy and herbal. Nice balance. Decent carbonation. Nice mild smoky flavor throughout. More smoke in the aroma than in the taste. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.
Draft at Beer Revolution, bartender recommended... quaffable light smoked beer, lots of chocolate but has an overall very malty character that gets in the way a bit, worth trying

Full pint sample. Pours with a near black body with a foam tan head that lasts. Aromas are light smokey, alder wood, light leather, bacon. Overall: malty and bready. Really minimal hops. Flavors are bread, grainy, chocolate, light roast, toasty, grainy, clean, with light smoke. Medium to lively bubbles. Dry.

12oz bottle. Hazy golden yellow, small stable adhesive head. Slight grainy aroma. Bitter for a pale lager, not very "fresh" though. Not much finesse or creativity, but the bottom line is that it just doesn’t taste very good.
On tap at DE. Pale yellow. Light yeast, spent grain, cereal, bread, light butter aroma. Flavor is light and crisp, some butter notes, grainy...meh.

Poured up on tap at Dave’s Electric brewpub with deep clear gold and a white head. The aroma is sweet with a mix of biscuit malts, some lagery yeast, a touch of grainy malts and a sense of sweet raspberry. Hmmm. The taste has spicy hops mixing with a raspberry like esteriness and faint earthy hops. It stays on the hop spicy side into the finish.

on tap at the tempe pub 12/21/2009. golden yellow colored body with a soft clingy white head. the nose is a bit reminiscent of corn tortillas... mixed with cereal grain, yeast and some vanilla. the flavor doesn’t give me a whole bunch to work with... but there is nothing bad or wrong with it... it is a lot like the aroma along with a peppery spice kick. terribly easy to quaff...5/3/5/3/14/3.1

Enjoyed on tap at new Tempe brewpub location. Pours very pale golden color with medium sized white head. Nose is somewhat faint with a cereal/malt grainy nose. On the palate it is light in flavor, and could easily pass for a macro lager. A little thin and watery as well, but very easy to drink.
Bottle courtesy of rustychiles. Pours gold with a rocky white head. Smells of corn, citrus, dry malt, apples. Tastes peppery and spicy with some grassiness and a sweet finish.
Is there corn in here? Crazy corn aroma here. Slight haze to the pale gold. One sip, unsure. Sharp, funky, drainpour.

Thanks to cbkschubert for this one - pours a fizzy, semi-cloudy pale gold - frothy head - very muted aroma, with some faint grassy hops and weak malts - starts off a little fruity, with some apricot and peach notes - gets moderately bitter through the middle, with a floral/rosewater character, which is odd for the style, but welcome - some strange, almost phenolic character near the finish (gets almost rubbery) - this makes it less enjoyable - in fact, it makes it hard to drink after the first few sips - finish is of corn and grain - actually kind of lame - we need a picture of the label on the site, though; it’s so cheesy that it’s awesome.

At Oregon Brewers Festival 2008 Pours out a ligth yellow topped with a tall white head. Aroma of malts and corn. Not something I would drink all the time. Like the description said maybe on a "Hot Arizona Summer" day
On tap at the OBF 2008--Poured a pale golden body with a sharp, sweet creamy nose. Adjuncts? Sure seemed like it. Highly sessionable. Not very memorable.

Really looking forward to this one as I love the style; Can(s) to glass. Aroma - coriander + coriander; unfortunately aroma and taste of coriander overpowered faint notes of citrus and spice. Honestly wasn't that much flavor for the style - disappointed. drinkable though.

Bottle. A- Coriander, mild orange, wheat. A- Gold color, clear liquid, white head. T- Coriander, orange, mild white pepper. P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, balanced finish. O- So very similar to Hoegaarden that it brings back memories of how that beer first got me into craft. Well balanced and even as heartbreaking as it was to know this bottle was 18 months so it still drank pleasantly. Really lovely stuff.
tomada " on tap" en Cimmeria.Muy citrica. Limonada. Frutal.Refrescante.Quiza para epoca de calor.Espuma blanca.Color rubio pajizo

From old tasting notes. Brewed in Austin, Texas. Cloudy pale yellow color. Thin misty white head. Acidic grapefruit nose.Tangy lactic character. Interesting spicy citrus malt flavor. Refreshing and tasty.
Yet another rating that has disappeared. This is incorrect for the MJ book to as the one in the book was brewed in Texas.

330ml bottle from Roeland. Pours a hazy golden colour with tightly packed white head and some lacing. Aromas of citrus and white pepper and some light fruitiness (pears mostly). Palate has medium high carbonation and light body. Flavours of citrus, wheat, pears. Very low bitterness and a fruity dry finish.
En belgisk white. Lavet af ham der bryggede Hoegaarden. Er knapt så belgisk .

It pours pale gold with slight lacing and a white head. It has aromas of fruit, lemon, wheat, and hints of pear. It have fruit flavors lead by lemon, orange, hints of pear, wheat, hints of coriander and spice. It is light bodied with high carbonation. Overall this is a fairly easy drinking fruity beer with spice and wheat compliments.

Light sweet wheat aroma with some spices. Looks great but could have more head. Slightly watery, but the essentials are there. Citrus, light spiciness, vanilla, wheat malts. Tastes nice just a bit too mild for me. I really like a flavorful wit beer and this one is just too weak (in flavor). Similar to Hoegaarden, just less pronounced. Nevertheless a nice one.

0.355l bottle. Hazy golden body, thin white head. Aroma of biscuit, honey, orange zest, peach and spices. Taste of bread, honey, coriander and some hops. Less fruity and more bready than the Hoegaarden, but still fine.

Draft at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours fairly hazy, dark gold, with a nice average head of white foam, fluffy and persistent, fine grained. Aroma is rose, honey, citrus. Body and carbonation are average. Taste is moderately sweet, with a hunt of peppery feeling. Finish is fairly short.

25/VIII/18 - sample @ BXL Beer Festival - BB: n/a (2018-1094) Thanks to the Belgian and Dutch Ratebeer crews for sharing today's beers! Clear orange beer, practically no head. Aroma: very yeasty, floral indeed, some banana, fruity, bit malty, some caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium to light body. Taste: floral, watery, soft bitterness, fruity touch, malty, decent enough but not really good. Aftertaste: watery, malty, floral notes, not a big fan.
Rami Rami is drinking a Fleurette by Birrificio Italiano at BXLBeerFest Strasznie dziwna, ziolowoprzyprawowa paleta narzucona na jakies chmiele i zboze

5 3 5 3 10 Draft at BXL Beerfest ‘18, Brussels.  Near clear golden orange with no head.  Aroma of malt, cardboard and light hops.  Flavour is light sweet and light to moderate bitter.  Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Thanks to the RB crew for sharing! Sampled draft @ BXLBeerFest 2018! Paler orange, near clear. No head. Oily sweet candy-esque sweet passionfruit,.. Too dull plastic sweet candy grape sugar, flat warm plastic,… Bit watery, lacking carbonation. Not the best for sure.

Tap at BXL festival. Slight hazy orange pink with small head. Flowery indeed, light berries, fruity hops, quite some CO2, roses too, not much elderflowers but it is really flowery. Very light sweet, almost medium bitter and light tart. Over light bodied with watery feel.
At BXL festival. Hazy orangey golden with white head. Sweet malts, floral, flower petals, light parfumey. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. A subtle beer. Quite alright.
Draft - Almost strawberry and yeasty note. Cloudy copper with a decent white head. A touch sweet and fruity, again with the strawberries and a touch of pepper.

Tap at BrewDog Tallinn, a while ago, didn't take notes. I liked it despite it being a bit too sweet and flowery for my liking and the light body. Otherwise a pretty nice refreshing brew. Can't recall it being notably spicy/peppery though. Wouldn't mind having it again.

Tap (Brewdog, Tallinn) (4:3:4:2:7=2.0) Slightly farty grainy aroma, some hint of sourness and flowers maybe once or twice, but served so cold there really is nothing worth mentioning there. Watery palate, crisp carbonation in combination with some minerally aspects makes it quite soda watery. Yeah, lime-scaley water taste, some yeasty home brew, some weak apple pie hint. Sweetish, finish leaves me with a hint of rose syrup, and a bit of minerally water. Weak sauce, dirty water with a few rose petals floating on it. The few aspects it has are generally flawed.

column1: Officina della Birra Occhio di Falco
column5: ambrato molto carico quasi scura buona schiuma persistente naso liuirizia cffe cosi anche in bocca note tostate leggero acidulo

column1: Officina della Birra Occhio di Falco
column5: A dark brown beer with a small brown head. The aroma is sweet malty with distinct roaty notes. The flavor is also sweet malty, but with primarily notes of roasted bread.

column1: Officina della Birra Occhio di Falco
column5: Dark chestnut brown. Rich malty nose with toffee, chocolate. Rich sweet toffee malt. Hint of chocolate. Smooth body.

column1: Officina della Birra Occhio di Falco
column5: Bottled. Very dark brown, small head. Aroma of wood and molasses. Fairly sweet with some chocoalte. Firm maltiness. Some coffee in the finish.

column1: Officina della Birra Occhio di Falco
column5: very dark colour with a fine black tainted head, beautiful lacing, roasted coffeish aroma, slightly nutty, sweet, full-bodied, very creamy with a decent finishing bitterness and a long dry bitter moccha aftertaste - a well-balanced and well-made brew; nice work !

column1: Officina della Birra Occhio di Falco
column5: Black colour, thin collar of creamy foam. Light but very nice roasted malt aroma. Good malty body, strong roasted malt character, ending in a long and bitter final. Beers of Switzerland

ambrata schiuma non abbondante media persitenza noso maltato caramello un leggero fruttati frutta secca 5.2-% on tap ambrato carico schiuma media discreta pesistenza naso maltato lieve torrefatto toffee riscaldante etilico amaro medio 2.9
reddish colour, fine head, dark fruit aroma, medium-bodied, dry malty finish - the flavour does not carry the promising aroma
Amber colour, thick collar of foam. Nice aroma of malt and unmalted grains (bran). Pretty good malt taste, some sweetness, well balanced. Sweet-bitter palate, aromatic. Beers of Switzerland

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottle enjoyed during a holiday in Australia. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. Tasting notes not kept, just rating.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Can purchased in Ireland. Pours clear orange body. Aroma is light malt. Flavor is nothing. Bland, boring, no alcohol?? LAME brew.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Nothing much going on here. Pours a pale gold, clear, with a Houdini-head. Little aroma bar some ’tinny’ dank liquor and a little malt. Similar in the mouth, watery thin, gassy and marred by cardboard malt tones. I don’t think Lion Nathan care much for the level of intelligence the beer drinking public in Australia possess, because this was awful. Bland and forgettable.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Far, far better than XXXX Gold, this beer wa sa definite surprise to me. It was reasonably drinkable.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Why call a beer like this a Sovereign Superior Lager when it is a mid-strength piece of piss? No more to say.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Still not sure what the point of mid-strength beer is. This is the 1st premium mid-strength I have had, and definitely the best.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: definetly better than xxxx gold as far as mid-strenght beer goes, but that's not saying much at all, rubbish aussie lager.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: This beer has a gold yellow body - hue with a bitter initial flavor and a light body.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Mild hoppy aroma, nce gold colour with big head. Clean hoppy flavour with mild bitter tatse. Not bad for mid strength beer.

column4: Castlemaine Perkins Brewery (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: maybe it's the queensland heat getting to me but i enjoyed this a lot more than i expected. quite luscious vanilla mango malt. zero hops but that still beats pride of ringwood. full-bodied for a midstrength

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Bottle, 325 ml, courtesy of JFK10000. Shared with him and Miro B. Brown with beige head. Sweet. Caramel, dried fruit, figs, bit yeasty. Bitter finish. Medium bodied.

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Schiuma beige chiaro fine presente. Colore mogano, abbastanza limpida. L’intensità olfattiva è buona. Aromi: nocciola, frutta sotto spirito, caramello. L’intensità gustativa è buona. Corpo pieno.

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: My whole family is crazy about this beer, I never understood it. It is certainly a nice beer, but I have had better drinks.

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: 2 ans et 4 mois après embouteillage. Brune rougeâtre sans mousse et petite carbo. Arôme vineux, boisé, raisins secs, alcool complexe. En bouche, caramélisée et des du raisons secs, dattes et fruits vieillis alcoolisés. Une bonne bière !

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Bottle purchased at Beertopia. Poured dark hazy brown, off white head. Aroma of fruit, caramel, raisin, sweet brown sugar, malty. Taste was mild sweet, caramel, fig, dates, wine, dark fruits.

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Bottle shared at a tasting at zvsn place. Hazy reddish-copper with white head, some particles. Sweatish aroma with notes of dried fruits, caramel, white bread and nuts. The flavor is sweet and mild sour with notes of alcohol, bread, caramel, yeasts, dried fruits, dulce de leche, oxidised. Full-bodied.

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Aroma: fresh malt, hints of pineapple, noticeable alcohol Appearance: dark brown hazy, lasting tan head with patchy lacing Flavour: super sweet malt with hints of choc & carbon, balanced bitterness Palate: thick, gently carbonated, finishes carbon & bitter

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Bottle. Thanks rayaron. Hazy amber. Aroma of honey, caramel, yeast, prunes umami. Sweet, malty, dried fruits, chocolate, soy sauce, honey, alcohol. Medium-bodied, smooth.

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Bottled on 12/09/2016 today's date 2/04/2019 says potential aging color looks brownish reddish kinda looking at tamarindo thick creamy head lots of floaters in the glass smell of dried fruits spices metallic taste bitter aftertaste fruits yeast alcohol wine

column1: Dieu du Ciel! Rigor Mortis Abt
column5: Bottle. Iced tea brown, almost no head. Light malty aroma, biscuits, yeast. Really pleasant cookies, malts, dried apricot, fig, dates, sweet bread flavors. No frills on this one, really good.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Backlog, bottle that pours a hazy straw golden with a medium sized creamy white head. Nose and flavor of ashy rye, lemons, bitter grass, and a touch of malt but the sweetness is minimal. Light to medium bodied with Dry and bitter finish

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Very tasty beer. The rye character does balance the hops nicely. Very enjoyable.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: I rounded the flavor rating up to 8 on this one, but in all reality, I found it to be about a 7.5. I also rounded overall down to 7, in order to give a final rating of 3.7, but overall is probably more like a 7.5. I just found 3.8 too high but 3.6 too low for this one and didn't feel like adjusting the other categories. I see a lot of reviews giving this brew no love, but I don't think a rating from 2.0-3 is giving this beer justice, because I thought it was better than that. Nothing great, but I would say has to be above average?? Typical pale ale appearance of a light goldish to light orange color. Tastes of various malts, sweetness from the rye, a little citrus, and mild hops. I didn't find the rye to be overwhelming at all. Although I probably won't be buying this again with so many other and better beers out there, it was worth the try.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Found out of can. The aroma was unique and spot on but the taste left me disappointed with an odd but unpleasant aftertaste.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Can from systembolaget Orange white head Aroma of almond rye, Taste bitter rye. Tart fell. Old taste.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Can, thanks vjohans. Pours amber, no head. Aroma of rye and tangerine. Drinkable and not too chewy rye brew. Hoppy with some rye sweetness.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Bottle @ Brewhouse Cafe, Atlanta. Dark golden with a thin head. Crisp and hoppy over any stated rye, but there is a hint of gritty malts in this respect. All still very drinkable.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Burk systembolaget. Mörkorange kulöt. Doft av kåda, tallbarr och citrus. Maltig smak med bitter humlekaraktär. Lite knäck och druva

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: 355ml Dose. Dunkelgolden und trüb mit mittelgroßer Schaumkrone. Fruchtig. Blumig. Malzig. Süßlicher Geschmack, milder Abgang.

column4: Terrapin Beer Company (Tenth and Blake - Molson Coors)
column5: Bottle. Golden in colour. Malty; toasty malts, rye, caramel. Hoppy; grassy hops. Spicy. Fruity; citrus grapefruit, hint of lemon. Nice malt/hops/fruit balance. Sweet grainy spicy malts and mildly bitter fruity hops. (2009-10)

>wąchasz >mokre zboże modzno >lekki spirytus lub zależały płyn do spryskiwaczy czy inny rozpuszczalnik >pijesz >puste >wodniste >w smaku jedno wielkie lekko słodkie zero >jakby całą noc moczyć biszkopty w wodzie, dolać trochę spirytusu i voilà >wybitny paździerz
Słodkie, wodniste, alkoholowe, puste. Dodatkowo, a jak, rozpuszczalnik. Paskudne.
500ml can (?, Poland) Sweet rich malty aroma, a bit soyey and sweet. Crazy sweet malty body. Remarkably clean. Big, but not that hot. Sweet and estery in the mouth. Very full. Pretty decent mocne.

500ml can (random petrol station, Poland). Pale yellow color. Sweet, malty, acetone, caramel and strawberries in aroma. Caramel, malty, alcoholic, sweet and some extracts in taste. Alcoholic and sweet in aftertaste. Harsh to drink.

Piwo kupione tylko i wyłącznie dlatego, że znalazło się w zestawieniu 1001 piw których warto sprobować... I cały czas myślałem, że będzie dramat wielki... Ale ostatecznie nie było aż tak źle. Rarytas to to nie jest, ale zdecydowanie dało się wypić ;) Piwo warzone w Jędrzejowie, bierze swoją nazwę od gwiazdozbioru Strzelec. Wybór padł właśnie na ten gwiazdozbiór, gdyż w herbie Jędrzejowa widnieje biała strzała na czerwonym tle. Logo piwa ma również do tego nawiązywać :) Nie wiem, jak niegdyś wyglądało i smakowało to piwo, ale teraz Strzelec ma ciemnozłoty kolor i bardzo przyzwoitą, białą, wysoką pianę. Aromat zdecydowanie słodowy, nieco alkoholu w tle. W smaku słodowo. Lekka goryczka i trochę jonów żelaza. Wysycenie dość spore. Moc piwa nie daje jakoś szczególnie o sobie znać, więc ogólnie Strzelec Mocne wypada całkiem korzystnie...
Deep Starts with alcohol but malt, grain and honey comes through. Bitter watery finish.
A little darker compared to the Jasne Pelne. Very sparkling. White head, very lacy. Sweet taste with a very metallic aftertaste.
Moderate malty aroma. Average, frothy, white head. Good lacing. Clear yellow body. Moderate bitter flavor. Light to medium palate.
Yellow coloured and clear. Has a whtie head, mostly diminishing. Aroma is lightly malty amd moderate bitter. Flavor is lightly sweet and bitter finish. Dry texture.
Can. Creamy white good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Light bitter very alcoholiv flavor. Short light bitter finish. Watery palate.
On tap at Michelstadter Rathausbrau. Served amber, with a slight haze, and a good head. Has a malty sweetness, with fruit and lemon hints. Has a good spicy bitter finish
Malziger, etwas herber Antrunk. Mild würzig bitter, zum Ende hin monoton. Süffig, nett. 11/10/9/9//10

Draught @ Michelstädter Rathausbräu, Mauerstrasse 1-3, Michelstadt, Hesse, Germany 64720. Light unclear medium orange amber colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, dusty, light nutty, light dark toffee. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, nutty, caramel, sugary malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121001]

Enjoyed in a growler picked up at the brewery and which I shipped back to myself. Enjoyed in a Portsmouth brewery snifter at fridge temp. brown appearance with hints of ruby red. Nose is pretty weak. Bacarian hops, mild malt back bone, wheat and citrus. Taste is very light with lots of floral. Tastes like Juicy Juice that’s carbonated. Fruity, hint of bitterness. Weird as this style is not juicy or bitter. Light body.
Draught at the bräuhaus Hazy red-amber color. Light caramel aroma. Soft mouthfeel, light caramel flavor; the body is lean; low bitterness. A weak beer.
Copper coloured and slightly hazy with rich head. Softly malty with toffee sweetnes and creamy mouthfeel. Medium bitterness.

On tap in Michelstadter Rathausbrau. Served pale and very cloudy, with a good head. Has a yeasty aroma. Tastes of bananas and pear drops, with a hint of lemon. Has a surprisingly spicy bitter finish, and is almost bitter enough to be a hopfenweizen
Bananig hefiger und etwas süßer Antrunk. Steigende, nun etwas herbe Hefearomen, süffig, geringe Bitterkeit. Gelungen. 12/11/11/11//11

Draught @ Michelstädter Rathausbräu, Mauerstrasse 1-3, Michelstadt, Hesse, Germany 64720. Hazy - murky medium orange colour with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate to heavy yeasty, fruity, banana, clove, yeast. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, clove, yeasty, fruity. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20121001]
A slightly hazy amber coloured beer with a decent thickish whitish head. The taste is on the thin side. Pleasant enough but uninspiring.

Draught at the bräuhaus Muddy orange-blond color; creamy head. Light what aroma, a bit stronger wheat flavor; it’s also lightly spicy, and there is a shade of banana only at the very end; quite dry. Correct bitterness. Ordinary.
Ambber coloured, cloudy and lively. Big funky bubblegum and toffee aroma. Sweet with smooth mouthfeel and a spicy, herbal finish,

got this at the abbey cafe with two other beers and cheese. Of the three this was my favorite, it is lower abv than their bigger dubble common beer. this one is light yet hoppy with spicey notes, citrus and sweet. paired with the cheese this was great!

Clear, golden-amber colored, medium white frothy head, rather lasting. Aroma is pale malt, bit biscuit, plenty of spicy, herbal hops with some citrus notes. Taste is medium- sweet malt, light biscuit, moderate hoppy spicy, herbal and citrus notes, medium+ bitterness, bit yeasty, dry finish. Light+ bodied, average carbonation, watery. Belgian Session IPA comes to mind... No Brett whatsoever.
Tasted at the cafe next to the Orval monastery. A little yeasty for me, but lovely anyway.I preferred the orval jeune at 6.2

Tap at À L’Ange Gardien. Slightly unclear amber with white head. Nose is hoppy. Grainy malts, hay, floral notes of hopbells, grassiness, soft fruitiness and dry yoghurt yeastiness. Soft sweet and grainy, medium to quite strong earthy herbal bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. Regular Orval is much better but this is also a very nice beer to drink fresh, very tasteful, refreshing and a nice rural herbal grassy vibe to it. Wish I could take a bottle home to drink during an outdoor picknick.

On tap at the only place it can be, L'ange guardian in Orval. Aroma is so so nondescript. Appearance is murky gold with Orval carbonation. Taste is somewhere between an Orval and a seasoned English golden. It's decent but nothing mind blow8ng. Hope the monks enjoy it in this amazing Abbey.
ofwel groene Orval genoemd, slechts 4,5° alc , ook wel het bier van de paters genoemd. Hier wordt geen hergisting gebruikt en op die manier blijft het alcohol gehalte wat steken.

Van 't vat in A L'Ange Gardien te Florenville. U: Troebel koperkleurig met een witte schuimkraag. G: Pompelmoes, citrus, groene hop, licht kruidig en grassig. S: Moutzoete aanzet met een lichte hopbitterheid. Citrus, groene hop en een lichte kruidigheid. M: Doordrinker met medium carbonatie.

Draft at A l'Ange Gardien. Color: Clear amber, nice thick long lasting white head. Taste: Fruity with a good amount of hopbitterness, notes of lemon and the orval bretty yeast. Medium body, average carbonation. Dry fruity and hoppy palate at finish. Nice one.

Comme son nom l'indique, un petit orval, la robe est moins dense mais ambrée. Le nez allie notes épicées, maltées, finement houblonnée. La bouche est souple et digeste tout en gardant cette fine acidité et l'amertume caractéristiques de l'Orval. Une bière de plaisir, très digeste.

Pours cloudy golden amber with low white head. Aroma of mild pine, herbs, light spices. Taste is peppery, mild citrus, slightly funky, spicy and herbal finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

(Bottle 25 cl) Hazy amber colour with floating impurities and no head whatsoever. Light aroma of malt. Weak notes of caramel in a rather light body. Very limited bitterness. A somewhat rustic character. Organic. 280905
The only good thing about this is that it is eco-friendly...................
Not very interesting. Actually below average................................
A typical mass-produced boring lager. ......................................
Fantastic brown beer. Drinks really fluent,combines fantasticly with meat dishes. Typical belgian style beer

Dark ruby red and brown with a creamy, lasting toffee-coloured head. Intense sour aroma with some caramel and fruit. Flavours are refreshingly sweet and sour with notes of apples and caramel. Medium to light-bodied. Refreshing and complex.

(Bottle 25 cl) Hazy brown with a nice head that leaves a pretty lacework. Some roasted malt and some brown dugar with only a hint of tartness. Bitter, hoppy finish. Softer, milder and less sharp than your typical Flemish sour - a bit like sweet, Danish Christmas table beer ("julehvidtøl"). 290899

Light amber color with a white airy head. Nice aroma of caramel and sweet malts with a little fruity tone. Good round taste with a sweet malty touch and a light sour fruity freshness. In the end there is a fine bitterness that fits well in the beer.

The aroma is slightly sweet malty with notes of caramel. The color is amber and it has a very small light brown head. The flavor is sweet malty with fruity notes and a good bitterness. A little thin - but it is a 5% ABV Flemish Sour ale - which could explain that.

(Actual bottle I'm having is called 'Adriaen Brouwer'. But everything points at labelbeer of Oudenaards) Deep brown with reddish shine. Good yellow-brown head, irregular. Nose with chaff, moccha, (wet) brown bread. Nutty taste, brown bread/malt; sweet - nearly German in character. No acids detectable. Tastes more as a Münich than as a Flemish Oud bruin. Bit thin, mouthfeel as if suspension of sweet flour in watery liquid. Not only untrue to style, it's not very exciting neither. Unremarkable.
Rusty and caramel aroma. Brown color, off-white head, nice lace. Bit sweet (caramel), hint of sourness, nice bitterness. Not very special.
Bottled, Pasteurised. Reddy brown beer with thin head. Thinnish malty flavour a little sour fruity flavour, green apple perhaps. No real balance in the finish, fairly moderate.
A nice red ale. It is not very sour, but more like a more complex version of Rodenbach Classic. It's interesting and still refreshing and easy to drink.
Bitter and sour. A little more hoppy than whats normal for a Flanders red ale. Not as sour as Rodenbach.
The foam stability is ok, the body light. The Aroma is malty, flowery, hoppy, foresty. The taste is maltaromatic, light alcoholic, hoppy, light bitter floral. Ok.
Bottle from York Beer & Wine. Pale straw coloured with a sweet toffee and warming caramel flavour, malty and grassy notes with almost sugary sweet fruit on the finish.
Many thanks for this beer to Beerhunter111.P ours a clear golden color. Aroma is floral and bright. Taste has sweet sticky caramel.

Das Bier hat eine klare goldgelbe Farbe und eine mittgroße weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch getreidig malzig, leicht hopfig, zitronig, trocken. Geschmack süß malzig, Getreidig, leicht hopfig, grasig, minimal alkoholisch.

Bottle from Kris wines and drunk at home. Clear pale gold lasting thick white head. Some pale lager malt on the aroma and some peach. Tasty enough heller bock. Not too hot or boozy, just the right level of sweetness. Nicely drinkable, good noble hop spicy bitterness on the finish. Like the regular helles very drinkable.
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours clear pale golden yellow, massive Teutonic white head. Aromas if cooked corn, floral hops. Taste brings a grassy note, sweet finish. Not bad.
Ein einfacher, recht simpler Bock mit ein wenig Vanille und Zucker im Aroma. Trinkbar, suess, einfach gestrickt und ohne, dass man den hohen Alkoholgehalt merken wuerde. Naja, ordentlich eben.

Deep clear golden colour with low steady head and smooth body. Nose of ripe hops. Taste of mild ripe hops, barley, torf, grass, straw and roses. Easy to drink with floral hints, but just nothing that special and nice. Average, solid Bock.

50cl Bottle, thanks bierkoning! Clear golden colour, thick white head. Aroma of sweet malts, honey, light grassy hops, light fruity, some alcohol, later turning to the smell of glue. Flavour is sweet, malty, honey, floral, light grassy bitter finish, light fruity. Medium-bodied, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not really exciting, but well made and nice.
Bottle. Color light yellow with medium white head. Aroma malt, grain, sweet. Taste sweet, honey, malt, grain.

Bottle. Clear deep brown color with amber highlight. Aroma is black breadcrust, light prunes, chocolate, molasses, Andechs style. Taste is black bread, chocolate, light prunes, burnt brown sugar, very full-bodied. Oily mouthfeel with natural carbonation. Great Dark Bock!
0,5 l Flasche aus einem kleinen Laden in Mittenwald. Dunkle, rötliche Farbe, kleine Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Getreide, leichte Röstaromen. Im Antrunk süßlich, im Abgang Kaffee, Karamell
a malty bock beer. dark with light head. not very sweet with some bitterness. a lot of roasted flavors.
Klare orangebraune Farbe, fingerbreite beige Schaumkrone. Geruch dezent röstmalzig, scharf getreidig, Karamell. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, viel Karamell, gering getreidig.

Many thanks to Beerhunter111 for this bottle! Fresh smooth beginning. Malty with not too much sweetness. Hints of bitterness in the aftertaste. Not too deep or too characteristic. Nice malty mainstream-bock. Round, drinkable, ok.
Ein Bock wiede jeder andere wohl auch. Etwas Vanille mit einer guten Portion Alkohol und etwas Karamell. Leicht sueffig mit einigen guten Momenten.

Pours out of the bottle in a deep dark amber-brown colour with low unsteady head and medium body. Aroma of caramel and flowers. Taste of mild hops, light malt, barley, roses, herbs and caramel. Light sweet finish. Easy to drink yet a little bit boring and average. Okay
Clear dark amber color with white head. Malt caramel arma. Light sweet and smooth with some old fruit flavour

500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours a ruby brown colour with a small whitr head. Aroma of tart berries, chocolate, hay and some floral notes. Flavour of tart berries, plum, chocolate chip cookies, cream, grassy bitterness and grains. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and a smooth, malty, warming finish. Great balance and very tasty.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Pours clear dark copper color with a minimal head. Aroma of sweet ripe fruits, caramel malts, mild nuts, yeast and some hay. Flavor of ripe fruits, caramel malts, toffee notes, nuts and some berry notes. Slick palate, bready and malty finish. Nice and smooth. 4314
Hazy amber with a thick off-white head. Fruity aroma, banana and peach. Taste is grain and more peach. Interesting.
Hefe Weizen aus dem Odenwald. Ein Gold Gelbes Hefe Weizen das ein gutes Mundgefühl erzeugt.
German wheat beer and tasting like one: malty taste lingering for a long time. Spicy. Boring.
Fles 50cl in Hirschhorn. Erg 'tarwe'. Toch niet mijn ding. (8-2010).------.

Normal labels here, not special and not a lot of information here. Cloudy amber beer with very nice fine long white head, smell is yeast, light overripe bananas, taste is dominated by yeast, light banana, medium body, oily texture, fresh, light sour and watery, lively carbonation, normal Hefeweizen, not special, boring, for me not enough bananas, not vanilla, yeast is dominated, (I have 0.5l bottle with best-before Mar2019 and batch 8066 09:06)

Light orange. Frothy to soapy white head that lingers. Lemon and yeast in the aroma, soft banana undertones, garden weed. Taste a bit tart, citric, with mild acidity. Body is medium with light alcohol warmth. Carbonation is soft. Mediocre.
04-06-17 // 500ml bottle at Planke Nord, Mainz. Cloudy orange with a big white head. Mild banana fruit, mild yeasty, some spices, light bodied, high carbonation. Average.
on tap oro velata buona schiuma banana filo speziato corretta ma non esaltante
Hefetrübes orangegold mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, hefig, leicht fruchtig, etwas Banane, minimale Säure, sehr spritzig.
