Flasche 0,5l: Ocker, helles Braun, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger fester feinporiger Schaum; frische Nase, leichte Süße, Malz, Getreide, kräftige Hefearomen, leichte fruchtige Noten, grüne Bananen; im Körper leichte Süße, Malz, kräftige Hefearomen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte grüne Fruchtnoten, Sternfrucht, grüne Bananen, leichte Säure, leichte Hopfennoten; angenehmer frischer Nachgang mit kräftigen Hefenoten

Pours a clear gold, the head is white, average and decent lace. Nose is malt, clean and crisp, front is lightly malt sweet, the top light, the finish is dry, acidic, lightly hopped and a quite decent session beer, but as with most Lagers/Pils, leaves me lacking, but well worth the try, as I understand, it's "Draught Only" at this time.
Deep dark color, low head retention. Coffee aroma, lots of malt and sweetness on the palate, nutty, toffee, chocolate. Lightly roasted finish, touch of hops, but remaining sweet and chocolaty.
Pours dark golden some head some lacing. Nose is peppery and some grain. Flavours of cereal, pepper and earthy bitterness. Taste med bitter med sweet. Full sticky body.

Extremely cloudy, milky, no foam. Clean malt bubble gum aroma. Fresh palate, tangy, zesty citrus. Nice flavor and extremely refreshing but think the rye should have had more of an impact. Might have needed more time?
Sweet, honey and peach nectar. Dries slightly in the finish but never really bites or bitters. Pleasant alternative for craftophiles.

column4: Birreria Ticinese (formerly La Tana del Luppolo)
column5: Blond hazy colour. Nice hop aroma, fruity (there's some Cascade hop used in the brewing). Some residual sweetness, good body, rather malty; a hint of Fragola raisin in the flavour. Good and long final. Maybe I was really thirsty, that afternoon. Beers of Switzerland

column4: Birreria Ticinese (formerly La Tana del Luppolo)
column5: Yellow and clear. Almost no head. Smell of grass, a bit flowers, a bit sour. Tastes watery, empty, a bit malty, almost no bitterness. Almost no body, quite boring.

column4: Birreria Ticinese (formerly La Tana del Luppolo)
column5: Bottled 33cl. Courtesy of Bov. It pours a surprisingly dark hazy copper beer with a very quick diminishing head. A huge amount of apple appearing in the aroma which is sweet malty. Sweet malty taste with a lot of apple showing up again. Very low bitterness. Some hay sneaking in. Medium bodied. Not much lacework. Residual sugars in the finish which is reminiscent of chestnut and malt. Thanks a lot Bov!

column4: Birreria Ticinese (formerly La Tana del Luppolo)
column5: hazy blond colour, giant head, nice lace, buttery notes, some hops in the nose, mild, sweet, crisp and fresh, no bitterness, no character

column4: Birreria Ticinese (formerly La Tana del Luppolo)
column5: Blond hazy colour. Very nice hop aroma, floreal and fruity. Good mix of malt and hop, maybe a little overcarbonated. Good palate. Beers of Switzerland

column4: Birreria Ticinese (formerly La Tana del Luppolo)
column5: Dark colour, bubbly head. Pretty strong aroma; roasted malt and coffee, bread, dough, yeast. Rather watery, some sweetness, light body, not enough hop. Rather poor hop and palate. Beers of Switzerland

F: big, white, average retention. C: yellowish, light hazy. A: malty, grassy, floral, herbal, green leaves, yeast. T: malt, grassy bitterness, yeasty, herbal, light citrus, coriander, orange peels, medium body, good carbonation, not bad, 33cl bottle in shopping centre Serfontana in Morbio Inferiore in Switzerland.

Bottle from a Coop somewhere in the Mesocco Valley. A very light Helles: Barely recognizable hops and malt, rather has the tartness and acidity of a simple cider. Dirty corny malt in the nose besides that, but really almost water. Ugly.

Aroma: light floral hops, grain malts. Appearance: slightly hazy gold, medium, frothy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: very mild bitters continue, floral hops again, malts, grain, light bread, yeast. Overall: OK Lager, nothing special though. Bottle from the brewery, Stabio.
Truebes helles bier, eher fruchtig, zitoniger abgang, leicht und erfrischend, perfekt im sommer
Grainy German style lager beer with a slight fruity touch, fitting for the region it’s comming from, the Swiss-Italian Ticino.
Hazy golden with white head. Nice hoppy aroma, citrus and herbal. At taste is light bitter with some good zesty flavour.

Bouteille 33cl du Grain d’Orge, Crissier, BB 22-03-2014. Dorée claire, col blanc fin. Arôme donne de suite un bouquet nauséabond de pomme-tannin rappelant ce côté frais fruité vert et possible signe d’infection de style aldéhyde. Palais reste similaire avec pas mal de notes de pommes vertes, pelure et un arrière gout herbacé et houblonné. Effervescence est haute laissant un fini amer râpeux. Malt de style carapils, munich mais je n’arrive pas à passer au delà du profile pomme. Dommage surtout que la série Bad Attitude m’avait fait plaisir.

Bottle 33 cl from Au Grain d’Orge - Neuchâtel (CH). Muddy blonde with a short head and crackling allegro. Aromas of fresh cereals, citrusy hop and honey. Taste of cereals, bitter-sweet, hop citrus note. Nice and fresh, with a hoppy character final and a point of acridity.
Bevuta presso il locale di Mendrisio, aroma scarso, quais niente, fianel leggermente amarognolo ma birra di certo non indimenticabile
oro schiuma non abbondante poco persistente sentori maltati lieviti leggero erbaceo fruttato in bocca rimane solo il malto in bottiglia e pastorizzata forse perde un po 2.6
Surprisingly nice and fresh beer. Smooth body of wheat, with some soft herbs and fruit. Nice.
Dobre i nietypowe piwo pszeniczne, Wygląd powala bo po ostrożnym przelaniu ukazuje się sama piana, która dłógo się utrzymuje. Straszliwie mętne, maślane w smaku.

Yellow/orange and hazy. Full but unstable head. Smell of a bit banana, citrus, slightly acidic, a bit grassy hops. Taste of banana, citrus, a bit malty. Long lasting sourness and lacking body. Quite fizzy.

Bottiglia da 33cl regalatami da Wiggs (grazie!!!); versa colore arancione acceso torbido con discreta schiuma cremosa, aroma dolce e maltato con poche note di banana; interessante il sapore piuttosto complesso per lo stile. Corpo molto pesante, frizzantezza comunque abbastanza elevata. Piacevolissima sorpresa

Bottled 0,33L. Bought in Mendrisio. Creamy and foamy head, good resistance. Orange dark color with reddish reflex. Good and fine fizz. Much muddy and dense one. Decidedly alcoholic scent with wheat and yeast notes, wine cellar and "cereals juice". Little lively taste, rather extinguished in truth, with alcoholic and withered clear grape notes. Lightly acidulous and mellow on the end. Courtesy of my dad.

Bottle. Tasting session with omhper and ante Plenty of yeast in this bottle. Big nice head, as it should be in a wheat. Nice malty aroma but with more phenolic than estery compounds. Spicy character and a wee hint of milk chocolate. Pretty salty aftertaste.
Bottled. Cloudy brownish amber, creamy head. Aroma of citrus and metal. Dryish and lightly fruity, no esters detected. Instead there is caramel and viola, but it falls short of being interesting.

Very hazy dark orange appearance topped with a big tan coloured head. Yeast and diacetyl in aroma hints of red fruit. Nutty, buttery aqnd yeasty flavour, hints of potatoes in the biscuity and yeasty aftertaste.
cloudy dark orange colour with little foam, corny and banana aroma, oily and rather light-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel, slightly dry banana aftertaste - a little bit cloying

2004-05-23, Draught, 6-4-6-3-13=32 Muddy light amber color. Spicy aroma, and lemony. Ordinary Weizen, with a good sweet malty line. 2002-09-10, Draught, 7-5-7-4-15=38 Amber hazy colour; beautiful thick head. Strong, characteristic aroma, spicy. Rather sweet in the front, enough malty, good balance, pretty good hop ending in a long palate, sweet and bitter.

Sample@GBBF2018, London, with the Malmö crew - Hazy amber pour with a off white head. Sweet and toasted malty with some toffee and caramel sweetness, some dried fruit notes, light brown sugar, medium body, hoppy and toasted malty warming finish.

Keg. at the GBBF 2018 day 1 07/08/2018. Palate is prickly highish carbonation, toffee. Aroma is sweet brown malts, toffee apple,. Flavour is composed of burnt toffee apple, simple stuff. Meh. Bitter burnt sugars.

Keg at GBBF 2018. It pours hazy amber with a small yellowy beige head. The aroma is sweet, tangy, brown bread, toasty brown sugars, fruit cake, nectarine, tangy fruits and toasted nut. The taste is slick, chewy, bitter, brown bread, spicy, grassy, wood, leather, toasted nut and earth with a drying finish. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. Decent spicy bitter.
Bottle @home, thank you daniele. Amber clear with a orangey foam, some sediments. Nose: earthy, hazelnut, some phenols. Mouth: it’s peppery and a bit off. Certainly a bad bottle.

Bottle from GBBF 2017 and drunk at home. Clear reddish brown colour lasting beige head. Earthy malty aroma. It is quite English to be honest. Attractive malts and then very English style hops on the finish. Yep decent enough carrues abv well. Likeable English Strong. Peppery hop on finish.

Tap at Be.re. Cloudy brown-orange with a low head. Fruity, estery nose, plums. Very fruity flavor, plum, apple, somewhat sweet. Peppery finish. Low, prickly carbonation. Slightly rough and unfinished.
Murky copper with a decent head. Aroma herbal, caramel, and some nuts. Taste full, nutty, some herbal notes, but all subdued. Low carbonation.
Brun öl med beige skum. Doft av karamell och torkad frukt. I smaken tillkommer kryddighet och en nötig beska.
On tap. Copper with thin cream head. Fruity and malt aroma, flavour is sweet caramel with bitter end
40cl @ tap. Buona ambrata, un po’ amarognola, aroma debole sentori erbacei e agrumati.

On tap at IL Santo Bevitore, Venice, Italy in the company of Will and Steve. Pours gold, light gold, white haze slight haze. I was really thirsty so drank 40cl in no time at all, however it was very nice, very refreshing, very good.
On tap. Sanft trübes gelbes Bier, dünner weisser Schaum. Würziger Getreideduft. Ganz leichte Pilznoten. Sehr süffig. Bitternoten, Gras, Getreide, Hopfen. Sehr anständiges Kölsch.
To prawie idealny Kolsch. Ładna podbudowa sodowa, przyjemny chmiel i goryczka. Ale zbyt dużo estrow w typie czerwonego jabłka.

Keg @ Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Hazy straw golden, large, dense and lasting white head, rich lacing. Big citrus fruity aroma, zest and carambola. Light bodied and smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Taste is citrus fruity and citrus zesty bitter, exotic citrus fruits and grassy. Dry and bitter finish.

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 18 June 2018) Hazy golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with bread, citrus and grass. Malty, fruity taste with notes of bread, citrus, grass, peaches, some dough and a mild grassy bitterness. Medium body, with a slight sweetness. Hardly complex, but tasty and balanced. Quite nice.

Keg at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Fruity nose with hints of chlorine and pine needles. Mid dry with light body and rounded mouthfeel. Fruity with with mild grass. Minimal bitterness. Well made malt character, pity about the aroma.
Pours rather clear blonde. Creamy white head, stable and pillowy. Smell is very subtile. Mild hoppyness. Taste is very balanced, bitter , pale malts. Bit metallic. Ok
On tap at Lambiczoon. Straw color with a big, foamy head. Cucumber, mild fruity hoppiness in the nose. Bitter, fruity, good malty, toasty base. Full body, fizzy, long, toasty finish.
Tap at Lambiczoon, Milan. Near clear golden shade. Huge head. Notes of honey and a fair bit of floral character. Taste is close to dry. OK.
Bevuta il 29/09/2017 @ChiareScureFestival in Milano. Alla spina. Biondo chiaro, poca schiuma. Odore di crosta si pane, agrumi. In bocca sentori speziati, citrici, di limone. Retrogusto acidulo.
A pretty quality dark beer, crisp clean and a standard for the style. Dresden beerfest

0.5 can. Nagyon sötét gyakorlatilag fekete sör, kitöltéskor barnás habbal, ami elég jól előhívható, olajos felszín . Földes, karamelles illat, majd amint melegedett, kávés is. Nem túl testes, földes, kávés, száraz jó alap barna. Itatja magát, de nem kiemelkedő. Lágernek nagyon jó.

From the can. Brown with a frothy, beige head that fades quickly but not completely. Mild whiff of caramel, smoke and cardboard. The taste saves the beer from a fatal dive into mediocrity: smokey, full of tobacco, toast and toffee. Body is medium, oily, carbonation is mild. Not bad in the end for simple, everyday drinking.

0,5l bottle. Lovely black colour with off white head. Roasty character and a little coffee at the background. Good drinkability average carbonation. Tastes bitter with a roast in the aftertaste. Nice black lager.

Auch wenn man es oft nicht glauben will, aber bei den dunklen Bieren sind die Tschechen und Slowaken den westlicheren Braumeisten mehr als ebenbürtig...allerdings machte es lange das viele grausliche Billigbier, schwer ein gutes Trankerl zu finden. Nun ja, eines haben wir gefunden: das Urpiner Ležiak výčápný tmavný 11° Am besten in der Altstadt von Bratislava genießen

Can. Pours almost black with a beige head. Aroma of toasted malt, caramel, artificial sweetener, berry notes, caramel, nuts. Taste follows with some coffee notes, a bit metallic. Finish is sweet and roasty.
Nice look in theglass. Aroma of caramel, grain, cherries(!?). Flat, sweety, metallic taste. Awful, strange, artificial, grainy-sour cabbage aftertaste.

0.5 l can from local 'Billa', best before May 2019. Clear, very dark ruby to black with a large, frothy, almost stable, beige head. Sweetish-malty, moderately roasty aroma of caramel, cocoa and some toasted nuts with hints of coffee. Moderately sweet, malty, quite roasty taste of coffee, cocoa, some licorice and a touch of toasted nuts, followed by a short, moderately roasty-bitter, quite earthy-dry finish and minimally metallic finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Solid, great bargain.
Ciemna barwa, szarawa i dość gęsta piana znika po krótkim czasie.Gładki, słodowy smak z elementami kawowymi, nieco goryczki. Posmak trochę gorzkawy z długo utrzymującym się słodowym, miodowym tłem.
Je ne suis pas spécialement amateur des bières noires, mais celle-ci n'est pas mauvaise du tout!

column2: Garden City, New York, United States
column5: Not really too wheaty, but that's sort of the way American Wheats tend to be, so you can't really dock them points for that. Better as it warms, with a watery, crisp flavor that hints at wheat without really delivering. A tad sour?

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Vintage rating. Bottle pours a pale golden body. Nicely hoped with the malt in good balance. No etoh, eh its okay.

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: The sweet malts and slight hop bite at the end gave this session beer a little more kick than the regular Genny products. It seems like it only lasted for about one good summer.

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: When Labatt was making huge inroads directly into HFBC’s back yard they rolled this out to compete. This was a good beer and a direct shot at Labatt. They should have stuck with it.

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: malts and mild hop character on in this one all around comptely unoffsensive and refreshing.

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Light golden, not yellow color. Light pleasant aroma. Mildly sweet flavor that goes well with anything. Was extremely pleased with the bartender's recommendation.

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: For three years now i have been imagining if this beer was a figment of my imagination or actually existed. A distributor in State College, Pa was giving out free samples of the beer one week and my friends and i got one, split it amongst ourselves, and decided to go back and get a case. When we tried to go back and get another case, the stuff had vanished and the people at the store acted like they had never heard of the stuff. I know this because when I asked a guy at the store about it he replied, "Never heard of the stuff." So now, many years later (3), i finally learn the stuff exists. I no longer have to wonder if i am crazy or not. ... Oh, And it was pretty damn good back then too.

column4: Dundee Brewing Company (Cervecería Costa Rica - FIFCO)
column5: Slightly more flavorful than an ordinary lager. I well remember the inexplicable Dundee's Honey Lager craze of 1996 - which I never understood. If this beer takes off in popularity, it would be equally inexplicable. ha ha

Cloudy apricot swirling with soupy chunks of sediment. Fruity caramel aroma, fragrant peachy-coriander flavour. Sweet, thick and subtly perfumey. Gave me the shits for about a week. The palate is minestrone soup. There are things floating in this beer I dare not drink. But considering they have emerged from a 3L bottle I’ve ’laid down’ (forgotten about) for several years, this beer has pleasantly exceeded my expectations.

lots of koriander and malt in the aroma. sweet malty, spicy taste with a bit bitter finish which is not so long. body is a bit thin althought it looks rather oily. looks dark yellow with a huge head. lacks some character but is certainly not bad, just a little average. (reminds me of ice tea).

(Bottle 33 cl) I bought this in a French supermarket, thinking that it was a French beer. But no, it’s a "Bière Belge". Information about the brewery is nowhere to be found on the label, except that it’s produced for the Auchan-supermarkets. Very orange/amber-colored, unclear with a very creamy and lively head. The style is very close to a Tripel, sweet with a bit of sharp hops. But it’s not exactly a "Big Belgian". 051003
Bottled, from Bordeaux. Cloudy golden colour. Sharp, fermented hay aroma. Tart, bitter finish that sticks to the sides of your mouth.
Blond color. Compact foam and of good persistence. Fragrant aroma...........
amber-orange colour with a big creamy head, yeasty and honeyish aroma, medium-bodied, slightly tart with a quite watery finish - a low quality tripel
Nice golden blonde beer with a very sweet aroma. Sweet refreshing beer,but not very complex for a Belgian ale. A good supermarket brew

This has a gold colour and not as much head as I expected. The aroma is fresh a wheat beer like. Flavours also remind me of a wheat - coriander, banana and spices are present. Quite an amalgamation of styles and not bad for it.

Auchan private label prodcut, which, I guess, means two things: a) should be good enough to be worth of the Auchan name, and b) shouldn't be too expensive or complex. All considered, the goals are accomplished. Dark golden, opaque in colour. Pours a good head. Smells of malt with a hint of lemon. A bit thin in the mouth, tastes good even if seems to lack some character. Decent aftertaste that won't last long.
Blond colour, generous head, nice perlage. Light malt, a bit metallic aroma. Not completely mature, but quite nice balance of malt and hop, again somehow metallic. Ordinary palate.
Fles 33cl thuis. Zoet, banaan, romig, klein zuurtje, suikers, ver weg wat citrus, wat kruidnagel. (23-8-2019).
swing-top bottle, golden with a creamy head. aroma of banana, malts, yeast, some citrus, taste light, soft, smooth, citrus, banana, malts, yeast, clove, light sour flavor, decent, not the greatest.

Bottle shared by Caesar. Unclear hazy sort of dusty orange color, full sized white to off-white head. Smell and taste weizen, a bit yeasty, a hit sweet and herbal. Hmm no not my kind of weizen at all. Meh.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from local 'REWE', best before July 2018. Hazy, amber with a large, foamy, almost stable, off-white head. Sweetish, quite yeasty-spicy and a bit fruity aroma of banana, cloves and some pear. Moderately sweet, quite yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity taste of banana, cloves, some pear and a touch of nuts, followed by a short, moderately bitter, a little tart, quite yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, slightly creamy and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Decent.

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is wheat, spicy yeast, clove, and banana. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter with some wheaty sourness. Body is light to medium. Drinkable but unremarkable Hefe, body a bit watery.
Clear dark yellow, big white lacing foam head. Little weak in aroma (muffled by foam), citrus in taste, nice wiezen. (Velp 201608)
Glass at ’’de 24 uurs van Maastricht’’, amber orange beer, medium head. Aroma is wheat, some fruit. Taste is the same. Typical weizen.

(Pott’s Weizen) Swing top bottle, 330 ml at Tape, Arnhem, served into a weizen glass. ABV 5.3% Mostly clear body, deep orange in colour. Almost two fingers of white, thick head. Very good retention. Aroma of wheat, light clove, banana. Taste has more clove, wheat of course, light bubblegum and banana as well. Medium thin body, good carbonation. Your standard weizen, easy to drink and refreshing.
Bottle at Tape, Arnhem. Thick creamy white head. Cloudy golden pour. A decent weizen

Bottle. Pours in hazy yellow body with low white head. Aroma has hay, banana and light spicy tones. Taste has medium wheat sweetness with very light bitterness, almost none. Body is medium, medium to full carbonation.

Bottle/Moulin des Moines Blondy Free @ Friends/Dr Yeast. Appearance: pours clear straw yellow with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, burnt popcorn, butter and cardboard. palette: light sweet malty aroma, average carbonation, light to medium body, medium sweetness, unbalanced by a light bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: stay away
Bottle at Steffi Lauterhofen - straight from the bottle. malty, Malzbier-like, sweetish, cardboard, thin. the Dinkel-Radler I had as well was way better.

getrunken im März 2018 Dieses Bier gab es eine Zeitlang in ausgewählten Bio-Supermärkten Wiens. Dort konnte es sich aber nicht allzu lange halten. Der widerliche Geschmack nach alten Brot und gammligen Knödeln blieb mir bis heute in Erinnerung. Schön dass es Bio ist, aber das ist auch schon seine einzige positive Eigenschaft.
From Carrefour. In Teku glass. At lunch, with fried potatoes + eggs and chicken wings. Plenty of the typical nastyness so common in alcohol-free beers. Probably the spelt make it even worse
Heel erg zoete siroop smaak met graan en grenadine. Erg vol mondgevoel bijna niet door te drinken
Berliinissä 5/2016 Yoyo-ravintolassa. Quite sweet and malty non-alcoholic beer. Not my favourite.

Actually Blondy Free by Le Moulin des moines. Light yellow with pink reflections body; cloudy; big bubbles, abundant but not lasting foam. Aroma and taste quite similar the one the other : slightly sour, flowery, honey, edelberry. Very very light but fairly fine and subtle. That’s not beer (which explains the low mark here) but that’s something interesting anyway, as a "beginning of beer". But, well, I must admit I’m pleased with just a beginning, owing to the fact that I don’t enjoy Moulin des moines’ beers...

Review based on personal notes. Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: slight hop aroma mixed with the characteristic low alcohol notes. APPEARANCE: very pale straw color and hazy. thin white head with poor retention. TASTE: watered down flavour with some faint malty notes. low bitterness with an almost sweet finish. PALATE: thin body with low carbonation. OVERALL: its a low alcohol beer, thats it. watered down flavour and poor aroma.

330 ml bottle as “Moulin des Moines Blondy Free” bought at Organic Bliss in Causeway Bay. Translucent dull golden yellow colour with layer of yeast sediments; Razor-thin head and residual soapy white foam which fades in 5 seconds; Moderate sticky lacing and near zero carbonation; Sweet aroma of water chestnut juice, with sugarcane, perotis and barley; Near zero sweet taste of thin malt, with light wood chips, non-sweet water chestnut, perotis and tapioca; Light body, watery palate; Mouth feel is lightened low-alco beer: no sweetness at all, woody taste is light. No awful AL-related off tastes, but it pretty much reduced to something akin to a mix of water chestnut juice and sugarcane-perotis drink so common in Southern China. Okay… Hoppiness is zero in nose and taste. No bitterness, just herbal perotis finish; Wet after taste. Very easy to mouth. Comments: This is perhaps the most palatable low-alcohol beer I’ve had so far, probably because it was watered down so much to rid of any harsh LA elements. It really tastes like water chestnut juice and nothing beery. Sounds bad, but actually quite refreshing. LA-wise, this one is pretty good.

33cl bottle from Biernavigatie. Pale yellow with a small to medium white head. Light body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with some bitter tones. Malts, yeast, hay and grass. Quite a tastefull beer for a low alcohol brew.

50 cl bottle as Organig/Okologisch Weisse Premium, 5.3%. Murky worn out orangey/brownish color, big expansive creamy white head. Aroma of weizen malts, banana and some spice. Medium body, creamy texture, dry finish lighly spiced. Simple weizen.

Cloudy yellow/brown color, average sized white head. Aroma of banana, wheat. Taste is similar but kinda unusual. Slightly sourish and spicy, bubblegum notes. Average to high carbonation, light to medium body. Mnja. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle 0.5l. Cloudy dirty yellow liquid with big head. Medium body, heavy carbonated. Sour, strange taste. A bit hard to swallow. Didn’t like it. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Poured a hazy orange color with a smaller sized head. citrus, some wheat, cloves and bananas.
Bottle. Sweet banana, cherry, clove, and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy reddish amber color with large head. Slightly sweet banana, clove, and wheat malt flavor. Nice smell but flavor pretty weak.

bottle - pours a cloudy dark amber - almost honey-colored, light tan, frothy head. Banana bread aroma with a touch of spice and a hint of chocolate, only small trace of fruit. Flavor is bready and I detected a buttery quality initially with a hint of cloves, apricot and chocolate. Needs a bit more fruit to be balanced though. Nice creamy palate. interesting...

bottle, labelled Export Hefeweizenbier, bought somewhere in the Hallertau. Cloudy amber-brownish colour with a large and creamy head. Fruity nose. Very wheaty, slightly grainy with a shy yeast character, fruity hints also present, but not too intensive. A well-balanced Hefeweizen.

Bottiglia da 50cl a pasto a Brescia; strana hefe, colore rossiccio scuro, sapore bananoso come usuale ma con note tostate. Un esperimento un po’ azzardato e non troppo piacevole.______________ENGLISH TEXT HERE______________50cl bottle @ meal in Brescia; weird hefe, dark reddish color, banana flavor as usual but with roasted notes. A daring experiment and not too pleasant one.

Thank you Masn/g2b.dk for this rarity. It has 5,3%. It’s dark golden with a huge, nice head and the aroma has notes of wheat and some banana. The flavour isn’t very strong, but it does have notes of wheat and a light: sweetness, banana and clove. It’s refreshing and quite OK, but a bit on the light side...
Bottle at Kent BF. Cloudy amber. Thick beige head. Clove, spice aroma, muted banana, really good in mouth, lovely lush toffee, decent full wheat beer, good clove, but not terrific.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Robe blond clair, à peine voilée, moins que ce que je pensais pour une blanche bio. Mousse moyenne, tient peu, peu de bulles. Nez discret, mais on sent clairement la banane, et ensuite une très légère touche citronnée. En bouche, la banane est là en premier, avec une trèèès légère acidité. Manque de corps, presque aqueux. Léger et tranquille, mais pas fifou. Se boit bien, mais malgré le petit côté banane sympa, manque d'autres arômes, de texture...

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: getrunken im Sommer 2017 Wenn man ein Bier mit dem Attribut "Leicht" kauft, darf man nicht mit allzu großer Vollmundigkeit bzw. Bierigkeit rechnen, daher wlll ich dieses Bier mal nicht schlechter machen, als es sein sollte. Das Bier schmeckt primär nämlich nach Wasser. Besondere Aromen, besonders aus der "Frucht-Ecke" sind gar nicht auszumachen, weil es einfach nicht stark genug nach Weißbier schmeckt. Es drängt sich der Verdacht auf, dass man das hauseigene Weißbier einfach mit Wasser gestreckt hat. Vielleicht als Erfrischung nach dem Sport denkbar, aber mehr wohl eher nicht.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 0,5l Flasche. Trübes dunkelgelbes klassisches Weissbier mit weissem feinem Schaum. In der Nase Hefe und Getreide, leicht seifig. Antrunk recht würzig. Hefe und Brotteig. Dazu frisches Gras. Denn wird es etwas säuerlich. Im Abgang unrund. Ganz ok für eine leichte Weisse.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: [backlog] 10-04-16 // bottle at Inselrhein. Okay for light abv. Light yeasty, light fruit.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Hazy yellow color with big head. Aroma is wheat and banana. Flavor is banana, some cardboard. Pretty ok for low alcohol weisse. Great for those long poker nights.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, leicht fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, leicht bananig fruchtig, minimal säuerlich.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Hellgelbes, trübes Dünnbier mit mittelprächtiger Krone. Leicht brotig-bananiges Aroma. Dünn im Antrunk. Wiederum etwas brotig und bananig im Geschmack. Kann nicht überzeugen.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 0,5 l bottle cereal, Wheat, Malty, citrus, banana, golden, cloudy, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, light body, creamy, thin feel, average carbonation,

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Pours dark golden with a huge frothy and creamy head. Aroma of wheat spices and ripe banana. Taste is sweet bready malty, light body as expected, some light sour wheat towards the end. Not bad.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Bottle. Golden -yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is orang, wheat, malt. Flavour is orange, wheat, malt, citrus, banana, cloves. Medium to thin body. Boring beer.
06-09-18 // 500ml bottle shared at Kick n Rush Mainz .Cloudy yellow. Small white head. Nose more spice. Light bodied hefe with mild green banana and green apple acidity notes. Quite nice.

Swing-top bottle. Cloudy golden colour. Proper head. Aroma: surprising strawberry, wheat, banana, honey. Odd. Light to mefium body. Fruity taste. Bread as well. Some spice sip after sip. Low bitterness. A very different one.
the aroma is fruity and floral with shades of wheat, candy, yeast and some herbs... the taste is fruity and malty with notes of sweet apple, yeast, lollipop and toffee... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Flasche 0,5l: Ocker, kräftige Trübung, feinperlig, kräftiger fester feinporiger weißer Schaum; recht süße malzige Nase, Getreide, Cornflakes, Zitrusaromen, leichte Hopfennoten, grüne Bananen, kräftige Hefearomen; frischer prickelnder Körper, kräftig malzig, Getreide, leichte fruchtige Süße, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, Zitrusnoten, grüne Bananen, kräftige Hefearomen; angenehmer malzig-süßer Nachgang mit Hefearomen

Buegelverschlußflasche: Pale golden, cloudy, mid-sized and very stable creamy white head, sourish lemony-fruity and yeasty nose, delicate traces of wheat in the background; mild to moderate sorish-sweetish flavour with a very faint bitterness, light bodied; slightly lingering mainly sourish-citrussy finish. A fresh Sommer-Weizen...

Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy and moderate yeasty aroma. Light bitter flavor. Short light bitter finish. Thin but nice fruity esters. Watery palate.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are banana, yeast, wheat malt, hops and has a nice sweet finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Opaque hazy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is fruity, banana, light clove, yeasty, rather clean for a hefe though, enjoyable. Taste is sweet, fruity, light banana flavor, nice palate. Pretty easy drinking hefe.

50cl on tap. Cloudy pale yellow colour with a generous white head. Light banana, pear and clove in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is light and more on the sweet side. Overall, a nice drinkable Hefeweizen.

Beczka, Wiesbaden. Aromat słody pszenicznego z lekkim bananem i delikatnymi drożdżami. Piana biała, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, trwała. Piwo mętne o jasnej, prawie słomkowej barwie. W smaku słodkawe z lekkim bananowym posmakiem. Bardzo orzeźwiający, wysoko nasycone, typowy niemiecki pszeniczniak.

I had this beer many years ago at one time when I was only giving ratings to the beers but was too lazy and stupid to write down my thoughts. I will update this as soon as I get my hands on this beer again.
Pale golden and crystal clear. Honey aroma. Clean and fruity with short flavour.
Strong malt with nutty flavors. Low hops but nice body. Has a medium body flavor Good stuff
Typical dunkel with dark malts and untypical pronounced hops. Bitter and corn like.
At trinkgut Gülden Bonn/Bad godesberg in Germany, Brown hazy, medium head, smoky, banana, full flavor, with hinds of grapefruit and raisin. nice one.
(Bottle 50 cl) Cloudy, dark brown with a reddish hue. Soft, smooth and fruity with only a hint of bitterness. Very beautiful bottle. 170201
One of the best Dunkelweizen I have tasted! It’s rich with a very good balance of sweet and sour notes. Long aftertaste with a nice dryness in the end.
Bad beer. no head at all. Watery and artificial. Not complex nor well-balanced.
Murky brown with no head. Terrible sour wheat aroma. Thin and watery. The flavours are very few.
a bit surprised that no-one else liked this. had a sea slat aroma and was darker than most. quite sour - plenty of burnt vanilla and peach nectar
Some clove, but mostly estery/yeasty sourness in arome. Murky brown. Bready banana taste, a bit too light body. Ok, but not really impressive.

Robe ambrée trouble, mousse correcte mais peu durable (fin disque). Nez marqué de malt et banane, pointe épicée. En bouche, banane, girofle, rondeur. Le froment se sent bien. Belle longueur en bouche, mais des arômes qui gagneraient à être plus délicats. Weizen classique.
Pours a hazed golden with white head. Standard weiss aroma and taste, up the middle. Notes : Zell am See Austria, Jan ‘19

Leuchtend orange, trüb mit stabiler weißer Krone. Typischer Weißbiergeruch mit Banane, Nelke und Weizenmalz. Weicher Antrunk mit angenehm dosierter Kohlensäure bei schlankem, latent wässrigem Körper. Sortentypische Frucht aromen von mittlerer Intensität gepaart mit Weizen- und Karamellmalz. Kaum herb. Rund und süffig. Vielleicht etwas zu zahm...
Pa taisno no Vāczemes. Viegli dzerams kviesis. Aromata mazliet suņu spalvas ar banānu. Garšā banānīgs ļoti patikams viegli dzerams. Kremigs.
Bottle: Aroma with light citrus and banana notes. Light notes of rubber, dark malts. Orange amber color, white head. Flavor is few wheat, light caramelic, malt, some off-notes.
50cl swing top bottle. A hazy dark golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of phenolic esters, clove and yeast. Taste of clove, yeast, phenols, dry mild fruity finish.

Hazy murky amber with no real head, some floaties. Aroma is cooked peas, cookie dough, grass, cauliflower, rotten peach, yeast, dandelion. Taste is slight spicy clove at first with a bit of squeakiness and cauliflower finish. Alcohol and yeast aftertaste, low carbonation. Doughy mouthfeel. One of the worst Hefeweizen I had, and even from Germany...
Charakterystyczne dla pszenicy aromaty ledwo wyczuwalne. Delikatna nuta banana, pomaranczy. Bardzo wodniste, zwiewne. Srednie nasycenie. Kciuk w dol.
Amber color with medium head. Arom malt, banana.Taste too sweet, banana, grain, high carbonation. Darker color then usual. Taste something between hefeweizen and unfiltered lager.

Hazy (but not too much) amber color, with a nice big head, but disappearing. Aroma of banana esters and wheat. Taste is wheat, caramel, banana. A bit watery texture, low carbonation. Not much bitterness. Ok beer.
12-07-17 // 500ml bottle. Light hazy golden beer with a solid white head. Malty body, grains, muffy herbal hops.
Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, blumig. Geschmack malzig, leicht fruchtig, grasig.

sehr hopfig-frischer Geruch, leichte Hefetöne wahrnehmbar. Der Antrunk ist muffig-herb, nicht sonderlich frisch und etwas laff. Der Hauptteil wird muffiger-hefiger, und diese muffige Herbe zieht sich bis zum Nachgeschmack durch. Auf der Zunge verbleibt eine sehr muffig-alte herbe Note. --> nicht so mein Bier - zu penetrant-muffig-herb. (Test vom 13.7.2008) --> 12,9,9,6,12,9 - 9,00

It’s hazy pale yellow-golden with a creamy white head. The aroma has notes of flower, grass, bread, grain and fruit - pleasantly hoppy. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of grass, fruit, yeast, bread, grain and the finish is slightly dry and hoppy. It’s very pleasant.
The head is medium, the body cloudy. It smells a bit sour, very yeasty. The taste is sour, fruity, bitter, yeasty. Ok 10/9/10/10/10/10
Pours a pale yellow. Quite floral and hoppy. Somewhat perfumed finish. Flavour of malts with notes of spices.

Aromatisch getreidiger Antrunk. Die Getreidetöne werden stärker ud können schlußendlich nur vom hopfig-herben Ton gebannt werden. Dieser fällt sehr grasig aus, aber auch intensiv, flacht aber im Nachgeschmack schnell ab. Mir fehlt etwas die Würzigkeit. Test vom 22.12.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 9,8,9,8,8,8 - 8,25
Bottle. Cloudy yellow, big white head. Citric yeasty aroma. Medium to light yet chewy body, sparkly mouthfeel. Fresh citric and grassy notes dominate, light refreshing summerbeer.

500 ml flip-top bottle in Germany at home thanks to shrubber85. Cloudy, dark yellow color with firm, white head. Malty aroma with notes of grain, bread, grassy hops and a touch of toffee. Malty, grainy taste with bread and grassy, spicy hops in a dry, fairly bitter finish. Perfectly balanced and very tasty. Nice one.

bottle, mit Dank ins Ruhrgebiet! Hazy strawy yellow colour, large white head. Yeasty and hoppy aroma. Light-bodied yet with an elegant malty base, slightly grainy. An impressive amount of bitter hops is presetn from the beginning. Quite high carbonation, otherwise really convincing!
A small taste @ the flagship Alko, press blind tasting. Pours clear amber with a medium head. Aroma is clean malts. Flavor is lightly roasted malts with some nuts, some hops. Decent.
Clear ruby pour. Warm, caramel tones with the right amount of spices. Proper bock
Clear brown with a thick off-white head. Malty aroma. Taste is based on malty flavours with a decent bitterness. Quite drinkable.
Brown. Aroma is dried plum dried figs toffee and a little tobacco. Taste is sweet dense toffee with dried figs and A little booze. Very dense but not unpleasant.

0.5 l bottle from 'EDEKA Preller' (Breckerfeld), best before July 2020. Clear, reddish amber with a medium large, frothy, stable, off-white head. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity aroma of caramel, raisins and traces of nuts. Quite sweet, malty, slightly fruity taste of caramel, raisins and some nuts, followed by a short, slightly bitter, minimally grassy-spicy finish. Medium to full body, smooth and slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Decent Bock, easily drinkable but not very deep.
Amber with off white head - Malt with caramel aroma - Malt body with caramel flavour with some hints of bitterness in the back - The malt goes into the finish - This was nice

Bottle. Dark copper/amber with a massive head. Aroma of dark fruits and malts. Taste is dark fruits, malt lozenges, caramel and a little bit of honey. More bitter than sweet. Medium carbonation. Ok. Considering my history with Mönchshof I'm pleasantly surprised.

"Mönchshof Bockbier", Flasche. - Rotgold, blank. - In der Nase karamelsüßliches, breites dunkles Malz und nur vage krautige Herbe. - Antrunk satt dunkelmalzig mit Karamel, Nüssen und dunkler Malzbittere, die etwas dumpf wirkt und durch aromatisch eher vage Hopfenherbe komplementiert wird. Milder rezent, vollmundig kremig aber nicht breit; recht gut kaschierter Alkohol. Im Abgang gut dunkelmalzbitter und ausreichend krautig hopfenherb. - Für ein Industriebier gar nicht so schlecht. Bei Erwärmung wird es allerdings übel ranzig.

Swing-top bottle 50cl. from a Netto supermarket, Kohlscheid, @home poured into a lager glass. Clear medium amber, good off-white to beige head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma roasted malt, caramel, candy sugar; taste medium sweet and light bitter, malty, caramel and burnt sugar; malty sweet and a bit bitter aftertaste, cardboard, sugary; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; mediocre bock.

Der Geruch ist röstmalzig. Kastanienfarbenes Bier, relativ wenig Schaum. Der Antrunk ist süß und cremig. Aromen von Honig, Malz, leicht kräuterig. Im Nachtrunk ein klein wenig sprittig. Passend carbonisiert. Erinnert mich persönlich mehr an ein starkes Honigbier. Sehr süffig

Flasche 0,5l: Golden, dezente Trübung, stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; leicht fruchtige + recht süße Nase, dezente Zitrusnoten, leichte Hopfennoten, kräftig Malz, Malzzucker, Getreide, etwas Karamell, Honig, dezente Hefearomen; frischer + dezent fruchtiger Körper, sehr leichte Zitrusnoten, dezente Hopfennoten, kräftig Malz, Malzzucker, Getreide, etwas Karamell, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, leichte Hefearomen; angenehmer malzig-fruchtiger Nachgang
Pivo iznimne kvalitete, odličnog okusa i onog njemačkog štiha... odlično za piti!

"Schussenrieder Original No 1", Flasche von GTM Bokmeyer, Mergentheim. - Goldgelb, nur schwach trüb. - In der Nase mild brotiges helles Malz und milde, leicht zitrusfruchtige Hopfenherbe. - Antrunk frisch hellmalzig und etwas matt brotig mit Bierwürze und milder Süße. Zu schwache, leicht muffige Herbe. Milder rezent, schlank bis dünn. Im Abgang leicht ranzig und nur matt hopfenherb. - Zu lahm gehopftes, wäßriges Zwickel.
Hazy golden. Aroma is fresh green hops and chewy doughy malt. Faint fruit. Taste is harsh, sour a little starchy and average bitterness. Medium drinkability. Aroma promised more...
water with malt extract. slightly sweet, lack of hops, saturation large. beer drink not beer.
Shared bottle at RB/HD at Askje 13.10.18. Cloudy pale straw colour. Aroma and taste of sweet pilsner malt, green bananas, yeast and hints of grass and wheat.
Shared bottle at local tasting.Pours clear weak golden with a small head. Aroma of grainy malts. Taste is moderate sweet grainy with a herbal bitter finish

Fra flaske på RBHD-samling hos Asle Bjørn, okt-18: klar lys gylden med ok skum. Mild, frisk aroma og smak med florale toner, gule epler, acasiehonning og hint av søt citrus. En enkel og samtidig elegant forfriskning.
RBHD-treff på Mosterøy. 0,5 l flaske. Gave fra Lars Helge. Klar gyllen kropp med hvitt skum. Lukter søtlig tørt løv. Smaker søtt med innslag av honning. lite bitterhet. Moderat karbonering.
Shared 500 ml swingtop bottle at local tasting. Golden colour, white head. Moderately malty aroma. Decent malty flavour, moderate herbal hops.

@Backlog, Werk de lijst met bieren door en kom erachter dat ik deze nog niet had toegevoegd, wazig oranje met matige witte kraag, aroma is die van citrus, en lichte hop, pilsmouten en iets van koriander smaken zijn redelijk moutig, citrus, gras en gist zwakke body, licht bitter, maar verder oninteressant bier
Bottle from the brewery. Hazy golden color with a beige head. A lot of citrus in the aroma. Sweet fruity taste with some light bitterness.

Bottled. An unclear golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma has notes of citrusy and dusty hops, wheat, and barley malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, and citrus fruits, as well as lighter notes of wheat, leading to a dry wheaty finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
Bottle 30cl and on tap. Kolsch styled beer. Yeasty smell with a good straight on watery finish. Refreshing beer imo, nice Kolsch. This beer is retired though.

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Slightly hazy yellow with a dense and creamy white head. Sweet, fresh and fruity nose with a vague whiff of yeast. medium body, sweet fruit, lightly bitter finish. Quite fresh
Hazy yellow with a tiny white head. Malty aroma with floral hops. Flavour was hoppy with pine and flowers. Finished dry and bitter.
Bottle at Papsø. Hazy yellow coloured with a small white head. Fruity aroma of spices, yeast and flowers. Fruity flavour of spices, yeast, bverries and flowers with notes of hops. Hoppy finish.
30 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is yeasty and vague spiced. Yeasty, light wheaty and mild spiced flavoured. Vague citric and fruity touch. Ends dry and wheaty.

300ml Bottle - Hazy amber/orange in colour. Grainy and dusty aroma with a hint of fruit. The taste is rather pleasant with light fruit, malt hops with a hint of grain. Fairly tasty despite the simplicity.

300ml bottle (Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam) Massive high-power gusher. Hazy pale orange, brief head. Very simple light grainy and fruity aroma, a touch dusty and close. Likewise the taste, a dry simple graininess, and some dust. Simple slightly hoppy finish, but really lacking compared with the better Dutch brewers. However, it’s very drinkable, and quite pleasant.
Hazy golden with a decent white head. Yeasty aroma. Taste is yeast and grain, very mild booze, subtle bitterness. A decent Tripel.
Seichte Krone, dunkles gold. Etwas hefige Nase, alkoholisch, malzig. Antrunk Malzsüße, Karamell, etwas herber Honig, klare Alkoholnote.

Bottle shared at home. Almost perfect clear golden with white head. Sweet pale malts, straw, sugary, vanilla extract, light spices, dried up yoghurt yeasty. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation.

F: medium, white, average retention. C: gold, hazy. A: malty, vaguely fruity, yeasty, caramel, honey, floral. T: sweet malty, honey, weak bitterness, grassy, fruity, bit bubble gum, simple sugary, medium to full body, medium carbonation, nothing special or memorable, more on the sweet side, 30cl bottle from Beerwulf webshop.
Eén beetje geel/troebel van kleur. Smaak van honing en van karamel gemend met dat van lichte vruchten + citrus. Bier heeft een enthousiaste schuimkraag als het van de tap komt. -backlog de BierApp-
Dick und schwer mit viel Malz und Alkohol. Zum Schluss hin getreidig und Karamell. Ganz ok.
Aangenaam zoetige triple die lekker wegdrinkt. 8,5% alcohol. Romige smaak en zachte afdronk.
Herbes Karamell, leicht bitter und dezent süß. Markantes Alkoholaroma, etwas zu sehr für mich. Schwerer herber Nachgeschmack. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fles 30cl thuis. Vlak. Lijkt in ondersmaak op zowel dubbel als winterbier. Smaakt redelijk. (6-2009).
Donkergeel bier met mooie stevige schuimkraag. Smaak is bitter hoppig, zoet en kruidig met iets van banaan, honing en sinaasappel. Echt een goede tripel, klasse!

Bottle, from historic notes. Source not recorded. Poured amber copper colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, light vanilla. Moderate sweetness, bitterness and body. Slight oily texture and above average carbonation. Alright.

September 24, 2015 - at Craft (Covent Garden) - 500ml clear bottle from Waitrose - hotel room rate. As Waitrose Sunset Amber Ale. Bubbly clear light amber with a small off-white head. Nutty, sweet, twiggy, meh aroma ... taste follows, less sweet and twiggy, some bittereness of a sort - boring amber though. Airy, light body, finishes quick and clean - not bad. Or good.

"Waitrose Sunset Amber Ale" bottle from Waitrose, Hexham. Bright amber coloured with no head. It has a toffee and marzipan flavour with vanilla and red fruity notes followed by a smooth burnt toffee finish. Not bad.
Bottle from Waitrose, as sunset. Amber colour with a tan head. Fruity and light caramel aroma and taste. Medium body.
500ml bottle from waitrose as waitrose amber ale. aroma is bitter hops, weak mals and fruits. taste is really nice smooth hops, hay and fruit. really nice.

Clear 500ml bottle, best before Feb 09, drank in Aug 08. The label claims it is a ’Pale Ale’. Poured into a straight pint sleeve glass. Light amber in colour, with a good foam blanket of white bubbles sat on top. Slight haze, but not cloudly. Aroma of candy-floss, but not sickly, just sweet. There is some vanilla in there, but not sure I’d have picked that up without the label leading me to it! The taste is sweet as well, but a bitterness fights back as you sip the beer and it becomes harsher as the beer warms in the mouth and throat. There is a good hop presence too. The beer has a drying effect on your mouth, and it made me burp a bit, so plenty of carbonisation I suppose. Can’t call it refreshing, but it is a decent beer and one with a different feel and taste to it compared with most other British Brews.
5.0% gold colour with a good head, malt and vanilla aroma, vanilla and hop taste, nice beer.
23rd May 2008. Very smooth ale - has an almost silky feel. The slight hoppyness is nicely offset by the distinct vanilla streak. Dry finish with a touch of hop bitterness.

Biggish offwhite lasting head. Coppery body with light carbonation. Sugary perfumy vanilla fudge aroma, vaguely artificial, with spicy notes. Dry caramel and intense artificial vanilla taste with roasty metallic notes. Unfresh, artificial palate. Mid-bodied. Buttery mouthfeel. Dry metallic roasty wooden aftertaste. Interesting but flawed because unbalanced and artificial. (0.5l bottle, Tesco, London.)

Borostyánszínű, enyhén opálos, tölgyfahordóban érlelt, 5% alkoholtartalmú ale a Burton upon Trent-i Marston’s Brewery-ből. Ízében először mintha egy kis vadmeggy is feltűnne, majd egy igen határozott, de lágy, bársonyos vaníliás-szegfűszeges íz kerül előtérbe. Végezetül igen határozott keserűséggel búcsúzik. És mindez egy kortyon belül! A sörészet egyik (kisebb) csodája.

Bottle from Booths, Media City. Pale yellow with a thin head. With its citric hints and a nod to a pale ale in texture, as well as its low carbonation this slightly more of an ale than a lager, and just about decent enough to enjoy.
Broughton Organic Lager from Booths, Keswick. Pale straw coloured with toffee, grassy and citrus flavours followed by a bitter-sweet pine finish.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl, couleur blonde mousse moyenne tout comme l’effervescence, en bouche attaque sur les houblons amers et très citronnés vraiment agréable pour les fortes chaleurs.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Blonde claire légère. Nez plutôt plat mais au palais, on reconnaît des arômes de houblons discrets, de fruits jaunes. Bel équilibre.

Bottle at the Doric Arms, Edinburgh on 16 May. Poured a clear, pale golden colour, with a thin white head. Aroma was fairly light, with some bready malt and peppery hop. Some grassy hop flavours, with sponge cake and herbs. Finish was lager malt, corn and hay.
330ml bottle from Sainsburys (labelled ’Broughton Organic Lager’). Very pleasant and refreshing lager. Clean taste with a light malt sweetness and not overly bitter from the hops.
Bottle at the White Lady. Looks like a lager should look. Tastes like a lager should taste. OK.
330ml bottle at Pot Still, Glasgow (as Broughton Organic Lager) - clear yellow, thin white head, pale malty aroma and flavour, bit of green hop, highly carbonated, bittersweet, unusual, refreshing

Bottle at home. Orange amber, ugly bubbly soapy head fades to nothing. Grassy hop aroma. Slightly honeyed palate- bready malts, grass, slight bitterness on the finish. Not bad, not good. Perfectly drinkable.
Bottle from Peckhams. Sweet grasssy aroma. Hazy yellow colour. Sour grassy flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Not great.
330 ml bottle. Clear yellow beer with white head. Aroma of corn, grain and light yeast. Taste bready, yeastie, corny and malt.
Coriander, mead, wheat in aroma. Light pale color, clear with small white head. Wheat, spicy. Light body, high carbonation, sharp.

the aroma is fruity and herbal with hints of citrus peel, yeast, coriander and some other spicy grasses... the taste is fruity and floral with notes of citrus peel, yeast, coriander, candy and spicy herbs... sweet, tart and dry aftertaste...
Fles 33cl in Pénestin als Mater Biere Blanche / Wit Bier. Vlak, wat zoetig, weinig uitgesproken. Licht tarwe. (7-2012).

Bottle from World Beer Market (Sake no Taniguchi). Thin yeasty and estery nose, with some banana, light citrus, and a tiny coriander note. Hazy pale yellow color, with a very fine-bead white head. Light wheatiness, some grass, and a little touch of citrus. Thin body. Not much pizzazz here. Overall, quite tame but drinkable.

Bottled, as Roman Mater, courtesy of and shared with heavy. Murky golden body, small white head. Aroma... Coriander, apple, doughy, phenolic touches. Perfumey. Prickly, huge coriande, bit citric, dry, slightly tart, slightly lactic. Tasty light wit.
Tap. Cloudy orange, huge white head. Nice esters on nose. Banana. Citrus. Spice. Light to medium body. Medium dry taste. Very fruity. Delicious. Perfect sample of the style.
bottle pale cloudy medium head cereal light spicy dry chiara torbida schiuma media media persistenza cereale speziatura leggera secca

Bottled 250ml. -from www.beershop.hr Hazy yellow coloured, medium sized white head, pure coriander in the nose. Again strong coriander, slightly fruity and notes of vegetables with touch of spices in the finish. Bit one-dimensional but ok.

Hazy golden blonde coloured body with a smallish, single centimetre tall pure white head. Aroma of corn, grain, light yeast, bread, coriander seed and a bit of funky stale sugar. Medium-bodied; Assertive funky, bready, yeastie, corn-y and stale malt dominate this one with a very overtly funky flavour that doesn’t show spice, but does show an odd malt element and little else - some light sugars and a bit of yeast, but that’s it. Aftertaste shows more of the same with some light coriander seed and perhaps a bit of curacao or full oranges, but nothing great. Overall, a pretty bad beer that doesn’t show well and has very funky flavours. Sadly, that said - I’m glad I sampled this and will never have it again, but i’m not happy that I carted this thing across the Atlantic when much better options were easily found, but I am happy that it was just a 25cL bottle. I sampled this 25 cL bottle purchased from Beer Mania in Bruxelles, Belgium on 19-August-2013 for €1,99 sampled at home in Washington on 14-September-2016 after lugging this thing across the pond.
At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, clear deepish yellow color, aroma of honey and something chemical, honey malty flavor and quite sweet. Not too good.
Bottle sample at a tasting Thanks Tom. Hazy pale golden, small head. Skunky aroma. Sweetish, honey, vegetal, grains, oxidized. Light-bodied.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom L's place. Thanks Tom L. Golden. Vegetables, DMS, graininess, sweet, slightly bitterish finish, light-bodied.
Pours yellow with a small head, aroma of grain, diacetyl, flavor is bitter with grain, malt, medium bodied
500ml bottle (Moscow). Clear yellow color. Small size, white head, stays. Malty, caramel, sweet and some corn in aroma. Malty, sweet, buttery, caramel in taste. Sweet and fizzy aftertaste. Happens.
very pale light uninteresting with white head. nothing much to say just another bulky piss

Bottle... Lightly hazed golden lager with a small, wispy, then creamy, white head. Excellent retention. Lactic, beefy and biscuity aroma. Fairly well-balanced flavor; medium sweetness and moderate, metallic bitterness. Medium-bodied with medium carbonation. Lengthy, bitter-sweet finish.
Earthy aroma. Cloudy honey gold pour with ample foamy white head. Grain and honey in the body with a grainy burn on the way down.
Aroma is grassy straw. Taste is similar a decent body with easy going though nothing special.
sweet honey, corn, grain aroma. hazy gold with a large frothy white head. vigorous lacing. medium bodied. sweet flavor using pale malts. palate is pretty boring. clean finish. cool "thermo-sign".
Deep copper/red color, medium fluffy head. Aroma of alcohol, fruits and caramel malts. Taste is rather sweet and alcoholic with hints of warm milk. Top 10 malt liquor.

Pours dark copper, some beige foam on top. Lots of sweet caramel in the nose, caramel jam. Taste is heavy, sweet but not really cloying, just heavy. Hops are coming out in the finish. Sweet wavy hoppy Oktoberfest beer, I can imagine this style to be a predecessor for IPA styles according to old stories (if I remember them correctly that is).

Bottle. Red brown with off white head and decent lacing. Strong caramel and biscuit aromas with baked apple and grassy notes. On the sweetener side, but not over powering and has a slight dryness in the finish. Slight sticky feel. Tasty Oktoberfest offering.

Pours chestnut with a slight head with nearly no lacing. Aroma is plum and a hint of toffee. Taste is sweet raisin that adds a smidge of cinnamon. Aftertaste is smooth and without hoppiness. A great marzen, one of the best around.

bottle. deep amber with one finger head. somehow i've missed this one the last several years, so i was excited to pick this one up given the very high ratings. strongly malty body with sweet caramel and toffee. toasty, a bit of dark fruit. surprisingly underhopped for the style. was a bit underwhelmed -- it's just a beer, and doesn't have a lot of marzen character.

Bottle undated. Deep unfiltered garnet. Fat cap of custard foam holds well. Sloppy aroma of concord grape jelly, wet dark break, concrete, raisin, Twizzlers candy, molasses, and cola. Hints of DMS and chalky roast. Soft carbonation. Full bodied. Initially fuzzy and heavily sugary, with faint DMS swirled with cola-like sugars and strong concord jelly notes. Starchy malt and unrefined wet bread flavors unfold amid sharper char notes which dispel any malt purity that might arise. Clash of roast and sugar, along with the unchecked esters of rum-soaked plums which reach medicinal levels, only add unnecessary girth to the overcrowded body. Alcohol punishes the tongue as the sugars continually escalate. Candy apple notes and papery malt exacerbate the impurities, and the malt is one dimensional, overly kilned and sharp with zero nuance or texture. Wet and incessantly sugary finish is medicinal and tangy, with plums and candy apples lingering alongside fuzzy DMS notes. Upon first whiff this had "drain pour" written all over it, and sure enough in the mouth it’s all sugar and the obligatory malt purity is nowhere to be found. Hardly a märzen, but even by bock standards, which this certainly is stylistically closer to, this is severely under attenuated and just really difficult to stomach. An aimless monstrosity.

Bottle. Deep amber/light brown body. Frothy, light beige head, lasting. Aroma of caramel, toasted grain, candy sugar, overripe dark fruit. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/lightly sticky texture, lively carbonation. A dark, malty beer. Taste of roast, caramel, toffee. Light plastic and raw graininess in the finish. Unlike any fest beer I've had. The roast really throws this off. And then there's untamed sweetness that lasts through the finish.

Brown liquid with a hint of orange when held to the light. Moderate sized light tan colored head. Sweet grainy scents, with some dark corn syrup and sorghum. Smells a bit more like a hearty brown ale than a clean Oktoberfest. Sweet flavors from the start with some prunes and dark fruit. Herbal/woody bitterness. Not much of an Oktoberfest and too sweet and nearly cloying to be a crisp fall quaff.

12oz bottle pours a clear dark amber/brown with a large khaki head. Aroma is very fruity berries, strawberries and raspberries, with underlying caramel and toffee malt. Very fruity flavors similar to aroma with caramel and toffee malts light hop and yeast on the finish.

Twelve ounce bottle from Party Town, tasted on September 29, 2017. Dark amber color, good toasted malt aroma, pungent malty taste--maybe a bit too pungent but a good beer overall. Not quite worth the $11.99 six pack price but relatively few beers are.

On tap at Ellyn's Tap & Grill in Glen Ellyn, IL. served as a 5 oz. taster showing a clear, brown/amber color, with a presentable layer of light tan froth that reduced to a persistent ring, with ribbons & spots of lacing. The nose was toasted, almost roasted, touches of cocoa & vanilla, and caramel & toffee sweetness. The taste was similar, better than medium bodied, with good carbonation, a roasted & earthy bitterness that lingered, and slightly parched on the finish. Not so much a Marzen, but I appreciated the subtle warmth and bold nature.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a lightly cloudy golden orange colour with tiny white head. Aroma is banana, light clove and lemon. Flavour is lots of banana, clove/coriander and light lemon. Light carbonation. Solid.
Sample at Atlantic Beer Festival Moncton. Cloudy pale yellow color, massive off white head. Aroma of medicinal lemon. Taste has banana and lemon.

Draft at brewpub. About a finger of white head. Appearance is an unfiltered yellow/orange. Smell is bananas, wheat and citrus, but the lemon garnish masks the smell some. Taste is banana, lemon and wheat. Very zesty. Palate is medium with lots of carbonation. Otherall, tangy.
Hazy orange, thin to no head. Sweet mango and banana flavour with a serious banana aroma.

My Bottom Line: Honeyed bananas are bothered by green peppers in this sweet and muddled Weizen. Further Personal Perceptions: -A ring of foam surrounds the opaque beige yellow. -Wheat stands out by doesn’t work that well with the ample residual sugars (for the style). -The mouthfeel is not that refreshing due to these dextrins. -Herbal hops are tasted alongside these green peppers. On tap at Artisan Café and Brewpub, in Dalhousie
Had it at the BArnyard BBQ . Lots of citrus taste, You can also taste the wheat. Very good taste, Very good looking. Left me very satisfied.

On tap at the brewpub (they listed their seasonal as a wheat beer... I’m assuming it’s this one). Nice, orange color, quite hazy, with a small head and no lacing. Very nice aroma... the wheat is there, but citrus as well and something else pleasant that I can’t distinguish. Smooth on the palate - nice carbonation. Flavor fell a little short of what I expected, but it’s still a fairly good wheat beer whose flavor doesn’t diminish too quickly.

The other seasonal available at the brewhouse (the first being the Oktoberfest)-- and this is the better choice IMHO. On the board, this is titled "Weizen Wheat". It appears as a deep bronzy golden, hazy, with a big dense white head leving plenty of lace. Huge estery banana and spice aroma. The palate is bursting with estery wheatiness, banana, cloves-- all the things you look forward to in an excellent hefe. This beer was the standout of the night by a longshot!
cloudy, tan appearance. notes of banana, coconut and strong citrus flavours. distinct sour flavour as well.
On tap a the pub... Aroma:light wheat banana nose... Appearance:Light hazy yellow,small head.. Flavor:Light wheat,light chemical flavor...

On tap at The Brewer’s Art, pours a hazy blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out crisp crackery malt. Flavour is crisp, with dry hopping, crisp crackery malt and a bit of Belgian yeast. Crisp and nicely made.
Can at in laws watching Christmas things. Richer golden pour. Nose is fruity and strong yeast. Tastes of florals, banana, coriander, Belgian yeast. Medium bodied. Nice change of pace.
On tap at The Brewer’s Art. Pours a clear yellow gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is clove, banana, yeast. Medium body, spice, clove, banana, pure sugar, dry finish, good.
Can from Greg g. Nose is grass and spicy hop. Golden body is smooth. A good strong ale with hip acridness at end. Cereal and sugars smooth it out a bit. Pretty tasty.

Best by May 8th 2017. It pours a pale gold with an inch and receding head of foam. Smells of kind of spicy hops, sweet and grainy malt. The taste is nice. Grain with an ample off setting spicy hop character and some sweet notes. A very tasty Golden Ale that’s very easy to drink and doesn’t suffer from a thin body.
Can from total wine. Clear golden with tiny white head. Aroma of grasses, glue, floral hops. Taste is lavender, grasses, hibiscus. Decent. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at brewers art in Baltimore with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Gold with small white head, served in goblet. Light grain sweet nose, some funk. Light and sweet flavor, crisp, alcohol well hidden. Thin, medium body.
Served on tap at Brewers Art. Slight haze golden color with a white head. Citrus grain Belgium yeast. Citrus Belgium yeast flavor. Medium body. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled on draft at the brewpub this beer poured a dark yellow-gold color with a small off-white head that faded and left no lacing. The aroma was dryish, perfumey and a bit chalky. The flavor was dry, bitter, perfumey and medicinal. Long finish. Medium body. Disappointing.

Yellow color with a sticky white head. Candy sugar, pear and a hint of earth. Fruity esters, lemon, bitter orange peel, candi sugar sweetness, and a light, almost wheaty malt profile. The alcohol is well hidden. Decent Belgian golden.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle and pours a hazy orange color with minimal off white fizzy head. Aroma has medium notes of esters and some alcohol. Flavor has notes of fusel alcohol, and esters. It finishes with a thin ester alcoholic note. Mouthfeel medium. Overall below average not sure if i would drink this again.
Sampler in charleston, another barely subpar tripel. Yey. Bready and fiercely carbonated. No major flaws
Cast at Max’s Belgian beer fest. Cloudy yellow. Mildly hoppy, straw, lemon, pepper. Not bad.

On draught at the brewpub. Pours a clear pale golden color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily. Rings of lacing. Vinous aroma with notes of yeast and malt. Medium body with flavors of tart fruit, yeast, malt and spice. The finish is fruity with a lingering tart aftertaste. Good all around.
Draft. Pours golden with a white head. Flavor is very sweet with a bit of spiciness, but overall bland. The alcohol is hidden very well.

Probably the third or fourth tripel I’ve tried called Cerberus. (get original). Pours a clear yellow with a thin white head that leaves very good lacing. I’m conflicted by the nose. It is complex and interesting, but not the nose of a tripel: Big white wine and champagne, massive chardonnay grapes, some fusel alcohol, big artifical candies in the nose, Jagermeister, licorice or something in the nose (help me out here), dried light fruits, marachino cherries, overly sweet cherry frosting. Taste is white wine, champagne, vinous, tart and boozy. Misses a bunch of tripel notes I’d like to see. Unreal how much this tastes like white wine. It’s really cool but not what a tripel is about. If they soured this and aged it in oak- you could get something out of this world.

Straight from the tap at Brewer’s Art &#40the greatest bar ever&#41. Looks like a typical Tripel. Big fluffy head, golden body. Smells like malt, spiciness too. Flavor is a little less in your face than most Tripels. That being said, this beer goes down SMOOTH for 9.5% Could be a session beer, but you’d be on your ass sooner, rather than later.

I was able to sample this on cask at Max’s Taphouse during Max’s Belgian Fest. Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head. Smells grassy, a tad herby with a touch of clove. Flavor is astringent with grassy hops, some light candy and plenty of Belgian yeast. Chalky on the end with no hint of the alcohol. Eh.

On cask at Max’s Belgian Fest: Pours a hazy deep goldenrod with a spotty-lacing white head. Aroma of lightly sweet biscuity pale Belgian malt with lots of earthy grassy character and some bittering sulfur. Starts with a light caramely sweetness and earthy bittering hops before a drier bittersweet finish. Not much of a tripel, but an interesting brew nonetheless.

Draught in a small chalice at the brewpub. Straw yellow without much of a head (they did pour it almost to the rim though...). Not a huge aroma, but a nice spicy, herbal hops note, with a touch of pale malt and light fruity yeast character. The flavor is dry and hoppy, with light malt and yeast. Fruity hints of banana and grape. Medium bodied with crisp carbonation. Simple and dangerously smooth and drinkable. I could session this, but that would be a short session indeed.
Clear with white head not persistent. Light cereal aroma, light sweet and watery.

Pils di colore giallo spento, scarico...schiuma presente...olfatto maltato con finale amaro poco persistente, dopo l’assaggio risulta watery, con un finale amaro poco pulito e piacevole...non indimenticabile...
bottle, 033. Cloudy amber colour, white foam I have bought this beer @ the spluga brewery...and...DISGUSTING! Very acid, it wasn’t conserved in the correct way. bad!
chiara schiuma abbondante e persistente sentori maltati miele leggero floreale ma non intensa in bocca abbsastanza delicata sentore maltati poi leggero amaro che risalta più nel retrogusto

Draught at the brewpub, 2007-07-14, 8-4-7-4-15=38 First batch tasted. Hazy bond color; huge head. Excellent hop aroma. Medium body strength, some malt flavor, some residual sweetness, with a respectable ending bitterness, growing at the end, possibly with a light grapefruit fruitness and bitterness. Second batch tasted. The aroma takes some time to develop, revealing good Saaz; the flavor is better, smooth, quite malty, and the mix with the bitterness is well done; there is also a touch of honey. Draught at the brewpub, 2002-09-09, 5-3-4-2-12=26 Amber colour, hazy. Pretty simple aroma and taste. Ordinary palate, a bit aromatic. The dangers of brewing with malt extracts…

Bottled 0,50L. Yellow pale color, much clear, hazy one and veiled. Optimal and fine fizz. Unusually clear, nearly fluorescent color. Abundant and voluminous head, good persistence. Fresh aroma with clear notes of stum, cereal’s juice, yeast, wheat, lemon and malt. Extremely sour and acid taste with nearly absent alcohol and bitter content.

Draught at the brewpub, 2007-07-14, 7-4-7-3-15=36 Cloudy orange to light amber color; big creamy head. Very nice aroma, mixing together malt, hop, spices, light banana. The mouthfeel is medium-light, fresh, with a good mix of flavors, light citrus fruits too, and respectable ending bitterness. Draught at the brewpub, 2002-09-09, 6-4-5-2-13=30 Amber colour. Thick head, nice lace. Nice spicy aroma, banana. Quite nice body, good balance of malt sweetness, bitterness, spicy character; a bit citrusy, and some banana. Maybe the few grains add some body, compared to the other beers of the same brewery.

Draught at the brewpub, 2007-07-14, 6-4-6-3-12=31 Hazy amber color. Light malt and perfumy aroma. Good body structure, light sweet caramel flavor, but also a light sourness. Draught at the brewpub, 2002-09-09, 6-3-5-2-13=29 Amber colour. Pretty strong hop and honey aroma. Light body, but clear honey character. Ordinary palate, just some hop. Unluckly the honeyish character reminds me too much an old lager.
For a light beer this one was actually very good. Pours a golden color with almost no head, very smooth and drinkable, not to carbonated.
Sampled @ Salem Beer Works with the Mad_Indian. Pours pale goldenwith a small white head. Aroma is slightly sweet pale malts. The flavor is slightly sweet, with mild traces of bitterness, and thin.
Sampled with Stegosaurus during our second Boston Tour. Served at salem location. Golden pour thin in body and thinin taste. Watery but not the worst light beer in the world.
Pretty much right down the middle light beer. This pale ale offers the basic aromas and palate of malt and hops. The finish is crisp.
on tap-pours a white head and straw color. Aroma is sweet grain. Taste is sweet grain, secondary light hops. Nice light beer. OK carbonation.

On tap at BeerWorks Fenway, 7/2/2005. Listed as "Millar Lite" but I can’t imagine that was much different than their generic brewpub light lager. Appears a golden-straw, very light-toned, with a lightly foamy/bubbly film on the top. Moderate amount of bubbles rising. Aroma has some light soap and sugar, hints of lager yeast and a touch of sweet corn. Flavor begins with a clean, dry pale malt, not exactly honey-sweet, but decidedly clean and inoffensive. Body, for a light lager, was respectable, being crisp and refreshing, not heavy or sluggish and not overcarbonated. Little variation from sip to sip, but no stale or adjuncty flavors on the finish. Perhaps a bit of salt and seltzer water suggestions, but mainly just pale grains. No one expected much out of this one, but everyone was impressed. But then, I knew Jodie is a talented brewer, so I’m not surprised afterall. Why don’t they just call it Mueller Lite?
A decent light with some hoppyness to it. This is the one I would order after having a few of his bigger cousins.

On tap at the Salem Beer Works. Yellow, yellow, yellow color with a thin head. The beer itself is ok, but there’s a wonderful, fully malty aftertaste that slides into your senses long after the sip is gone.
on tap, fenway location during World Series Game ... I LOVE THIS BEER. why? beacause it is so fuckin easy to drink. tatse crisp and refreshing with wheaty finish... a wonderful sesiion beer.
Sampled this during World Series Game 1, across from Fenway. Aroma is like white wine. A pretty drinkable round, but certainly not heavy. I like it, for a low carber.

Draught @ Fenway Location: This one pours a clear, paler yellow color. There was a small white head that didn’t leave much (if any) lacing. Lighter nose. Some malts and grassiness. The taste was a bit lighter too, but not bad.Some malts, hint of grain and a hint of hops. Very drinkable, but non-descript.

From tap at the Fenway location. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is light cornish and slight grassy. Bitter, toastred malty and grassy to light cornish finish. Ends dry and bitter.

A: The beer pours an extremely pale yellow color with a small white head. S: The aroma is very sweet, far more than expected for a Helles. Definitely a bit of corn and straw. Maybe a bit of grass and bread in there, too. Not much aroma to this. T: Similar to the aroma in terms of flavor. It’s a bit watery and very light bread/malt and just little hop flavor. There’s a touch of corn and straw, maybe some grass and a faint bitterness. M: Light in body with low to medium carbonation. O: I enjoy a good Helles, but this was not one of those.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté à l’établissement de Canal Street (Boston, MA). Arôme: Légère odeur de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde. Présence d’un mince col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe de miel. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. (Rating #3676)

Draught pint at Fenway on 5/25/07 I’ll admit to not knowing this was supposed to be a helles and knowing that now, I’m a little less impressed. Dosent have nearly the malt flavor or yeast character I would expect. Rather, it’s quite dry and attenuated with a floral hop aroma and flavor that seems more like EKGs than any more exciting German hop. Still, taken as a session blonde ale (or lager, as they say), the crispness is there, with a little bit of yeast bite (though I never once mistook this for a real munich yeast). Some light honey, a bit of seltzer water (lots of carbonation) and light toastiness on the finish. Clear, pale-gold body with a small white head that shows moderate retention and little/no lacing. More like DAB (so I guess it works as a dortmunder).
Smells fruity, tastes fruity. Small head, goldenrod almost orange color. A little bit of a yeasty aftertast.
Light golden in color with a small white head. aroma of butter and bready malt. Flavors of butter and floral hops with a crisp malt character. Finishes dry and crisp.
Some body, but still very light appearing and tasting. There's a hint of sweetness in the aroma, but an odd titch of astringency in the mouth.
Draft. Dark amber color. Very thin tasting and not much else to it. The best thing about it is it's appearance.
On tap in Salem, labled Marblehead Mild. Deep amber with a thin head, sweet malty aroma, funky sweet aftertaste, light bodied.
Deep amber in color with a small white head.Sweet and malty,with virtually no hop presented.
nice dark bready mild. underhopped and a pleasantly sweet caramel malt flavour comes through.
Dark in color, with a creamy taste. i liked this one a lot. although, i only tried the sampler.

Cask version: This was a lot different than the kegged version, and I generally agree with Nutfield, that it was a much creamier and smoother beer. However, the drastic temperature difference between the two might make it hard to make a complete side by side comparison (cask beers generally being warm). Keg version: Good as far as mild's go I suppose, something which my lower than normal rating might reflect. I find it hard to objectively judge styles that I generally don't care for though. My suggestion is to try it yourself, perhaps do what I did and get it in a 4oz sampler. (keg rating 3.0)

Cask version: It was nice to have this side-by-side with the non-cask version: there ARE differences between these two. Much smoother, creamier, with a frothy and substantial head. Although, the carbonation is too intrusive here. Still, some nice flavors emerging (as with the non-cask Mild). Keg version: Little aroma (true to form for a mild) but on tasting there's something nice going on here. I wouldn't call it maltiness, but there are caramel overtones. Served too cold. Hint of red in the color. Keg rating 2.7

12 oz. draft. After many years of passing up this beer I finally order it. Not surprised. Not much on the nose, slight toasted malt. Malts are toffee and toasted flavors. Hops are subtle and lean on fruit. Lighter / watery body and texture. A completely out dated style of beer.

From tap at the brewery. Clear reddish copper color with light beige head. Malty and light hoppy aroma, caramel, bread, grass. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Aroma is grainy malt with light caramel notes. Pours Amber with lace halo. Taste is medium sweet to bitter. Palate is medium bodied thin to medium bodied, slick texture sweet finish. I prefer the porter. A6 App4 T7 P4 O13 = 3.4
On tap at Beer Works Fenway Park. Decent sweetish malt decent hops. Clean but with some character. Fine.
Draft at BEERWORKS No. 1 Fenway in Boston, MA. Dark amber color with a small off-white head. Sweet malt flavor with a light smoky finish. Clean. Smooth. Alcohol warmth.
[2/2/17] Draught at Boston Beer Works Canal Street in Boston. Clear amber. Malt, caramel, toasty hint, sweetish, bitterish hops finish.
