Pours a good copper with a small white head that coats the glass quite intensively. Nose is of roasted and toasted cereals. Taste is more cereals and lightly earthy. Gently bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation. OK

On tap on the premise [Canal St] Pours copper with low-medium off-white head, good lacing. Aroma is of caramel, malts. Taste is of bitterness, earth, caramel, malts. Palate: Medium-full body. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Good, malty.

on tap on the premises - canal st. boston. clear dark golden, red tint, with a small white cap offering some retention and lacing. toasted red maltiness, tobacco, specialty maltiness - sweetish, grassiness, minerals, clean yeast action. moderate carbonation, light body - oily ; semi-sweet spicy finish. just slightly under-attenuated but a pretty nice red ale.

Draft at Canal Street. Lightly hazed amber body with small off-white head. Aroma is medium sweet, caramel, orange, light spicy. Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, orange, light spicy. Light-medium body, light resin.

A cloudy mid orange coloured beer with a thick white head. A light wheat beer aroma, clove spice and banana with a hint of grassy hop. Dry mouthfeel. A dry wheats flavour, with the expected clove and banana, but again, a tart, zesty hop element comes through adding a refreshing taste to the finish. Draught @ Gröninger Braukeller, Hamburg.
On tap at the brewpub. Trübes dunkel orange gelbes Bier mit einer schönen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch leicht bananig, Nelke, leicht hefig. Geschmack würzig malzig, Nelke, bitter im Abgang.
From tap at the brewpub. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of oranges, wheat, yeast, spice and banana.
nice fresh koriander aroma,orange, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice weiss finish.

A nice hefe @Gröninger. Golden coloured and unclear. Has a white head, medium duration. Spicy, apples, sweet aroma. Flavor starts sweet, more spicy notes. LIght acid and finish. Light astringent and harmonic.

Draught @ Groninger Braukeller, Hamburg. Pours hazy light burnt orange with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, light sweet fruit. Flavor is wheat, yeast, sweet fruity, light tartness, mild lemon. Medium body, lively carbonation. 311014

31.07.2014, tap @ Gröninger Braukeller, Hamburg: Nice slightly fizzy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sour-ish fruity, wheat, butterscotch, winegum, broth, yeast, grass, hay, almonds, dried fruits. Taste is slightly sour-ish grainy, wheat, yeast, dried fruits, grass, banana, weeds, hay, cereal, almond. Little bitterness, harsh mouthfeel. Meh!

Draught at Gröninger Braukeller. Hazy orange coloured with a medium sized off-white head. Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel with notes of spices and bananas. Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, bananas and hops with notes of spices. Spicy finish.
Mittelstarker herber Beginn, wenig hefig. Kaum süß, dumpf, langweilig. Auch zum Ende kaum spritzig, laff, lieblos. 9/7/6/6//7
Tap @ Gröninger Braukeller, Hamburg. Hazy orange with a big and lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. Soft. 011212

Das bernsteinfarbene Bier, das sich aus der Flasche ergießt, ist sicher kein Pils. Ein gutes Halbdunkles oder WIener Lager. Eigentlich ein gutes Bier, aber aufgrund der falschen Bezeichung nur mittelmäßige Punkte.
On tap at the pub in Hamburg. Deep cloudy amber, white foam. Soft, quite malty, bready, sweet with a mild noble hop. Not really a classic German pils. Low to medium carb. Pleasant enough.
Vom Fass. Hellbraunes Bier, cremiger Schaum. Kaum Aroma. Im Geschmack Malz und etwas Nüsse, die auch länger bleiben. Süffig, aber flach. Und ich habe keine Ahnung, warum das Bier „Pils“ heist.

Farbe: Kupfer, klar. Schaum fein, dicht, eher beständig. Nase: riecht wie es aussieht. Leicht geröstetes Getreide, leicht malzig, bitter Geschmack: eher bitter im Mund und auch Nachgeschmack, aber im Gegensatz zu einem 0815 pils eher schaumig im Abgang, röstaromen jetzt deutlicher mit getreidemalz. Jo ganz gut, kernig aber nicht störend eckig.

Tap at the brewpub - hazy copper color, white head. good lacing. bit hoppy, floral, good malty body, red malts, medium sweet, low carbonation. finishes medium dry. really good to drink, even though far closer to an amber lager than to a Pils as advertised.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung). Ordentlich gebraut, nicht so herb, wie eigentlich aus Hamburg erwartet.

Bottle. Copper coloured with a nice white head. Aroma is mildly fruity-hoppy. Taste is caramell, nuts, malts, raisins and something I cant put my finger on, maybe chestnut? Pretty sweet and unusual for a Pils...Low bitterness in the aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. Quite interesting but Im not totally convinced.

Bottle from supermarket in Schwerin. Light brown head. Amber color. Caramel aroma (IN A PILS)! The caramel also present in the taste with typical caramel sweetness blended with light roasted malts. Low bitterness. This is probably a wrong labeled bottle, perhaps a dunkle?
On tap at the brewpub. Bready malty smell. Similar taste, light toasty. Clean and drinkable but nothing special.
Pours hazy, copper, surprising since it’s simply announced as a pils. A nice caramel roasty smell and taste, well balanced. Some salt.
Clear to gold with suds of head. Dry straw aroma and taste. Notes: On tap at the brewery during the Epic Vegas Brewery Tour of ’17

A hazed blonde pilsner with a thin white head. In aroma, light chalky malt with light mineral notes, grassy hops, OK. In mouth, a nice sweet malt with light grassy hops, light mineral notes, inoffensive. On tap at brewery.

Transfer from BA review on 6-14-13- Served on tap in a 20 oz mug Appearance – The beer is served a medium golden color with a two finger white head. The head fades relatively quickly leaving only a light level of lace on the sides of the glass. Smell – The aroma is heaviest of a bready and caramel smell mixed with a very light grassy hop smell. Taste – The taste begins with a malty and slightly sweet flavor of caramel. As the flavor advances the caramel sweetness fades slightly with a bit of the grassy and citrus hop coming to the tongue. In the end a crisp and clean flavor is left to linger on the tongue. Mouthfeel-The body of the beer is on the thinner to medium side for a lager of its strength with a carbonation level that is normal to slightly above average. Both are quite nice for making one easy drinking brew. Overall- A refreshing and rather easy drinking pale lager.
Draft at the source. Hazy pale yellow color, white head. Aroma of light straw. Taste is mild lemon.
Yellow pour with creamy white head and lace. An almost sulphur aroma dominates. Flat paper after a slightly sweet start. Thin bodied and fizzy.

Tap. Pale gold lager. Hugs rim. Has a light hops aroma, not much else. Same goes for flavor. this beer came and went with little impression left. VERY light, with a flat finish. Not bitter, sweet, but indistinguishable, with a 5-second fade. Like a light brand name beer. Eh. Whatever.

Date: July 03, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear gold, fine white head, patterned lace Aroma: light cereal aroma with light floral hops Flavor: sweet malt flavor, well bittered with floral hops, light bitter finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.5/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: *4
Pours yellow wit a thin white head. Smells and tastes skunky and chewy sweet with some non-descript hop notes on the finish.
on tap-pours a retaining thin white head and slightly hazy yellow color. Aroma is sweet grain, secondary lemon/spice hops. Taste is sweet grain-some caramel, slight spice hops. Light body.
This beer is a real piece of crap. Very little head, not enough carbination for a lager. Some crazy bubble gum taste. it just blows. I would rather have a bud light on draft any day.

On tap at Yardbird at the Venetian Casino in Las Vegas on 10 October 2017. Deep copper toffee colour with a puffy beige head. Smells malty and there is plenty of malt in the flavour as well. Bready flavour with vanilla and caramel aftertaste.
Copper color with a white head. Clean toast malty aroma and taste. Notes: On tap at the brewery during the Epic Vegas Brewery Tour of ’17

A lightly hazed amber marzen with a thin off white head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with light solvent notes, nail polish. In mouth, a rather sweet watery caramel malt with faint hops, light mineral notes, boring.

Transfer from BA review on 6-14-13- Served on tap in a 20 oz mug Appearance – The beer is served a nice copper color with a one finger off white head. The head fades over a moderate amount of time leaving a lighter level of lace on the sides of the glass. Smell – The aroma is bready and sweet with lots of caramel and toffee aromas as well as a little bit of a light fruit aroma of apple and a little bit of grassy hop. Taste – The taste begins big of caramel malt mixed with some lighter grainy and more mildly toasted bready tastes. The caramel remains strong throughout the taste and is joined by some fruitiness. Toward the end a more floral and grassy hop flavor joins the profile creating a rather sweet but somewhat still balanced flavor to linger on the tongue. Mouthfeel- The body of the beer is average in thickness and has a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side. Both are rather nice for the lightly roasted flavors as well as the sweetness of the brew. Overall- A tasty and rather enjoyable red with a nice enjoyable flavor pallet.
On draught at Barley’s Casino & Brewing Company. Caramel malt aroma. Taste is light caramel malt and a little bit of grassy hops. Nice maltiness.
Draft at the source. Hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma of light straw. Taste is caramel and bubblegum.
Deep copper pour with creamy white head and lace. Caramel malt and earthy hops. Sweet caramel and floral tones on the flavor. Medium bodied and a tad fizzy.
I had this beer on tap at Barley’s in Vegas. basically, it was very light and mediocre. nothing special

Tap. Medium brown/amber. Light head, dissolves quickly. Smells of malty hops, a bit nutty, like it should, baby. Taste is surprisingly fruity and sweet, with a hoppy finish that has undertones of coffee and caramel. Finishes smooth and soft, and has a nice slow fade. Yummy.

Date: July 03, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: clear copper, fine off white head, drippy lace patterns Aroma: sweet bready malt aroma with a touch of butterscotch Flavor: sweet malt flavor, lots of bready character, buttery sweetness, light balancing bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 9/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Drinkability: 6/10 Score: *4

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Draft in Vegas. A black beer with a brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, bread, and caramel, leading to a dry roasted finish.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: A dark brown Schwartz bier with a thin light mocha head. In aroma, light nutty caramel malt with light grassy hops, faint buttery notes. In mouth, a light sweet caramel malt with light nutty notes, watery bodied, faint hops, boring. On tap at brewery.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Transfer from BA review on 6-14-13- Served on tap in a 20 oz mug Appearance – Served a deep brown colored brew with a two finger tan colored head. The head fades relatively quickly leaving only spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. Smell – The aroma is a mix of sweet and roasted malt. The roasted malt smells have hints of chocolate and coffee mixed within with the sweeter smells being of a caramel and light brown sugar aroma. Taste – The taste begins with a sweet roasted malt taste comprised of a mix of roasted barely and caramel. As the flavor advances further the caramel dries a bit with a light more brown sugar like taste coming to the tongue in its place. At this time so to comes some cocoa flavors adding to the more dark flavor profile of the brew. In the end with the sweetness getting lighter a rather crisp and moderately roasted flavor is left to linger on the tongue. Mouthfeel- The body of the beer is on the slightly thinner side for a darker brew with a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side. While not ideal for the more roasted flavors of the brew as it gave it a bit more of a watery feel, it did make for a more refreshing style dark lager and overall worked for the warmer weather in which it was enjoyed. Overall- A little thin and too sweet up front, but it dries out some at the end making for a more crisp and easy drinking black lager. Not bad.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: On draught at Barley’s Casino & Brewing Company. Opaque cola color. Aroma is roasted and caramel malts. Taste is toasted, roasted dark malt with some caramel and biscuit notes. Refreshing.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Draft at the source. Clear deep maroon color, tan edge head. Aroma of lightly toasted brown bread. Taste is sweetish brownies. Not bad.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Brown black pour with no head or lace. Aroma is roasted malt with a hinto chocolate. Sweet roasty malt start earthy hops tones at the end. Medium bodied and fizzy.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: I had this ontap at barley’s casino. Like most of their beers it is very light bodied with muted flavors

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Date: December 02, 2010 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub a nice easy drinking dark beer, chocolate malts and caramel sweetness, low bitterness, a $2 tall pint is a perfect companion to a $4 gambler special breakfast Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: ** /4

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Pours dark brown with an off white head. Smells of rich malt and spicy. Tastes sweet and malty with a nutty finish.

column1: Barleys Casino Black Mountain Dark Lager
column5: Sample at the brewpub. Pours a dark amber-brown color with a thin beige head that dissipates quickly. Spotty lacing. Lightly roasty aroma with mild malt and coffee. Medium body with toasted malt, chocolate and mild hops flavor. The finish is lightly smoky with malt and hops flavors that linger a bit. Somewhere between a Dunkel and Schwarzbier, albeit not a great example of either. Average overall.

A hazed yellow weizen with a thin white head. In aroma, light banana esters with light lemon, and cloves. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light banana and cloves, classic if a bit watery . On tap at brewery.
On draught at barleys / pours cloudy lemonade. Nose of yeast, cloves. Taste is of diluted yeast, cloves, pretty watered down. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at the source. Cloudy pale yellow, white edge head. Aroma of light citrus. Taste is mild banana. Color change, Nevada.
Hazed yellow pour with creamy white head and lace. Banana and clove dominate the aroma. Clove banana and paper with a dry finish,, Light medium bodied and fizzy.
I had this on tap at Barley’s in Vegas. Pale yellow, hazy, the aroma was of a bit of banana and clove, the body and flavor were thin.

Poured from a growler(9 bucks) little or no head with no lacing.Aroma was citrus and yeasty. Taste on lemon and thats about it,Mouthfeel was thin little carbonation with dry finish of citrus. Overall below average for Heffe.

Tap, with lemon that I removed. Looked like cloudy lemon juice, or a Blue Moon, but bartender told me that’s unusual, normally clearer. Rim hugger. Smells of delicate citrus: lemon and orange. Tastes of wheat, fruit and banana bread. A sweet and soft brew with a nice medium finish. A long lingering aftertaste of banana bread makes it very nice, not the usual fare at a brewpub.

Name: Hefeweizen Date: July 03, 2009 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: cloudy light yellow, fine white head, drippy lace Aroma: light sweet banana and clove aroma, lingering lemon from the fruited glass Flavor: light sweet malt flavor, nice wheat character, banana sweetness, light clove, light tartness that could either be the wheat or the last remains of the drive by fruiting Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Drinkability: 8/10 Score: *4

Not a bad hefe considering..... There was a sad presence of some sort of fruit concoction smell that was held in the background. and that was it, the alcohol was quite weak and this watered downed brew did not satisfy that well.

on tap-pours a rich white head that laces and hazy straw color. Aroma is banana, secondary grain/wheat. Taste is banana, secondary grain/wheat, some lemon, pepper. As it warms the pepper turns to clove and comes thru on the nose too.

An unclear orange beer with a beutiful head. It has a citrus/orange aroma and a flavor that is slightly acidic and bitter citrus but balanced with a nice sweetness. It's diferent from other 3-4 grain beers I've had - very refreshing.
Bottle. Dark Red. Very cherry fruity, slightly tart, refreshing, effervescent beer. Dry fruity finish. Very drinkable. (2008)
Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl. @ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, España. A: Dark red / Rojo oscuro. T/S: Cherry, sweet / Cereza, dulce.
Deep reddish amber pour. Soft cherryness mixed with a spicy/bitterness. Very rich.
Tasted@Århus Syd extreme tasting: Purple, red color with very small and light pink head. Aroma is tart. Taste of Marzipan (almond).

Fresh cherries and a slight mustiness in aroma. The flavor is cherries, a tart middle and a slightly sweet finish, all with a mild funkiness. Very good lambic, can’t say there’s anything wrong with this.

355ml bottle poured a deep red color and slightly hazy with almost no head or lacing. Aroma is all cherries. Taste is mostly cherry fruit sweetness and some tartness in the finish. Light body and light carbonation. Just too fruity for my tastes, as I like my fruit beers with just a little essence of fruit.

12oz bottle from Pick’s poured into a shaker. Pours a very dark red with lots of black chunkies. Small bit of white head. Aroma of fresh picked cherries. Not the cough medicine kind, the good kind. Taste is lightly sweet and medium sour. Taste is some nice tart cherries. Light bodied with a sticky texture. Lively carbonation and a long sour finish. Overall, the taste is pretty good. Loses major points for the big black chunks though. It’s good for now, but we’ll see how it affects my stomach tomorrow morning...

Interestingly shaped 355 ml brown bottle. It pours a hazy dark rose color and it STRUGGLES to form a head. The smell is of luden’s, which I enjoy. The flavor is super syrupy and thick with a cherry candy flavor. There is very little carbonation, it just feels like syrup. There are better fruit beers. Serving type: bottle Reviewed on: 03-17-2011 03:24:16

Deep ruddy-tinted amber pour. Thick palate with a soft cherryish sweetness. Nice bright spicy/fruity aroma. Very rich and fruity with a soft spicy backnote. Some light anise and a kiss of light tartness on the back. A bit of fruity sweetness and some nice cherry flavour. Not unlike Quelque Chose but it’s a bit tarter. A little bit of soft malic tartness and some dustiness on the finish.
8th February 2006 Warning! Early amateur rating! Very cherry beer, not sharp at all. Easy to drink but not as spectacular as the Apricot beer from this brewer.
This screams LAGER! Nice golden hue. If you like the malt, this is like chewing on barley. Very good!

Name: Dark River Oatmeal Stout Date: 08/12/2000 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub black, whispy tan head, sweet roasted aroma, rich and creamy texture,rich roasted malt flavor with a touch of chocolaae, hint of bitterness in the finish Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.5/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
I'm not a big stout fan, but this is good stuff. Good old fashioned chocolate color, even in the foamy head. Very coffee. Good beer.
Not named without reason, it's really red! Foamy head that sticks around for the party. Surprisingly hoppy; slightly bitter. Good.
Roast and caramel. Black pour with near explosive head and lacing. Bittersweet end. Good dry porter. Tap at BWI location.

Pours oil black with tan head. Nose bringing about notes of roast, semi-sweet cocoa, oak, coffee and water. Initial burst of dark coffee, roasted malts and barley with a finish of bitter coffee, semi-sweet chocolate and darkened malt. Very dark but somewhere in the finish is a slight acidity and sweetness. Tangy. Lemon maybe? Good dark porter.

SLL Tasting. Pours a dark brown with a one finger tan head and very light lacing. Moderate aroma of chocolate, expresso and medium roasted malt. Tastes of medium roasted malt with a bit of char. Light chocolate and coffee. Slightly sweet. Mildly bitter and sour dough finish. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Delicious and flavorful Porter. Aroma was really good. Strong coffee and roasted malt. Pour was a nice deep rich dark brown/near black with a thin off white ring for a head. Taste was really good for such a low ABV. Strong coffee flavors in the front with a nice bitter roasted malt and hoppy finish. A little chocolate came out as it warmed. Good carbonation.
roasty and woody with pine hop and some chocolate with a bit of earth. how can you screw that up? they didn’t. refreshing foamy zing in the body and a moderate finish morphing cocoa, porter and hops.
Dark brown/black aroma. Chocolate notes finish the body but woody hops actually dominate the palate.
12 oz bottle. Lots of good chewy awesomeness. Some hints of tar and molasses. Worth every penny.
Pours an opaque black with a dense tan head which lingers......aroma of coffee.....taste is smooth beginning, chocolate early fading into coffee and slight bitterness and lingering coffee notes.

Tap. Pours deep reddish black, medium tan creamy head, dissipates slowly, solid lacing. Aroma is roasty with plenty of ashtray and burned malts. Flavor is heavy roast, hints of smoke, burned malts, light plus sweet and light plus bitter, some acidity from the roast. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel. A bit too burned perhaps, but otherwise solid.
More roast grain essence in this vice the SBJ. Semi sweet chocolate and coffee, creamy mouth feel, mild bitter finish.
dark amber..no head..roasty..and a tad toasty..but light and slight...boring..I'm snoring..Used to think much higher..but lately I've been a crier..

on cask at the mission Valley Oggi's. Very dissapointing. The color was a good looking brown but from there the experience went downhill. it was lighter than water in the mouth, no body. The flavor was in the same boat. there was very little to talk about, just a touch of toastiness underneath the water. The bartender described it as "a bit of a lady's drink." well no ladies i would know because those ladies have no taste.

Small polish brewery mad not bad pilsner. It reminds me old times, with that black horse logo. Light gold, white average head. Light malty flavours, soft feel. Maybe a bit to light for pilsner. One of better polish micros.

33cl bottle from Malta. It is a good lager with low co2, but long lasting medium foam. Taste is also OK. Sweet malt, some smoke, some hop and hint of citric yeast. Surprisingly good in its own category.
[Butelka 07.05.2020] Barwa złota, klarowne. Piana średnia, średnio pęcherzykowa. Aromat i smak lagera, słodowo, niewielka goryczka. Nasycenie średnie.
Nice, easy to drink lager. Subtle citrusy aftertaste. Aroma grassy and fresh. Not incredibly challenging
Van tap bij Viva Aviv in Bangkok. Zoet, weeïg, ergens hoptonen, moutig, wat granig, licht klef. (8-12-2018).

light golden ale broasted corn with a malted broom straw and some light vegetation. a little sweet for balance and finishes short and watery after a touch of hop in the fizz. a bit of spring water type freshness.
W pierwszej nucie zadziwiająca nuta migdałowa. Później wychodzi typowa słodowość. W smaku słodowe, z nutami kwaskowymi. Nie smakuje jak typowy eurolager. Jest nawet trochę lepszy.
Wässrig herber Antrunk. Leicht getreidig, die Herbe bleibt konstant. Monoton, erfrischend aber langweilig. Mild würzig. Okay. 6/7/7/7//7
belle couleur blonde légèrement dorée. Col très mince et effemere. Belle effervescence. Gout quelconque.

On draught in Bangkok. Clear yellow with bright white head 1cm thick. Aroma of grass and hay. Tastes grassy but of fresh hops. Not too bad but ultimately too watery and tasteless. So good when really hot and thirsty.

On tap at the Bangkok airport. Aroma has a light malt character with light adjunct and a light hop character of floral and slightly fruity hops along with some grass. No diacetyl or sulfur. Pours a clear, very pale yellow gold with a small, moderately thick white head that recedes to a thin film that lingers. Faint lacing and no legs. Flavor is similar to the aroma, but with a slightly stronger adjunct character. Light bitterness an the hop character is more grassy than it was in the aroma. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall pretty indistinguishable from the regular Singha. I suppose its slightly cleaner and has a better mouthfeel, but otherwise about the same. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

this was the third malt liquor beer i had in thailand...do these boys want to get drunk or what. too thick for this climate imo. slight grainy feel with a bit of alcohol kick. probably the better of the three i had. but that aint saying much.

It is a bit odd really. This is a climate where it is normally always hot and huid. You would therefore expect a demand for cleanly hopped beers with reasonable ABV. Instead we get a lot of these malt liquors (actually the most common alcoholic drinks are undrinkable whiskeys and other offensive spirits). Anyway, off balance and unacceptably coarse.
better than singha, not as good as chang. a simple, well made beer. much smoother than you would expect for a strong malt liquor.

Can bought in Chiang Mai, Thailand. It said it was brewed by the Khon Kaen Brewery which is owned by Boon Rawd. A darker yellow with a slight orange tint. This beer actually has some aroma and flavor, much to my surprise. It had a slight brandy, fruity, sweet and grape aroma and flavor.

Its funny how the name of a small German town is supposed to lend this Lager some sense of quality. It ranks a bit above average in the region, ok, still it cannot compare to real good beer on a global scale.
Golden color, crisp flavour, light grassy aroma, nothing new just another pale lager

Even in Mexico this beer was bad. Bottled 090707. BB4 090109 so it should be in good condition. Bubbly yellow. Soft white sinking head. Sharp nose of grassy hops followed by dirt and a trace of garbage. Flavour makes you ask why you would be Thai beer in a Mexican supermarket! Too sweet and just bad.
this beer is everywhere lately, but it is nothing special, a little strong, and that is it. Somewhat like Canadian stron one.
Bottle: Label reads German Style Beer if that means a slight resemblance to a pils than it’s a decent try. Hoppy and herbal, with citric notes.
Can (330ml) at our two-story-room in Seam Reap (www.Goldenbanana.info) Clear yellow - white head. Citrus, wet hay, straw, white bread, bitter citrus finish.
Golden colour. Light grassy aroma. Grassy-hay taste with a faint hint of malt backing it up. Slightly sour finish.

From the bottle in the Radisson in Bangkok. So what? Perhaps I just wanted to say I was in Thailand. This is probably the closest you will get to a Euro style in this country. Like a lot of beers it is better in its homeland context and so I would consider this to be up there with a good beer of its intended style. Light coloured body with a crisp white head and a distinctive hint of Euro noble hops. Look it is a better attempt than a lot of breweries at this style, Australia included.

Bottle. I had a big bottle of this at the Good View restaurant in Chiang Mai, Thailand. Mittweida was much more common in the North than in Bangkok or the South of Thailand. The lager was light yellow with rising bubbles and a crisp flavor. Better than most, but maybe that is related to its German roots.
500ml bottle in 2016. Pale golden with a thin white head. Fairly standard helles, with a bit of a metallic whiff and thin body.

Aroma; light malts, caramel, grain, grass. Look; offwhite head, clear golden body. Taste; pale malts, leaves, caramel, grain, grass, and finishes malted. Feel; ok body n co². Overall; standard macro. [btl @im hauslicher Umgebung] 43438

Bottle picked up from Rewe Getränkemarkt, Zolling and consumed at home Attenkirchen, Bavaria, Thursday 28th March 2019 whilst cooking a German version of 'Toad in the Hole' and listening to Parquet Courts. Pours gold with a white head, good clarity, pretty much crystal clear. A little bit sweet, malty with a very subtle bitter bite, mid softness. Fine.

Jeder, der längere Zeit in Deutschland ist und hie und da gerne mal ein Bierchen trinkt, kommt irgenwann einmal mit Ötti in Berührung. Das Helle ist da der Klassiker. Es ist sicher kein Top-Bier, aber es gibt schlimmere.
Bottle at the 'Back to the Roots Classic German Beer Tasting' session. I only took numerical notes while having this.

Pours clear golden with a smallish head. Aroma has grainy maltiness, hint of vegetables and hay. Taste is mostly malty with grain and bread flavour. Very moderate spicy and slightly metallic taste of hops. Rather mild and light bodied but drinkable brew. (Poured from a 0,5l bottle)
Bottle @ El Catador two man down in Grindsted. Clear golden body with a small white head. Grain, paper, bad.

Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grains and hay, rather herbal, spicey, light corn, paper. Taste is rough grains, loads of grains and hay, rather dusty, slight bready, not really hoppy,,
Bottle. It pours clear golden with a creamy golden head. The aroma is malty with grainy and light hoppy notes. The flavour is grainy and malty with notes of hay and a whiff of hay.
Drinked in bottle bb 2.7.18. On the nose some wet hay, some diacetyl and some wort sweetness. In mouth is light bodied, quite bitter and dry, the finish is a bit sharp.

Tap at the Brewpub. Poured a hazy dark amber with a thin off-white head. The aroma is malt, floral metallic hop. The flavour is medium bitter with a light malt, hop bitter palate and a short bitter finish. Served a little too cool to be honest. Nice enough for a BKK brewed beer and I’d be happy to drink it if I lived here, but it doesn’t really compete with too many bitters brewed in Blighty.
Drought. Dark brown with small beige creamy head, caramel aroma, bit of a chocolate-caramel taste with slight bitterness at the end, longish finish. Not bad for Thai microbrew.
very homebrew-esque. malty and yeasty, no trace of hops, really disappointing and not the taste relief I was hoping for after several days of yellow water with bubbles...

didn’t get much aroma from this beer medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, lacking in hops. Guessing that acquiring a decent range of hops can be difficult in Thailand. This beer would really benefit from some better/more hops. An acceptable drink after 3 weeks of nothing but Thai lagers, but not close to a decent British bitter. Was soon back on Thai lagers in another establishment.

Pours light brown. Nose of biscuit and toast. licorice and caramel flavour with a trace of bitterness that lasts in the finish. Approaching a brown. Achievement unlocked; definitely a British-style beer. I think this place has everything down except the hops (and service, but that doesn’t factor in on my beer reviews).

Tap at Londoners in Bangkok. Hazy, darker amber pour is a bit dark for style with soapy lacing and lower foam. Muted nose with mild metal and dark bread. Taste is thin, no bitterness really, slight metallic bite, again more wheat toast and pumpernickel. Not so great, but after months in Thailand of only Chang, Leo, and Tiger; it tastes like heaven.

Half a pint from tap at the brewpub. Slightly hazy brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of slighlty roasted malt with caramel and hops. Sweet, malty and creamy with a nice bitterness. Finishes slightly dry with a nice bitterness. Roasted and bitter aftertaste. Taste and refreshing. Nice with some bitterness after lots of SEA pale lagers. (2012-05-15)

Muddy brown/red color. Somewhat transparent between the visible particles in the beer. A thin head stays for only a couple of minutes. Zero lacing. Low carbonation. Smells of biscuity malts, some grass and a faintly note of caramel. Taste is nutty and salty/astringent. A herbal tone of tea. Aftertaste is biscuity and with tons of sour salmiak and salt. Mouth-feel is thin and watery. Low carbonation. I hope there was something wrong with my pour. Will try to make another review. ABV must be about 4 - 4,5. Serving type: on-tap
on draught at the brew-pub.Amber cloudy colour. Bitter aftertaste. A decent bitter. Nice to have after so much bland lager here

Draught at the pub. Pours slight hazy amber coloured with a nice small off white head. Aromas of lightly roasted malt, some coffee, nuts and caramel. Nutty flavour with notes of caramel and roasted malt. After fourteen days with Chang Draught and Leo this beer is really tasty treat to find in a very air-conditioned basement in the middle of busy Bangkok.
Oct 2019 keg at the brewpub in Bangkok. Pretty standard pale lager. Soft, bland and inoffensive. Easy drinking and easily forgotten.

On tap at The Londoner Brewpub, pours a clear pale blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out crisp crackery malt, straw and light grass. Flavour is vegetal, with grassy and herbal, and dry biscuity malt. Too herbaceous and vegetal. Not convincing.
Отличное пиво и отличное место в Бангкоке! Владелец пригласил попробовать все сорта

Tap at the Brewpub. Poured a hazy medium amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is light yeast/malt. The flavour is light to medium bitter with a doughy biscuit malt palate and a short bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Won’t win too many awards but somewhat refreshing.
Drought. Pale yellow with small white foamy head, yeasty aroma, slightly sour taste, high carbonation, abrupt finish. Not really inspiring.

golden, clear, thin feel, average carbonation, tasted like a Thai brewed lager but to be fair, not as good as the mainstream Thai lagers, but then nowhere near as poor as mainstream UK "lagers" for example. Was no reason to keep drinking this instead of a Chang Classic. If you’re looking for a good pilsner, this isn’t it.
Pours deep straw. Nose of lemon and malt. Flavour is quite sweet. Finish has some lemon. I’m having trouble picking up the noble hops here.

Tap at the brewpub back when I lived in Thailand. Hazy golden pour, not very bright for lager. Weak foam and poor retention. Soapy lacing. Nose is DMS at times with corn and some frozen vegetables. Taste is fairly bland, mild biscuit, low hop balance with a metallic twang. Again, really nice after months of Chang, Leo, and Tiger (never pay double the price for Singha like a newb).

Pint from tap at the brewpub. Golden with a white head. Light fruity and malty aroma. Sweet with a slightly bitter finish and a slightly metallic taste. Somewhat bitter aftertaste. Nice enough, but nothing special, could have been better with more hops and bitterness. Still a nice break from the domestic pale lagers of Thailand. (2012-05-15)
on tap at the brewpub. Slightly hazy pils colour. Ok pils but I’m not really a pils lover. I just had to try it.

Sampled draught at the brewpub. Huge place! When going here just remember that Ratchadaphisek Rd. is split in two, and that this is on the northern side of Sukhumvit. Pours murky dark orange with average head. Estery bubblegum aaroma. Sweet and rounded, but near thin. Mild and fruity. Authentic, but unspectacular.

Tap. Stop two on my brewpub hunt in Bangkok. This place did not open until 6pm, so I found an internet cafe to start getting beers into the database. It is a great place with a huge concert stage. I left before the band hit the stage to find the Tawandang German Brewery. This beer was a hazy dark yellow with a foamy white head and rising bubbles. A nice coriander aroma with citrus, orange and spice flavors.
Sampled draught at the brewpub. Quite funny spelling here... Cloudy golden with small, creamy head. Sweet and bready, softly malty. Mild and honeyish with lightly hoppy finish.
Tap. Golden yellow with a foamy white head which quickly laced. An inviting yeasty aroma, crisp, dry, and refreshing with more character than typical lagers here.

zapach dość lekki, podpalany, czekoladowy, trochę zielonych roślin. kolor czarny, zmętniony, piana ciemnobeżowa, drobna, dość trwała. w smaku pełne, palone, czekoladowe, lekkie nuty kokosa i kawy. goryczka niska, podpalana, czekoladowa. nasycenie umiarkowane

On tap at Spark & Tawandang, pours a cloudy dark reddish brown with a medium beige head. Aroma brings out light toasted malt, some light nuttiness and a touch of red fruits. Flavour is dry, with toasted nuts, bready malt and a bit of a stale quality. Not bad, but could use some tweaking. Okay.

Tap at the Bangkok Rama 3 brewpub. Poured a hazy dark brown with a thin broken light head. The aroma is sweet roasty malt, light creamy caramel. The flavour is moderate sweet with a smooth rich grainy sweet malt, light hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Draft - Light toasted dark malts. Solid brown with a rich beige head. Dark sugar and some raisin. Not bad.
Mild würziger Start, etwas muffig, süßlich brotig. Langweilig, steigend bitter, was zum Ende das Hauptaroma wird. Nö. 8/8/8/7//8
Draft at the brewpub. Very hazy brown with a light tan head. Aroma of caramel, malt and light dark fruity notes. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

had this on tap in Phnom Penh. small creamy offwhite head.fair lacing. mostly diminishing. flat average-density brownish-black body. aroma: moderate roasted malt, light coffee, dark chocolate. if: moderate sweet (chocolatey). ff: moderate sweet light bitter; average duration. palate: light médium body, watery/oily texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. tastes likes acorn. 50s

[Tap] Deep brown color with a beige head on top. Aromas of nutty malts, cocoa powder and light toffee. Notes of toasted bread, nuts, caramel, minerals and a dry graininess in the flavor. Very little bitterness. Lively carbonation. Tasting notes from 9/2014.

Had this on draught in Phnom Penh. Slightly murky brown appearance with thin beige head. Aroma was quite stale but also some malts and toffee. Taste was better. Bitter roasted malts with a slightly sweet finish.
Draught at the brewpub in Singapore Dark brown color. More than roasty, chocolate or nutty character, these dark malts give a dusty character to the beer; the bitterness is rather low. Simple.

On tap at Spark & Tawandang, pours a hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out banana and clove in decent balance, with a little whispy wheat. Flavour follows accordingly, with a solid character of banana and clove. Actually a pretty authentic hef, with a solid banana character. Surprisingly decent.

Tap at the Bangkok Rama 3 brewpub. Poured a hazy straw colour with a thin broken white head. The aroma is yeast, banana, coriander spice. The flavour light sweet with a smooth acidic citrus, crushed banana, light spice palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Kinda liked this when I didn’t really expect to.
Draft - Wheat soft grains and banana. Cloudy yellow with a rich white head. Candied banana and soft wheat.
Hell herber, minimal bananiger Antrunk. Geringe Herbe, wenig würzig. Geringe Würzigkeit, langweilig. Aber typisch deutsch. 10/8/8/7//8

Very hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma of big yeast and banana, with wheat and light malty notes behind. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

[Tap] Golden pour with a distinct haze to it. A nice soapy foam head. Sweet and fruity aromas of yeast and some grains. Banana, green apple, banana, clove and some lemon in the taste. A bit thin. Very drinkable though. Tasting notes from 9/2014.
On draft. Aroma of banana. Cloudy. Flavors of sweet banana. Faint bittering. Quite pleasant!

On draught at the Phnom Penh branch. Not sure if they brew on site or if the beers come from Thailand. If the latter, perhaps this hadn’t travelled too well. If the former, I just wasn’t too impressed. Hazy yellowish amber pour. Aroma was quite skunky and eggy. Granted, a little wheat and citrus in it too. Taste was much the same. Fruity and citrussy with wheat but ultimately it was quite stale unfortunately.
Draught at the brewpub in Singapore Cloudy blond color. Light wheat aroma, more pronounced wheat flavor; it has mild spice and fruit touch; dry; very low bitterness. Easy but not bad.

Draught at the brewpub in Singapore on July 9, 2013. Sampled first, then had the "buy 1 pint get 1 free" offer with this beer. Hazy yellow color, small white head. Sweet, fruity, phenolic scent. Sweet, banana, fruity, clove taste. Dry aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Out of the three beers available this was the one who inspired most, which unfortunately don’t say all that much. Decent.
Drank at their restaurant in Chonburi. It is sweet but flat. I found it easy to drink but lacking anything making me want more.

zapach słodowy, ciężki, lekko kwaskowy, kukurydziany. kolor ciemnego złota, dość mocno zmętniony, piana biała, średnio trwała. w smaku słodycz, kukurydza, liście z kukurydzy, świeży zacier. goryczki praktycznie brak. nasycenie średnie

On tap at Spark & Tawandang, pours a hazy golden orange with a medium white head. Aroma brings out light straw, cereal malt and some corn. Flavour is lightly sweet, with cereal malt, some corn and straw. Very clean and easy to drink. Actually decently made.

Tap at the Bangkok Rama 3 brewpub. Poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy long-lasting white head. The aroma is malt, light hop. The flavour is moderate to light bitter with a watery, light floral hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. It’s not Chang!
Draft - Soft grains. Cloudy gold with a rich white head. Soft grain with bready notes and a touch of apple.
Heller, wässrig herber Antrunk. Keine Würzigkeit, kein Hopfen, überaus langweilig. Etwas parfümiert im Mittelteil, kurzer herber Nachhall. Meh. 9/7/8/8//8
Draft at the brewpub. Very hazy orange golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, light malt and very light fruity hops. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with moderate carbonation.

[Tap] Dark golden pour with a large amount of soapy foam on top. Faint nose of grass, pale malts and some vegetable. Flavors of light malts, grains, crackers and straw. Fairly clean and drinkable. Tasting notes from 9/2014.
Tried from draught in Phnom Penh. Slightly hazy yellow pour with creamy head. Aroma is floral, hoppy and citrussy. Fresh. Good smooth hoppy taste. Nice.
Draught at the brewpub in Singapore Cloudy deep blond color. Pleasant crispy malt aroma, but too weak and dry body, the malt has a paper accent; low bitterness. Easy but not flawed.
FTA: fortified pale lager. Flat and just as good as vodka diluted with water or any other Bochkarev beer.
Pours a clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, some fruit and hay. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a boozy finish. Ok.

7% version. Pale amber pour with a tight white head. The aroma is moderately sweet but it doesn’t have that fusely awfulness that I might have expected. Light malt and some very faint alcohol flavour. Not much in the way of hops but it’s not cloying either. Not a terrible strong lager, such as they are.

Bochkarev Brewery--Heineken Brewery LLC.--Russia--Bochkarev Extra Beer--2004 16.9 oz. Bottle. 8.00% ABV. 20 IBU’s? (4.5 / 5.0) Malt Liquor. Thin mild lace big white head. Clear thin straw color. Buttery floral hop front. Smooth clean rich Pils sweet creamy butterscotch body. Clean balanced mild hop end. Mild citrus fruit notes. Rich Russian. 3/11/2004.

My bottle (not the one pictured: see frankenkitty’s review) was entirely in Russian. My attempt to translate it using a Cyrillic alphabet and a Russian-English, English-Russian dictionary from 1961 (several pages missing throughout) follows: From Russia with loving! Much enjoyment to ensue from the drinking! Inferior ingredients have pleased to have been discouraged from useage. Decandent Western brewers use Noble hops...Proudly we are to use only most glorious former- Soviet Republic Chernobyl Hops! Nasdrovya! (A crude image of a bald man pounding what appears to be a shoe on a table, under which this apparent motto, "We will BURY you, one sip at a time!!!) The following appeared to be issued as a warning: NOT TO BE USING AS DIESEL ADDITIVE FOR TO MAKE WINTER TRUCK EASIER START-UP...UNLESS STAND WELL BACK!

Staying with my Russian theme for this Sunday evening, I gave this one a try and it was quite below average. Aroma was very metallic, some alcohol, but suprisingly (thankfully) no skunk. I couldn’t pick up much else because the metallic scent was really overpowering. Appearance was a lightl yellow in color, a little haze and decent ivory white head. Mouthfeel was light to medium bodied, and a little harsh with the alcohol. Flavor was metal (think licking a dirty penny), a little hoppy and some malty sweetness. But like the nose, the flavor of this beer was squahsed by the prominent metallic flavor going on. Overall, not a very good beer and since it came in a pint bottle pretty tough to drink the whole thing.

500 ml bottle poured a clear yellow with a small dissapating white head. Aromas of light graininess, grass and straw. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of white bread, grass and corn with a lingering sweet finish.

tap. As I recall it: Pours golden. Fresh, moderate hoppiness, some traces of fruit in taste and aroma. Also some traces of wet grass. Not 100% sure this is the one I had though, but I think so. Pardon me if not.

(bottle - 500 ml) Pale gold pour with a soapy white head. Aroma is oddly sweet. Lots of malts and not very much in the hop department. Taste is very sweet and malty with some metallic hints and tons of alcohol at the end. Very harsh, watery, and metallic.
Canned. pale yellow in colour. Rich fluffy white head, lacings. The aroma is hayish an metallic. It has a sweet flavour of malt and alcohol. It’s quite fruity and it has a dry aftertaste.

De mis notas. Bebida en el Aeropuerto de Bangkok Dorado pálida con espuma de color blanco, ligera turbidez. Aroma ligeramente cítrico con leves notas a trigo. Sabor parecido al aroma con notas cítricas y con algo de levadura aparte de las notas a trigo. Final ligero.

funny little spot in the airport, looked just like a small, off to the side cafe, but i could see the various taps sticking up. and i knew i had found the beer ’in the airport" hazy beer with a n apple nose. slight wheat, spice flavors watered down backfeel with a bit of off flavors. ehh.

27 Jun 2005 - (Bangkok Airport, Terminal 2, Brewpub - 2nd last beer before going home) - Citrus and vinuos aromas. Light cloudy and light yellow-brown colour, good lacing and reasonmable head. Vinuos citrus and light malt flavour. Tangy bitter and fruit finish with medium mouthfeel.
Location: Bangkok Airport. Grass aroma with hops. Cloudy yellow apperance with fair head and lacing. Hop flavour with malt. Fizzy palate.
Dull beige, hazy. Aroma of garbage, apple skins, wheat, banana. Slight tartness, very raw malt husk character. Astringent, minerally finish. Unpleasant.

Brewed in American tradition????? Uh oh, I was hoping for a Belgian or German tradition. Anyway, let's look past that and concentrate on the beer at hand. It certainly looks like a wheat beer, agreeably pale yellow and hazy. The flavour immeidately suggests an ale yeast though, as there are fruity overtones but not the big ones provided by a wit/wiezen. You know, landing at Bangkok airport you really want something like this to begin with. It's okay but doesn't make me jump up and down.
Sampled draught at the brewpub (Location at airport, terminal 2). Cloudy pale yellow. papery and mild. Sweet with notes honey. Some malt maybe, but mainly just bland.
A powerful wheat surface hides a few hops underneath...A light body of honey disappoints and dulls the experience...If you crave for a good wheat beer whilst in Bangkok, head over to Tawandang...
Transperent yellow with a thin white head. Slightly citric aroma. Flavour is mostly wheat with a little yeast.

Tap. There are three locations for this place. There is one in each of the two airport terminals. One is called Brewhouse Express and the other is Brew House. There is also the location where the beer is made. It is now called "Orbit", and it has concerts and dance music with ladies dancing on the bar. Interesting place for a brewpub! I had two samples of the Twister Wheat. It had a hazy yellow color with a white head. It was very light and understated for a wheat with a somewhat sweet flavor.
this little dude was drank at the airport somwhere out ther, terminal 2 going to 1? whatever? a slight haze to a golden colored beer. fruity nose with a sweet biscuit malt taste.

Dark tan colour with chill haze and a finger of foam. Fruity-hoppy aroma (lime, raspberry) with a slight hint of baguette-like malts in the background. Vegetal palate, hitns of chocolate chip cookie dough, some grassy-limey hop. Full body for the style. Sweetish, heavy, vegetal finish.

Mama, give me the hop aroma I crave for and good mouthfeel from a fine pilsner. Damn, mama, you just killed a man, put a gun against his head, pulled a trigger now he's dead. Mama, life had just begun, now you've gone and blown it all away by not putting enough noble saaz into this beer which started so well but fell over. While this could have been a sturdy soul you have merely produced a little silhouette of a beer. Scaramouche!
Sampled draught at the brewpub (Location at airport, terminal 2). Deep golden. Neutral aroma. Clean , hard maltiness. Lightly cellary. Fizzy and bland.

Creamy malt and light grassy hops march on to the oblivion of a watery aftertaste...I'm definitely not charging for another one...Pales in comparison to the wonderful London Pilsner 33 of the Londoner Brewpub...
Hazy yellow colour. Malt balanced. Bland, international pils. Not much better than any mass-produced Asian beer.

Tap. There are three locations for this place. Two at the airport and one at a place called "Orbit" which as concerts and dance music. This beer was light yellow with a white head. It was smooth and had a good body.

Rescatada de mis notas. Tomada en el Aeropuerto de BangkokColor dorado con espuma blanca, duración corta. Aroma con notas a cereal. Sabor ligero a malta, cereal y heno fresco. Final de ligera maltosidad con leve amrgor.
this one was the lighter of the two between the pilsner, sweet suppose you can taste a hint of honey with a malty nugget backing. very thin.
Straw colour (frosted glass....argh); pale malt aroma with hints of honey, saffron; honeyish taste with fresh pale malt character. Hints of biscuit. Balanced but quite light.

Mama without the aroma. While it is best that some mamas don't have too much of an odor about them this is not one of those occasions. This bee should be called Eric, coz he's only got half the sting expected. Now, half a bee, can philosophically, simply be, drunk delighfullee, you see? But regretablee, this killer bee, cannot clearlee, be regarded highlee.

Sampled draught at the brewpub (Location at airport, terminal 2). Pale golden and slghtly hazy with dense head. Light bodiede and clean, medium dry. Grassy finish with a touch of metal. Not much flavour.
Stinging hop pepper in a surprisingly creamy palate...Old magos left out in the sun a few yards away...A bit better than their pilsner but still does not hit target for me...
It tastes remarkably similar to their mama Bull Pilsener, only blander. Not much better than drinking a Singha.

Tap. There are three locations for this place. You will find it at the airport terminals and in the city at a place called "Orbit" on the address listed on this site. The Killer Bee Lager was a pale yellow with a smooth, low carbonation, light body.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: more of a fat tire esque beer here, amber orange color, with sweet fruit hop nose. full bodied with a bit more umph then the others. still not great but good enough to drink here in thailand.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: 27 Jun 2005 - (Bangkok Airport, Terminal 2, Brewpub - last beer before going home) - Floral and stone fruit malt aroma. Clear brown-orange colour with nice lacing and reasonable head. Full fruit and malt flavour with hoppy vinuos flavours. Tangy fruit finish and medium mouthfeel.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: Sweet malt aroma with stone fruit and flowers. Clear orange brown colour with fair head and lacing. Sweet malt flavour. Fizzy palate.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: Orange-tinged light brown colour. Slightly browned head. Oh my god - hops! I remember those! Piney with a hint of pommelo, wood and tobacco. If this were cigar I’d be loving this. Woody tasting palate , slight citrus and bitterness. Oooo. Underneath is chewy caramel. Despite shocking my palate with flavours unknown in months, I have to be realistic. It’s not that good.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: Well, given the lack of grunt provided by the others I decided to splurge and pay 145baht for the biggun. This is still only less than $5 Aussie so if good it will be worth it. well it is an OK beer. There are disctinct malty notes and good mouthfeel which is backed up by a good coppery colour and malty/hop aroma. At least there is evidence that this was brewed with an ale yeast as some of the necessary characters come through. Perhaps the palate for this beer is not one of a typical ratebeerian. Most of the visitors don't seem to care what they order from my brief observation. They are here for a bite to eat and a drink before they board a flight to be offered a bite to eat and a drink an hour later. Discerning.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: Sampled draught at the brewpub (Location at airport, terminal 2). The address given here directs you to a dubious night club called Orbit. To enter Orbit you either have to pay for a very expensive bottle of whiskey, or pay a n extremely steep entry fee. Also there is no mention anywhere by the entrance of a brewery inside. As it is much cheaper, even for one person, to grab a taxi and go to the airport I'd recommend the airport location. Funnily this is still called Taurus. This beer is their showpiece: an orange-brown, cloudy ale with small creamy head. It is sweet and toffeeish with traces of almondsa nd butterscotch. There are some citrusy hops up front, It is medium bodied with a clean, simple malt profile and finishes with some pleasant hoppy bitterness. Much like a decent standard amber ale on a US brewpub chain.

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: A hot caramel whisky slowly lets through citrusy hops...Candy sugar and corny syrup converge as spicy alcohol and interest diverge...The joy rocket somewhat misfires...

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: Light orange colour. Butter malt aroma with a British yeast flavour. This is definitely the bst beer that I had in Thailand (which isn't saying much).

column1: La Lunar Head Butt Strong Ale
column5: Tap. There are three locations for this place. Two at the airport and one at a place called "Orbit" which as concerts and dance music. This was the best beer of the lot. It had a rich amber color with a foamy off-white head and rising bubbles. The flavor was bitter, hoppy, sweet, had a medium body, malty, and some chocolate.
50cl can. thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Boozy. Not great. Bland and boring
Eine Art heller Bock mit stark malzig-chemischen Einschlag. Trotz der aufdringlichen Süße und des merkbaren Alkoholgehaltes bleibt es doch halbwegs trinkbar. Keine Spezialität, aber es geht.
Bottle in Minsk 🇧🇾. Grainy with malty back. Smooth seeetish, moderate bitter, round and grainy.
From bottlein St. Petersburg. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.
Классика для всех алкашей страны. Твой лучший друг если ты хочешь напиться от пива. Вкус просто поражает отвратительным взрывом алкоголя во рту.

05-07-2017; bottle; at home (bought somewhere in Moscow, Russia). The looks of the beer are simple, yet good. It looks like a typical lager/pilsener. The colour of the beer is a lovely golden yellow, a bit darker golden than most lagers. The beer is absolutely crystal clear. On top of the beer a thick layer of rough white foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses very fast, leaving a very thin and rough drape. The smell ain’t bad, I even like it. There is a nice sweet maltiness, giving also some slight fruity touches to the smell. You can also clearly smell the alcohol. The sweetness of the malts and the fruitiness also contains a slight aroma of some honey and a slight bread-like aroma. It isn’t bad. There are also clear and nice bitters of hops. There isn’t a lot of hop in here, it is merely a bitter touch. The taste is pretty much the same. Nice strong malty sweets, with a touch of fruit and honey, and nice bitter touch. The alcohol flavour is strong. The beer lacks some hop strength. It is a bit out of balance, towards the sweet side. The palate of the beer is average. Light body, rather smooth and also rather light carbonation. The finish mainly consists of sweet malt and alcohol. All in all, not a bad beer, but it is mainly sweet malts and alcohol. It is a typical malt liquor, but form time to time that ain’t bad.

Bottled 500ml. -random shop in Minsk, Belarus. As Okhota Krepkoe Eksportnoe with 6.3%ABV. Golden coloured, small white head, almost neutral nose. Sweet malty, vegetables, some alcohol and slightly acidic fruity with strong carbonation. Could be better could be worse.
Aroma: sweetness, alcohol. Appearance: golden without head. Tate: in start a bit sweetness, in finish bitterness and alcohol. Palate: medium body, medium carbonation.
Can 480 ml. Pale gold color, good white foam. Aroma: sweet, malty, esters and maize. Taste: strong alcohol, malt, pear, so sad.

500 ml can. Brewed in Bobruisk, Belarus (Heineken Group). Labelled as Okhota Krepkoe Export. ABV: 6.3 %. Pours clean deep yellow colour. Very good pillowy tall white head. Stays. Soft carbonation. Aroma: sour overripe apples, honey, booze, malts. The taste is all about corn, malts, sour apples and a massive load of alcohol. Light to meduim body. Yeap, cheap & tough. I suppose this version is more like a strong lager. Why did I try it? I’m just curious.
Tried this before it was retired in 2010. Brown and very sweet. Thickly spicy. Hop bitterness doesn’t even this out sadly.

Hard to open, neaded a polygrip tool to get open. Sampled 201660701. Big and lasting off white head.Opaque red-orange color. Orange and woody aromas in a nice balance. Sweet caramell and oranfe fruit taste. Small sweetness and a firm body. distinct but balanced bitterness.

Bottle. It poured an amber color with a white head. The aroma was of caramel, honey, and light floral esters. The taste was similar to the aroma with more caramel, honey, toffee and some floral hops. Tasty.
On draft at Mad Fox Barleywine Festival 2015. Pours a clear copper with an ecru head. Light malty nose. Flavors of caramel and some stone fruit notes. Smooth, slightly sweet and boozy finish.
Draft at Bricks. Pours clear reddish brown with some white head and lacing. Nose is some smoke and caramel. Taste is peat and smoke with a lot of hop bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel.
Hazy cider orange brown pour, white head. Aroma is fruit, alcohol, and notes of... soy sauce? Flavor is Orange, dried fruits, toffee. Slightly smoky and dry.

Slightly cloudy orangy color with medium off white head. Aroma mostly citrus hops with some malt. Full body. Not too much alcohol. Flavor is mostly hoppy with pine and citrus. Some malt sweetness. Balance is reasonable. More IPA-like than barleywine.

"a barleywine with peat malt and candi sugar...different. has a lot of what you’d expect from a good BW (caramel sweetness, good dose of bittering hops) but the subtle smoke in the aroma and flavor/finish is different. great full mouthfeel. smooth, and tasty. a little overpriced, only because there are others for less that are as good but it’s unique and good enough to be a real treat if you haven’t had it."

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton. Poured into a snifter at home. Pours an orange brown with a medium thick head. Head gone in 30 seconds. No real lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, barrel, heavy carmelized malts, and mild peat. The taste is malty, caramel, oak barrel, and fresh earthy hops. There was a weird medicinal taste however that was a big turnoff. I found it to be a very hoppy barleywine. I tend to like them more malty. Medium body, bitter mouth with the hops.

Draft @ Sunset. The bartender couldn’t tell me if it was an aged keg. And it doesn’t taste of me it so.... They must have started brewing this again. Anyhow, ruby color with lasting tan head. Aroma is sweet malt, leather and English roasted malts. Flavor is English malt forward. Shoe leather, English toffee, light caramel and mild spice. 8% is covered up with a sweet finish. Overall super easy to drink and not syurpy or over sweet at all.
Cloudy golden with a rocky white head, the aroma on this beer was grainy and sweet. The flavor was very much full of honey. Little in the way of hop character, but smooth and quenching. Average.
Golden and still with a poofy head. This smells like Waldorf salad!? The taste is got the essence of Granny apples, with an almost soapy flavor. Sweet and yechy.
Bottled version. Pours yellow with a white head. Nose is light malt and corn. The taste is a little bit better with some malt and grain. Has very little hop character. Finishes somewhat bland.
Small white head. Clear light gold color. Light bodied. No aroma to speak of. Not much flavor either, watery, corny notes. A fizzy, pissy little beer. I hope the aussys dont drink this stuff!?

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), lightly hoppy (herbs), with a rather strong note of cooked corn. Flavor is lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation.

Decent beer, but not much like a real lager to me. Very fruity taste, but not much hops presence like I would expect. Decent, easyto-drink beer but not really what I expect from a beer labeled "lager." Dissapointing.

Assuming that my brother wasn't drinking his at the tail end of a drinking session, this brewery needs some quality control. The beginning was innocent enough, but rice and corn seemed to take over halfway into the taste and didn't give up. Pale, yellow, halfway between clear and cloudy.

I was pleasantly surprised by this beer. Given the proximity to College Station that this brewery is, I was not expecting much. This lager had a nice malty taste, wasnt overly crisp or skunky like many lagers tend to be. The finish was great, crisp apples.

Pours an unknown color from the traditional wooden beer barrel, with a fluffy cap of white foam that dissipates fairly quickly in the opaque ceramic glass. Aroma of clean pilsner and melanoidin malts, herbal and earthy hops, and a traditional German lager yeast. Taste follows, a light metallic note develops the more you drink which is unfortunate. Not sure if it was from the cleaning method of the glasses or the ceramic was actually leaching iron, but it got almost unbearable by the end of the liter. I guess that is Oktoberfest in Bayern for you.

Bottle from Lupe Pintos. Clear golden body with a lasting white head. Steady carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of parsnip and earth. Flavour of grain and pear skin. Medium body with a slick texture. Soft fizz. Sharp and earthy.

The best oktoberfest beer I’ve had. So crisp and clean, without the terrible harshness that many of the other big breweries have. Grainy and a bit stronger. Fantastic even at 8 months old. D&S dreaden

500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 6.3%. Rich yellow gold colour. Small, short-lasting head. Slight citrus and bready, corny aroma. Moderate-medium carbonation. Taste does not follow the aroma thankfully, there's a mild nondescript citrus bittersweet kick but then a rich dark-bread malt makes itself known, much better than weedy reedy lagery white-bread malts, and really carries this beer. It's sweet, even verging on caramely, but it's anything but sickly, and the flavours mesh very well, giving the brewer quite an accomplished impression - something most Augustiner beers tend to do. If it takes 6.3% ABV to have a lager with this level of flavour, go for it I say.

From fass @Birrifugio Trastevere (Rome). Dorata, limpidissima, brillante, schiuma bianca media, molto persistente. Al naso note di mollica di pane, cereali, pasta lievita. In bocca è maltata dolce, un po' monocorde. Corpo leggero, carbonazione media. Nonostante tutto, ha un suo perché.
50cl bottle. Clear pale golden, big white head. Aroma of sweet pale malts. Taste also sweet pale malts, caramel, almost no bitterness. Medium body.

Bottle picked up from REWE, Zolling and consumed at home, Attenkirchen, Sunday 6th October 2019 cooking Minced Beef and Cheese Pies and listening to Elena Tonra from Daughter and her solo album Ex:Re. Pours golden with a clean white head. Enjoying this, malty but certainly not too sweet, in fact displays a little dryness and a bit of bitterness, crisp and cleaner than expected.
500ml bottle in 2016. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of hay, light lemon zest and honey. Flavour is grainy, with measured sweetness and quite crisp.
Bottle. Malty aroma and taste, caramel, grain, medium bitter. Medium body, malty bitter finish. Ok.

Złociste, klarowne piwo z niezłą białą pianą, trochę nie w stylu ale nieźle się prezentuje. Aromat delikatny słodowy, trochę owocowy, przyjemny. W smaku lekko zbożowe z nutą owocową. Przyjemny oktoberfest
Cask at SRAF 2010. Pours golden amber, nose is malty, grassy, taste is malty toffee, floral, crisp.

Cask at Edinburgh beer festival 2008 ... Deep copper ... light malt ... sweet malt some tofeee some raisins...3.7 TK2 Cask at Bow Bar... Deep black ?? (i did check) ... nice sweet toffee fruit malts and dark roast ... very tasty. 4.4

Hand pump, Market Porter. Something had gone wrong in the process here, with an overtone of rotten eggs spoiling the taste. There is possibly an OK beer trying to come out here, but they’ll have to try again.
Cask@The Market Porter, Borough, London. Definite sulfuric, egg-fart aroma. Palate is weak, lightly acidic, watery, grainy malts. Yeah, not very exciting.
Cask handpump, Market Porter. Chestnut colour. Terrible aroma. Farty. Some fruit in mouth. It’s not that good to be honest.

Cask (handpump), Market Porter, Southwark. Seemed a fairly typical Scottish bitter to me. Copper colour. Emphasis on caramel malt and light fruit. Low hop profile. Soft and easy drinking. Not a huge amount of presence. Perfectly competent but not really my thing.
A decent wee bitter here. Aroma gives grass and maybe a little citrus hops too, maybe pepper. Taste is similar, light and you could drink this indefinitly.
Not bad, somewhat refreshing, not golden but a little dark in color. The foam was not big but was there. Nice at all.
Cask Stillage at the Metropolitan Cathedral Crypt, Liverpool 19/02/2004 Golden with sour fruit and spicy flavours. Crisp slightly bitter lasting finish.

Sampled cask conditioned at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Mahogany colour. Interesting aromatic nose with hints of ash, sulphur and nuts. Medium- to light bodied and lightly acidic with fruity and vinuous notes. Lingerinf fruity finish with low bitterness. A pleasant and very drinkable bitter with an unusual touch.

Thick foamy head with good lacing. Lot of carbonation.. Nose of coriander/orange and tart/tangy. Very yeasty too. Creamy texture. Nice spice with a silky tart finish. Very drinkable. Update: This beer is on tap again and is still amazing.

Tap. FINALLY this stuff comes back so I can up by percentage of Bitter End beers consumed by one. Glowing hazy yellow. Tangy, a little bit taffylike. Slightly fruity, effervescent, some wheat. Not bad, might go well with bready foods.

Certainly not a bad wit, but just not the greatest. Notes of chicken stock honestly.. Looks light and fizzy. I must say it is better than the current celis white product coming out of Michigan., which used to be one of my favorites. but alas grat
This should be called "wheat's end" because it tastes more like a wheat than a wit. It lacks the coriander and spice punch needed to make it a credible copy of most top wits.
This is said to have been modeled after Celis White, it was a decent try, but came up a bit short. Tasted almost like a wheat beer, notes of clove and sweet celery. Not enough punch to it.

Only Jamesport beer I’ve ever had. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance was a slight hazy orange to slight burnt brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within less than thirty seconds. Light lacing was there. The smell had a light grainy apricot to wheat breadiness going on. The taste was exactly the same. On the palate,this one sat about a light to medium in body. There’s a light sessionability about this one. Overall, good beer worthy of having again.
Draft. Apricot and lemon wheat malt aroma. Hazy pale yellow with minimal head. Tart apricot and wheat malt flavor. Nice balance. A very nice fruit beer.
Flight draft in Ludington. Hazey yellow-orange color with a white ring. Dusty fruit aroma. Nice peachy flavor mixed with the wheat. Pleasant.

5 oz. sample on 5-20-12 (Flight 1)- served a nontransparent, appearing very much like unfiltered freshly made oj. Slight nose of apricots up front. Hits the mouth with a light body, malt is buried by apricots, but it’s alright in this case. Went down way to easy...

Had this one on draught as part of the sampler at the brewpub in Ludington, Michigan. Cloudy medium yellow pour with some flowery hoppiness, very fruity, pronounced apricot and peach with some apple sweetness, clean finish. Good.
Draft at brewpub. Hazy golden amber hue with a small white head that diminished slowly. Sweet wheat and apricot aroma. Full apricot flavor with a good wheat finish. Took a growler with me.

Sampled at the brewery. Not much aroma, just a slight hint of wheatish malt. Cloudy straw yellow with a very thin white head. Wow, candy-like peach or apricot flavor. Medicinal, caugh syrup finish. Thin body, water dry finish.

Sample at brewery and growler fill. Cloudy yellow and thin head. Wonderful apricot and hop aroma, which does a pretty good job of indicating the overall flavor as well. As others have indicated, the apricot, while assertive, isn’t sickly sweet or cloying. Will glady return to Ludington for another growler fill of this.
Nice foam floating on pretty lemony-orange hues. Creamy palate. At least the apricot flavor is bitter, not sickly sweet, and seems relatively authentic. In all, nice flavor, zingy finish. Good.

So here's the thing. I've carried a ferocious anti-fruit beer chip on my shoulder for a long time but recently have had some decent fruit brews and have to wonder. Either my palate has been broadened with experience or the breweries have figured out how to actually fold fruit into the process more adeptly. In any event, I find this brew to be beautifully apricot - not so much that cloying cheap artificialty sends me raging into that good barbaric night that damned so many fruit beers heretofore, and not so little that it seems only a whispered afterthought. No, there is apricot AND some malty substance both to this brew and if I wish for more hop balance it is still in recognition of what is, after all, there.

Clean golden colour, frothy head, disappearing in a few minutes; too much yeast deposit. Simple aroma, with just some malt and white sugar. Good body structure, not too strong, pretty sweet; some alcohol, malt, sugar; too simple. Ordinary palate, rather poor hop. Nothing more than pleasant and drinkable.
NOT ON THE CASK.The best of the day. Nice red color. Good white head. Well balanced flavor with floral and spice notes. Slightly dry finish.

CASK Deep amber color, the head is creamy white, the lace in thick sheets. Nose is malt, lightly floral, hints of caramel, interesting. Front is sweet, top light, the finish is dry, lightly acidic, nicely hopped and a quite good beer. I hope they have many more aniiversaries to celebrate and that this beer is on thier list. ranks #705 on my current 1000 beer master list.
05.10.2019. 0,33l Can named Buval, Belgian beer. Aldi, Brussel. Pale yellow colour with white head. fresh grassy beer with rather thin body. Ok

Aroma: Light floral, honey, grainy Appearance: Brilliant, light gold body. Small, white head. Good retention. Small to fine bubbles. Flavour: Medium honey. Medium-light bitterness. Slightly sweet finish, honey. Mouthfeel: Medium-light body, Medium carbonation. Overall: The sweetness is unpleasant. The beer lacks crispness, balance. 330 ml can, poured.
Pils dont il n'y a rien à dire sauf qu'elle rafraîchit assez quand il fait chaud et qu'elle n'est pas trop alcoolisée. Pas plus mauvaise qu'une Heineken.
Gedronken als Buval. Smaak van lichte graan en een lichte hop bitterheid. Niet een hele spannende pils. -backlog de BierApp-

Belgijski Buval utożsamiany jest właściwie z Karlsquell Edel Pils, produkowanym dla dyskontów Aldi. Barwa jasnozłota, idealna klarowność. Ładna, biała piana. Aromat nie dostarcza wielu doznań... Choć wiem, że to pils, to chciałoby się trochę Belgii uświadczyć ;) Nuty słodowe dominują. W smaku lekkie, niemal wodniste. Nuty słodowe, goryczka bardzo delikatna... Da się wypić w chłodny dzień ;)
Fijn bier, een beloning voor de smaakpapillen, ik heb het warm gedronken dus het was moeilijk te recenseren op zijn volle potentiële.
Can from Aldi. Clear blond colour, medium carbonation. Malty, rather sweet, cardboard, industrial boring lager.
Couleur dorée claire, très léfère mousse. Nez inexistant. Gout a peine houblonné poussièreux mais avec ajout de sucre industriel genre maïs horrible....

F: thin, white, quickly diminishing. C: pale gold, clear. A: malty, corny, vaguely sweet grainy. T: malty, light metallic, watery grainy, vaguely sweet grassy, yes for 33 cents you get what you want and don’t expect taste or even some experience, medium body and carbonation, rated as “Buval” 5% ABV, 33cl can from ALDI, Chaussée de Louvain, Brussels.
Converting ticks to ratings. Had the Ottweiler version back in the late 90's, from Aldi. Cheap sweet lager, metallic, skunky. Really don't want to know what the Martens version tastes like.
light yellow/golden color. very thin head, very thin one with 4.9% , thin basic,..
(Can 50 cl) Pours pilsener golden with a neat, creamy head. Hoppy nose. Rather thin body without much of a malty sensation but with a dry, bitterish finish. 290106

A hazy yellow beer with a thin white head. The aroma is sweet with light notes of butter, while the flavor is sweet and acidic with a hoppy end. I thought it was too old - but noting the other ratings, I’m not sure anything was wrong.
Can. Clear yellow coloured with a wihte head. Aroma of malts and fruits with notes of spices and hops. Flavour of malts and hops.
Can. Slightly hoppy aroma. Yellow colour with a big, white, rocky head. Sweetish flavour with some hop aroma and bitterness. I have had worse crap lagers.
dunno why but i have a soft spot for german canned supermarket lager. this tasted of chemicals and aluminium (pronounced 'aluminum')
Light book-like nose and pale gold color. The head has huge holes in it and looks like ocean foam. Extremely light taste with a dry touch at the end. Watery. Not very good.

Suprised to find a rating short after I added it and quite a high rating for such a crap beer - but who knows! Aroma is like flowers...rotten flowers. Yellow with a soap foam. Harsh biterness that holds unfortuntely on - seems like hours, yuck. "You dislike it?" - pivo -

On tap at Otto’s in State College, PA. Pours a clear, deeper brown colored body with a finger-width, creamy, light tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is light with some nutty grains, a hint of caramel and fruit, and a light earth. Flavor is a bit better. Lightly sweetened caramel and a touch of toast up front with a bit of a fruity, nuttiness. Light, but noticeable earthy hopping comes in as the toast kicks up a bit. Finishes dry with a light bitterness and a touch of sweetness to balance. Fairly lengthy aftertaste following a medium body and a moderate carbonation. Overall, a decent brown ale. Nice grainy sweetness and a balanced earthy hopping and toast. Nothing special, but easy drinking and sessionable.

Sampled on draft at Otto’s this beer poured a dark brown color with orange highlights and a huge foamy orange-white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was smoky, woody and had a faint fruity presence. The finish was dry and woody. Medium body. Eh.

On tap at brewpub. On the fence for this one. There are some mushy cereal, rotten grain flavors, but then some decent hop balance. Really, it’s not my style of Brown. A little sweet, rather plain, and with a slight off flavor.
Pours brown from tap with a big brown head. A hint of caramel malt on the nose. Pretty plain on the tongue. Clean finisher. Nothing too exciting.

Clear garnet appearance with a medium sized cream colored head and good lacing. Subtle, caramel malt aroma with some nuttiness just beneath the surface. Hazelnuts, toffee and toasty malts accent the gently hopped taste. Smooth, mild, moderately carbonated mouthfeel leading to a medium length finish. A nice session beer. On tap at the tavern.

Growler pour. Pours brown with red hues and khaki head. Nose is caramel and chocolate. Sweet taste, chocolate and caramel with mild roast, some mild fruit, raisin and apple. Nice mouth feel, slightly watery but full. Good lacing. Nicely done brown ale. Just a little hop presence, giving it a nice, crisp finish.

Courtesy of Juart from growler. Pours a dark brown color with a slight reddish hue. Has a slight beige foamy head, but not really that much. The growler was a little old though. The aroma is a sweet butterscotch with a slight cream and grainyness. The flavor has a dark toffee with some roasted coffee notes, a little bit of black cherry, and a nice bitterness to balance out the heavy malt sweetness. A bittersweet chocolate flavor that lingers on the tongue. A good oily texture with a very light carbonation.
